Sets the license of the application showing the @about dialog from a list of known licenses.
This function overrides the license set using gtk_about_dialog_set_license().
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_logo
function.description:
Sets the pixbuf to be displayed as logo in the about dialog. If it is %NULL, the default window icon set with gtk_window_set_default_icon() will be used.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_logo_icon_name
function.description:
Sets the pixbuf to be displayed as logo in the about dialog. If it is %NULL, the default window icon set with gtk_window_set_default_icon() will be used.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_program_name
function.description:
Sets the name to display in the about dialog. If this is not set, it defaults to g_get_application_name().
Since: 2.12

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_translator_credits
function.description:
Sets the translator credits string which is displayed in the translators tab of the secondary credits dialog.
The intended use for this string is to display the translator of the language which is currently used in the user interface. Using gettext(), a simple way to achieve that is to mark the string for translation: |[ gtk_about_dialog_set_translator_credits (about, _("translator-credits")); ]| It is a good idea to use the customary msgid "translator-credits" for this purpose, since translators will already know the purpose of that msgid, and since #GtkAboutDialog will detect if "translator-credits" is untranslated and hide the tab.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_version
function.description:
Sets the version string to display in the about dialog.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_website
function.description:
Sets the URL to use for the website link.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_website_label
function.description:
Sets the label to be used for the website link.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: website_label
parameter.parameter_description: the label used for the website link

function.name: gtk_about_dialog_set_wrap_license
function.description:
Sets whether the license text in @about is automatically wrapped.
Since: 2.8

function.name: gtk_accel_group_activate
function.description: Finds the first accelerator in @accel_group that matches @accel_key and @accel_mods, and activates it.

parameter.name: accel_quark
parameter.parameter_description: the quark for the accelerator name

parameter.name: acceleratable
parameter.parameter_description: the #GObject, usually a #GtkWindow, on which to activate the accelerator

parameter.name: accel_key
parameter.parameter_description: accelerator keyval from a key event

parameter.name: accel_mods
parameter.parameter_description: keyboard state mask from a key event

function.return: %TRUE if an accelerator was activated and handled this keypress

function.name: gtk_accel_group_connect
function.description:
Installs an accelerator in this group. When @accel_group is being activated in response to a call to gtk_accel_groups_activate(), @closure will be invoked if the @accel_key and @accel_mods from gtk_accel_groups_activate() match those of this connection.
The signature used for the @closure is that of #GtkAccelGroupActivate.
Note that, due to implementation details, a single closure can only be connected to one accelerator group.

parameter.name: accel_group
parameter.parameter_description: the accelerator group to install an accelerator in

parameter.name: accel_flags
parameter.parameter_description: a flag mask to configure this accelerator

parameter.name: closure
parameter.parameter_description: closure to be executed upon accelerator activation

function.name: gtk_accel_group_connect_by_path
function.description:
Installs an accelerator in this group, using an accelerator path to look up the appropriate key and modifiers (see gtk_accel_map_add_entry()). When @accel_group is being activated in response to a call to gtk_accel_groups_activate(), @closure will be invoked if the @accel_key and @accel_mods from gtk_accel_groups_activate() match the key and modifiers for the path.
The signature used for the @closure is that of #GtkAccelGroupActivate.
Note that @accel_path string will be stored in a #GQuark. Therefore, if you pass a static string, you can save some memory by interning it first with g_intern_static_string().

parameter.name: accel_group
parameter.parameter_description: the accelerator group to install an accelerator in

parameter.name: accel_path
parameter.parameter_description: path used for determining key and modifiers

parameter.name: closure
parameter.parameter_description: closure to be executed upon accelerator activation

function.name: gtk_accel_group_disconnect
function.description:
Removes an accelerator previously installed through gtk_accel_group_connect().
Since 2.20 @closure can be %NULL.

parameter.name: accel_group
parameter.parameter_description: the accelerator group to remove an accelerator from

parameter.name: closure
parameter.parameter_description: the closure to remove from this accelerator group, or %NULL to remove all closures

function.return: %TRUE if the closure was found and got disconnected

function.name: gtk_accel_group_disconnect_key
function.description: Removes an accelerator previously installed through gtk_accel_group_connect().

parameter.name: accel_group
parameter.parameter_description: the accelerator group to install an accelerator in

function.return: %TRUE if there was an accelerator which could be removed, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_accel_group_find
function.description: Finds the first entry in an accelerator group for which @find_func returns %TRUE and returns its #GtkAccelKey.

parameter.name: find_func
parameter.parameter_description: a function to filter the entries of @accel_group with

function.return: the key of the first entry passing @find_func. The key is owned by GTK+ and must not be freed.

function.name: gtk_accel_group_from_accel_closure
function.description: Finds the #GtkAccelGroup to which @closure is connected; see gtk_accel_group_connect().
function.return: the #GtkAccelGroup to which @closure is connected, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_accel_group_get_is_locked
function.description:
Locks are added and removed using gtk_accel_group_lock() and gtk_accel_group_unlock().
Since: 2.14
function.return: %TRUE if there are 1 or more locks on the @accel_group, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_accel_group_get_modifier_mask
function.return: the modifier mask for this accel group.

function.name: gtk_accel_group_lock
function.description:
Locks the given accelerator group.
Locking an acelerator group prevents the accelerators contained within it to be changed during runtime. Refer to gtk_accel_map_change_entry() about runtime accelerator changes.
If called more than once, @accel_group remains locked until gtk_accel_group_unlock() has been called an equivalent number of times.

function.name: gtk_accel_group_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkAccelGroup.
function.return: a new #GtkAccelGroup object

function.name: gtk_accel_group_query
function.description: Queries an accelerator group for all entries matching @accel_key and @accel_mods.

parameter.name: n_entries
parameter.parameter_description: location to return the number of entries found, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_accel_group_unlock
function.description: Undoes the last call to gtk_accel_group_lock() on this @accel_group.

function.name: gtk_accel_groups_activate
function.description: Finds the first accelerator in any #GtkAccelGroup attached to @object that matches @accel_key and @accel_mods, and activates that accelerator.

parameter.name: object
parameter.parameter_description: the #GObject, usually a #GtkWindow, on which to activate the accelerator

parameter.name: accel_key
parameter.parameter_description: accelerator keyval from a key event

parameter.name: accel_mods
parameter.parameter_description: keyboard state mask from a key event

function.return: %TRUE if an accelerator was activated and handled this keypress

function.name: gtk_accel_groups_from_object
function.description: Gets a list of all accel groups which are attached to @object.
function.return: a list of all accel groups which are attached to @object

function.name: gtk_accel_label_get_accel_widget
function.description: Fetches the widget monitored by this accelerator label. See gtk_accel_label_set_accel_widget().
function.return: the object monitored by the accelerator label, or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_accel_label_get_accel_width
function.description: Returns the width needed to display the accelerator key(s). This is used by menus to align all of the #GtkMenuItem widgets, and shouldn't be needed by applications.
function.return: the width needed to display the accelerator key(s).

function.name: gtk_accel_label_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkAccelLabel.

parameter.name: string
parameter.parameter_description: the label string. Must be non-%NULL.

function.return: a new #GtkAccelLabel.

function.name: gtk_accel_label_refetch
function.description: Recreates the string representing the accelerator keys. This should not be needed since the string is automatically updated whenever accelerators are added or removed from the associated widget.
function.return: always returns %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_accel_label_set_accel
function.description:
Manually sets a keyval and modifier mask as the accelerator rendered by @accel_label.
If a keyval and modifier are explicitly set then these values are used regardless of any associated accel closure or widget.
Providing an @accelerator_key of 0 removes the manual setting.
Since: 3.6

parameter.name: accelerator_mods
parameter.parameter_description: the modifier mask for the accel

function.name: gtk_accel_label_set_accel_closure
function.description: Sets the closure to be monitored by this accelerator label. The closure must be connected to an accelerator group; see gtk_accel_group_connect().

parameter.name: accel_closure
parameter.parameter_description: the closure to monitor for accelerator changes.

function.name: gtk_accel_label_set_accel_widget
function.description: Sets the widget to be monitored by this accelerator label.

function.name: gtk_accel_map_add_entry
function.description:
Registers a new accelerator with the global accelerator map. This function should only be called once per @accel_path with the canonical @accel_key and @accel_mods for this path. To change the accelerator during runtime programatically, use gtk_accel_map_change_entry().
Set @accel_key and @accel_mods to 0 to request a removal of the accelerator.
Note that @accel_path string will be stored in a #GQuark. Therefore, if you pass a static string, you can save some memory by interning it first with g_intern_static_string().

function.name: gtk_accel_map_add_filter
function.description:
Adds a filter to the global list of accel path filters.
Accel map entries whose accel path matches one of the filters are skipped by gtk_accel_map_foreach().
This function is intended for GTK+ modules that create their own menus, but don't want them to be saved into the applications accelerator map dump.

function.name: gtk_accel_map_change_entry
function.description:
Changes the @accel_key and @accel_mods currently associated with @accel_path. Due to conflicts with other accelerators, a change may not always be possible, @replace indicates whether other accelerators may be deleted to resolve such conflicts. A change will only occur if all conflicts could be resolved (which might not be the case if conflicting accelerators are locked). Successful changes are indicated by a %TRUE return value.
Note that @accel_path string will be stored in a #GQuark. Therefore, if you pass a static string, you can save some memory by interning it first with g_intern_static_string().

parameter.name: replace
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if other accelerators may be deleted upon conflicts

function.return: %TRUE if the accelerator could be changed, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_accel_map_foreach
function.description: Loops over the entries in the accelerator map whose accel path doesn't match any of the filters added with gtk_accel_map_add_filter(), and execute @foreach_func on each. The signature of @foreach_func is that of #GtkAccelMapForeach, the @changed parameter indicates whether this accelerator was changed during runtime (thus, would need saving during an accelerator map dump).

parameter.name: foreach_func
parameter.parameter_description: function to be executed for each accel map entry which is not filtered out

function.name: gtk_accel_map_foreach_unfiltered
function.description: Loops over all entries in the accelerator map, and execute @foreach_func on each. The signature of @foreach_func is that of #GtkAccelMapForeach, the @changed parameter indicates whether this accelerator was changed during runtime (thus, would need saving during an accelerator map dump).

parameter.name: foreach_func
parameter.parameter_description: function to be executed for each accel map entry

function.name: gtk_accel_map_get
function.description:
Gets the singleton global #GtkAccelMap object. This object is useful only for notification of changes to the accelerator map via the ::changed signal; it isn't a parameter to the other accelerator map functions.
Since: 2.4
function.return: the global #GtkAccelMap object

function.name: gtk_accel_map_load
function.description: Parses a file previously saved with gtk_accel_map_save() for accelerator specifications, and propagates them accordingly.

parameter.name: file_name
parameter.parameter_description: a file containing accelerator specifications, in the GLib file name encoding

function.name: gtk_accel_map_load_fd
function.description:
Filedescriptor variant of gtk_accel_map_load().
Note that the file descriptor will not be closed by this function.

function.name: gtk_accel_map_load_scanner
function.description: #GScanner variant of gtk_accel_map_load().

parameter.name: scanner
parameter.parameter_description: a #GScanner which has already been provided with an input file

function.name: gtk_accel_map_lock_path
function.description:
Locks the given accelerator path. If the accelerator map doesn't yet contain an entry for @accel_path, a new one is created.
Locking an accelerator path prevents its accelerator from being changed during runtime. A locked accelerator path can be unlocked by gtk_accel_map_unlock_path(). Refer to gtk_accel_map_change_entry() for information about runtime accelerator changes.
If called more than once, @accel_path remains locked until gtk_accel_map_unlock_path() has been called an equivalent number of times.
Note that locking of individual accelerator paths is independent from locking the #GtkAccelGroup containing them. For runtime accelerator changes to be possible, both the accelerator path and its #GtkAccelGroup have to be unlocked.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_accel_map_lookup_entry
function.description: Looks up the accelerator entry for @accel_path and fills in @key.

parameter.name: key
parameter.parameter_description: the accelerator key to be filled in (optional)

function.return: %TRUE if @accel_path is known, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_accel_map_save
function.description: Saves current accelerator specifications (accelerator path, key and modifiers) to @file_name. The file is written in a format suitable to be read back in by gtk_accel_map_load().

parameter.name: file_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the file to contain accelerator specifications, in the GLib file name encoding

function.name: gtk_accel_map_save_fd
function.description:
Filedescriptor variant of gtk_accel_map_save().
Note that the file descriptor will not be closed by this function.

function.name: gtk_accel_map_unlock_path
function.description:
Undoes the last call to gtk_accel_map_lock_path() on this @accel_path. Refer to gtk_accel_map_lock_path() for information about accelerator path locking.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_accelerator_get_default_mod_mask
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_accelerator_set_default_mod_mask().
function.return: the default accelerator modifier mask

function.name: gtk_accelerator_get_label
function.description:
Converts an accelerator keyval and modifier mask into a string which can be used to represent the accelerator to the user.
Since: 2.6
function.return: a newly-allocated string representing the accelerator.

function.name: gtk_accelerator_get_label_with_keycode
function.description:
Converts an accelerator keyval and modifier mask into a (possibly translated) string that can be displayed to a user, similarly to gtk_accelerator_get_label(), but handling keycodes.
This is only useful for system-level components, applications should use gtk_accelerator_parse() instead.
Since: 3.4

parameter.name: display
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkDisplay or %NULL to use the default display

function.return: a newly-allocated string representing the accelerator.

function.name: gtk_accelerator_name
function.description:
Converts an accelerator keyval and modifier mask into a string parseable by gtk_accelerator_parse(). For example, if you pass in #GDK_KEY_q and #GDK_CONTROL_MASK, this function returns "<Control>q".
If you need to display accelerators in the user interface, see gtk_accelerator_get_label().
function.return: a newly-allocated accelerator name

function.name: gtk_accelerator_name_with_keycode
function.description:
Converts an accelerator keyval and modifier mask into a string parseable by gtk_accelerator_parse_full(), similarly to gtk_accelerator_name() but handling keycodes. This is only useful for system-level components, applications should use gtk_accelerator_parse() instead.
Since: 3.4

parameter.name: display
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkDisplay or %NULL to use the default display

function.return: a newly allocated accelerator name.

function.name: gtk_accelerator_parse
function.description:
Parses a string representing an accelerator. The format looks like "<Control>a" or "<Shift><Alt>F1" or "<Release>z" (the last one is for key release).
The parser is fairly liberal and allows lower or upper case, and also abbreviations such as "<Ctl>" and "<Ctrl>". Key names are parsed using gdk_keyval_from_name(). For character keys the name is not the symbol, but the lowercase name, e.g. one would use "<Ctrl>minus" instead of "<Ctrl>-".
If the parse fails, @accelerator_key and @accelerator_mods will be set to 0 (zero).

parameter.name: accelerator_key
parameter.parameter_description: return location for accelerator keyval, or %NULL

parameter.name: accelerator_mods
parameter.parameter_description: return location for accelerator modifier mask, %NULL

function.name: gtk_accelerator_parse_with_keycode
function.description:
Parses a string representing an accelerator, similarly to gtk_accelerator_parse() but handles keycodes as well. This is only useful for system-level components, applications should use gtk_accelerator_parse() instead.
If a keycode is present in the accelerator and no @accelerator_codes is given, the parse will fail.
If the parse fails, @accelerator_key, @accelerator_mods and @accelerator_codes will be set to 0 (zero).
Since: 3.4

parameter.name: accelerator_key
parameter.parameter_description: return location for accelerator keyval, or %NULL

parameter.name: accelerator_codes
parameter.parameter_description: return location for accelerator keycodes, or %NULL

parameter.name: accelerator_mods
parameter.parameter_description: return location for accelerator modifier mask, %NULL

function.name: gtk_accelerator_set_default_mod_mask
function.description:
Sets the modifiers that will be considered significant for keyboard accelerators. The default mod mask is #GDK_CONTROL_MASK | #GDK_SHIFT_MASK | #GDK_MOD1_MASK | #GDK_SUPER_MASK | #GDK_HYPER_MASK | #GDK_META_MASK, that is, Control, Shift, Alt, Super, Hyper and Meta. Other modifiers will by default be ignored by #GtkAccelGroup. You must include at least the three modifiers Control, Shift and Alt in any value you pass to this function.
The default mod mask should be changed on application startup, before using any accelerator groups.

function.name: gtk_accelerator_valid
function.description: Determines whether a given keyval and modifier mask constitute a valid keyboard accelerator. For example, the #GDK_KEY_a keyval plus #GDK_CONTROL_MASK is valid - this is a "Ctrl+a" accelerator. But, you can't, for instance, use the #GDK_KEY_Control_L keyval as an accelerator.
function.return: %TRUE if the accelerator is valid

function.name: gtk_accessible_connect_widget_destroyed
function.description:
This function specifies the callback function to be called when the widget corresponding to a GtkAccessible is destroyed.
Deprecated: 3.4: Use gtk_accessible_set_widget() and its vfuncs.

function.name: gtk_accessible_get_widget
function.description:
Gets the #GtkWidget corresponding to the #GtkAccessible. The returned widget does not have a reference added, so you do not need to unref it.
Since: 2.22
function.return: pointer to the #GtkWidget corresponding to the #GtkAccessible, or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_accessible_set_widget
function.description:
Sets the #GtkWidget corresponding to the #GtkAccessible.
<note><para>@accessible will not hold a reference to @widget. It is the caller's responsibility to ensure that when @widget is destroyed, the widget is unset by calling this function again with @widget set to %NULL.</para></note> Since: 2.22

function.name: gtk_action_activate
function.description:
Emits the "activate" signal on the specified action, if it isn't insensitive. This gets called by the proxy widgets when they get activated.
It can also be used to manually activate an action.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10: Use g_action_group_activate_action() on a #GAction instead

function.name: gtk_action_block_activate
function.description:
Disable activation signals from the action
This is needed when updating the state of your proxy #GtkActivatable widget could result in calling gtk_action_activate(), this is a convenience function to avoid recursing in those cases (updating toggle state for instance).
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use g_simple_action_set_enabled() to disable the #GSimpleAction instead

function.name: gtk_action_connect_accelerator
function.description:
Installs the accelerator for @action if @action has an accel path and group. See gtk_action_set_accel_path() and gtk_action_set_accel_group()
Since multiple proxies may independently trigger the installation of the accelerator, the @action counts the number of times this function has been called and doesn't remove the accelerator until gtk_action_disconnect_accelerator() has been called as many times.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction and the accelerator group on an associated #GtkMenu instead

function.name: gtk_action_create_icon
function.description:
This function is intended for use by action implementations to create icons displayed in the proxy widgets.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10: Use g_menu_item_set_icon() to set an icon on a #GMenuItem, or gtk_container_add() to add a #GtkImage to a #GtkButton

parameter.name: icon_size
parameter.parameter_description: the size of the icon that should be created.

function.return: a widget that displays the icon for this action.

function.name: gtk_action_create_menu
function.description:
If @action provides a #GtkMenu widget as a submenu for the menu item or the toolbar item it creates, this function returns an instance of that menu.
Since: 2.12
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction and #GMenuModel instead, and create a #GtkMenu with gtk_menu_new_from_model()
function.return: the menu item provided by the action, or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_action_create_menu_item
function.description:
Creates a menu item widget that proxies for the given action.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10: Use g_menu_item_new() and associate it with a #GAction instead.
function.return: a menu item connected to the action.

function.name: gtk_action_create_tool_item
function.description:
Creates a toolbar item widget that proxies for the given action.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10: Use a #GtkToolItem and associate it with a #GAction using gtk_actionable_set_action_name() instead
function.return: a toolbar item connected to the action.

function.name: gtk_action_disconnect_accelerator
function.description:
Undoes the effect of one call to gtk_action_connect_accelerator().
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction and the accelerator group on an associated #GtkMenu instead

function.name: gtk_action_get_accel_closure
function.description:
Returns the accel closure for this action.
Since: 2.8
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction and #GtkMenu instead, which have no equivalent for getting the accel closure
function.return: the accel closure for this action. The returned closure is owned by GTK+ and must not be unreffed or modified.

function.name: gtk_action_get_accel_path
function.description:
Returns the accel path for this action.
Since: 2.6
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction and the accelerator path on an associated #GtkMenu instead
function.return: the accel path for this action, or %NULL if none is set. The returned string is owned by GTK+ and must not be freed or modified.

function.name: gtk_action_get_always_show_image
function.description:
Returns whether @action<!-- -->'s menu item proxies will always show their image, if available.
Since: 2.20
Deprecated: 3.10: Use g_menu_item_get_attribute_value() on a #GMenuItem instead
function.return: %TRUE if the menu item proxies will always show their image

function.name: gtk_action_get_gicon
function.description:
Gets the gicon of @action.
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, and g_menu_item_get_attribute_value() to get an icon from a #GMenuItem associated with a #GAction
function.return: The action's #GIcon if one is set.

function.name: gtk_action_get_icon_name
function.description:
Gets the icon name of @action.
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, and g_menu_item_get_attribute_value() to get an icon from a #GMenuItem associated with a #GAction
function.return: the icon name

function.name: gtk_action_get_is_important
function.description:
Checks whether @action is important or not
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, and control and monitor whether labels are shown directly
function.return: whether @action is important

function.name: gtk_action_get_label
function.description:
Gets the label text of @action.
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, and get a label from a menu item with g_menu_item_get_attribute_value(). For #GtkActionable widgets, use the widget-specific API to get a label
function.return: the label text

function.name: gtk_action_get_name
function.description:
Returns the name of the action.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10: Use g_action_get_name() on a #GAction instead
function.return: the name of the action. The string belongs to GTK+ and should not be freed.

function.name: gtk_action_get_proxies
function.description:
Returns the proxy widgets for an action. See also gtk_activatable_get_related_action().
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: a #GSList of proxy widgets. The list is owned by GTK+ and must not be modified.

function.name: gtk_action_get_sensitive
function.description:
Returns whether the action itself is sensitive. Note that this doesn't necessarily mean effective sensitivity. See gtk_action_is_sensitive() for that.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10: Use g_simple_action_get_enabled() on a #GSimpleAction instead
function.return: %TRUE if the action itself is sensitive.

function.name: gtk_action_get_short_label
function.description:
Gets the short label text of @action.
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, which has no equivalent of short labels
function.return: the short label text.

function.name: gtk_action_get_stock_id
function.description:
Gets the stock id of @action.
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, which has no equivalent of stock items
function.return: the stock id

function.name: gtk_action_get_tooltip
function.description:
Gets the tooltip text of @action.
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, and get tooltips from associated #GActionable widgets with gtk_widget_get_tooltip_text()
function.return: the tooltip text

function.name: gtk_action_get_visible
function.description:
Returns whether the action itself is visible. Note that this doesn't necessarily mean effective visibility. See gtk_action_is_sensitive() for that.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, and control and monitor the state of #GtkActionable widgets directly
function.return: %TRUE if the action itself is visible.

function.name: gtk_action_get_visible_horizontal
function.description:
Checks whether @action is visible when horizontal
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, and control and monitor the visibility of associated widgets and menu items directly
function.return: whether @action is visible when horizontal

function.name: gtk_action_get_visible_vertical
function.description:
Checks whether @action is visible when horizontal
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, and control and monitor the visibility of associated widgets and menu items directly
function.return: whether @action is visible when horizontal

function.name: gtk_action_group_add_action
function.description:
Adds an action object to the action group. Note that this function does not set up the accel path of the action, which can lead to problems if a user tries to modify the accelerator of a menuitem associated with the action. Therefore you must either set the accel path yourself with gtk_action_set_accel_path(), or use <literal>gtk_action_group_add_action_with_accel (..., NULL)</literal>.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10

function.name: gtk_action_group_add_action_with_accel
function.description:
Adds an action object to the action group and sets up the accelerator.
If @accelerator is %NULL, attempts to use the accelerator associated with the stock_id of the action.
Accel paths are set to <literal><Actions>/<replaceable>group-name</replaceable>/<replaceable>action-name</replaceable></literal>.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: accelerator
parameter.parameter_description: the accelerator for the action, in the format understood by gtk_accelerator_parse(), or "" for no accelerator, or %NULL to use the stock accelerator

function.name: gtk_action_group_add_actions
function.description:
This is a convenience function to create a number of actions and add them to the action group.
The "activate" signals of the actions are connected to the callbacks and their accel paths are set to <literal><Actions>/<replaceable>group-name</replaceable>/<replaceable>action-name</replaceable></literal>.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: data to pass to the action callbacks

function.name: gtk_action_group_add_actions_full
function.description:
This variant of gtk_action_group_add_actions() adds a #GDestroyNotify callback for @user_data.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: data to pass to the action callbacks

function.name: gtk_action_group_add_radio_actions
function.description:
This is a convenience routine to create a group of radio actions and add them to the action group.
The "changed" signal of the first radio action is connected to the @on_change callback and the accel paths of the actions are set to <literal><Actions>/<replaceable>group-name</replaceable>/<replaceable>action-name</replaceable></literal>.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: entries
parameter.parameter_description: an array of radio action descriptions

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the value of the action to activate initially, or -1 if no action should be activated

parameter.name: on_change
parameter.parameter_description: the callback to connect to the changed signal

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: data to pass to the action callbacks

function.name: gtk_action_group_add_radio_actions_full
function.description:
This variant of gtk_action_group_add_radio_actions() adds a #GDestroyNotify callback for @user_data.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: entries
parameter.parameter_description: an array of radio action descriptions

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the value of the action to activate initially, or -1 if no action should be activated

parameter.name: on_change
parameter.parameter_description: the callback to connect to the changed signal

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: data to pass to the action callbacks

function.name: gtk_action_group_add_toggle_actions
function.description:
This is a convenience function to create a number of toggle actions and add them to the action group.
The "activate" signals of the actions are connected to the callbacks and their accel paths are set to <literal><Actions>/<replaceable>group-name</replaceable>/<replaceable>action-name</replaceable></literal>.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: entries
parameter.parameter_description: an array of toggle action descriptions

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: data to pass to the action callbacks

function.name: gtk_action_group_add_toggle_actions_full
function.description:
This variant of gtk_action_group_add_toggle_actions() adds a #GDestroyNotify callback for @user_data.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: entries
parameter.parameter_description: an array of toggle action descriptions

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: data to pass to the action callbacks

function.name: gtk_action_group_get_accel_group
function.description:
Gets the accelerator group.
Since: 3.6
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: the accelerator group associated with this action group or %NULL if there is none.

function.name: gtk_action_group_get_action
function.description:
Looks up an action in the action group by name.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: the action, or %NULL if no action by that name exists

function.name: gtk_action_group_get_name
function.description:
Gets the name of the action group.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: the name of the action group.

function.name: gtk_action_group_get_sensitive
function.description:
Returns %TRUE if the group is sensitive. The constituent actions can only be logically sensitive (see gtk_action_is_sensitive()) if they are sensitive (see gtk_action_get_sensitive()) and their group is sensitive.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: %TRUE if the group is sensitive.

function.name: gtk_action_group_get_visible
function.description:
Returns %TRUE if the group is visible. The constituent actions can only be logically visible (see gtk_action_is_visible()) if they are visible (see gtk_action_get_visible()) and their group is visible.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: %TRUE if the group is visible.

function.name: gtk_action_group_list_actions

Lists the actions in the action group.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10

function.name: gtk_action_group_new

Creates a new #GtkActionGroup object. The name of the action group is used when associating <link linkend="Action-Accel">keybindings</link> with the actions.

function.name: gtk_action_group_set_translate_func
function.description:
Sets a function to be used for translating the @label and @tooltip of #GtkActionEntry<!-- -->s added by gtk_action_group_add_actions().
If you're using gettext(), it is enough to set the translation domain with gtk_action_group_set_translation_domain().

Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: data to be passed to @func and @notify

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: a #GDestroyNotify function to be called when @action_group is destroyed and when the translation function is changed again

function.name: gtk_action_group_set_translation_domain
function.description:
Sets the translation domain and uses g_dgettext() for translating the @label and @tooltip of #GtkActionEntry<!-- -->s added by gtk_action_group_add_actions().
If you're not using gettext() for localization, see gtk_action_group_set_translate_func().
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: domain
parameter.parameter_description: the translation domain to use for g_dgettext() calls, or %NULL to use the domain set with textdomain()

function.name: gtk_action_group_set_visible

Changes the visible of @action_group.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10

function.name: gtk_action_group_translate_string
function.description:
Translates a string using the function set with gtk_action_group_set_translate_func(). This is mainly intended for language bindings.
Since: 2.6
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: the translation of @string

function.name: gtk_action_is_sensitive
function.description:
Returns whether the action is effectively sensitive.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10: Use g_simple_action_get_enabled() on a #GSimpleAction instead
function.return: %TRUE if the action and its associated action group are both sensitive.

function.name: gtk_action_is_visible
function.description:
Returns whether the action is effectively visible.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, and control and monitor the state of #GtkActionable widgets directly
function.return: %TRUE if the action and its associated action group are both visible.

function.name: gtk_action_muxer_get_parent
function.return: the parent of @muxer, or NULL.

function.name: gtk_action_muxer_insert
function.description:
Adds the actions in @action_group to the list of actions provided by @muxer. @prefix is prefixed to each action name, such that for each action <varname>x</varname> in @action_group, there is an equivalent action @prefix<literal>.</literal><varname>x</varname> in @muxer.
For example, if @prefix is "<literal>app</literal>" and @action_group contains an action called "<literal>quit</literal>", then @muxer will now contain an action called "<literal>app.quit</literal>".
If any #GtkActionObservers are registered for actions in the group, "action_added" notifications will be emitted, as appropriate.
@prefix must not contain a dot ('.').

parameter.name: prefix
parameter.parameter_description: the prefix string for the action group

function.name: gtk_action_muxer_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkActionMuxer.

function.name: gtk_action_muxer_remove
function.description:
Removes a #GActionGroup from the #GtkActionMuxer.
If any #GtkActionObservers are registered for actions in the group, "action_removed" notifications will be emitted, as appropriate.

parameter.name: prefix
parameter.parameter_description: the prefix of the action group to remove

function.name: gtk_action_muxer_set_parent
function.description: Sets the parent of @muxer to @parent.

function.name: gtk_action_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkAction object. To add the action to a #GtkActionGroup and set the accelerator for the action, call gtk_action_group_add_action_with_accel(). See <xref linkend="XML-UI"/> for information on allowed action names.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, associating it to a widget with #GtkActionable or creating a #GtkMenu with gtk_menu_new_from_model()

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: A unique name for the action

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: the label displayed in menu items and on buttons, or %NULL

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.parameter_description: a tooltip for the action, or %NULL

parameter.name: stock_id
parameter.parameter_description: the stock icon to display in widgets representing the action, or %NULL

function.return: a new #GtkAction

function.name: gtk_action_observable_register_observer
function.description: Registers @observer as being interested in changes to @action_name on @observable.

parameter.name: observer
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkActionObserver to which the events will be reported

function.name: gtk_action_observable_unregister_observer
function.description:
Removes the registration of @observer as being interested in changes to @action_name on @observable.
If the observer was registered multiple times, it must be unregistered an equal number of times.

parameter.name: observer
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkActionObserver to which the events will be reported

function.name: gtk_action_observer_action_added
function.description:
This function is called when an action that the observer is registered to receive events for is added.
This function should only be called by objects with which the observer has explicitly registered itself to receive events.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the action is now enabled

parameter.name: parameter_type
parameter.parameter_description: the parameter type for action invocations, or %NULL if no parameter is required

parameter.name: state
parameter.parameter_description: the current state of the action, or %NULL if the action is stateless

function.name: gtk_action_observer_action_enabled_changed
function.description:
This function is called when an action that the observer is registered to receive events for becomes enabled or disabled.
This function should only be called by objects with which the observer has explicitly registered itself to receive events.

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the action is now enabled

function.name: gtk_action_observer_action_removed
function.description:
This function is called when an action that the observer is registered to receive events for is removed.
This function should only be called by objects with which the observer has explicitly registered itself to receive events.

function.name: gtk_action_observer_action_state_changed
function.description:
This function is called when an action that the observer is registered to receive events for changes to its state.
This function should only be called by objects with which the observer has explicitly registered itself to receive events.

parameter.name: state
parameter.parameter_description: the new state of the action

function.name: gtk_action_set_accel_group
function.description:
Sets the #GtkAccelGroup in which the accelerator for this action will be installed.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction and the accelerator group on an associated #GtkMenu instead

function.name: gtk_action_set_accel_path
function.description:
Sets the accel path for this action. All proxy widgets associated with the action will have this accel path, so that their accelerators are consistent.
Note that @accel_path string will be stored in a #GQuark. Therefore, if you pass a static string, you can save some memory by interning it first with g_intern_static_string().
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction and the accelerator path on an associated #GtkMenu instead

function.name: gtk_action_set_always_show_image
function.description:
Sets whether @action<!-- -->'s menu item proxies will always show their image, if available.
Use this if the menu item would be useless or hard to use without their image.
Since: 2.20
Deprecated: 3.10: Use g_menu_item_set_icon() on a #GMenuItem instead, if the item should have an image

parameter.name: always_show
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if menuitem proxies should always show their image

function.name: gtk_action_set_gicon
function.description:
Sets the icon of @action.
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, and g_menu_item_set_icon() to set an icon on a #GMenuItem associated with a #GAction, or gtk_container_add() to add a #GtkImage to a #GtkButton

function.name: gtk_action_set_icon_name
function.description:
Sets the icon name on @action
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, and g_menu_item_set_icon() to set an icon on a #GMenuItem associated with a #GAction, or gtk_container_add() to add a #GtkImage to a #GtkButton

function.name: gtk_action_set_is_important
function.description:
Sets whether the action is important, this attribute is used primarily by toolbar items to decide whether to show a label or not.
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, and control and monitor whether labels are shown directly

function.name: gtk_action_set_label
function.description:
Sets the label of @action.
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, and set a label on a menu item with g_menu_item_set_label(). For #GtkActionable widgets, use the widget-specific API to set a label

function.name: gtk_action_set_sensitive
function.description:
Sets the ::sensitive property of the action to @sensitive. Note that this doesn't necessarily mean effective sensitivity. See gtk_action_is_sensitive() for that.
Since: 2.6
Deprecated: 3.10: Use g_simple_action_set_enabled() on a #GSimpleAction instead

function.name: gtk_action_set_short_label
function.description:
Sets a shorter label text on @action.
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, which has no equivalent of short labels

function.name: gtk_action_set_stock_id
function.description:
Sets the stock id on @action
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, which has no equivalent of stock items

function.name: gtk_action_set_tooltip
function.description:
Sets the tooltip text on @action
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, and set tooltips on associated #GActionable widgets with gtk_widget_set_tooltip_text()

function.name: gtk_action_set_visible
function.description:
Sets the ::visible property of the action to @visible. Note that this doesn't necessarily mean effective visibility. See gtk_action_is_visible() for that.
Since: 2.6
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, and control and monitor the state of #GtkActionable widgets directly

function.name: gtk_action_set_visible_horizontal
function.description:
Sets whether @action is visible when horizontal
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, and control and monitor the visibility of associated widgets and menu items directly

parameter.name: visible_horizontal
parameter.parameter_description: whether the action is visible horizontally

function.name: gtk_action_set_visible_vertical
function.description:
Sets whether @action is visible when vertical
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use #GAction instead, and control and monitor the visibility of associated widgets and menu items directly

parameter.name: visible_vertical
parameter.parameter_description: whether the action is visible vertically

function.name: gtk_action_unblock_activate
function.description:
Reenable activation signals from the action
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use g_simple_action_set_enabled() to enable the #GSimpleAction instead

function.name: gtk_actionable_get_action_name
function.description:
Gets the action name for @actionable.
See gtk_actionable_set_action_name() for more information.
Since: 3.4
function.return: the action name, or %NULL if none is set

function.name: gtk_actionable_get_action_target_value
function.description:
Gets the current target value of @actionabe.
See gtk_actionable_set_action_target_value() for more information.
Since: 3.4
function.return: the current target value

function.name: gtk_actionable_set_action_name
function.description:
Specifies the name of the action with which this widget should be associated. If @action_name is %NULL then the widget will be unassociated from any previous action.
Usually this function is used when the widget is located (or will be located) within the hierarchy of a #GtkApplicationWindow.
Names are of the form "win.save" or "app.quit" for actions on the containing #GtkApplicationWindow or its associated #GtkApplication, respectively. This is the same form used for actions in the #GMenu associated with the window.
Since: 3.4

function.name: gtk_actionable_set_action_target
function.description:
Sets the target of an actionable widget.
This is a convenience function that calls g_variant_new() for @format_string and uses the result to call gtk_actionable_set_action_target_value().
If you are setting a string-valued target and want to set the action name at the same time, you can use gtk_actionable_set_detailed_action_name ().
Since: 3.4

function.name: gtk_actionable_set_action_target_value
function.description:
Sets the target value of an actionable widget.
If @target_value is %NULL then the target value is unset.
The target value has two purposes. First, it is used as the parameter to activation of the action associated with the #GtkActionable widget. Second, it is used to determine if the widget should be rendered as "active" - the widget is active if the state is equal to the given target.
Consider the example of associating a set of buttons with a #GAction with string state in a typical "radio button" situation. Each button will be associated with the same action, but with a different target value for that action. Clicking on a particular button will activate the action with the target of that button, which will typically cause the action's state to change to that value. Since the action's state is now equal to the target value of the button, the button will now be rendered as active (and the other buttons, with different targets, rendered inactive).
Since: 3.4

parameter.name: target_value
parameter.parameter_description: a #GVariant to set as the target value, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_actionable_set_detailed_action_name
function.description:
Sets the action-name and associated string target value of an actionable widget.
This allows for the effect of both gtk_actionable_set_action_name() and gtk_actionable_set_action_target_value() in the common case that the target is string-valued.
@detailed_action_name is a string of the form <literal>"action::target"</literal> where <literal>action</literal> is the action name and <literal>target</literal> is the string to use as the target.
Since: 3.4

function.name: gtk_activatable_do_set_related_action
function.description:
This is a utility function for #GtkActivatable implementors.
When implementing #GtkActivatable you must call this when handling changes of the #GtkActivatable:related-action, and you must also use this to break references in #GObject->dispose().
This function adds a reference to the currently set related action for you, it also makes sure the #GtkActivatable->update() method is called when the related #GtkAction properties change and registers to the action's proxy list.
<note><para>Be careful to call this before setting the local copy of the #GtkAction property, since this function uses gtk_activatable_get_related_action() to retrieve the previous action</para></note>
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10

function.name: gtk_activatable_get_related_action
function.description:
Gets the related #GtkAction for @activatable.
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: the related #GtkAction if one is set.

function.name: gtk_activatable_get_use_action_appearance
function.description:
Gets whether this activatable should reset its layout and appearance when setting the related action or when the action changes appearance.
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: whether @activatable uses its actions appearance.

function.name: gtk_activatable_set_related_action
function.description:
Sets the related action on the @activatable object.
<note><para>#GtkActivatable implementors need to handle the #GtkActivatable:related-action property and call gtk_activatable_do_set_related_action() when it changes.</para></note>
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10

function.name: gtk_activatable_set_use_action_appearance
function.description:
Sets whether this activatable should reset its layout and appearance when setting the related action or when the action changes appearance
<note><para>#GtkActivatable implementors need to handle the #GtkActivatable:use-action-appearance property and call gtk_activatable_sync_action_properties() to update @activatable if needed.</para></note>
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: use_appearance
parameter.parameter_description: whether to use the actions appearance

function.name: gtk_activatable_sync_action_properties
function.description:
This is called to update the activatable completely, this is called internally when the #GtkActivatable:related-action property is set or unset and by the implementing class when #GtkActivatable:use-action-appearance changes.
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10

function.name: gtk_adjustment_changed
function.description: Emits a #GtkAdjustment::changed signal from the #GtkAdjustment. This is typically called by the owner of the #GtkAdjustment after it has changed any of the #GtkAdjustment properties other than the value.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_clamp_page
function.description: Updates the #GtkAdjustment:value property to ensure that the range between @lower and @upper is in the current page (i.e. between #GtkAdjustment:value and #GtkAdjustment:value + #GtkAdjustment:page_size). If the range is larger than the page size, then only the start of it will be in the current page. A #GtkAdjustment::changed signal will be emitted if the value is changed.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_configure
function.description:
Sets all properties of the adjustment at once.
Use this function to avoid multiple emissions of the #GtkAdjustment::changed signal. See gtk_adjustment_set_lower() for an alternative way of compressing multiple emissions of #GtkAdjustment::changed into one.
Since: 2.14

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_lower
function.description:
Retrieves the minimum value of the adjustment.
Since: 2.14
function.return: The current minimum value of the adjustment.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_minimum_increment
function.description:
Gets the smaller of step increment and page increment.
Since: 3.2
function.return: the minimum increment of @adjustment

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_page_increment
function.description:
Retrieves the page increment of the adjustment.
Since: 2.14
function.return: The current page increment of the adjustment.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_page_size
function.description:
Retrieves the page size of the adjustment.
Since: 2.14
function.return: The current page size of the adjustment.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_step_increment
function.description:
Retrieves the step increment of the adjustment.
Since: 2.14
function.return: The current step increment of the adjustment.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_upper
function.description:
Retrieves the maximum value of the adjustment.
Since: 2.14
function.return: The current maximum value of the adjustment.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_get_value
function.description: Gets the current value of the adjustment. See gtk_adjustment_set_value ().
function.return: The current value of the adjustment.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkAdjustment.
function.return: a new #GtkAdjustment.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_set_lower
function.description:
Sets the minimum value of the adjustment.
When setting multiple adjustment properties via their individual setters, multiple #GtkAdjustment::changed signals will be emitted. However, since the emission of the #GtkAdjustment::changed signal is tied to the emission of the #GObject::notify signals of the changed properties, it's possible to compress the #GtkAdjustment::changed signals into one by calling g_object_freeze_notify() and g_object_thaw_notify() around the calls to the individual setters.
Alternatively, using a single g_object_set() for all the properties to change, or using gtk_adjustment_configure() has the same effect of compressing #GtkAdjustment::changed emissions.
Since: 2.14

function.name: gtk_adjustment_set_page_increment
function.description:
Sets the page increment of the adjustment.
See gtk_adjustment_set_lower() about how to compress multiple emissions of the #GtkAdjustment::changed signal when setting multiple adjustment properties.
Since: 2.14

function.name: gtk_adjustment_set_page_size
function.description:
Sets the page size of the adjustment.
See gtk_adjustment_set_lower() about how to compress multiple emissions of the GtkAdjustment::changed signal when setting multiple adjustment properties.
Since: 2.14

function.name: gtk_adjustment_set_step_increment
function.description:
Sets the step increment of the adjustment.
See gtk_adjustment_set_lower() about how to compress multiple emissions of the #GtkAdjustment::changed signal when setting multiple adjustment properties.
Since: 2.14

function.name: gtk_adjustment_set_upper
function.description:
Sets the maximum value of the adjustment.
Note that values will be restricted by <literal>upper - page-size</literal> if the page-size property is nonzero.
See gtk_adjustment_set_lower() about how to compress multiple emissions of the #GtkAdjustment::changed signal when setting multiple adjustment properties.
Since: 2.14

function.name: gtk_adjustment_set_value
function.description:
Sets the #GtkAdjustment value. The value is clamped to lie between #GtkAdjustment:lower and #GtkAdjustment:upper.
Note that for adjustments which are used in a #GtkScrollbar, the effective range of allowed values goes from #GtkAdjustment:lower to #GtkAdjustment:upper - #GtkAdjustment:page_size.

function.name: gtk_adjustment_value_changed
function.description: Emits a #GtkAdjustment::value_changed signal from the #GtkAdjustment. This is typically called by the owner of the #GtkAdjustment after it has changed the #GtkAdjustment:value property.

function.name: gtk_alignment_get_padding
function.description:
Gets the padding on the different sides of the widget. See gtk_alignment_set_padding ().
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: padding_top
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the padding for the top of the widget, or %NULL

parameter.name: padding_bottom
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the padding for the bottom of the widget, or %NULL

parameter.name: padding_left
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the padding for the left of the widget, or %NULL

parameter.name: padding_right
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the padding for the right of the widget, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_alignment_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkAlignment.

parameter.name: xalign
parameter.parameter_description: the horizontal alignment of the child widget, from 0 (left) to 1 (right).

parameter.name: yalign
parameter.parameter_description: the vertical alignment of the child widget, from 0 (top) to 1 (bottom).

parameter.name: xscale
parameter.parameter_description: the amount that the child widget expands horizontally to fill up unused space, from 0 to 1. A value of 0 indicates that the child widget should never expand. A value of 1 indicates that the child widget will expand to fill all of the space allocated for the #GtkAlignment.

parameter.name: yscale
parameter.parameter_description: the amount that the child widget expands vertically to fill up unused space, from 0 to 1. The values are similar to @xscale.

function.return: the new #GtkAlignment.

function.name: gtk_alignment_set
function.description: Sets the #GtkAlignment values.

parameter.name: xalign
parameter.parameter_description: the horizontal alignment of the child widget, from 0 (left) to 1 (right).

parameter.name: yalign
parameter.parameter_description: the vertical alignment of the child widget, from 0 (top) to 1 (bottom).

parameter.name: xscale
parameter.parameter_description: the amount that the child widget expands horizontally to fill up unused space, from 0 to 1. A value of 0 indicates that the child widget should never expand. A value of 1 indicates that the child widget will expand to fill all of the space allocated for the #GtkAlignment.

parameter.name: yscale
parameter.parameter_description: the amount that the child widget expands vertically to fill up unused space, from 0 to 1. The values are similar to @xscale.

function.name: gtk_alignment_set_padding
function.description:
Sets the padding on the different sides of the widget. The padding adds blank space to the sides of the widget. For instance, this can be used to indent the child widget towards the right by adding padding on the left.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: padding_top
parameter.parameter_description: the padding at the top of the widget

parameter.name: padding_bottom
parameter.parameter_description: the padding at the bottom of the widget

parameter.name: padding_left
parameter.parameter_description: the padding at the left of the widget

parameter.name: padding_right
parameter.parameter_description: the padding at the right of the widget.

function.name: gtk_alternative_dialog_button_order
function.description:
Returns %TRUE if dialogs are expected to use an alternative button order on the screen @screen. See gtk_dialog_set_alternative_button_order() for more details about alternative button order.
If you need to use this function, you should probably connect to the ::notify:gtk-alternative-button-order signal on the #GtkSettings object associated to @screen, in order to be notified if the button order setting changes.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: screen
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkScreen, or %NULL to use the default screen

function.return: Whether the alternative button order should be used

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_button_append_custom_item
function.description:
Appends a custom item to the list of applications that is shown in the popup; the item name must be unique per-widget. Clients can use the provided name as a detail for the #GtkAppChooserButton::custom-item-activated signal, to add a callback for the activation of a particular custom item in the list. See also gtk_app_chooser_button_append_separator().
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: label

parameter.name: icon
parameter.parameter_description: the icon for the custom item

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_button_append_separator

Appends a separator to the list of applications that is shown in the popup.

Returns the current value of the #GtkAppChooserButton:show-default-item property.
Since: 3.2
function.return: the value of #GtkAppChooserButton:show-default-item

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_button_get_show_dialog_item
function.description:

function.return: the value of #GtkAppChooserButton:show-dialog-item

Creates a new #GtkAppChooserButton for applications that can handle content of the given type.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: content_type

function.description:
Selects a custom item previously added with gtk_app_chooser_button_append_custom_item().
Use gtk_app_chooser_refresh() to bring the selection to its initial state.

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the custom item

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_button_set_heading
function.description: Sets the text to display at the top of the dialog. If the heading is not set, the dialog displays a default text.

function.name: gtk_app_chooser_button_set_show_default_item
