function.return: the #GtkCellRenderer at @x and @y.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_current_path_string
function.description:
Gets the current #GtkTreePath string for the currently applied #GtkTreeIter, this is implicitly updated when gtk_cell_area_apply_attributes() is called and can be used to interact with renderers from #GtkCellArea subclasses.
Since: 3.0
function.return: The current #GtkTreePath string for the current attributes applied to @area. This string belongs to the area and should not be freed.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_edit_widget
function.description:
Gets the #GtkCellEditable widget currently used to edit the currently edited cell.
Since: 3.0
function.return: The currently active #GtkCellEditable widget

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_edited_cell
function.description:
Gets the #GtkCellRenderer in @area that is currently being edited.
Since: 3.0
function.return: The currently edited #GtkCellRenderer

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_focus_cell
function.description:
Retrieves the currently focused cell for @area
Since: 3.0
function.return: the currently focused cell in @area.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_focus_from_sibling
function.description:
Gets the #GtkCellRenderer which is expected to be focusable for which @renderer is, or may be a sibling.
This is handy for #GtkCellArea subclasses when handling events, after determining the renderer at the event location it can then chose to activate the focus cell for which the event cell may have been a sibling.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the #GtkCellRenderer for which @renderer is a sibling, or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_focus_siblings
function.description:
Gets the focus sibling cell renderers for @renderer.
Since: 3.0
function.return: A #GList of #GtkCellRenderers. The returned list is internal and should not be freed.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellAreaContext to perform this request with

parameter.name: minimum_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum height, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural height, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height_for_width
function.description:
Retrieves a cell area's minimum and natural height if it would be given the specified @width.
@area stores some geometrical information in @context along the way while calling gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width(). It's important to perform a series of gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width() requests with @context first and then call gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height_for_width() on each cell area individually to get the height for width of each fully requested row.
If at some point, the width of a single row changes, it should be requested with gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width() again and then the full width of the requested rows checked again with gtk_cell_area_context_get_preferred_width().
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellAreaContext which has already been requested for widths.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the width for which to check the height of this area

parameter.name: minimum_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum height, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_height
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural height, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellAreaContext to perform this request with

parameter.name: minimum_width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum width, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural width, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width_for_height
function.description:
Retrieves a cell area's minimum and natural width if it would be given the specified @height.
@area stores some geometrical information in @context along the way while calling gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height(). It's important to perform a series of gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height() requests with @context first and then call gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_width_for_height() on each cell area individually to get the height for width of each fully requested row.
If at some point, the height of a single row changes, it should be requested with gtk_cell_area_get_preferred_height() again and then the full height of the requested rows checked again with gtk_cell_area_context_get_preferred_height().
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellAreaContext which has already been requested for widths.

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the height for which to check the width of this area

parameter.name: minimum_width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum width, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_width
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural width, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_area_get_request_mode
function.description:
Gets whether the area prefers a height-for-width layout or a width-for-height layout.
Since: 3.0
function.return: The #GtkSizeRequestMode preferred by @area.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_has_renderer
function.description:
Checks if @area contains @renderer.
Since: 3.0
function.return: %TRUE if @renderer is in the @area.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_inner_cell_area
function.description:
This is a convenience function for #GtkCellArea implementations to get the inner area where a given #GtkCellRenderer will be rendered. It removes any padding previously added by gtk_cell_area_request_renderer().
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: the @widget relative coordinates where one of @area's cells is to be placed

parameter.name: inner_area
parameter.parameter_description: the return location for the inner cell area

function.name: gtk_cell_area_is_activatable
function.description:
Returns whether the area can do anything when activated, after applying new attributes to @area.
Since: 3.0
function.return: whether @area can do anything when activated.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_is_focus_sibling
function.description:
Returns whether @sibling is one of @renderer's focus siblings (see gtk_cell_area_add_focus_sibling()).
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: sibling
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellRenderer to check against @renderer's sibling list

function.return: %TRUE if @sibling is a focus sibling of @renderer

function.name: gtk_cell_area_remove
function.description:
Removes @renderer from @area.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_cell_area_remove_focus_sibling
function.description:
Removes @sibling from @renderer's focus sibling list (see gtk_cell_area_add_focus_sibling()).
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: sibling
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellRenderer to remove from @renderer's focus area

function.name: gtk_cell_area_render
function.description:
Renders @area's cells according to @area's layout onto @widget at the given coordinates.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellAreaContext for this row of data.

parameter.name: paint_focus
parameter.parameter_description: whether @area should paint focus on focused cells for focused rows or not.

function.name: gtk_cell_area_request_renderer
function.description:
This is a convenience function for #GtkCellArea implementations to request size for cell renderers. It's important to use this function to request size and then use gtk_cell_area_inner_cell_area() at render and event time since this function will add padding around the cell for focus painting.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: orientation
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkOrientation in which to request size

parameter.name: for_size
parameter.parameter_description: the allocation contextual size to request for, or -1 if the base request for the orientation is to be returned.

parameter.name: minimum_size
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum size, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_size
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural size, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_area_set_focus_cell
function.description:
Explicitly sets the currently focused cell to @renderer.
This is generally called by implementations of #GtkCellAreaClass.focus() or #GtkCellAreaClass.event(), however it can also be used to implement functions such as gtk_tree_view_set_cursor_on_cell().
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_cell_area_stop_editing
function.description:
Explicitly stops the editing of the currently edited cell.
If @canceled is %TRUE, the currently edited cell renderer will emit the ::editing-canceled signal, otherwise the the ::editing-done signal will be emitted on the current edit widget.
See gtk_cell_area_get_edited_cell() and gtk_cell_area_get_edit_widget().
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_cell_editable_editing_done
function.description: Emits the #GtkCellEditable::editing-done signal.

function.name: gtk_cell_editable_remove_widget
function.description: Emits the #GtkCellEditable::remove-widget signal.

function.name: gtk_cell_editable_start_editing
function.description: Begins editing on a @cell_editable. @event is the #GdkEvent that began the editing process. It may be %NULL, in the instance that editing was initiated through programatic means.

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_add_attribute
function.description:
Adds an attribute mapping to the list in @cell_layout.
The @column is the column of the model to get a value from, and the @attribute is the parameter on @cell to be set from the value. So for example if column 2 of the model contains strings, you could have the "text" attribute of a #GtkCellRendererText get its values from column 2.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: the column position on the model to get the attribute from

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_clear
function.description:
Unsets all the mappings on all renderers on @cell_layout and removes all renderers from @cell_layout.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_clear_attributes
function.description:
Clears all existing attributes previously set with gtk_cell_layout_set_attributes().
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: cell
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkCellRenderer to clear the attribute mapping on

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_get_area
function.description:
Returns the underlying #GtkCellArea which might be @cell_layout if called on a #GtkCellArea or might be %NULL if no #GtkCellArea is used by @cell_layout.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the cell area used by @cell_layout.

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_get_cells
function.description:
Returns the cell renderers which have been added to @cell_layout.
Since: 2.12
function.return: a list of cell renderers. The list, but not the renderers has been newly allocated and should be freed with g_list_free() when no longer needed.

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_pack_end
function.description:
Adds the @cell to the end of @cell_layout. If @expand is %FALSE, then the @cell is allocated no more space than it needs. Any unused space is divided evenly between cells for which @expand is %TRUE.
Note that reusing the same cell renderer is not supported.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: expand
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if @cell is to be given extra space allocated to @cell_layout

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_pack_start
function.description:
Packs the @cell into the beginning of @cell_layout. If @expand is %FALSE, then the @cell is allocated no more space than it needs. Any unused space is divided evenly between cells for which @expand is %TRUE.
Note that reusing the same cell renderer is not supported.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: expand
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if @cell is to be given extra space allocated to @cell_layout

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_reorder
function.description:
Re-inserts @cell at @position.
Note that @cell has already to be packed into @cell_layout for this to function properly.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_set_attributes
function.description:
Sets the attributes in list as the attributes of @cell_layout.
The attributes should be in attribute/column order, as in gtk_cell_layout_add_attribute(). All existing attributes are removed, and replaced with the new attributes.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_cell_layout_set_cell_data_func
function.description:
Sets the #GtkCellLayoutDataFunc to use for @cell_layout.
This function is used instead of the standard attributes mapping for setting the column value, and should set the value of @cell_layout's cell renderer(s) as appropriate.
@func may be %NULL to remove a previously set function.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_accel_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkCellRendererAccel.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the new cell renderer

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_activate
function.description: Passes an activate event to the cell renderer for possible processing. Some cell renderers may use events; for example, #GtkCellRendererToggle toggles when it gets a mouse click.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: widget-dependent string representation of the event location; e.g. for #GtkTreeView, a string representation of #GtkTreePath

parameter.name: background_area
parameter.parameter_description: background area as passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render()

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: cell area as passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render()

function.return: %TRUE if the event was consumed/handled

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_class_set_accessible_type
function.description:
Sets the type to be used for creating accessibles for cells rendered by cell renderers of @renderer_class. Note that multiple accessibles will be created.
This function should only be called from class init functions of cell renderers.

parameter.name: renderer_class
parameter.parameter_description: class to set the accessible type for

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: The object type that implements the accessible for @widget_class. The type must be a subtype of #GtkRendererCellAccessible

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_combo_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkCellRendererCombo. Adjust how text is drawn using object properties. Object properties can be set globally (with g_object_set()). Also, with #GtkTreeViewColumn, you can bind a property to a value in a #GtkTreeModel. For example, you can bind the "text" property on the cell renderer to a string value in the model, thus rendering a different string in each row of the #GtkTreeView.
Since: 2.6
function.return: the new cell renderer

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_get_aligned_area
function.description:
Gets the aligned area used by @cell inside @cell_area. Used for finding the appropriate edit and focus rectangle.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget this cell will be rendering to

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: cell area which would be passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render()

parameter.name: aligned_area
parameter.parameter_description: the return location for the space inside @cell_area that would acually be used to render.

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_get_alignment
function.description:
Fills in @xalign and @yalign with the appropriate values of @cell.
Since: 2.18

parameter.name: xalign
parameter.parameter_description: location to fill in with the x alignment of the cell, or %NULL

parameter.name: yalign
parameter.parameter_description: location to fill in with the y alignment of the cell, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_get_fixed_size
function.description: Fills in @width and @height with the appropriate size of @cell.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: location to fill in with the fixed width of the cell, or %NULL

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: location to fill in with the fixed height of the cell, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_get_padding
function.description:
Fills in @xpad and @ypad with the appropriate values of @cell.
Since: 2.18

parameter.name: xpad
parameter.parameter_description: location to fill in with the x padding of the cell, or %NULL

parameter.name: ypad
parameter.parameter_description: location to fill in with the y padding of the cell, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_get_preferred_height
function.description:
Retreives a renderer's natural size when rendered to @widget.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget this cell will be rendering to

parameter.name: minimum_size
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum size, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_size
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural size, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_get_preferred_height_for_width

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget this cell will be rendering to

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the size which is available for allocation

parameter.name: minimum_height
parameter.parameter_description: location for storing the minimum size, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_height
parameter.parameter_description: location for storing the preferred size, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_get_preferred_size
function.description:
Retrieves the minimum and natural size of a cell taking into account the widget's preference for height-for-width management.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget this cell will be rendering to

parameter.name: minimum_size
parameter.parameter_description: location for storing the minimum size, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_size
parameter.parameter_description: location for storing the natural size, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_get_preferred_width
function.description:
Retreives a renderer's natural size when rendered to @widget.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget this cell will be rendering to

parameter.name: minimum_size
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the minimum size, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_size
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the natural size, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_get_preferred_width_for_height

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget this cell will be rendering to

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the size which is available for allocation

parameter.name: minimum_width
parameter.parameter_description: location for storing the minimum size, or %NULL

parameter.name: natural_width
parameter.parameter_description: location for storing the preferred size, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_get_request_mode
function.description:
Gets whether the cell renderer prefers a height-for-width layout or a width-for-height layout.
Since: 3.0
function.return: The #GtkSizeRequestMode preferred by this renderer.

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_get_sensitive
function.description:
Returns the cell renderer's sensitivity.
Since: 2.18
function.return: %TRUE if the cell renderer is sensitive

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_get_size
function.description:
Obtains the width and height needed to render the cell. Used by view widgets to determine the appropriate size for the cell_area passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render(). If @cell_area is not %NULL, fills in the x and y offsets (if set) of the cell relative to this location.
Please note that the values set in @width and @height, as well as those in @x_offset and @y_offset are inclusive of the xpad and ypad properties.
Deprecated: 3.0: Use gtk_cell_renderer_get_preferred_size() instead.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: the widget the renderer is rendering to

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: The area a cell will be allocated, or %NULL

parameter.name: x_offset
parameter.parameter_description: location to return x offset of cell relative to @cell_area, or %NULL

parameter.name: y_offset
parameter.parameter_description: location to return y offset of cell relative to @cell_area, or %NULL

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: location to return width needed to render a cell, or %NULL

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: location to return height needed to render a cell, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_get_state
function.description:
Translates the cell renderer state to #GtkStateFlags, based on the cell renderer and widget sensitivity, and the given #GtkCellRendererState.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the widget state flags applying to @cell

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_get_visible
function.description:
Returns the cell renderer's visibility.
Since: 2.18
function.return: %TRUE if the cell renderer is visible

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_is_activatable
function.description:
Checks whether the cell renderer can do something when activated.
Since: 3.0
function.return: %TRUE if the cell renderer can do anything when activated

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_pixbuf_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkCellRendererPixbuf. Adjust rendering parameters using object properties. Object properties can be set globally (with g_object_set()). Also, with #GtkTreeViewColumn, you can bind a property to a value in a #GtkTreeModel. For example, you can bind the "pixbuf" property on the cell renderer to a pixbuf value in the model, thus rendering a different image in each row of the #GtkTreeView.
function.return: the new cell renderer

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_progress_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkCellRendererProgress.
Since: 2.6
function.return: the new cell renderer

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_render

parameter.name: cr
parameter.parameter_description: a cairo context to draw to

parameter.name: background_area
parameter.parameter_description: entire cell area (including tree expanders and maybe padding on the sides)

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: area normally rendered by a cell renderer

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_set_alignment
function.description:
Sets the renderer's alignment within its available space.
Since: 2.18

parameter.name: xalign
parameter.parameter_description: the x alignment of the cell renderer

parameter.name: yalign
parameter.parameter_description: the y alignment of the cell renderer

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_set_fixed_size
function.description: Sets the renderer size to be explicit, independent of the properties set.

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the width of the cell renderer, or -1

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the height of the cell renderer, or -1

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_set_padding
function.description:
Sets the renderer's padding.
Since: 2.18

parameter.name: xpad
parameter.parameter_description: the x padding of the cell renderer

parameter.name: ypad
parameter.parameter_description: the y padding of the cell renderer

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_set_sensitive
function.description:
Sets the cell renderer's sensitivity.
Since: 2.18

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_set_visible
function.description:
Sets the cell renderer's visibility.
Since: 2.18

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_spin_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkCellRendererSpin.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a new #GtkCellRendererSpin

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_spinner_new
function.description:
Returns a new cell renderer which will show a spinner to indicate activity.
Since: 2.20
function.return: a new #GtkCellRenderer

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_start_editing
function.description: Passes an activate event to the cell renderer for possible processing.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: widget-dependent string representation of the event location; e.g. for #GtkTreeView, a string representation of #GtkTreePath

parameter.name: background_area
parameter.parameter_description: background area as passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render()

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: cell area as passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render()

function.return: A new #GtkCellEditable, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_stop_editing
function.description:
Informs the cell renderer that the editing is stopped. If @canceled is %TRUE, the cell renderer will emit the #GtkCellRenderer::editing-canceled signal.
This function should be called by cell renderer implementations in response to the #GtkCellEditable::editing-done signal of #GtkCellEditable.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: canceled
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the editing has been canceled

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_text_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkCellRendererText. Adjust how text is drawn using object properties. Object properties can be set globally (with g_object_set()). Also, with #GtkTreeViewColumn, you can bind a property to a value in a #GtkTreeModel. For example, you can bind the "text" property on the cell renderer to a string value in the model, thus rendering a different string in each row of the #GtkTreeView
function.return: the new cell renderer

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_text_set_fixed_height_from_font
function.description: Sets the height of a renderer to explicitly be determined by the "font" and "y_pad" property set on it. Further changes in these properties do not affect the height, so they must be accompanied by a subsequent call to this function. Using this function is unflexible, and should really only be used if calculating the size of a cell is too slow (ie, a massive number of cells displayed). If @number_of_rows is -1, then the fixed height is unset, and the height is determined by the properties again.

parameter.name: number_of_rows
parameter.parameter_description: Number of rows of text each cell renderer is allocated, or -1

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_get_activatable
function.description:
Returns whether the cell renderer is activatable. See gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_set_activatable().
Since: 2.18
function.return: %TRUE if the cell renderer is activatable.

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_get_active
function.description: Returns whether the cell renderer is active. See gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_set_active().
function.return: %TRUE if the cell renderer is active.

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_get_radio
function.description: Returns whether we're rendering radio toggles rather than checkboxes.
function.return: %TRUE if we're rendering radio toggles rather than checkboxes

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkCellRendererToggle. Adjust rendering parameters using object properties. Object properties can be set globally (with g_object_set()). Also, with #GtkTreeViewColumn, you can bind a property to a value in a #GtkTreeModel. For example, you can bind the "active" property on the cell renderer to a boolean value in the model, thus causing the check button to reflect the state of the model.
function.return: the new cell renderer

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_set_activatable
function.description:
Makes the cell renderer activatable.
Since: 2.18

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_set_active
function.description: Activates or deactivates a cell renderer.

function.name: gtk_cell_renderer_toggle_set_radio
function.description: If @radio is %TRUE, the cell renderer renders a radio toggle (i.e. a toggle in a group of mutually-exclusive toggles). If %FALSE, it renders a check toggle (a standalone boolean option). This can be set globally for the cell renderer, or changed just before rendering each cell in the model (for #GtkTreeView, you set up a per-row setting using #GtkTreeViewColumn to associate model columns with cell renderer properties).

parameter.name: radio
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to make the toggle look like a radio button

function.name: gtk_cell_view_get_displayed_row
function.description:
Returns a #GtkTreePath referring to the currently displayed row. If no row is currently displayed, %NULL is returned.
Since: 2.6
function.return: the currently displayed row or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_view_get_draw_sensitive
function.description:
Gets whether @cell_view is configured to draw all of its cells in a sensitive state.
Since: 3.0
function.return: whether @cell_view draws all of its cells in a sensitive state

function.name: gtk_cell_view_get_fit_model
function.description:
Gets whether @cell_view is configured to request space to fit the entire #GtkTreeModel.
Since: 3.0
function.return: whether @cell_view requests space to fit the entire #GtkTreeModel.

function.name: gtk_cell_view_get_model
function.description:
Returns the model for @cell_view. If no model is used %NULL is returned.
Since: 2.16
function.return: a #GtkTreeModel used or %NULL

function.name: gtk_cell_view_get_size_of_row
function.description:
Sets @requisition to the size needed by @cell_view to display the model row pointed to by @path.
Since: 2.6
Deprecated: 3.0: Combo box formerly used this to calculate the sizes for cellviews, now you can achieve this by either using the #GtkCellView:fit-model property or by setting the currently displayed row of the #GtkCellView and using gtk_widget_get_preferred_size().
function.return: %TRUE

function.name: gtk_cell_view_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkCellView widget.
Since: 2.6
function.return: A newly created #GtkCellView widget.

function.name: gtk_cell_view_new_with_context
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkCellView widget with a specific #GtkCellArea to layout cells and a specific #GtkCellAreaContext.
Specifying the same context for a handfull of cells lets the underlying area synchronize the geometry for those cells, in this way alignments with cellviews for other rows are possible.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: context
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellAreaContext in which to calculate cell geometry

function.return: A newly created #GtkCellView widget.

function.name: gtk_cell_view_new_with_markup
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkCellView widget, adds a #GtkCellRendererText to it, and makes it show @markup. The text can be marked up with the <link linkend="PangoMarkupFormat">Pango text markup language</link>.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: markup
parameter.parameter_description: the text to display in the cell view

function.return: A newly created #GtkCellView widget.

function.name: gtk_cell_view_new_with_pixbuf
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkCellView widget, adds a #GtkCellRendererPixbuf to it, and makes it show @pixbuf.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: pixbuf
parameter.parameter_description: the image to display in the cell view

function.return: A newly created #GtkCellView widget.

function.name: gtk_cell_view_new_with_text
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkCellView widget, adds a #GtkCellRendererText to it, and makes it show @text.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: the text to display in the cell view

function.return: A newly created #GtkCellView widget.

function.name: gtk_cell_view_set_background_color
function.description:
Sets the background color of @view.
Since: 2.6
Deprecated: 3.4: Use gtk_cell_view_set_background_rgba() instead.

function.name: gtk_cell_view_set_background_rgba
function.description:
Sets the background color of @cell_view.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_cell_view_set_displayed_row
function.description:
Sets the row of the model that is currently displayed by the #GtkCellView. If the path is unset, then the contents of the cellview "stick" at their last value; this is not normally a desired result, but may be a needed intermediate state if say, the model for the #GtkCellView becomes temporarily empty.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_cell_view_set_draw_sensitive
function.description:
Sets whether @cell_view should draw all of its cells in a sensitive state, this is used by #GtkComboBox menus to ensure that rows with insensitive cells that contain children appear sensitive in the parent menu item.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: draw_sensitive
parameter.parameter_description: whether to draw all cells in a sensitive state.

function.name: gtk_cell_view_set_fit_model
function.description:
Sets whether @cell_view should request space to fit the entire #GtkTreeModel.
This is used by #GtkComboBox to ensure that the cell view displayed on the combo box's button always gets enough space and does not resize when selection changes.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: fit_model
parameter.parameter_description: whether @cell_view should request space for the whole model.

function.name: gtk_cell_view_set_model
function.description:
Sets the model for @cell_view. If @cell_view already has a model set, it will remove it before setting the new model. If @model is %NULL, then it will unset the old model.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_cell_view_set_value
function.description:
Sets a property of a cell renderer of @cell_view, and makes sure the display of @cell_view is updated.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: property
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the property of @renderer to set

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the new value to set the property to

function.name: gtk_check_button_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkCheckButton.
function.return: a #GtkWidget.

function.name: gtk_check_button_new_with_label
function.description: Creates a new #GtkCheckButton with a #GtkLabel to the right of it.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: the text for the check button.

function.return: a #GtkWidget.

function.name: gtk_check_button_new_with_mnemonic
function.description: Creates a new #GtkCheckButton containing a label. The label will be created using gtk_label_new_with_mnemonic(), so underscores in @label indicate the mnemonic for the check button.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: The text of the button, with an underscore in front of the mnemonic character

function.return: a new #GtkCheckButton

function.name: gtk_check_menu_item_get_active
function.description: Returns whether the check menu item is active. See gtk_check_menu_item_set_active ().
function.return: %TRUE if the menu item is checked.

function.name: gtk_check_menu_item_get_draw_as_radio
function.description:
Returns whether @check_menu_item looks like a #GtkRadioMenuItem
Since: 2.4
function.return: Whether @check_menu_item looks like a #GtkRadioMenuItem

function.name: gtk_check_menu_item_get_inconsistent
function.description: Retrieves the value set by gtk_check_menu_item_set_inconsistent().
function.return: %TRUE if inconsistent

function.name: gtk_check_menu_item_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkCheckMenuItem.
function.return: a new #GtkCheckMenuItem.

function.name: gtk_check_menu_item_new_with_label
function.description: Creates a new #GtkCheckMenuItem with a label.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: the string to use for the label.

function.return: a new #GtkCheckMenuItem.

function.name: gtk_check_menu_item_new_with_mnemonic
function.description: Creates a new #GtkCheckMenuItem containing a label. The label will be created using gtk_label_new_with_mnemonic(), so underscores in @label indicate the mnemonic for the menu item.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: The text of the button, with an underscore in front of the character

function.return: a new #GtkCheckMenuItem

function.name: gtk_check_menu_item_set_active
function.description: Sets the active state of the menu item's check box.

parameter.name: is_active
parameter.parameter_description: boolean value indicating whether the check box is active.

function.name: gtk_check_menu_item_set_draw_as_radio
function.description:
Sets whether @check_menu_item is drawn like a #GtkRadioMenuItem
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_check_menu_item_set_inconsistent
function.description: If the user has selected a range of elements (such as some text or spreadsheet cells) that are affected by a boolean setting, and the current values in that range are inconsistent, you may want to display the check in an "in between" state. This function turns on "in between" display. Normally you would turn off the inconsistent state again if the user explicitly selects a setting. This has to be done manually, gtk_check_menu_item_set_inconsistent() only affects visual appearance, it doesn't affect the semantics of the widget.

parameter.name: setting
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to display an "inconsistent" third state check

function.name: gtk_check_menu_item_toggled
function.description: Emits the #GtkCheckMenuItem::toggled signal.

function.name: gtk_check_version
function.description:
Checks that the GTK+ library in use is compatible with the given version. Generally you would pass in the constants #GTK_MAJOR_VERSION, #GTK_MINOR_VERSION, #GTK_MICRO_VERSION as the three arguments to this function; that produces a check that the library in use is compatible with the version of GTK+ the application or module was compiled against.
Compatibility is defined by two things: first the version of the running library is newer than the version @required_major.required_minor.@required_micro. Second the running library must be binary compatible with the version @required_major.required_minor.@required_micro (same major version.)
This function is primarily for GTK+ modules; the module can call this function to check that it wasn't loaded into an incompatible version of GTK+. However, such a check isn't completely reliable, since the module may be linked against an old version of GTK+ and calling the old version of gtk_check_version(), but still get loaded into an application using a newer version of GTK+.
function.return: %NULL if the GTK+ library is compatible with the given version, or a string describing the version mismatch. The returned string is owned by GTK+ and should not be modified or freed.

function.name: gtk_clipboard_clear
function.description: Clears the contents of the clipboard. Generally this should only be called between the time you call gtk_clipboard_set_with_owner() or gtk_clipboard_set_with_data(), and when the @clear_func you supplied is called. Otherwise, the clipboard may be owned by someone else.

function.name: gtk_clipboard_get
function.description: Returns the clipboard object for the given selection. See gtk_clipboard_get_for_display() for complete details.

parameter.name: selection
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkAtom which identifies the clipboard to use

function.return: the appropriate clipboard object. If no clipboard already exists, a new one will be created. Once a clipboard object has been created, it is persistent and, since it is owned by GTK+, must not be freed or unreffed.

function.name: gtk_clipboard_get_display
function.description:
Gets the #GdkDisplay associated with @clipboard
Since: 2.2
function.return: the #GdkDisplay associated with @clipboard

function.name: gtk_clipboard_get_for_display
function.description:
Returns the clipboard object for the given selection. Cut/copy/paste menu items and keyboard shortcuts should use the default clipboard, returned by passing %GDK_SELECTION_CLIPBOARD for @selection. (%GDK_NONE is supported as a synonym for GDK_SELECTION_CLIPBOARD for backwards compatibility reasons.) The currently-selected object or text should be provided on the clipboard identified by #GDK_SELECTION_PRIMARY. Cut/copy/paste menu items conceptually copy the contents of the #GDK_SELECTION_PRIMARY clipboard to the default clipboard, i.e. they copy the selection to what the user sees as the clipboard.
(Passing #GDK_NONE is the same as using <literal>gdk_atom_intern ("CLIPBOARD", FALSE)</literal>. See <ulink url="http://www.freedesktop.org/Standards/clipboards-spec"> http://www.freedesktop.org/Standards/clipboards-spec</ulink> for a detailed discussion of the "CLIPBOARD" vs. "PRIMARY" selections under the X window system. On Win32 the #GDK_SELECTION_PRIMARY clipboard is essentially ignored.)
It's possible to have arbitrary named clipboards; if you do invent new clipboards, you should prefix the selection name with an underscore (because the ICCCM requires that nonstandard atoms are underscore-prefixed), and namespace it as well. For example, if your application called "Foo" has a special-purpose clipboard, you might call it "_FOO_SPECIAL_CLIPBOARD".
Since: 2.2

parameter.name: display
parameter.parameter_description: the display for which the clipboard is to be retrieved or created

parameter.name: selection
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkAtom which identifies the clipboard to use.

function.return: the appropriate clipboard object. If no clipboard already exists, a new one will be created. Once a clipboard object has been created, it is persistent and, since it is owned by GTK+, must not be freed or unrefd.

function.name: gtk_clipboard_get_owner
function.description: If the clipboard contents callbacks were set with gtk_clipboard_set_with_owner(), and the gtk_clipboard_set_with_data() or gtk_clipboard_clear() has not subsequently called, returns the owner set by gtk_clipboard_set_with_owner().
function.return: the owner of the clipboard, if any; otherwise %NULL.

function.name: gtk_clipboard_request_contents
function.description: Requests the contents of clipboard as the given target. When the results of the result are later received the supplied callback will be called.

parameter.name: target
parameter.parameter_description: an atom representing the form into which the clipboard owner should convert the selection.

parameter.name: callback

function.name: gtk_clipboard_request_image
function.description:
Requests the contents of the clipboard as image. When the image is later received, it will be converted to a #GdkPixbuf, and @callback will be called.
The @pixbuf parameter to @callback will contain the resulting #GdkPixbuf if the request succeeded, or %NULL if it failed. This could happen for various reasons, in particular if the clipboard was empty or if the contents of the clipboard could not be converted into an image.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: a function to call when the image is received, or the retrieval fails. (It will always be called one way or the other.)

function.name: gtk_clipboard_request_rich_text
function.description:
Requests the contents of the clipboard as rich text. When the rich text is later received, @callback will be called.
The @text parameter to @callback will contain the resulting rich text if the request succeeded, or %NULL if it failed. The @length parameter will contain @text's length. This function can fail for various reasons, in particular if the clipboard was empty or if the contents of the clipboard could not be converted into rich text form.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: a function to call when the text is received, or the retrieval fails. (It will always be called one way or the other.)

function.name: gtk_clipboard_request_targets
function.description:
Requests the contents of the clipboard as list of supported targets. When the list is later received, @callback will be called.
The @targets parameter to @callback will contain the resulting targets if the request succeeded, or %NULL if it failed.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: a function to call when the targets are received, or the retrieval fails. (It will always be called one way or the other.)

function.name: gtk_clipboard_request_text
function.description:
Requests the contents of the clipboard as text. When the text is later received, it will be converted to UTF-8 if necessary, and @callback will be called.
The @text parameter to @callback will contain the resulting text if the request succeeded, or %NULL if it failed. This could happen for various reasons, in particular if the clipboard was empty or if the contents of the clipboard could not be converted into text form.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: a function to call when the text is received, or the retrieval fails. (It will always be called one way or the other.)

function.name: gtk_clipboard_request_uris
function.description:
Requests the contents of the clipboard as URIs. When the URIs are later received @callback will be called.
The @uris parameter to @callback will contain the resulting array of URIs if the request succeeded, or %NULL if it failed. This could happen for various reasons, in particular if the clipboard was empty or if the contents of the clipboard could not be converted into URI form.
Since: 2.14

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: a function to call when the URIs are received, or the retrieval fails. (It will always be called one way or the other.)

function.name: gtk_clipboard_set_can_store
function.description:
Hints that the clipboard data should be stored somewhere when the application exits or when gtk_clipboard_store () is called.
This value is reset when the clipboard owner changes. Where the clipboard data is stored is platform dependent, see gdk_display_store_clipboard () for more information.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: targets
parameter.parameter_description: array containing information about which forms should be stored or %NULL to indicate that all forms should be stored.

function.name: gtk_clipboard_set_image
function.description:
Sets the contents of the clipboard to the given #GdkPixbuf. GTK+ will take responsibility for responding for requests for the image, and for converting the image into the requested format.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_clipboard_set_text
function.description: Sets the contents of the clipboard to the given UTF-8 string. GTK+ will make a copy of the text and take responsibility for responding for requests for the text, and for converting the text into the requested format.

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: length of @text, in bytes, or -1, in which case the length will be determined with <function>strlen()</function>.

function.name: gtk_clipboard_set_with_data
function.description: Virtually sets the contents of the specified clipboard by providing a list of supported formats for the clipboard data and a function to call to get the actual data when it is requested.

parameter.name: targets
parameter.parameter_description: array containing information about the available forms for the clipboard data

parameter.name: get_func
parameter.parameter_description: function to call to get the actual clipboard data

parameter.name: clear_func
parameter.parameter_description: when the clipboard contents are set again, this function will be called, and @get_func will not be subsequently called.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data to pass to @get_func and @clear_func.

function.return: %TRUE if setting the clipboard data succeeded. If setting the clipboard data failed the provided callback functions will be ignored.

function.name: gtk_clipboard_set_with_owner
function.description:
Virtually sets the contents of the specified clipboard by providing a list of supported formats for the clipboard data and a function to call to get the actual data when it is requested.
The difference between this function and gtk_clipboard_set_with_data() is that instead of an generic @user_data pointer, a #GObject is passed in.

parameter.name: targets
parameter.parameter_description: array containing information about the available forms for the clipboard data

parameter.name: get_func
parameter.parameter_description: function to call to get the actual clipboard data

parameter.name: clear_func
parameter.parameter_description: when the clipboard contents are set again, this function will be called, and @get_func will not be subsequently called

parameter.name: owner
parameter.parameter_description: an object that "owns" the data. This object will be passed to the callbacks when called

function.return: %TRUE if setting the clipboard data succeeded. If setting the clipboard data failed the provided callback functions will be ignored.

function.name: gtk_clipboard_store
function.description:
Stores the current clipboard data somewhere so that it will stay around after the application has quit.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_clipboard_wait_for_contents
function.description: Requests the contents of the clipboard using the given target. This function waits for the data to be received using the main loop, so events, timeouts, etc, may be dispatched during the wait.

parameter.name: target
parameter.parameter_description: an atom representing the form into which the clipboard owner should convert the selection.

function.return: a newly-allocated #GtkSelectionData object or %NULL if retrieving the given target failed. If non-%NULL, this value must be freed with gtk_selection_data_free() when you are finished with it.

function.name: gtk_clipboard_wait_for_image
function.description:
Requests the contents of the clipboard as image and converts the result to a #GdkPixbuf. This function waits for the data to be received using the main loop, so events, timeouts, etc, may be dispatched during the wait.
Since: 2.6
function.return: a newly-allocated #GdkPixbuf object which must be disposed with g_object_unref(), or %NULL if retrieving the selection data failed. (This could happen for various reasons, in particular if the clipboard was empty or if the contents of the clipboard could not be converted into an image.)

function.name: gtk_clipboard_wait_for_rich_text
function.description:
Requests the contents of the clipboard as rich text. This function waits for the data to be received using the main loop, so events, timeouts, etc, may be dispatched during the wait.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the format of the returned data

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the length of the returned data

function.return: a newly-allocated binary block of data which must be freed with g_free(), or %NULL if retrieving the selection data failed. (This could happen for various reasons, in particular if the clipboard was empty or if the contents of the clipboard could not be converted into text form.)

function.name: gtk_clipboard_wait_for_targets
function.description:
Returns a list of targets that are present on the clipboard, or %NULL if there aren't any targets available. The returned list must be freed with g_free(). This function waits for the data to be received using the main loop, so events, timeouts, etc, may be dispatched during the wait.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: targets
parameter.parameter_description: location to store an array of targets. The result stored here must be freed with g_free().

parameter.name: n_targets
parameter.parameter_description: location to store number of items in @targets.

function.return: %TRUE if any targets are present on the clipboard, otherwise %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_clipboard_wait_for_text
function.description: Requests the contents of the clipboard as text and converts the result to UTF-8 if necessary. This function waits for the data to be received using the main loop, so events, timeouts, etc, may be dispatched during the wait.
function.return: a newly-allocated UTF-8 string which must be freed with g_free(), or %NULL if retrieving the selection data failed. (This could happen for various reasons, in particular if the clipboard was empty or if the contents of the clipboard could not be converted into text form.)

function.name: gtk_clipboard_wait_for_uris
function.description:
Requests the contents of the clipboard as URIs. This function waits for the data to be received using the main loop, so events, timeouts, etc, may be dispatched during the wait.
Since: 2.14
function.return: a newly-allocated %NULL-terminated array of strings which must be freed with g_strfreev(), or %NULL if retrieving the selection data failed. (This could happen for various reasons, in particular if the clipboard was empty or if the contents of the clipboard could not be converted into URI form.)

function.name: gtk_clipboard_wait_is_image_available
function.description:
Test to see if there is an image available to be pasted This is done by requesting the TARGETS atom and checking if it contains any of the supported image targets. This function waits for the data to be received using the main loop, so events, timeouts, etc, may be dispatched during the wait.
This function is a little faster than calling gtk_clipboard_wait_for_image() since it doesn't need to retrieve the actual image data.
Since: 2.6
function.return: %TRUE is there is an image available, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_clipboard_wait_is_rich_text_available
function.description:
Test to see if there is rich text available to be pasted This is done by requesting the TARGETS atom and checking if it contains any of the supported rich text targets. This function waits for the data to be received using the main loop, so events, timeouts, etc, may be dispatched during the wait.
This function is a little faster than calling gtk_clipboard_wait_for_rich_text() since it doesn't need to retrieve the actual text.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE is there is rich text available, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_clipboard_wait_is_target_available
function.description:
Checks if a clipboard supports pasting data of a given type. This function can be used to determine if a "Paste" menu item should be insensitive or not.
If you want to see if there's text available on the clipboard, use gtk_clipboard_wait_is_text_available () instead.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: target
parameter.parameter_description: A #GdkAtom indicating which target to look for.

function.return: %TRUE if the target is available, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_clipboard_wait_is_text_available
function.description:
Test to see if there is text available to be pasted This is done by requesting the TARGETS atom and checking if it contains any of the supported text targets. This function waits for the data to be received using the main loop, so events, timeouts, etc, may be dispatched during the wait.
This function is a little faster than calling gtk_clipboard_wait_for_text() since it doesn't need to retrieve the actual text.
function.return: %TRUE is there is text available, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_clipboard_wait_is_uris_available
function.description:
Test to see if there is a list of URIs available to be pasted This is done by requesting the TARGETS atom and checking if it contains the URI targets. This function waits for the data to be received using the main loop, so events, timeouts, etc, may be dispatched during the wait.
This function is a little faster than calling gtk_clipboard_wait_for_uris() since it doesn't need to retrieve the actual URI data.
Since: 2.14
function.return: %TRUE is there is an URI list available, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_color_button_get_alpha
function.description:
Returns the current alpha value.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.4: Use gtk_color_chooser_get_rgba() instead.
function.return: an integer between 0 and 65535

function.name: gtk_color_button_get_color
function.description:
Sets @color to be the current color in the #GtkColorButton widget.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.4: Use gtk_color_chooser_get_rgba() instead.

parameter.name: color
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkColor to fill in with the current color

function.name: gtk_color_button_get_rgba
function.description:
Sets @rgba to be the current color in the #GtkColorButton widget.
Since: 3.0
Deprecated: 3.4: Use gtk_color_chooser_get_rgba() instead.

parameter.name: rgba
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkRGBA to fill in with the current color

function.name: gtk_color_button_get_title
function.description:
Gets the title of the color selection dialog.
Since: 2.4
function.return: An internal string, do not free the return value

function.name: gtk_color_button_get_use_alpha
function.description:
Does the color selection dialog use the alpha channel ?
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.4: Use gtk_color_chooser_get_use_alpha() instead.
function.return: %TRUE if the color sample uses alpha channel, %FALSE if not

function.name: gtk_color_button_new
function.description:
Creates a new color button.
This returns a widget in the form of a small button containing a swatch representing the current selected color. When the button is clicked, a color-selection dialog will open, allowing the user to select a color. The swatch will be updated to reflect the new color when the user finishes.
Since: 2.4
function.return: a new color button

function.name: gtk_color_button_new_with_color
function.description:
Creates a new color button.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.4: Use gtk_color_button_new_with_rgba() instead.

parameter.name: color
parameter.parameter_description: A #GdkColor to set the current color with

function.return: a new color button

function.name: gtk_color_button_new_with_rgba
function.description:
Creates a new color button.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: rgba
parameter.parameter_description: A #GdkRGBA to set the current color with

function.return: a new color button

function.name: gtk_color_button_set_alpha
function.description:
Sets the current opacity to be @alpha.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.4: Use gtk_color_chooser_set_rgba() instead.

function.name: gtk_color_button_set_color
function.description:
Sets the current color to be @color.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: Use gtk_color_chooser_set_rgba() instead.

parameter.name: color
parameter.parameter_description: A #GdkColor to set the current color with

function.name: gtk_color_button_set_rgba
function.description:
Sets the current color to be @rgba.
Since: 3.0
Deprecated: 3.4: Use gtk_color_chooser_set_rgba() instead.

parameter.name: rgba
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkRGBA to set the current color with

function.name: gtk_color_button_set_title
function.description:
Sets the title for the color selection dialog.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_color_button_set_use_alpha
function.description:
Sets whether or not the color button should use the alpha channel.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.4: Use gtk_color_chooser_set_use_alpha() instead.

parameter.name: use_alpha
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if color button should use alpha channel, %FALSE if not

function.name: gtk_color_chooser_add_palette
function.description:
Adds a palette to the color chooser. If @orientation is horizontal, the colors are grouped in rows, with @colors_per_line colors in each row. If @horizontal is %FALSE, the colors are grouped in columns instead.
The default color palette of #GtkColorChooserWidget has 27 colors, organized in columns of 3 colors. The default gray palette has 9 grays in a single row.
The layout of the color chooser widget works best when the palettes have 9-10 columns.
Calling this function for the first time has the side effect of removing the default color and gray palettes from the color chooser.
If @colors is %NULL, removes all previously added palettes.
Since: 3.4

parameter.name: orientation
parameter.parameter_description: %GTK_ORIENTATION_HORIZONTAL if the palette should be displayed in rows, %GTK_ORIENTATION_VERTICAL for columns

parameter.name: colors_per_line
parameter.parameter_description: the number of colors to show in each row/column

parameter.name: n_colors
parameter.parameter_description: the total number of elements in @colors

parameter.name: colors
parameter.parameter_description: the colors of the palette, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_color_chooser_dialog_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkColorChooserDialog.
Since: 3.4

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: Transient parent of the dialog, or %NULL

function.return: a new #GtkColorChooserDialog

function.name: gtk_color_chooser_get_rgba
function.description:
Gets the currently-selected color.
Since: 3.4

parameter.name: color
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkRGBA to fill in with the current color

function.name: gtk_color_chooser_get_use_alpha
function.description:
Returns whether the color chooser shows the alpha channel.
Since: 3.4
function.return: %TRUE if the color chooser uses the alpha channel, %FALSE if not

function.name: gtk_color_chooser_set_rgba
function.description:
Sets the color.
Since: 3.4

function.name: gtk_color_chooser_set_use_alpha
function.description:
Sets whether or not the color chooser should use the alpha channel.
Since: 3.4

parameter.name: use_alpha
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if color chooser should use alpha channel, %FALSE if not

function.name: gtk_color_chooser_widget_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkColorChooserWidget.
Since: 3.4
function.return: a new #GtkColorChooserWidget

function.name: gtk_color_selection_dialog_get_color_selection
function.description:
Retrieves the #GtkColorSelection widget embedded in the dialog.
Since: 2.14
function.return: the embedded #GtkColorSelection

function.name: gtk_color_selection_dialog_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkColorSelectionDialog.

parameter.name: title
parameter.parameter_description: a string containing the title text for the dialog.

function.return: a #GtkColorSelectionDialog.

function.name: gtk_color_selection_get_current_alpha
function.description: Returns the current alpha value.
function.return: an integer between 0 and 65535

function.name: gtk_color_selection_get_current_color
function.description:
Sets @color to be the current color in the GtkColorSelection widget.
Deprecated: 3.4: Use gtk_color_selection_get_current_rgba() instead.

parameter.name: color
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkColor to fill in with the current color

function.name: gtk_color_selection_get_current_rgba
function.description:
Sets @rgba to be the current color in the GtkColorSelection widget.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: rgba
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkRGBA to fill in with the current color

function.name: gtk_color_selection_get_has_opacity_control
function.description: Determines whether the colorsel has an opacity control.
function.return: %TRUE if the @colorsel has an opacity control, %FALSE if it does't

function.name: gtk_color_selection_get_has_palette
function.description: Determines whether the color selector has a color palette.
function.return: %TRUE if the selector has a palette, %FALSE if it hasn't

function.name: gtk_color_selection_get_previous_alpha
function.description: Returns the previous alpha value.
function.return: an integer between 0 and 65535

function.name: gtk_color_selection_get_previous_color
function.description:
Fills @color in with the original color value.
Deprecated: 3.4: Use gtk_color_selection_get_previous_rgba() instead.

parameter.name: color
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkColor to fill in with the original color value

function.name: gtk_color_selection_get_previous_rgba
function.description:
Fills @rgba in with the original color value.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: rgba
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkRGBA to fill in with the original color value

function.name: gtk_color_selection_is_adjusting
function.description: Gets the current state of the @colorsel.
function.return: %TRUE if the user is currently dragging a color around, and %FALSE if the selection has stopped

function.name: gtk_color_selection_new
function.description: Creates a new GtkColorSelection.
function.return: a new #GtkColorSelection

function.name: gtk_color_selection_palette_from_string
function.description: Parses a color palette string; the string is a colon-separated list of color names readable by gdk_color_parse().

parameter.name: str
parameter.parameter_description: a string encoding a color palette

parameter.name: colors
parameter.parameter_description: return location for allocated array of #GdkColor

parameter.name: n_colors
parameter.parameter_description: return location for length of array

function.return: %TRUE if a palette was successfully parsed

function.name: gtk_color_selection_palette_to_string
function.description: Encodes a palette as a string, useful for persistent storage.
function.return: allocated string encoding the palette

function.name: gtk_color_selection_set_change_palette_with_screen_hook
function.description:
Installs a global function to be called whenever the user tries to modify the palette in a color selection.
This function should save the new palette contents, and update the #GtkSettings:gtk-color-palette GtkSettings property so all GtkColorSelection widgets will be modified.
Since: 2.2

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: a function to call when the custom palette needs saving

function.return: the previous change palette hook (that was replaced)

function.name: gtk_color_selection_set_current_alpha
function.description:
Sets the current opacity to be @alpha.
The first time this is called, it will also set the original opacity to be @alpha too.

function.name: gtk_color_selection_set_current_color
function.description:
Sets the current color to be @color.
The first time this is called, it will also set the original color to be @color too.
Deprecated: 3.4: Use gtk_color_selection_set_current_rgba() instead.

parameter.name: color
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkColor to set the current color with

function.name: gtk_color_selection_set_current_rgba
function.description:
Sets the current color to be @rgba.
The first time this is called, it will also set the original color to be @rgba too.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: rgba
parameter.parameter_description: A #GdkRGBA to set the current color with

function.name: gtk_color_selection_set_has_opacity_control
function.description: Sets the @colorsel to use or not use opacity.

parameter.name: has_opacity
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if @colorsel can set the opacity, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_color_selection_set_has_palette
function.description: Shows and hides the palette based upon the value of @has_palette.

parameter.name: has_palette
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if palette is to be visible, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_color_selection_set_palette_color
function.description: Sets the palette located at @index to have @color as its color.

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: the color index of the palette

parameter.name: color
parameter.parameter_description: A #GdkColor to set the palette with

function.name: gtk_color_selection_set_previous_alpha
function.description:
Sets the 'previous' alpha to be @alpha.
This function should be called with some hesitations, as it might seem confusing to have that alpha change.

function.name: gtk_color_selection_set_previous_color
function.description:
Sets the 'previous' color to be @color.
This function should be called with some hesitations, as it might seem confusing to have that color change. Calling gtk_color_selection_set_current_color() will also set this color the first time it is called.
Deprecated: 3.4: Use gtk_color_selection_set_previous_rgba() instead.

parameter.name: color
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkColor to set the previous color with

function.name: gtk_color_selection_set_previous_rgba
function.description:
Sets the 'previous' color to be @rgba.
This function should be called with some hesitations, as it might seem confusing to have that color change. Calling gtk_color_selection_set_current_rgba() will also set this color the first time it is called.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: rgba
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkRGBA to set the previous color with

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_active
function.description:
Returns the index of the currently active item, or -1 if there's no active item. If the model is a non-flat treemodel, and the active item is not an immediate child of the root of the tree, this function returns <literal>gtk_tree_path_get_indices (path)[0]</literal>, where <literal>path</literal> is the #GtkTreePath of the active item.
Since: 2.4
function.return: An integer which is the index of the currently active item, or -1 if there's no active item.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_active_id
function.description:
Returns the ID of the active row of @combo_box. This value is taken from the active row and the column specified by the #GtkComboBox:id-column property of @combo_box (see gtk_combo_box_set_id_column()).
The returned value is an interned string which means that you can compare the pointer by value to other interned strings and that you must not free it.
If the #GtkComboBox:id-column property of @combo_box is not set, or if no row is active, or if the active row has a %NULL ID value, then %NULL is returned.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the ID of the active row, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_active_iter
function.description:
Sets @iter to point to the current active item, if it exists.
Since: 2.4
function.return: %TRUE, if @iter was set

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_add_tearoffs
function.description:
Gets the current value of the :add-tearoffs property.
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: the current value of the :add-tearoffs property.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_button_sensitivity
function.description:
Returns whether the combo box sets the dropdown button sensitive or not when there are no items in the model.
Since: 2.14
function.return: %GTK_SENSITIVITY_ON if the dropdown button is sensitive when the model is empty, %GTK_SENSITIVITY_OFF if the button is always insensitive or %GTK_SENSITIVITY_AUTO if it is only sensitive as long as the model has one item to be selected.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_column_span_column
function.description:
Returns the column with column span information for @combo_box.
Since: 2.6
function.return: the column span column.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_entry_text_column
function.description:
Returns the column which @combo_box is using to get the strings from to display in the internal entry.
Since: 2.24
function.return: A column in the data source model of @combo_box.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_focus_on_click
function.description:
Returns whether the combo box grabs focus when it is clicked with the mouse. See gtk_combo_box_set_focus_on_click().
Since: 2.6
function.return: %TRUE if the combo box grabs focus when it is clicked with the mouse.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_has_entry
function.description:
Returns whether the combo box has an entry.
Since: 2.24
function.return: whether there is an entry in @combo_box.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_id_column
function.description:
Returns the column which @combo_box is using to get string IDs for values from.
Since: 3.0
function.return: A column in the data source model of @combo_box.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_model
function.description:
Returns the #GtkTreeModel which is acting as data source for @combo_box.
Since: 2.4
function.return: A #GtkTreeModel which was passed during construction.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_popup_accessible
function.description:
Gets the accessible object corresponding to the combo box's popup.
This function is mostly intended for use by accessibility technologies; applications should have little use for it.
Since: 2.6
function.return: the accessible object corresponding to the combo box's popup.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_popup_fixed_width
function.description:
Gets whether the popup uses a fixed width matching the allocated width of the combo box.
Since: 3.0
function.return: %TRUE if the popup uses a fixed width

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_row_separator_func
function.description:
Returns the current row separator function.
Since: 2.6
function.return: the current row separator function.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_row_span_column
function.description:
Returns the column with row span information for @combo_box.
Since: 2.6
function.return: the row span column.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_title
function.description:
Gets the current title of the menu in tearoff mode. See gtk_combo_box_set_add_tearoffs().
Since: 2.10
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: the menu's title in tearoff mode. This is an internal copy of the string which must not be freed.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_get_wrap_width
function.description:
Returns the wrap width which is used to determine the number of columns for the popup menu. If the wrap width is larger than 1, the combo box is in table mode.
Since: 2.6
function.return: the wrap width.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_new
function.description:
Creates a new empty #GtkComboBox.
Since: 2.4
function.return: A new #GtkComboBox.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_new_with_area
function.description: Creates a new empty #GtkComboBox using @area to layout cells.

parameter.name: area
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellArea to use to layout cell renderers

function.return: A new #GtkComboBox.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_new_with_area_and_entry
function.description:
Creates a new empty #GtkComboBox with an entry.
The new combo box will use @area to layout cells.

parameter.name: area
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellArea to use to layout cell renderers

function.return: A new #GtkComboBox.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_new_with_entry
function.description:
Creates a new empty #GtkComboBox with an entry.
Since: 2.24
function.return: A new #GtkComboBox.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_new_with_model
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkComboBox with the model initialized to @model.
Since: 2.4
function.return: A new #GtkComboBox.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_new_with_model_and_entry
function.description:
Creates a new empty #GtkComboBox with an entry and with the model initialized to @model.
Since: 2.24
function.return: A new #GtkComboBox

function.name: gtk_combo_box_popdown
function.description:
Hides the menu or dropdown list of @combo_box.
This function is mostly intended for use by accessibility technologies; applications should have little use for it.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_combo_box_popup
function.description:
Pops up the menu or dropdown list of @combo_box.
This function is mostly intended for use by accessibility technologies; applications should have little use for it.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_combo_box_popup_for_device
function.description:
Pops up the menu or dropdown list of @combo_box, the popup window will be grabbed so only @device and its associated pointer/keyboard are the only #GdkDevice<!-- -->s able to send events to it.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_active
function.description:
Sets the active item of @combo_box to be the item at @index.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: index_
parameter.parameter_description: An index in the model passed during construction, or -1 to have no active item

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_active_id
function.description:
Changes the active row of @combo_box to the one that has an ID equal to @active_id, or unsets the active row if @active_id is %NULL. Rows having a %NULL ID string cannot be made active by this function.
If the #GtkComboBox:id-column property of @combo_box is unset or if no row has the given ID then the function does nothing and returns %FALSE.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: active_id
parameter.parameter_description: the ID of the row to select, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_active_iter
function.description:
Sets the current active item to be the one referenced by @iter, or unsets the active item if @iter is %NULL.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_add_tearoffs
function.description:
Sets whether the popup menu should have a tearoff menu item.
Since: 2.6
Deprecated: 3.10

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_button_sensitivity
function.description:
Sets whether the dropdown button of the combo box should be always sensitive (%GTK_SENSITIVITY_ON), never sensitive (%GTK_SENSITIVITY_OFF) or only if there is at least one item to display (%GTK_SENSITIVITY_AUTO).
Since: 2.14

parameter.name: sensitivity
parameter.parameter_description: specify the sensitivity of the dropdown button

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_column_span_column
function.description:
Sets the column with column span information for @combo_box to be @column_span. The column span column contains integers which indicate how many columns an item should span.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: column_span
parameter.parameter_description: A column in the model passed during construction

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_entry_text_column
function.description:
Sets the model column which @combo_box should use to get strings from to be @text_column. The column @text_column in the model of @combo_box must be of type %G_TYPE_STRING.
This is only relevant if @combo_box has been created with #GtkComboBox:has-entry as %TRUE.
Since: 2.24

parameter.name: text_column
parameter.parameter_description: A column in @model to get the strings from for the internal entry

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_focus_on_click
function.description:
Sets whether the combo box will grab focus when it is clicked with the mouse. Making mouse clicks not grab focus is useful in places like toolbars where you don't want the keyboard focus removed from the main area of the application.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: focus_on_click
parameter.parameter_description: whether the combo box grabs focus when clicked with the mouse

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_id_column
function.description:
Sets the model column which @combo_box should use to get string IDs for values from. The column @id_column in the model of @combo_box must be of type %G_TYPE_STRING.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: id_column
parameter.parameter_description: A column in @model to get string IDs for values from

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_model
function.description:
Sets the model used by @combo_box to be @model. Will unset a previously set model (if applicable). If model is %NULL, then it will unset the model.
Note that this function does not clear the cell renderers, you have to call gtk_cell_layout_clear() yourself if you need to set up different cell renderers for the new model.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_popup_fixed_width
function.description:
Specifies whether the popup's width should be a fixed width matching the allocated width of the combo box.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: fixed
parameter.parameter_description: whether to use a fixed popup width

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_row_separator_func
function.description:
Sets the row separator function, which is used to determine whether a row should be drawn as a separator. If the row separator function is %NULL, no separators are drawn. This is the default value.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: user data to pass to @func, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_row_span_column
function.description:
Sets the column with row span information for @combo_box to be @row_span. The row span column contains integers which indicate how many rows an item should span.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: row_span
parameter.parameter_description: A column in the model passed during construction.

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_title
function.description:
Sets the menu's title in tearoff mode.
Since: 2.10
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: title
parameter.parameter_description: a title for the menu in tearoff mode

function.name: gtk_combo_box_set_wrap_width
function.description:
