Gets the tabstops that were set on the entry using gtk_entry_set_tabs(), if any.
Since: 3.10
function.return: the tabstops, or %NULL if none was set.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_text
function.description:
Retrieves the contents of the entry widget. See also gtk_editable_get_chars().
This is equivalent to:
<informalexample><programlisting> gtk_entry_buffer_get_text (gtk_entry_get_buffer (entry)); </programlisting></informalexample>
function.return: a pointer to the contents of the widget as a string. This string points to internally allocated storage in the widget and must not be freed, modified or stored.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_text_area
function.description:
Gets the area where the entry's text is drawn. This function is useful when drawing something to the entry in a draw callback.
If the entry is not realized, @text_area is filled with zeros.
See also gtk_entry_get_icon_area().
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: text_area
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for the text area.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_text_length
function.description:
Retrieves the current length of the text in @entry.
This is equivalent to:
<informalexample><programlisting> gtk_entry_buffer_get_length (gtk_entry_get_buffer (entry)); </programlisting></informalexample>
Since: 2.14
function.return: the current number of characters in #GtkEntry, or 0 if there are none.

function.name: gtk_entry_get_visibility
function.description: Retrieves whether the text in @entry is visible. See gtk_entry_set_visibility().
function.return: %TRUE if the text is currently visible

function.name: gtk_entry_get_width_chars
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_entry_set_width_chars().
function.return: number of chars to request space for, or negative if unset

function.name: gtk_entry_im_context_filter_keypress
function.description:
Allow the #GtkEntry input method to internally handle key press and release events. If this function returns %TRUE, then no further processing should be done for this key event. See gtk_im_context_filter_keypress().
Note that you are expected to call this function from your handler when overriding key event handling. This is needed in the case when you need to insert your own key handling between the input method and the default key event handling of the #GtkEntry. See gtk_text_view_reset_im_context() for an example of use.
Since: 2.22
function.return: %TRUE if the input method handled the key event.

function.name: gtk_entry_layout_index_to_text_index
function.description: Converts from a position in the entry contents (returned by gtk_entry_get_text()) to a position in the entry's #PangoLayout (returned by gtk_entry_get_layout(), with text retrieved via pango_layout_get_text()).

parameter.name: layout_index
parameter.parameter_description: byte index into the entry layout text

function.return: byte index into the entry contents

function.name: gtk_entry_new
function.description: Creates a new entry.
function.return: a new #GtkEntry.

function.name: gtk_entry_new_with_buffer
function.description:
Creates a new entry with the specified text buffer.
Since: 2.18

parameter.name: buffer
parameter.parameter_description: The buffer to use for the new #GtkEntry.

function.return: a new #GtkEntry

function.name: gtk_entry_progress_pulse
function.description:
Indicates that some progress is made, but you don't know how much. Causes the entry's progress indicator to enter "activity mode," where a block bounces back and forth. Each call to gtk_entry_progress_pulse() causes the block to move by a little bit (the amount of movement per pulse is determined by gtk_entry_set_progress_pulse_step()).
Since: 2.16

function.name: gtk_entry_reset_im_context
function.description:
Reset the input method context of the entry if needed.
This can be necessary in the case where modifying the buffer would confuse on-going input method behavior.
Since: 2.22

function.name: gtk_entry_set_activates_default
function.description:
If @setting is %TRUE, pressing Enter in the @entry will activate the default widget for the window containing the entry. This usually means that the dialog box containing the entry will be closed, since the default widget is usually one of the dialog buttons.
(For experts: if @setting is %TRUE, the entry calls gtk_window_activate_default() on the window containing the entry, in the default handler for the #GtkEntry::activate signal.)

parameter.name: setting
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to activate window's default widget on Enter keypress

function.name: gtk_entry_set_alignment
function.description:
Sets the alignment for the contents of the entry. This controls the horizontal positioning of the contents when the displayed text is shorter than the width of the entry.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: xalign
parameter.parameter_description: The horizontal alignment, from 0 (left) to 1 (right). Reversed for RTL layouts

function.name: gtk_entry_set_attributes
function.description:
Sets a #PangoAttrList; the attributes in the list are applied to the entry text.
Since: 3.6

function.name: gtk_entry_set_buffer
function.description:
Set the #GtkEntryBuffer object which holds the text for this widget.
Since: 2.18

function.name: gtk_entry_set_completion
gtk_entry_set_cursor_hadjustment
function.description:
Hooks up an adjustment to the cursor position in an entry, so that when the cursor is moved, the adjustment is scrolled to show that position. See gtk_scrolled_window_get_hadjustment() for a typical way of obtaining the adjustment.
The adjustment has to be in pixel units and in the same coordinate system as the entry.
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: adjustment
parameter.parameter_description: an adjustment which should be adjusted when the cursor is moved, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_entry_set_has_frame
function.description: Sets whether the entry has a beveled frame around it.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_activatable
function.description:
Sets whether the icon is activatable.
Since: 2.16

parameter.name: activatable
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the icon should be activatable

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_drag_source
function.description:
Sets up the icon at the given position so that GTK+ will start a drag operation when the user clicks and drags the icon.
To handle the drag operation, you need to connect to the usual #GtkWidget::drag-data-get (or possibly #GtkWidget::drag-data-delete) signal, and use gtk_entry_get_current_icon_drag_source() in your signal handler to find out if the drag was started from an icon.
By default, GTK+ uses the icon as the drag icon. You can use the #GtkWidget::drag-begin signal to set a different icon. Note that you have to use g_signal_connect_after() to ensure that your signal handler gets executed after the default handler.
Since: 2.16

parameter.name: target_list
parameter.parameter_description: the targets (data formats) in which the data can be provided

parameter.name: actions
parameter.parameter_description: a bitmask of the allowed drag actions

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_from_gicon
function.description:
Sets the icon shown in the entry at the specified position from the current icon theme. If the icon isn't known, a "broken image" icon will be displayed instead.
If @icon is %NULL, no icon will be shown in the specified position.
Since: 2.16

parameter.name: icon_pos
parameter.parameter_description: The position at which to set the icon

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_from_icon_name
function.description:
Sets the icon shown in the entry at the specified position from the current icon theme.
If the icon name isn't known, a "broken image" icon will be displayed instead.
If @icon_name is %NULL, no icon will be shown in the specified position.
Since: 2.16

parameter.name: icon_pos
parameter.parameter_description: The position at which to set the icon

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_from_pixbuf
function.description:
Sets the icon shown in the specified position using a pixbuf.
If @pixbuf is %NULL, no icon will be shown in the specified position.
Since: 2.16

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_from_stock
function.description:
Sets the icon shown in the entry at the specified position from a stock image.
If @stock_id is %NULL, no icon will be shown in the specified position.
Since: 2.16
Deprecated: 3.10: Use gtk_entry_set_icon_from_icon_name() instead.

parameter.name: stock_id
parameter.parameter_description: The name of the stock item, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_sensitive
function.description:
Sets the sensitivity for the specified icon.
Since: 2.16

parameter.name: sensitive
parameter.parameter_description: Specifies whether the icon should appear sensitive or insensitive

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_tooltip_markup
function.description:
Sets @tooltip as the contents of the tooltip for the icon at the specified position. @tooltip is assumed to be marked up with the <link linkend="PangoMarkupFormat">Pango text markup language</link>.
Use %NULL for @tooltip to remove an existing tooltip.
See also gtk_widget_set_tooltip_markup() and gtk_entry_set_icon_tooltip_text().
Since: 2.16

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.parameter_description: the contents of the tooltip for the icon, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_entry_set_icon_tooltip_text
function.description:
Sets @tooltip as the contents of the tooltip for the icon at the specified position.
Use %NULL for @tooltip to remove an existing tooltip.
See also gtk_widget_set_tooltip_text() and gtk_entry_set_icon_tooltip_markup().
Since: 2.16

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.parameter_description: the contents of the tooltip for the icon, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_entry_set_inner_border
function.description:
Sets %entry's inner-border property to %border, or clears it if %NULL is passed. The inner-border is the area around the entry's text, but inside its frame.
If set, this property overrides the inner-border style property. Overriding the style-provided border is useful when you want to do in-place editing of some text in a canvas or list widget, where pixel-exact positioning of the entry is important.
Since: 2.10
Deprecated: 3.4: Use the standard border and padding CSS properties (through objects like #GtkStyleContext and #GtkCssProvider); the value set with this function is ignored by #GtkEntry.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_input_hints
function.description:
Sets the #GtkEntry:input-hints property, which allows input methods to fine-tune their behaviour.
Since: 3.6

function.name: gtk_entry_set_input_purpose
function.description:
Sets the #GtkEntry:input-purpose property which can be used by on-screen keyboards and other input methods to adjust their behaviour.
Since: 3.6

function.name: gtk_entry_set_invisible_char
function.description: Sets the character to use in place of the actual text when gtk_entry_set_visibility() has been called to set text visibility to %FALSE. i.e. this is the character used in "password mode" to show the user how many characters have been typed. By default, GTK+ picks the best invisible char available in the current font. If you set the invisible char to 0, then the user will get no feedback at all; there will be no text on the screen as they type.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_max_length
function.description:
Sets the maximum allowed length of the contents of the widget. If the current contents are longer than the given length, then they will be truncated to fit.
This is equivalent to:
<informalexample><programlisting> gtk_entry_buffer_set_max_length (gtk_entry_get_buffer (entry), max); </programlisting></informalexample>

parameter.name: max
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum length of the entry, or 0 for no maximum. (other than the maximum length of entries.) The value passed in will be clamped to the range 0-65536.

function.name: gtk_entry_set_overwrite_mode
function.description:
Sets whether the text is overwritten when typing in the #GtkEntry.
Since: 2.14

function.name: gtk_entry_set_placeholder_text
function.description:
Sets text to be displayed in @entry when it is empty and unfocused. This can be used to give a visual hint of the expected contents of the #GtkEntry.
Note that since the placeholder text gets removed when the entry received focus, using this feature is a bit problematic if the entry is given the initial focus in a window. Sometimes this can be worked around by delaying the initial focus setting until the first key event arrives.
Since: 3.2

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: a string to be displayed when @entry is empty an unfocused, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_entry_set_progress_fraction
function.description:
Causes the entry's progress indicator to "fill in" the given fraction of the bar. The fraction should be between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive.
Since: 2.16

parameter.name: fraction
parameter.parameter_description: fraction of the task that's been completed

function.name: gtk_entry_set_progress_pulse_step
function.description:
Sets the fraction of total entry width to move the progress bouncing block for each call to gtk_entry_progress_pulse().
Since: 2.16

function.name: gtk_entry_set_tabs
function.description:
Sets a #PangoTabArray; the tabstops in the array are applied to the entry text.
Since: 3.10

function.name: gtk_entry_set_text
function.description:
Sets the text in the widget to the given value, replacing the current contents.
See gtk_entry_buffer_set_text().

function.name: gtk_entry_set_visibility
function.description:
Sets whether the contents of the entry are visible or not. When visibility is set to %FALSE, characters are displayed as the invisible char, and will also appear that way when the text in the entry widget is copied elsewhere.
By default, GTK+ picks the best invisible character available in the current font, but it can be changed with gtk_entry_set_invisible_char().
Note that you probably want to set #GtkEntry:input-purpose to %GTK_INPUT_PURPOSE_PASSWORD or %GTK_INPUT_PURPOSE_PIN to inform input methods about the purpose of this entry, in addition to setting visibility to %FALSE.

parameter.name: visible
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the contents of the entry are displayed as plaintext

function.name: gtk_entry_set_width_chars
function.description: Changes the size request of the entry to be about the right size for @n_chars characters. Note that it changes the size <emphasis>request</emphasis>, the size can still be affected by how you pack the widget into containers. If @n_chars is -1, the size reverts to the default entry size.

function.name: gtk_entry_text_index_to_layout_index
function.description: Converts from a position in the entry's #PangoLayout (returned by gtk_entry_get_layout()) to a position in the entry contents (returned by gtk_entry_get_text()).

parameter.name: text_index
parameter.parameter_description: byte index into the entry contents

function.return: byte index into the entry layout text

function.name: gtk_entry_unset_invisible_char
function.description:
Unsets the invisible char previously set with gtk_entry_set_invisible_char(). So that the default invisible char is used again.
Since: 2.16

function.name: gtk_enumerate_printers
function.description:
Calls a function for all #GtkPrinter<!-- -->s. If @func returns %TRUE, the enumeration is stopped.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: a function to call for each printer

parameter.name: destroy
parameter.parameter_description: function to call if @data is no longer needed

parameter.name: wait
parameter.parameter_description: if %TRUE, wait in a recursive mainloop until all printers are enumerated; otherwise return early

function.name: gtk_event_box_get_above_child
function.description:
Returns whether the event box window is above or below the windows of its child. See gtk_event_box_set_above_child() for details.
Since: 2.4
function.return: %TRUE if the event box window is above the window of its child

function.name: gtk_event_box_get_visible_window
function.description:
Returns whether the event box has a visible window. See gtk_event_box_set_visible_window() for details.
Since: 2.4
function.return: %TRUE if the event box window is visible

function.name: gtk_event_box_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkEventBox.
function.return: a new #GtkEventBox

function.name: gtk_event_box_set_above_child
function.description:
Set whether the event box window is positioned above the windows of its child, as opposed to below it. If the window is above, all events inside the event box will go to the event box. If the window is below, events in windows of child widgets will first got to that widget, and then to its parents.
The default is to keep the window below the child.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: above_child
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the event box window is above its child

function.name: gtk_event_box_set_visible_window
function.description:
Set whether the event box uses a visible or invisible child window. The default is to use visible windows.
In an invisible window event box, the window that the event box creates is a %GDK_INPUT_ONLY window, which means that it is invisible and only serves to receive events.
A visible window event box creates a visible (%GDK_INPUT_OUTPUT) window that acts as the parent window for all the widgets contained in the event box.
You should generally make your event box invisible if you just want to trap events. Creating a visible window may cause artifacts that are visible to the user, especially if the user is using a theme with gradients or pixmaps.
The main reason to create a non input-only event box is if you want to set the background to a different color or draw on it.
<note><para> There is one unexpected issue for an invisible event box that has its window below the child. (See gtk_event_box_set_above_child().) Since the input-only window is not an ancestor window of any windows that descendent widgets of the event box create, events on these windows aren't propagated up by the windowing system, but only by GTK+. The practical effect of this is if an event isn't in the event mask for the descendant window (see gtk_widget_add_events()), it won't be received by the event box. </para><para> This problem doesn't occur for visible event boxes, because in that case, the event box window is actually the ancestor of the descendant windows, not just at the same place on the screen. </para></note>
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: visible_window
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to make the event box have a visible window

function.name: gtk_events_pending
function.description:
Checks if any events are pending.
This can be used to update the UI and invoke timeouts etc. while doing some time intensive computation.
<example> <title>Updating the UI during a long computation</title> <programlisting> / * computation going on... * /
while (gtk_events_pending ()) gtk_main_iteration ();
/ * ...computation continued * / </programlisting> </example>
function.return: %TRUE if any events are pending, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_expander_get_expanded
function.description:
Queries a #GtkExpander and returns its current state. Returns %TRUE if the child widget is revealed.
See gtk_expander_set_expanded().
Since: 2.4
function.return: the current state of the expander

function.name: gtk_expander_get_label
function.description:
Fetches the text from a label widget including any embedded underlines indicating mnemonics and Pango markup, as set by gtk_expander_set_label(). If the label text has not been set the return value will be %NULL. This will be the case if you create an empty button with gtk_button_new() to use as a container.
Note that this function behaved differently in versions prior to 2.14 and used to return the label text stripped of embedded underlines indicating mnemonics and Pango markup. This problem can be avoided by fetching the label text directly from the label widget.
Since: 2.4
function.return: The text of the label widget. This string is owned by the widget and must not be modified or freed.

function.name: gtk_expander_get_label_fill
function.description:
Returns whether the label widget will fill all available horizontal space allocated to @expander.
Since: 2.22
function.return: %TRUE if the label widget will fill all available horizontal space

function.name: gtk_expander_get_label_widget
function.description:
Retrieves the label widget for the frame. See gtk_expander_set_label_widget().
Since: 2.4
function.return: the label widget, or %NULL if there is none

function.name: gtk_expander_get_resize_toplevel
function.description:
Returns whether the expander will resize the toplevel widget containing the expander upon resizing and collpasing.
Since: 3.2
function.return: the "resize toplevel" setting.

function.name: gtk_expander_get_spacing
function.description:
Gets the value set by gtk_expander_set_spacing().
Since: 2.4
function.return: spacing between the expander and child

function.name: gtk_expander_get_use_markup
function.description:
Returns whether the label's text is interpreted as marked up with the <link linkend="PangoMarkupFormat">Pango text markup language</link>. See gtk_expander_set_use_markup().
Since: 2.4
function.return: %TRUE if the label's text will be parsed for markup

function.name: gtk_expander_get_use_underline
function.description:
Returns whether an embedded underline in the expander label indicates a mnemonic. See gtk_expander_set_use_underline().
Since: 2.4
function.return: %TRUE if an embedded underline in the expander label indicates the mnemonic accelerator keys

function.name: gtk_expander_new
function.description:
Creates a new expander using @label as the text of the label.
Since: 2.4
function.return: a new #GtkExpander widget.

function.name: gtk_expander_new_with_mnemonic
function.description:
Creates a new expander using @label as the text of the label. If characters in @label are preceded by an underscore, they are underlined. If you need a literal underscore character in a label, use '__' (two underscores). The first underlined character represents a keyboard accelerator called a mnemonic. Pressing Alt and that key activates the button.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: the text of the label with an underscore in front of the mnemonic character

function.return: a new #GtkExpander widget.

function.name: gtk_expander_set_expanded
function.description:
Sets the state of the expander. Set to %TRUE, if you want the child widget to be revealed, and %FALSE if you want the child widget to be hidden.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: expanded
parameter.parameter_description: whether the child widget is revealed

function.name: gtk_expander_set_label
function.description:
Sets the text of the label of the expander to @label.
This will also clear any previously set labels.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_expander_set_label_fill
function.description:
Sets whether the label widget should fill all available horizontal space allocated to @expander.
Since: 2.22

parameter.name: label_fill
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the label should should fill all available horizontal space

function.name: gtk_expander_set_label_widget
function.description:
Set the label widget for the expander. This is the widget that will appear embedded alongside the expander arrow.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_expander_set_resize_toplevel
function.description:
Sets whether the expander will resize the toplevel widget containing the expander upon resizing and collpasing.
Since: 3.2

function.name: gtk_expander_set_spacing
function.description:
Sets the spacing field of @expander, which is the number of pixels to place between expander and the child.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: spacing
parameter.parameter_description: distance between the expander and child in pixels

function.name: gtk_expander_set_use_markup
function.description:
Sets whether the text of the label contains markup in <link linkend="PangoMarkupFormat">Pango's text markup language</link>. See gtk_label_set_markup().
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: use_markup
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the label's text should be parsed for markup

function.name: gtk_expander_set_use_underline
function.description:
If true, an underline in the text of the expander label indicates the next character should be used for the mnemonic accelerator key.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: use_underline
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if underlines in the text indicate mnemonics

function.name: gtk_false
function.description: Analogical to gtk_true(), this function does nothing but always returns %FALSE.
function.return: %FALSE

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_add_filter
function.description:
Adds @filter to the list of filters that the user can select between. When a filter is selected, only files that are passed by that filter are displayed.
Note that the @chooser takes ownership of the filter, so you have to ref and sink it if you want to keep a reference.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_add_shortcut_folder
function.description:
Adds a folder to be displayed with the shortcut folders in a file chooser. Note that shortcut folders do not get saved, as they are provided by the application. For example, you can use this to add a "/usr/share/mydrawprogram/Clipart" folder to the volume list.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: folder
parameter.parameter_description: filename of the folder to add

function.return: %TRUE if the folder could be added successfully, %FALSE otherwise. In the latter case, the @error will be set as appropriate.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_add_shortcut_folder_uri
function.description:
Adds a folder URI to be displayed with the shortcut folders in a file chooser. Note that shortcut folders do not get saved, as they are provided by the application. For example, you can use this to add a "file:///usr/share/mydrawprogram/Clipart" folder to the volume list.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: uri
parameter.parameter_description: URI of the folder to add

function.return: %TRUE if the folder could be added successfully, %FALSE otherwise. In the latter case, the @error will be set as appropriate.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_button_get_focus_on_click
function.description:
Returns whether the button grabs focus when it is clicked with the mouse. See gtk_file_chooser_button_set_focus_on_click().
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if the button grabs focus when it is clicked with the mouse.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_button_get_title
function.description:
Retrieves the title of the browse dialog used by @button. The returned value should not be modified or freed.
Since: 2.6
function.return: a pointer to the browse dialog's title.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_button_get_width_chars
function.description:
Retrieves the width in characters of the @button widget's entry and/or label.
Since: 2.6
function.return: an integer width (in characters) that the button will use to size itself.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_button_new
function.description:
Creates a new file-selecting button widget.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: title
parameter.parameter_description: the title of the browse dialog.

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: the open mode for the widget.

function.return: a new button widget.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_button_new_with_dialog
function.description:
Creates a #GtkFileChooserButton widget which uses @dialog as its file-picking window.
Note that @dialog must be a #GtkDialog (or subclass) which implements the #GtkFileChooser interface and must not have %GTK_DIALOG_DESTROY_WITH_PARENT set.
Also note that the dialog needs to have its confirmative button added with response %GTK_RESPONSE_ACCEPT or %GTK_RESPONSE_OK in order for the button to take over the file selected in the dialog.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: dialog
parameter.parameter_description: the widget to use as dialog

function.return: a new button widget.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_button_set_focus_on_click
function.description:
Sets whether the button will grab focus when it is clicked with the mouse. Making mouse clicks not grab focus is useful in places like toolbars where you don't want the keyboard focus removed from the main area of the application.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: focus_on_click
parameter.parameter_description: whether the button grabs focus when clicked with the mouse

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_button_set_title
function.description:
Modifies the @title of the browse dialog used by @button.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_button_set_width_chars
function.description:
Sets the width (in characters) that @button will use to @n_chars.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_dialog_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkFileChooserDialog. This function is analogous to gtk_dialog_new_with_buttons().
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: Transient parent of the dialog, or %NULL

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: Open or save mode for the dialog

parameter.name: first_button_text
parameter.parameter_description: stock ID or text to go in the first button, or %NULL

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: response ID for the first button, then additional (button, id) pairs, ending with %NULL

function.return: a new #GtkFileChooserDialog

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_error_quark
function.description:
Registers an error quark for #GtkFileChooser if necessary.
Since: 2.4
function.return: The error quark used for #GtkFileChooser errors.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_action
function.description:
Gets the type of operation that the file chooser is performing; see gtk_file_chooser_set_action().
Since: 2.4
function.return: the action that the file selector is performing

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_create_folders
function.description:
Gets whether file choser will offer to create new folders. See gtk_file_chooser_set_create_folders().
Since: 2.18
function.return: %TRUE if the New Folder button should be displayed.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_current_folder
function.description:
Gets the current folder of @chooser as a local filename. See gtk_file_chooser_set_current_folder().
Note that this is the folder that the file chooser is currently displaying (e.g. "/home/username/Documents"), which is <emphasis>not the same</emphasis> as the currently-selected folder if the chooser is in %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_SELECT_FOLDER mode (e.g. "/home/username/Documents/selected-folder/". To get the currently-selected folder in that mode, use gtk_file_chooser_get_uri() as the usual way to get the selection.
Since: 2.4
function.return: the full path of the current folder, or %NULL if the current path cannot be represented as a local filename. Free with g_free(). This function will also return %NULL if the file chooser was unable to load the last folder that was requested from it; for example, as would be for calling gtk_file_chooser_set_current_folder() on a nonexistent folder.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_current_folder_file
function.description:
Gets the current folder of @chooser as #GFile. See gtk_file_chooser_get_current_folder_uri().
Since: 2.14
function.return: the #GFile for the current folder.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_current_folder_uri
function.description:
Gets the current folder of @chooser as an URI. See gtk_file_chooser_set_current_folder_uri().
Note that this is the folder that the file chooser is currently displaying (e.g. "file:///home/username/Documents"), which is <emphasis>not the same</emphasis> as the currently-selected folder if the chooser is in %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_SELECT_FOLDER mode (e.g. "file:///home/username/Documents/selected-folder/". To get the currently-selected folder in that mode, use gtk_file_chooser_get_uri() as the usual way to get the selection.
Since: 2.4
function.return: the URI for the current folder. Free with g_free(). This function will also return %NULL if the file chooser was unable to load the last folder that was requested from it; for example, as would be for calling gtk_file_chooser_set_current_folder_uri() on a nonexistent folder.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_current_name
function.description:
Gets the current name in the file selector, as entered by the user in the text entry for "Name".
This is meant to be used in save dialogs, to get the currently typed filename when the file itself does not exist yet. For example, an application that adds a custom extra widget to the file chooser for "file format" may want to change the extension of the typed filename based on the chosen format, say, from ".jpg" to ".png".
Since: 3.10
function.return: The raw text from the file chooser's "Name" entry. Free this with g_free(). Note that this string is not a full pathname or URI; it is whatever the contents of the entry are. Note also that this string is in UTF-8 encoding, which is not necessarily the system's encoding for filenames.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_do_overwrite_confirmation
function.description:
Queries whether a file chooser is set to confirm for overwriting when the user types a file name that already exists.
Since: 2.8
function.return: %TRUE if the file chooser will present a confirmation dialog; %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_extra_widget
function.description:
Gets the current preview widget; see gtk_file_chooser_set_extra_widget().
Since: 2.4
function.return: the current extra widget, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_file
function.description:
Gets the #GFile for the currently selected file in the file selector. If multiple files are selected, one of the files will be returned at random.
If the file chooser is in folder mode, this function returns the selected folder.
Since: 2.14
function.return: a selected #GFile. You own the returned file; use g_object_unref() to release it.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_filename
function.description:
Gets the filename for the currently selected file in the file selector. The filename is returned as an absolute path. If multiple files are selected, one of the filenames will be returned at random.
If the file chooser is in folder mode, this function returns the selected folder.
Since: 2.4
function.return: The currently selected filename, or %NULL if no file is selected, or the selected file can't be represented with a local filename. Free with g_free().

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_filenames
function.description:
Lists all the selected files and subfolders in the current folder of @chooser. The returned names are full absolute paths. If files in the current folder cannot be represented as local filenames they will be ignored. (See gtk_file_chooser_get_uris())
Since: 2.4
function.return: a #GSList containing the filenames of all selected files and subfolders in the current folder. Free the returned list with g_slist_free(), and the filenames with g_free().

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_files
function.description:
Lists all the selected files and subfolders in the current folder of @chooser as #GFile. An internal function, see gtk_file_chooser_get_uris().
Since: 2.14
function.return: a #GSList containing a #GFile for each selected file and subfolder in the current folder. Free the returned list with g_slist_free(), and the files with g_object_unref().

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_filter
function.description:
Gets the current filter; see gtk_file_chooser_set_filter().
Since: 2.4
function.return: the current filter, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_local_only
function.description:
Gets whether only local files can be selected in the file selector. See gtk_file_chooser_set_local_only()
Since: 2.4
function.return: %TRUE if only local files can be selected.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_preview_file
function.description:
Gets the #GFile that should be previewed in a custom preview Internal function, see gtk_file_chooser_get_preview_uri().
Since: 2.14
function.return: the #GFile for the file to preview, or %NULL if no file is selected. Free with g_object_unref().

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_preview_filename
function.description:
Gets the filename that should be previewed in a custom preview widget. See gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget().
Since: 2.4
function.return: the filename to preview, or %NULL if no file is selected, or if the selected file cannot be represented as a local filename. Free with g_free()

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_preview_uri
function.description:
Gets the URI that should be previewed in a custom preview widget. See gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget().
Since: 2.4
function.return: the URI for the file to preview, or %NULL if no file is selected. Free with g_free().

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_preview_widget
function.description:
Gets the current preview widget; see gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget().
Since: 2.4
function.return: the current preview widget, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_preview_widget_active
function.description:
Gets whether the preview widget set by gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget() should be shown for the current filename. See gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget_active().
Since: 2.4
function.return: %TRUE if the preview widget is active for the current filename.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_select_multiple
function.description:
Gets whether multiple files can be selected in the file selector. See gtk_file_chooser_set_select_multiple().
Since: 2.4
function.return: %TRUE if multiple files can be selected.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_show_hidden
function.description:
Gets whether hidden files and folders are displayed in the file selector. See gtk_file_chooser_set_show_hidden().
Since: 2.6
function.return: %TRUE if hidden files and folders are displayed.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_uri
function.description:
Gets the URI for the currently selected file in the file selector. If multiple files are selected, one of the filenames will be returned at random.
If the file chooser is in folder mode, this function returns the selected folder.
Since: 2.4
function.return: The currently selected URI, or %NULL if no file is selected. If gtk_file_chooser_set_local_only() is set to %TRUE (the default) a local URI will be returned for any FUSE locations. Free with g_free()

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_uris
function.return: a #GSList containing the URIs of all selected files and subfolders in the current folder. Free the returned list with g_slist_free(), and the filenames with g_free().

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_get_use_preview_label
function.description: Gets whether a stock label should be drawn with the name of the previewed file. See gtk_file_chooser_set_use_preview_label().
function.return: %TRUE if the file chooser is set to display a label with the name of the previewed file, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_list_filters
function.description:
Lists the current set of user-selectable filters; see gtk_file_chooser_add_filter(), gtk_file_chooser_remove_filter().
Since: 2.4
function.return: a #GSList containing the current set of user selectable filters. The contents of the list are owned by GTK+, but you must free the list itself with g_slist_free() when you are done with it.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_list_shortcut_folder_uris
function.description:
Queries the list of shortcut folders in the file chooser, as set by gtk_file_chooser_add_shortcut_folder_uri().
Since: 2.4
function.return: A list of folder URIs, or %NULL if there are no shortcut folders. Free the returned list with g_slist_free(), and the URIs with g_free().

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_list_shortcut_folders
function.description:
Queries the list of shortcut folders in the file chooser, as set by gtk_file_chooser_add_shortcut_folder().
Since: 2.4
function.return: A list of folder filenames, or %NULL if there are no shortcut folders. Free the returned list with g_slist_free(), and the filenames with g_free().

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_remove_filter
function.description:
Removes @filter from the list of filters that the user can select between.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_remove_shortcut_folder
function.description:
Removes a folder from a file chooser's list of shortcut folders.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: folder
parameter.parameter_description: filename of the folder to remove

function.return:
%TRUE if the operation succeeds, %FALSE otherwise. In the latter case, the @error will be set as appropriate.
See also: gtk_file_chooser_add_shortcut_folder()

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_remove_shortcut_folder_uri
function.description:
Removes a folder URI from a file chooser's list of shortcut folders.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: uri
parameter.parameter_description: URI of the folder to remove

function.return:
%TRUE if the operation succeeds, %FALSE otherwise. In the latter case, the @error will be set as appropriate.
See also: gtk_file_chooser_add_shortcut_folder_uri()

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_select_all
function.description:
Selects all the files in the current folder of a file chooser.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_select_file
function.description:
Selects the file referred to by @file. An internal function. See _gtk_file_chooser_select_uri().
Since: 2.14
function.return: Not useful.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_select_filename
function.description:
Selects a filename. If the file name isn't in the current folder of @chooser, then the current folder of @chooser will be changed to the folder containing @filename.
Since: 2.4
function.return:
Not useful.
See also: gtk_file_chooser_set_filename()

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_select_uri
function.description:
Selects the file to by @uri. If the URI doesn't refer to a file in the current folder of @chooser, then the current folder of @chooser will be changed to the folder containing @filename.
Since: 2.4
function.return: Not useful.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_action
function.description:
Sets the type of operation that the chooser is performing; the user interface is adapted to suit the selected action. For example, an option to create a new folder might be shown if the action is %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_SAVE but not if the action is %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: the action that the file selector is performing

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_create_folders
function.description:
Sets whether file choser will offer to create new folders. This is only relevant if the action is not set to be %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN.
Since: 2.18

parameter.name: create_folders
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the New Folder button should be displayed

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_current_folder
function.description:
Sets the current folder for @chooser from a local filename. The user will be shown the full contents of the current folder, plus user interface elements for navigating to other folders.
In general, you should not use this function. See the <link linkend="gtkfilechooserdialog-setting-up">section on setting up a file chooser dialog</link> for the rationale behind this.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: filename
parameter.parameter_description: the full path of the new current folder

function.return: Not useful.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_current_folder_file
function.description:
Sets the current folder for @chooser from a #GFile. Internal function, see gtk_file_chooser_set_current_folder_uri().
Since: 2.14
function.return: %TRUE if the folder could be changed successfully, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_current_folder_uri
function.description:
Sets the current folder for @chooser from an URI. The user will be shown the full contents of the current folder, plus user interface elements for navigating to other folders.
In general, you should not use this function. See the <link linkend="gtkfilechooserdialog-setting-up">section on setting up a file chooser dialog</link> for the rationale behind this.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: uri
parameter.parameter_description: the URI for the new current folder

function.return: %TRUE if the folder could be changed successfully, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_current_name
function.description:
Sets the current name in the file selector, as if entered by the user. Note that the name passed in here is a UTF-8 string rather than a filename. This function is meant for such uses as a suggested name in a "Save As..." dialog. You can pass "Untitled.doc" or a similarly suitable suggestion for the @name.
If you want to preselect a particular existing file, you should use gtk_file_chooser_set_filename() or gtk_file_chooser_set_uri() instead. Please see the documentation for those functions for an example of using gtk_file_chooser_set_current_name() as well.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the filename to use, as a UTF-8 string

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_do_overwrite_confirmation
function.description:
Sets whether a file chooser in %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_SAVE mode will present a confirmation dialog if the user types a file name that already exists. This is %FALSE by default.
If set to %TRUE, the @chooser will emit the #GtkFileChooser::confirm-overwrite signal when appropriate.
If all you need is the stock confirmation dialog, set this property to %TRUE. You can override the way confirmation is done by actually handling the #GtkFileChooser::confirm-overwrite signal; please refer to its documentation for the details.
Since: 2.8

parameter.name: do_overwrite_confirmation
parameter.parameter_description: whether to confirm overwriting in save mode

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_extra_widget
function.description:
Sets an application-supplied widget to provide extra options to the user.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_file
function.description:
Sets @file as the current filename for the file chooser, by changing to the file's parent folder and actually selecting the file in list. If the @chooser is in %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_SAVE mode, the file's base name will also appear in the dialog's file name entry.
If the file name isn't in the current folder of @chooser, then the current folder of @chooser will be changed to the folder containing @filename. This is equivalent to a sequence of gtk_file_chooser_unselect_all() followed by gtk_file_chooser_select_filename().
Note that the file must exist, or nothing will be done except for the directory change.
If you are implementing a <guimenuitem>File/Save As...</guimenuitem> dialog, you should use this function if you already have a file name to which the user may save; for example, when the user opens an existing file and then does <guimenuitem>File/Save As...</guimenuitem> on it. If you don't have a file name already — for example, if the user just created a new file and is saving it for the first time, do not call this function. Instead, use something similar to this: |[ if (document_is_new) { / * the user just created a new document * / gtk_file_chooser_set_current_folder_file (chooser, default_file_for_saving); gtk_file_chooser_set_current_name (chooser, "Untitled document"); } else { / * the user edited an existing document * / gtk_file_chooser_set_file (chooser, existing_file); } ]|
Since: 2.14

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the error, or %NULL to ignore errors.

function.return: Not useful.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_filename
function.description:
Sets @filename as the current filename for the file chooser, by changing to the file's parent folder and actually selecting the file in list; all other files will be unselected. If the @chooser is in %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_SAVE mode, the file's base name will also appear in the dialog's file name entry.
Note that the file must exist, or nothing will be done except for the directory change.
You should use this function only when implementing a <guimenuitem>File/Save As...</guimenuitem> dialog for which you already have a file name to which the user may save. For example, when the user opens an existing file and then does <guimenuitem>File/Save As...</guimenuitem> on it to save a copy or a modified version. If you don't have a file name already — for example, if the user just created a new file and is saving it for the first time, do not call this function. Instead, use something similar to this: |[ if (document_is_new) { / * the user just created a new document * / gtk_file_chooser_set_current_name (chooser, "Untitled document"); } else { / * the user edited an existing document * / gtk_file_chooser_set_filename (chooser, existing_filename); } ]|
In the first case, the file chooser will present the user with useful suggestions as to where to save his new file. In the second case, the file's existing location is already known, so the file chooser will use it.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: filename
parameter.parameter_description: the filename to set as current

function.return: Not useful.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_filter
function.description:
Sets the current filter; only the files that pass the filter will be displayed. If the user-selectable list of filters is non-empty, then the filter should be one of the filters in that list. Setting the current filter when the list of filters is empty is useful if you want to restrict the displayed set of files without letting the user change it.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_local_only
function.description:
Sets whether only local files can be selected in the file selector. If @local_only is %TRUE (the default), then the selected file are files are guaranteed to be accessible through the operating systems native file file system and therefore the application only needs to worry about the filename functions in #GtkFileChooser, like gtk_file_chooser_get_filename(), rather than the URI functions like gtk_file_chooser_get_uri(),
On some systems non-native files may still be available using the native filesystem via a userspace filesystem (FUSE).
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: local_only
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if only local files can be selected

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget
function.description:
Sets an application-supplied widget to use to display a custom preview of the currently selected file. To implement a preview, after setting the preview widget, you connect to the #GtkFileChooser::update-preview signal, and call gtk_file_chooser_get_preview_filename() or gtk_file_chooser_get_preview_uri() on each change. If you can display a preview of the new file, update your widget and set the preview active using gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget_active(). Otherwise, set the preview inactive.
When there is no application-supplied preview widget, or the application-supplied preview widget is not active, the file chooser will display no preview at all.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget_active
function.description:
Sets whether the preview widget set by gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget() should be shown for the current filename. When @active is set to false, the file chooser may display an internally generated preview of the current file or it may display no preview at all. See gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget() for more details.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: active
parameter.parameter_description: whether to display the user-specified preview widget

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_select_multiple
function.description:
Sets whether multiple files can be selected in the file selector. This is only relevant if the action is set to be %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_OPEN or %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_SELECT_FOLDER.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: select_multiple
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if multiple files can be selected.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_show_hidden
function.description:
Sets whether hidden files and folders are displayed in the file selector.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: show_hidden
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if hidden files and folders should be displayed.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_uri
function.description:
Sets the file referred to by @uri as the current file for the file chooser, by changing to the URI's parent folder and actually selecting the URI in the list. If the @chooser is %GTK_FILE_CHOOSER_ACTION_SAVE mode, the URI's base name will also appear in the dialog's file name entry.
Note that the URI must exist, or nothing will be done except for the directory change.
You should use this function only when implementing a <guimenuitem>File/Save As...</guimenuitem> dialog for which you already have a file name to which the user may save. For example, whenthe user opens an existing file and then does <guimenuitem>File/Save As...</guimenuitem> on it to save a copy or a modified version. If you don't have a file name already — for example, if the user just created a new file and is saving it for the first time, do not call this function. Instead, use something similar to this: |[ if (document_is_new) { / * the user just created a new document * / gtk_file_chooser_set_current_name (chooser, "Untitled document"); } else { / * the user edited an existing document * / gtk_file_chooser_set_uri (chooser, existing_uri); } ]|
In the first case, the file chooser will present the user with useful suggestions as to where to save his new file. In the second case, the file's existing location is already known, so the file chooser will use it.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: uri
parameter.parameter_description: the URI to set as current

function.return: Not useful.

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_set_use_preview_label
function.description:
Sets whether the file chooser should display a stock label with the name of the file that is being previewed; the default is %TRUE. Applications that want to draw the whole preview area themselves should set this to %FALSE and display the name themselves in their preview widget.
See also: gtk_file_chooser_set_preview_widget()
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: use_label
parameter.parameter_description: whether to display a stock label with the name of the previewed file

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_unselect_all
function.description:
Unselects all the files in the current folder of a file chooser.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_unselect_file
function.description:
Unselects the file referred to by @file. If the file is not in the current directory, does not exist, or is otherwise not currently selected, does nothing.
Since: 2.14

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_unselect_filename
function.description:
Unselects a currently selected filename. If the filename is not in the current directory, does not exist, or is otherwise not currently selected, does nothing.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_unselect_uri
function.description:
Unselects the file referred to by @uri. If the file is not in the current directory, does not exist, or is otherwise not currently selected, does nothing.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_file_chooser_widget_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkFileChooserWidget. This is a file chooser widget that can be embedded in custom windows, and it is the same widget that is used by #GtkFileChooserDialog.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: Open or save mode for the widget

function.return: a new #GtkFileChooserWidget

function.name: gtk_file_filter_add_custom
function.description:
Adds rule to a filter that allows files based on a custom callback function. The bitfield @needed which is passed in provides information about what sorts of information that the filter function needs; this allows GTK+ to avoid retrieving expensive information when it isn't needed by the filter.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: needed
parameter.parameter_description: bitfield of flags indicating the information that the custom filter function needs.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: callback function; if the function returns %TRUE, then the file will be displayed.

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: function to call to free @data when it is no longer needed.

function.name: gtk_file_filter_add_mime_type
function.description:
Adds a rule allowing a given mime type to @filter.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_file_filter_add_pattern
function.description:
Adds a rule allowing a shell style glob to a filter.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_file_filter_add_pixbuf_formats
function.description:
Adds a rule allowing image files in the formats supported by GdkPixbuf.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_file_filter_filter
function.description:
Tests whether a file should be displayed according to @filter. The #GtkFileFilterInfo structure @filter_info should include the fields returned from gtk_file_filter_get_needed().
This function will not typically be used by applications; it is intended principally for use in the implementation of #GtkFileChooser.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: filter_info
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkFileFilterInfo structure containing information about a file.

function.return: %TRUE if the file should be displayed

function.name: gtk_file_filter_get_name
function.description:
Gets the human-readable name for the filter. See gtk_file_filter_set_name().
Since: 2.4
function.return: The human-readable name of the filter, or %NULL. This value is owned by GTK+ and must not be modified or freed.

function.name: gtk_file_filter_get_needed
function.description:
Gets the fields that need to be filled in for the structure passed to gtk_file_filter_filter()
This function will not typically be used by applications; it is intended principally for use in the implementation of #GtkFileChooser.
Since: 2.4
function.return: bitfield of flags indicating needed fields when calling gtk_file_filter_filter()

function.name: gtk_file_filter_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkFileFilter with no rules added to it. Such a filter doesn't accept any files, so is not particularly useful until you add rules with gtk_file_filter_add_mime_type(), gtk_file_filter_add_pattern(), or gtk_file_filter_add_custom(). To create a filter that accepts any file, use: |[ GtkFileFilter *filter = gtk_file_filter_new (); gtk_file_filter_add_pattern (filter, "*"); ]|
Since: 2.4
function.return: a new #GtkFileFilter

function.name: gtk_file_filter_set_name
function.description:
Sets the human-readable name of the filter; this is the string that will be displayed in the file selector user interface if there is a selectable list of filters.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the human-readable-name for the filter, or %NULL to remove any existing name.

function.name: gtk_fixed_move
function.description: Moves a child of a #GtkFixed container to the given position.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: the horizontal position to move the widget to.

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: the vertical position to move the widget to.

function.name: gtk_fixed_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkFixed.
function.return: a new #GtkFixed.

function.name: gtk_fixed_put
function.description: Adds a widget to a #GtkFixed container at the given position.

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: the horizontal position to place the widget at.

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: the vertical position to place the widget at.

function.name: gtk_font_button_get_font_name
function.description:
Retrieves the name of the currently selected font. This name includes style and size information as well. If you want to render something with the font, use this string with pango_font_description_from_string() . If you're interested in peeking certain values (family name, style, size, weight) just query these properties from the #PangoFontDescription object.
Since: 2.4
function.return: an internal copy of the font name which must not be freed.

function.name: gtk_font_button_get_show_size
function.description:
Returns whether the font size will be shown in the label.
Since: 2.4
function.return: whether the font size will be shown in the label.

function.name: gtk_font_button_get_show_style
function.description:
Returns whether the name of the font style will be shown in the label.
Since: 2.4
function.return: whether the font style will be shown in the label.

function.name: gtk_font_button_get_title

Retrieves the title of the font chooser dialog.

function.return: an internal copy of the title string which must not be freed.

function.name: gtk_font_button_get_use_font
function.description:
Returns whether the selected font is used in the label.

function.return: whether the selected font is used in the label.

function.name: gtk_font_button_get_use_size
function.description:
Returns whether the selected size is used in the label.
Since: 2.4
function.return: whether the selected size is used in the label.

function.name: gtk_font_chooser_dialog_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkFontChooserDialog.
Since: 3.2

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: Transient parent of the dialog, or %NULL

function.return: a new #GtkFontChooserDialog

function.name: gtk_font_chooser_get_font
function.description:
Gets the currently-selected font name.
Note that this can be a different string than what you set with gtk_font_chooser_set_font(), as the font chooser widget may normalize font names and thus return a string with a different structure. For example, "Helvetica Italic Bold 12" could be normalized to "Helvetica Bold Italic 12".
Use pango_font_description_equal() if you want to compare two font descriptions.
Since: 3.2
function.return: A string with the name of the current font, or %NULL if no font is selected. You must free this string with g_free().

function.name: gtk_font_chooser_get_font_desc
function.description:
Gets the currently-selected font.
Note that this can be a different string than what you set with gtk_font_chooser_set_font(), as the font chooser widget may normalize font names and thus return a string with a different structure. For example, "Helvetica Italic Bold 12" could be normalized to "Helvetica Bold Italic 12".
Use pango_font_description_equal() if you want to compare two font descriptions.
Since: 3.2
function.return: A #PangoFontDescription for the current font, or %NULL if no font is selected.

function.name: gtk_font_chooser_get_font_face
function.description:
Gets the #PangoFontFace representing the selected font group details (i.e. family, slant, weight, width, etc).
If the selected font is not installed, returns %NULL.
Since: 3.2

function.name: gtk_font_chooser_get_font_family
function.description:
Gets the #PangoFontFamily representing the selected font family. Font families are a collection of font faces.
If the selected font is not installed, returns %NULL.
Since: 3.2
function.return: A #PangoFontFamily representing the selected font family, or %NULL. The returned object is owned by @fontchooser and must not be modified or freed.

function.name: gtk_font_chooser_get_font_size
function.description:
The selected font size.
Since: 3.2
function.return: A n integer representing the selected font size, or -1 if no font size is selected.

function.name: gtk_font_chooser_get_preview_text
function.description:
Gets the text displayed in the preview area.
Since: 3.2
function.return: the text displayed in the preview area

Returns whether the preview entry is shown or not.
Since: 3.2
function.return: %TRUE if the preview entry is shown or %FALSE if it is hidden.

parameter.name: xalign
yalign
parameter.parameter_description: The y alignment of the label. A value of 0.0 aligns under the frame; 1.0 aligns above the frame. If the values are exactly 0.0 or 1.0 the gap in the frame won't be painted because the label will be completely above or below the frame.

function.name: gtk_frame_set_label_widget
function.description: Sets the label widget for the frame. This is the widget that will appear embedded in the top edge of the frame as a title.

function.name: gtk_frame_set_shadow_type
function.description: Sets the shadow type for @frame.

function.name: gtk_get_binary_age
function.description:
Returns the binary age as passed to <application>libtool</application> when building the GTK+ library the process is running against. If <application>libtool</application> means nothing to you, don't worry about it.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the binary age of the GTK+ library

function.name: gtk_get_current_event
function.description:
Obtains a copy of the event currently being processed by GTK+.
For example, if you are handling a #GtkButton::clicked signal, the current event will be the #GdkEventButton that triggered the ::clicked signal.
function.return: a copy of the current event, or %NULL if there is no current event. The returned event must be freed with gdk_event_free().

function.name: gtk_get_current_event_device
function.description: If there is a current event and it has a device, return that device, otherwise return %NULL.
function.return: a #GdkDevice, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_get_current_event_state
function.description: If there is a current event and it has a state field, place that state field in @state and return %TRUE, otherwise return %FALSE.

parameter.name: state
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the state of the current event

function.return: %TRUE if there was a current event and it had a state field

function.name: gtk_get_current_event_time
function.description: If there is a current event and it has a timestamp, return that timestamp, otherwise return %GDK_CURRENT_TIME.
function.return: the timestamp from the current event, or %GDK_CURRENT_TIME.

function.name: gtk_get_debug_flags
function.description:
Returns the GTK+ debug flags.
This function is intended for GTK+ modules that want to adjust their debug output based on GTK+ debug flags.
function.return: the GTK+ debug flags.

function.name: gtk_get_default_language
function.description:
Returns the #PangoLanguage for the default language currently in effect. (Note that this can change over the life of an application.) The default language is derived from the current locale. It determines, for example, whether GTK+ uses the right-to-left or left-to-right text direction.
This function is equivalent to pango_language_get_default(). See that function for details.
function.return: the default language as a #PangoLanguage, must not be freed

function.name: gtk_get_event_widget
function.description: If @event is %NULL or the event was not associated with any widget, returns %NULL, otherwise returns the widget that received the event originally.
function.return: the widget that originally received @event, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_get_interface_age
function.description:
Returns the interface age as passed to <application>libtool</application> when building the GTK+ library the process is running against. If <application>libtool</application> means nothing to you, don't worry about it.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the interface age of the GTK+ library

function.name: gtk_get_major_version
function.description:
Returns the major version number of the GTK+ library. (e.g. in GTK+ version 3.1.5 this is 3.)
This function is in the library, so it represents the GTK+ library your code is running against. Contrast with the #GTK_MAJOR_VERSION macro, which represents the major version of the GTK+ headers you have included when compiling your code.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the major version number of the GTK+ library

function.name: gtk_get_micro_version
function.description:
Returns the micro version number of the GTK+ library. (e.g. in GTK+ version 3.1.5 this is 5.)
This function is in the library, so it represents the GTK+ library your code is are running against. Contrast with the #GTK_MICRO_VERSION macro, which represents the micro version of the GTK+ headers you have included when compiling your code.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the micro version number of the GTK+ library

function.name: gtk_get_minor_version
function.description:
Returns the minor version number of the GTK+ library. (e.g. in GTK+ version 3.1.5 this is 1.)
This function is in the library, so it represents the GTK+ library your code is are running against. Contrast with the #GTK_MINOR_VERSION macro, which represents the minor version of the GTK+ headers you have included when compiling your code.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the minor version number of the GTK+ library

function.name: gtk_get_option_group
function.description:
Returns a #GOptionGroup for the commandline arguments recognized by GTK+ and GDK.
You should add this group to your #GOptionContext with g_option_context_add_group(), if you are using g_option_context_parse() to parse your commandline arguments.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: open_default_display
parameter.parameter_description: whether to open the default display when parsing the commandline arguments

function.return: a #GOptionGroup for the commandline arguments recognized by GTK+

function.name: gtk_grab_add
function.description:
Makes @widget the current grabbed widget.
This means that interaction with other widgets in the same application is blocked and mouse as well as keyboard events are delivered to this widget.
If @widget is not sensitive, it is not set as the current grabbed widget and this function does nothing.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: The widget that grabs keyboard and pointer events

function.name: gtk_grab_get_current
function.description: Queries the current grab of the default window group.
function.return: The widget which currently has the grab or %NULL if no grab is active

function.name: gtk_grab_remove
function.description:
Removes the grab from the given widget.
You have to pair calls to gtk_grab_add() and gtk_grab_remove().
If @widget does not have the grab, this function does nothing.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: The widget which gives up the grab

function.name: gtk_gradient_add_color_stop
function.description:
Adds a stop color to @gradient.
Since: 3.0
Deprecated: 3.8: #GtkGradient is deprecated.

function.name: gtk_gradient_new_linear
function.description:
Creates a new linear gradient along the line defined by (x0, y0) and (x1, y1). Before using the gradient a number of stop colors must be added through gtk_gradient_add_color_stop().
Since: 3.0
Deprecated: 3.8: #GtkGradient is deprecated.

parameter.name: x0
parameter.parameter_description: X coordinate of the starting point

parameter.name: y0
parameter.parameter_description: Y coordinate of the starting point

parameter.name: x1
parameter.parameter_description: X coordinate of the end point

parameter.name: y1
parameter.parameter_description: Y coordinate of the end point

function.return: A newly created #GtkGradient

function.name: gtk_gradient_new_radial
function.description:
Creates a new radial gradient along the two circles defined by (x0, y0, radius0) and (x1, y1, radius1). Before using the gradient a number of stop colors must be added through gtk_gradient_add_color_stop().
Since: 3.0
Deprecated: 3.8: #GtkGradient is deprecated.

parameter.name: x0
parameter.parameter_description: X coordinate of the start circle

parameter.name: y0
parameter.parameter_description: Y coordinate of the start circle

parameter.name: x1
parameter.parameter_description: X coordinate of the end circle

parameter.name: y1
parameter.parameter_description: Y coordinate of the end circle

function.return: A newly created #GtkGradient

function.name: gtk_gradient_ref
function.description:
Increases the reference count of @gradient.
Since: 3.0
Deprecated: 3.8: #GtkGradient is deprecated.
function.return: The same @gradient

function.name: gtk_gradient_resolve
function.description:
If @gradient is resolvable, @resolved_gradient will be filled in with the resolved gradient as a cairo_pattern_t, and %TRUE will be returned. Generally, if @gradient can't be resolved, it is due to it being defined on top of a named color that doesn't exist in @props.
Since: 3.0
Deprecated: 3.8: #GtkGradient is deprecated.

parameter.name: props
parameter.parameter_description: #GtkStyleProperties to use when resolving named colors

parameter.name: resolved_gradient
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the resolved pattern

function.return: %TRUE if the gradient has been resolved

function.name: gtk_gradient_to_string
function.description:
Creates a string representation for @gradient that is suitable for using in GTK CSS files.
Deprecated: 3.8: #GtkGradient is deprecated.
function.return: A string representation for @gradient

function.name: gtk_gradient_unref
function.description:
Decreases the reference count of @gradient, freeing its memory if the reference count reaches 0.
Since: 3.0
Deprecated: 3.8: #GtkGradient is deprecated.

function.name: gtk_grid_attach
function.description:
Adds a widget to the grid.
The position of @child is determined by @left and @top. The number of 'cells' that @child will occupy is determined by @width and @height.

parameter.name: left
parameter.parameter_description: the column number to attach the left side of @child to

parameter.name: top
parameter.parameter_description: the row number to attach the top side of @child to

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the number of columns that @child will span

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the number of rows that @child will span

function.name: gtk_grid_attach_next_to
function.description:
Adds a widget to the grid.
The widget is placed next to @sibling, on the side determined by @side. When @sibling is %NULL, the widget is placed in row (for left or right placement) or column 0 (for top or bottom placement), at the end indicated by @side.
Attaching widgets labeled [1], [2], [3] with @sibling == %NULL and @side == %GTK_POS_LEFT yields a layout of [3][2][1].

parameter.name: sibling
parameter.parameter_description: the child of @grid that @child will be placed next to, or %NULL to place @child at the beginning or end

parameter.name: side
parameter.parameter_description: the side of @sibling that @child is positioned next to

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: the number of columns that @child will span

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: the number of rows that @child will span

function.name: gtk_grid_get_baseline_row
function.description:
Returns which row defines the global baseline of @grid.
Since: 3.10
function.return: the row index defining the global baseline

function.name: gtk_grid_get_child_at
function.description:
Gets the child of @grid whose area covers the grid cell whose upper left corner is at @left, @top.
Since: 3.2

parameter.name: left
parameter.parameter_description: the left edge of the cell

parameter.name: top
parameter.parameter_description: the top edge of the cell

function.return: the child at the given position, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_grid_get_column_homogeneous
function.description: Returns whether all columns of @grid have the same width.
function.return: whether all columns of @grid have the same width.

function.name: gtk_grid_get_column_spacing
function.description: Returns the amount of space between the columns of @grid.
function.return: the column spacing of @grid

function.name: gtk_grid_get_row_baseline_position
function.description:
Returns the baseline position of @row as set by gtk_grid_set_row_baseline_position() or the default value %GTK_BASELINE_POSITION_CENTER.
Since: 3.10
function.return: the baseline position of @row

function.name: gtk_grid_get_row_homogeneous
function.description: Returns whether all rows of @grid have the same height.
function.return: whether all rows of @grid have the same height.

function.name: gtk_grid_get_row_spacing
function.description: Returns the amount of space between the rows of @grid.
function.return: the row spacing of @grid

function.name: gtk_grid_insert_column
function.description:
Inserts a column at the specified position.
Children which are attached at or to the right of this position are moved one column to the right. Children which span across this position are grown to span the new column.
Since: 3.2

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position to insert the column at

function.name: gtk_grid_insert_next_to
function.description:
Inserts a row or column at the specified position.
The new row or column is placed next to @sibling, on the side determined by @side. If @side is %GTK_POS_TOP or %GTK_POS_BOTTOM, a row is inserted. If @side is %GTK_POS_LEFT of %GTK_POS_RIGHT, a column is inserted.
Since: 3.2

parameter.name: sibling
parameter.parameter_description: the child of @grid that the new row or column will be placed next to

parameter.name: side
parameter.parameter_description: the side of @sibling that @child is positioned next to

function.name: gtk_grid_insert_row
function.description:
Inserts a row at the specified position.
Children which are attached at or below this position are moved one row down. Children which span across this position are grown to span the new row.
Since: 3.2

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position to insert the row at

function.name: gtk_grid_new
function.description: Creates a new grid widget.
function.return: the new #GtkGrid

function.name: gtk_grid_remove_column
function.description:
Removes a column from the grid.
Children that are placed in this column are removed, spanning children that overlap this column have their width reduced by one, and children after the column are moved to the left.
Since: 3.10

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position of the column to remove

function.name: gtk_grid_remove_row
function.description:
Removes a row from the grid.
Children that are placed in this row are removed, spanning children that overlap this row have their height reduced by one, and children below the row are moved up.
Since: 3.10

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position of the row to remove

function.name: gtk_grid_set_baseline_row
function.description:
Sets which row defines the global baseline for the entire grid. Each row in the grid can have its own local baseline, but only one of those is global, meaning it will be the baseline in the parent of the @grid.
Since: 3.10
function.return: the row index defining the global baseline

function.name: gtk_grid_set_column_homogeneous
function.description: Sets whether all columns of @grid will have the same width.

function.name: gtk_grid_set_column_spacing
function.description: Sets the amount of space between columns of @grid.

parameter.name: spacing
parameter.parameter_description: the amount of space to insert between columns

function.name: gtk_grid_set_row_baseline_position
function.description:
Sets how the baseline should be positioned on @row of the grid, in case that row is assigned more space than is requested.
Since: 3.10

function.name: gtk_grid_set_row_homogeneous
function.description: Sets whether all rows of @grid will have the same height.

function.name: gtk_grid_set_row_spacing
function.description: Sets the amount of space between rows of @grid.

parameter.name: spacing
parameter.parameter_description: the amount of space to insert between rows

function.name: gtk_handle_box_get_child_detached
function.description:
Whether the handlebox's child is currently detached.
Since: 2.14
Deprecated: 3.4: #GtkHandleBox has been deprecated.
function.return: %TRUE if the child is currently detached, otherwise %FALSE
