parameter.name: top_attach
parameter.parameter_description: The row number to attach the top of the item to

parameter.name: bottom_attach
parameter.parameter_description: The row number to attach the bottom of the item to

function.name: gtk_menu_attach_to_widget
function.description:
Attaches the menu to the widget and provides a callback function that will be invoked when the menu calls gtk_menu_detach() during its destruction.
If the menu is attached to the widget then it will be destroyed when the widget is destroyed, as if it was a child widget. An attached menu will also move between screens correctly if the widgets moves between screens.

parameter.name: attach_widget
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget that the menu will be attached to

parameter.name: detacher
parameter.parameter_description: the user supplied callback function that will be called when the menu calls gtk_menu_detach()

function.name: gtk_menu_bar_get_child_pack_direction
function.description:
Retrieves the current child pack direction of the menubar. See gtk_menu_bar_set_child_pack_direction().
Since: 2.8
function.return: the child pack direction

function.name: gtk_menu_bar_get_pack_direction
function.description:
Retrieves the current pack direction of the menubar. See gtk_menu_bar_set_pack_direction().
Since: 2.8
function.return: the pack direction

function.name: gtk_menu_bar_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkMenuBar
function.return: the new menu bar, as a #GtkWidget

function.name: gtk_menu_bar_new_from_model
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkMenuBar and populates it with menu items and submenus according to @model.
The created menu items are connected to actions found in the #GtkApplicationWindow to which the menu bar belongs - typically by means of being contained within the #GtkApplicationWindows widget hierarchy.
Since: 3.4
function.return: a new #GtkMenuBar

function.name: gtk_menu_bar_set_child_pack_direction
function.description:
Sets how widgets should be packed inside the children of a menubar.
Since: 2.8

function.name: gtk_menu_bar_set_pack_direction
function.description:
Sets how items should be packed inside a menubar.
Since: 2.8

function.name: gtk_menu_button_get_align_widget
function.description:
Returns the parent #GtkWidget to use to line up with menu.
Since: 3.6
function.return: a #GtkWidget value or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_menu_button_get_direction
function.description:
Returns the direction the menu will be pointing at when popped up.
Since: 3.6
function.return: a #GtkArrowType value.

function.name: gtk_menu_button_get_menu_model
function.description:
Returns the #GMenuModel used to generate the menu.
Since: 3.6
function.return: a #GMenuModel or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_menu_button_get_popup
function.description:
Returns the #GtkMenu that pops out of the button.
Since: 3.6
function.return: a #GtkMenu or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_menu_button_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkMenuButton widget with downwards-pointing arrow as the only child. You can replace the child widget with another #GtkWidget should you wish to.
Since: 3.6
function.return: The newly created #GtkMenuButton widget.

function.name: gtk_menu_button_set_align_widget
function.description:
Sets the #GtkWidget to use to line the menu with when popped up. Note that the @align_widget must contain the #GtkMenuButton itself.
Setting it to %NULL means that the popup menu will be aligned with the button itself.
Since: 3.6

function.name: gtk_menu_button_set_direction
function.description:
Sets the direction in which the menu will be popped up, as well as changing the arrow's direction. The child will not be changed to an arrow if it was customized.
If the menu when popped out would have collided with screen edges, we will do our best to keep it inside the screen and fully visible.
If you pass %GTK_ARROW_NONE for a @direction, the menu will behave as if you passed %GTK_ARROW_DOWN (although you won't see any arrows).
Since: 3.6

function.name: gtk_menu_button_set_menu_model
function.description:
Sets the #GMenuModel from which the #GtkMenuButton:popup property will be filled in, or %NULL to disable the button.
The #GtkMenu will be created with gtk_menu_new_from_model(), so actions will be connected as documented there.
If #GtkMenuButton:popup is already set, then its content will be lost and replaced by our newly created #GtkMenu.
Since: 3.6

function.name: gtk_menu_button_set_popup
function.description:
Sets the #GtkMenu that will be popped up when the button is clicked, or %NULL to disable the button. If #GtkMenuButton:menu-model is set, it will be set to %NULL.
Since: 3.6

function.name: gtk_menu_detach
function.description: Detaches the menu from the widget to which it had been attached. This function will call the callback function, @detacher, provided when the gtk_menu_attach_to_widget() function was called.

function.name: gtk_menu_get_accel_group
function.description: Gets the #GtkAccelGroup which holds global accelerators for the menu. See gtk_menu_set_accel_group().
function.return: the #GtkAccelGroup associated with the menu

function.name: gtk_menu_get_accel_path
function.description:
Retrieves the accelerator path set on the menu.
Since: 2.14
function.return: the accelerator path set on the menu.

function.name: gtk_menu_get_active
function.description: Returns the selected menu item from the menu. This is used by the #GtkComboBox.
function.return: the #GtkMenuItem that was last selected in the menu. If a selection has not yet been made, the first menu item is selected.

function.name: gtk_menu_get_attach_widget
function.description: Returns the #GtkWidget that the menu is attached to.
function.return: the #GtkWidget that the menu is attached to

function.name: gtk_menu_get_for_attach_widget
function.description:
Returns a list of the menus which are attached to this widget. This list is owned by GTK+ and must not be modified.
Since: 2.6
function.return: the list of menus attached to his widget.

function.name: gtk_menu_get_monitor
function.description:
Retrieves the number of the monitor on which to show the menu.
Since: 2.14
function.return: the number of the monitor on which the menu should be popped up or -1, if no monitor has been set

function.name: gtk_menu_get_reserve_toggle_size
function.description:
Returns whether the menu reserves space for toggles and icons, regardless of their actual presence.
Since: 2.18
function.return: Whether the menu reserves toggle space

function.name: gtk_menu_get_tearoff_state
function.description:
Returns whether the menu is torn off. See gtk_menu_set_tearoff_state().
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: %TRUE if the menu is currently torn off.

function.name: gtk_menu_get_title
function.description:
Returns the title of the menu. See gtk_menu_set_title().
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: the title of the menu, or %NULL if the menu has no title set on it. This string is owned by GTK+ and should not be modified or freed.

function.name: gtk_menu_item_activate
function.description: Emits the #GtkMenuItem::activate signal on the given item

function.name: gtk_menu_item_deselect
function.description: Emits the #GtkMenuItem::deselect signal on the given item. Behaves exactly like #gtk_item_deselect.

function.name: gtk_menu_item_get_accel_path
function.description:
Retrieve the accelerator path that was previously set on @menu_item.
See gtk_menu_item_set_accel_path() for details.
Since: 2.14
function.return: the accelerator path corresponding to this menu item's functionality, or %NULL if not set

function.name: gtk_menu_item_get_label
function.description:
Sets @text on the @menu_item label
Since: 2.16
function.return: The text in the @menu_item label. This is the internal string used by the label, and must not be modified.

function.name: gtk_menu_item_get_reserve_indicator
function.description:
Returns whether the @menu_item reserves space for the submenu indicator, regardless if it has a submenu or not.
Since: 3.0
function.return: %TRUE if @menu_item always reserves space for the submenu indicator

function.name: gtk_menu_item_get_right_justified
function.description:
Gets whether the menu item appears justified at the right side of the menu bar.
Deprecated: 3.2: See gtk_menu_item_set_right_justified()
function.return: %TRUE if the menu item will appear at the far right if added to a menu bar.

function.name: gtk_menu_item_get_submenu
function.description: Gets the submenu underneath this menu item, if any. See gtk_menu_item_set_submenu().
function.return: submenu for this menu item, or %NULL if none

function.name: gtk_menu_item_get_use_underline
function.description:
Checks if an underline in the text indicates the next character should be used for the mnemonic accelerator key.
Since: 2.16
function.return: %TRUE if an embedded underline in the label indicates the mnemonic accelerator key.

function.name: gtk_menu_item_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkMenuItem.
function.return: the newly created #GtkMenuItem

function.name: gtk_menu_item_new_with_label
function.description: Creates a new #GtkMenuItem whose child is a #GtkLabel.
function.return: the newly created #GtkMenuItem

function.name: gtk_menu_item_new_with_mnemonic
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkMenuItem containing a label.
The label will be created using gtk_label_new_with_mnemonic(), so underscores in @label indicate the mnemonic for the menu item.

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: The text of the button, with an underscore in front of the mnemonic character

function.return: a new #GtkMenuItem

function.name: gtk_menu_item_select
function.description: Emits the #GtkMenuItem::select signal on the given item. Behaves exactly like #gtk_item_select.

function.name: gtk_menu_item_set_accel_path
function.description:
Set the accelerator path on @menu_item, through which runtime changes of the menu item's accelerator caused by the user can be identified and saved to persistent storage (see gtk_accel_map_save() on this). To set up a default accelerator for this menu item, call gtk_accel_map_add_entry() with the same @accel_path. See also gtk_accel_map_add_entry() on the specifics of accelerator paths, and gtk_menu_set_accel_path() for a more convenient variant of this function.
This function is basically a convenience wrapper that handles calling gtk_widget_set_accel_path() with the appropriate accelerator group for the menu item.
Note that you do need to set an accelerator on the parent menu with gtk_menu_set_accel_group() for this to work.
Note that @accel_path string will be stored in a #GQuark. Therefore, if you pass a static string, you can save some memory by interning it first with g_intern_static_string().

parameter.name: accel_path
parameter.parameter_description: accelerator path, corresponding to this menu item's functionality, or %NULL to unset the current path.

function.name: gtk_menu_item_set_label
function.description:
Sets @text on the @menu_item label
Since: 2.16

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: the text you want to set

function.name: gtk_menu_item_set_reserve_indicator
function.description:
Sets whether the @menu_item should reserve space for the submenu indicator, regardless if it actually has a submenu or not.
There should be little need for applications to call this functions.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_menu_item_set_right_justified
function.description:
Sets whether the menu item appears justified at the right side of a menu bar. This was traditionally done for "Help" menu items, but is now considered a bad idea. (If the widget layout is reversed for a right-to-left language like Hebrew or Arabic, right-justified-menu-items appear at the left.)
Deprecated: 3.2: If you insist on using it, use gtk_widget_set_hexpand() and gtk_widget_set_halign().

parameter.name: right_justified
parameter.parameter_description: if %TRUE the menu item will appear at the far right if added to a menu bar

function.name: gtk_menu_item_set_submenu
function.description: Sets or replaces the menu item's submenu, or removes it when a %NULL submenu is passed.

function.name: gtk_menu_item_set_use_underline
function.description:
If true, an underline in the text indicates the next character should be used for the mnemonic accelerator key.
Since: 2.16

parameter.name: setting
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if underlines in the text indicate mnemonics

function.name: gtk_menu_item_toggle_size_allocate
function.description: Emits the #GtkMenuItem::toggle-size-allocate signal on the given item.

parameter.name: allocation
parameter.parameter_description: the allocation to use as signal data.

function.name: gtk_menu_item_toggle_size_request
function.description: Emits the #GtkMenuItem::toggle-size-request signal on the given item.

parameter.name: requisition
parameter.parameter_description: the requisition to use as signal data.

function.name: gtk_menu_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkMenu
function.return: a new #GtkMenu

function.name: gtk_menu_new_from_model
function.description:
Creates a #GtkMenu and populates it with menu items and submenus according to @model.
The created menu items are connected to actions found in the #GtkApplicationWindow to which the menu belongs - typically by means of being attached to a widget (see gtk_menu_attach_to_widget()) that is contained within the #GtkApplicationWindows widget hierarchy.
Since: 3.4
function.return: a new #GtkMenu

function.name: gtk_menu_popdown
function.description: Removes the menu from the screen.

function.name: gtk_menu_popup
function.description:
Displays a menu and makes it available for selection.
Applications can use this function to display context-sensitive menus, and will typically supply %NULL for the @parent_menu_shell, @parent_menu_item, @func and @data parameters. The default menu positioning function will position the menu at the current mouse cursor position.
The @button parameter should be the mouse button pressed to initiate the menu popup. If the menu popup was initiated by something other than a mouse button press, such as a mouse button release or a keypress, @button should be 0.
The @activate_time parameter is used to conflict-resolve initiation of concurrent requests for mouse/keyboard grab requests. To function properly, this needs to be the timestamp of the user event (such as a mouse click or key press) that caused the initiation of the popup. Only if no such event is available, gtk_get_current_event_time() can be used instead.

parameter.name: parent_menu_shell
parameter.parameter_description: the menu shell containing the triggering menu item, or %NULL

parameter.name: parent_menu_item
parameter.parameter_description: the menu item whose activation triggered the popup, or %NULL

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: a user supplied function used to position the menu, or %NULL

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: user supplied data to be passed to @func.

parameter.name: button
parameter.parameter_description: the mouse button which was pressed to initiate the event.

parameter.name: activate_time
parameter.parameter_description: the time at which the activation event occurred.

function.name: gtk_menu_popup_for_device
function.description:
Displays a menu and makes it available for selection.
Applications can use this function to display context-sensitive menus, and will typically supply %NULL for the @parent_menu_shell, @parent_menu_item, @func, @data and @destroy parameters. The default menu positioning function will position the menu at the current position of @device (or its corresponding pointer).
The @button parameter should be the mouse button pressed to initiate the menu popup. If the menu popup was initiated by something other than a mouse button press, such as a mouse button release or a keypress, @button should be 0.
The @activate_time parameter is used to conflict-resolve initiation of concurrent requests for mouse/keyboard grab requests. To function properly, this needs to be the time stamp of the user event (such as a mouse click or key press) that caused the initiation of the popup. Only if no such event is available, gtk_get_current_event_time() can be used instead.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: parent_menu_shell
parameter.parameter_description: the menu shell containing the triggering menu item, or %NULL

parameter.name: parent_menu_item
parameter.parameter_description: the menu item whose activation triggered the popup, or %NULL

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: a user supplied function used to position the menu, or %NULL

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: user supplied data to be passed to @func

parameter.name: button
parameter.parameter_description: the mouse button which was pressed to initiate the event

parameter.name: activate_time
parameter.parameter_description: the time at which the activation event occurred

function.name: gtk_menu_reorder_child
function.description: Moves @child to a new @position in the list of @menu children.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the new position to place @child. Positions are numbered from 0 to n - 1

function.name: gtk_menu_reposition
function.description: Repositions the menu according to its position function.

function.name: gtk_menu_set_accel_group
function.description: Set the #GtkAccelGroup which holds global accelerators for the menu. This accelerator group needs to also be added to all windows that this menu is being used in with gtk_window_add_accel_group(), in order for those windows to support all the accelerators contained in this group.

parameter.name: accel_group
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkAccelGroup to be associated with the menu.

function.name: gtk_menu_set_accel_path
function.description:
Sets an accelerator path for this menu from which accelerator paths for its immediate children, its menu items, can be constructed. The main purpose of this function is to spare the programmer the inconvenience of having to call gtk_menu_item_set_accel_path() on each menu item that should support runtime user changable accelerators. Instead, by just calling gtk_menu_set_accel_path() on their parent, each menu item of this menu, that contains a label describing its purpose, automatically gets an accel path assigned.
For example, a menu containing menu items "New" and "Exit", will, after <literal>gtk_menu_set_accel_path (menu, "<Gnumeric-Sheet>/File");</literal> has been called, assign its items the accel paths: <literal>"<Gnumeric-Sheet>/File/New"</literal> and <literal>"<Gnumeric-Sheet>/File/Exit"</literal>.
Assigning accel paths to menu items then enables the user to change their accelerators at runtime. More details about accelerator paths and their default setups can be found at gtk_accel_map_add_entry().
Note that @accel_path string will be stored in a #GQuark. Therefore, if you pass a static string, you can save some memory by interning it first with g_intern_static_string().

function.name: gtk_menu_set_active
function.description: Selects the specified menu item within the menu. This is used by the #GtkComboBox and should not be used by anyone else.

parameter.name: index
parameter.parameter_description: the index of the menu item to select. Iindex values are from 0 to n-1

function.name: gtk_menu_set_monitor
function.description:
Informs GTK+ on which monitor a menu should be popped up. See gdk_screen_get_monitor_geometry().
This function should be called from a #GtkMenuPositionFunc if the menu should not appear on the same monitor as the pointer. This information can't be reliably inferred from the coordinates returned by a #GtkMenuPositionFunc, since, for very long menus, these coordinates may extend beyond the monitor boundaries or even the screen boundaries.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: monitor_num
parameter.parameter_description: the number of the monitor on which the menu should be popped up

function.name: gtk_menu_set_reserve_toggle_size
function.description:
Sets whether the menu should reserve space for drawing toggles or icons, regardless of their actual presence.
Since: 2.18

parameter.name: reserve_toggle_size
parameter.parameter_description: whether to reserve size for toggles

function.name: gtk_menu_set_screen
function.description:
Sets the #GdkScreen on which the menu will be displayed.
Since: 2.2

parameter.name: screen
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkScreen, or %NULL if the screen should be determined by the widget the menu is attached to

function.name: gtk_menu_set_tearoff_state
function.description:
Changes the tearoff state of the menu. A menu is normally displayed as drop down menu which persists as long as the menu is active. It can also be displayed as a tearoff menu which persists until it is closed or reattached.
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: torn_off
parameter.parameter_description: If %TRUE, menu is displayed as a tearoff menu.

function.name: gtk_menu_set_title
function.description:
Sets the title string for the menu.
The title is displayed when the menu is shown as a tearoff menu. If @title is %NULL, the menu will see if it is attached to a parent menu item, and if so it will try to use the same text as that menu item's label.
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: title
parameter.parameter_description: a string containing the title for the menu

function.name: gtk_menu_shell_activate_item
function.description: Activates the menu item within the menu shell.

parameter.name: force_deactivate
parameter.parameter_description: if %TRUE, force the deactivation of the menu shell after the menu item is activated

function.name: gtk_menu_shell_append
function.description: Adds a new #GtkMenuItem to the end of the menu shell's item list.

function.name: gtk_menu_shell_bind_model
function.description:
Establishes a binding between a #GtkMenuShell and a #GMenuModel.
The contents of @shell are removed and then refilled with menu items according to @model. When @model changes, @shell is updated. Calling this function twice on @shell with different @model will cause the first binding to be replaced with a binding to the new model. If @model is %NULL then any previous binding is undone and all children are removed.
@with_separators determines if toplevel items (eg: sections) have separators inserted between them. This is typically desired for menus but doesn't make sense for menubars.
If @action_namespace is non-%NULL then the effect is as if all actions mentioned in the @model have their names prefixed with the namespace, plus a dot. For example, if the action "quit" is mentioned and @action_namespace is "app" then the effective action name is "app.quit".
This function uses #GtkActionable to define the action name and target values on the created menu items. If you want to use an action group other than "app" and "win", or if you want to use a #GtkMenuShell outside of a #GtkApplicationWindow, then you will need to attach your own action group to the widget hierarchy using gtk_widget_insert_action_group(). As an example, if you created a group with a "quit" action and inserted it with the name "mygroup" then you would use the action name "mygroup.quit" in your #GMenuModel.
For most cases you are probably better off using gtk_menu_new_from_model() or gtk_menu_bar_new_from_model() or just directly passing the #GMenuModel to gtk_application_set_app_menu() or gtk_application_set_menu_bar().
Since: 3.6

parameter.name: model
parameter.parameter_description: the #GMenuModel to bind to or %NULL to remove binding

parameter.name: with_separators
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if toplevel items in @shell should have separators between them

function.name: gtk_menu_shell_cancel
function.description:
Cancels the selection within the menu shell.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_menu_shell_deactivate
function.description:
Deactivates the menu shell.
Typically this results in the menu shell being erased from the screen.

function.name: gtk_menu_shell_deselect
function.description: Deselects the currently selected item from the menu shell, if any.

function.name: gtk_menu_shell_get_parent_shell
function.description:
Gets the parent menu shell.
The parent menu shell of a submenu is the #GtkMenu or #GtkMenuBar from which it was opened up.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the parent #GtkMenuShell

function.name: gtk_menu_shell_get_selected_item
function.description:
Gets the currently selected item.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the currently selected item

function.name: gtk_menu_shell_get_take_focus
function.description:
Returns %TRUE if the menu shell will take the keyboard focus on popup.
Since: 2.8
function.return: %TRUE if the menu shell will take the keyboard focus on popup.

function.name: gtk_menu_shell_insert
function.description: Adds a new #GtkMenuItem to the menu shell's item list at the position indicated by @position.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: The position in the item list where @child is added. Positions are numbered from 0 to n-1

function.name: gtk_menu_shell_prepend
function.description: Adds a new #GtkMenuItem to the beginning of the menu shell's item list.

function.name: gtk_menu_shell_select_first
function.description:
Select the first visible or selectable child of the menu shell; don't select tearoff items unless the only item is a tearoff item.
Since: 2.2

parameter.name: search_sensitive
parameter.parameter_description: if %TRUE, search for the first selectable menu item, otherwise select nothing if the first item isn't sensitive. This should be %FALSE if the menu is being popped up initially.

function.name: gtk_menu_shell_select_item
function.description: Selects the menu item from the menu shell.

function.name: gtk_menu_shell_set_take_focus
function.description:
If @take_focus is %TRUE (the default) the menu shell will take the keyboard focus so that it will receive all keyboard events which is needed to enable keyboard navigation in menus.
Setting @take_focus to %FALSE is useful only for special applications like virtual keyboard implementations which should not take keyboard focus.
The @take_focus state of a menu or menu bar is automatically propagated to submenus whenever a submenu is popped up, so you don't have to worry about recursively setting it for your entire menu hierarchy. Only when programmatically picking a submenu and popping it up manually, the @take_focus property of the submenu needs to be set explicitely.
Note that setting it to %FALSE has side-effects:
If the focus is in some other app, it keeps the focus and keynav in the menu doesn't work. Consequently, keynav on the menu will only work if the focus is on some toplevel owned by the onscreen keyboard.
To avoid confusing the user, menus with @take_focus set to %FALSE should not display mnemonics or accelerators, since it cannot be guaranteed that they will work.
See also gdk_keyboard_grab()
Since: 2.8

parameter.name: take_focus
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the menu shell should take the keyboard focus on popup

function.name: gtk_message_dialog_format_secondary_markup
function.description:
Sets the secondary text of the message dialog to be @message_format (with printf()-style), which is marked up with the <link linkend="PangoMarkupFormat">Pango text markup language</link>.
Due to an oversight, this function does not escape special XML characters like gtk_message_dialog_new_with_markup() does. Thus, if the arguments may contain special XML characters, you should use g_markup_printf_escaped() to escape it.
<informalexample><programlisting> gchar *msg;
msg = g_markup_printf_escaped (message_format, ...); gtk_message_dialog_format_secondary_markup (message_dialog, "%s", msg); g_free (msg); </programlisting></informalexample>
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: message_format
parameter.parameter_description: printf()-style markup string (see <link linkend="PangoMarkupFormat">Pango markup format</link>), or %NULL

function.name: gtk_message_dialog_format_secondary_text
function.description:
Sets the secondary text of the message dialog to be @message_format (with printf()-style).
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_message_dialog_get_image
function.description:
Gets the dialog's image.
Since: 2.14
function.return: the dialog's image

function.name: gtk_message_dialog_get_message_area
function.description:
Returns the message area of the dialog. This is the box where the dialog's primary and secondary labels are packed. You can add your own extra content to that box and it will appear below those labels, on the right side of the dialog's image (or on the left for right-to-left languages). See gtk_dialog_get_content_area() for the corresponding function in the parent #GtkDialog.
Since: 2.22
function.return: A #GtkVBox corresponding to the "message area" in the @message_dialog.

function.name: gtk_message_dialog_new
function.description: Creates a new message dialog, which is a simple dialog with an icon indicating the dialog type (error, warning, etc.) and some text the user may want to see. When the user clicks a button a "response" signal is emitted with response IDs from #GtkResponseType. See #GtkDialog for more details.
function.return: a new #GtkMessageDialog

function.name: gtk_message_dialog_new_with_markup
function.description:
Creates a new message dialog, which is a simple dialog with an icon indicating the dialog type (error, warning, etc.) and some text which is marked up with the <link linkend="PangoMarkupFormat">Pango text markup language</link>. When the user clicks a button a "response" signal is emitted with response IDs from #GtkResponseType. See #GtkDialog for more details.
Special XML characters in the printf() arguments passed to this function will automatically be escaped as necessary. (See g_markup_printf_escaped() for how this is implemented.) Usually this is what you want, but if you have an existing Pango markup string that you want to use literally as the label, then you need to use gtk_message_dialog_set_markup() instead, since you can't pass the markup string either as the format (it might contain '%' characters) or as a string argument. |[ GtkWidget *dialog; dialog = gtk_message_dialog_new (main_application_window, GTK_DIALOG_DESTROY_WITH_PARENT, GTK_MESSAGE_ERROR, GTK_BUTTONS_CLOSE, NULL); gtk_message_dialog_set_markup (GTK_MESSAGE_DIALOG (dialog), markup); ]|
Since: 2.4
function.return: a new #GtkMessageDialog

function.name: gtk_message_dialog_set_image
function.description:
Sets the dialog's image to @image.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_message_dialog_set_markup
function.description:
Sets the text of the message dialog to be @str, which is marked up with the <link linkend="PangoMarkupFormat">Pango text markup language</link>.
Since: 2.4

If %NULL, and @tab_label is a #GtkLabel or %NULL, then the menu label will be a newly created label with the same text as @tab_label; if @tab_label is not a #GtkLabel, @menu_label must be specified if the page-switch menu is to be used.

parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkWidget to be used as the label for the page, or %NULL to use the default label, 'page N'

parameter.parameter_description: the widget to use as a label for the page-switch menu, if that is enabled. If %NULL, and @tab_label is a #GtkLabel or %NULL, then the menu label will be a newly created label with the same text as @tab_label; if @tab_label is not a #GtkLabel, @menu_label must be specified if the page-switch menu is to be used.

function.name: gtk_notebook_reorder_child
function.description: Reorders the page containing @child, so that it appears in position @position. If @position is greater than or equal to the number of children in the list or negative, @child will be moved to the end of the list.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the new position, or -1 to move to the end

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_action_widget
function.description:
Sets @widget as one of the action widgets. Depending on the pack type the widget will be placed before or after the tabs. You can use a #GtkBox if you need to pack more than one widget on the same side.
Note that action widgets are "internal" children of the notebook and thus not included in the list returned from gtk_container_foreach().
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: pack_type
parameter.parameter_description: pack type of the action widget

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_current_page
function.description:
Switches to the page number @page_num.
Note that due to historical reasons, GtkNotebook refuses to switch to a page unless the child widget is visible. Therefore, it is recommended to show child widgets before adding them to a notebook.

parameter.name: page_num
parameter.parameter_description: index of the page to switch to, starting from 0. If negative, the last page will be used. If greater than the number of pages in the notebook, nothing will be done.

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_group_name
function.description:
Sets a group name for @notebook.
Notebooks with the same name will be able to exchange tabs via drag and drop. A notebook with a %NULL group name will not be able to exchange tabs with any other notebook.
Since: 2.24

parameter.name: group_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the notebook group, or %NULL to unset it

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_menu_label
function.description: Changes the menu label for the page containing @child.

parameter.name: menu_label
parameter.parameter_description: the menu label, or %NULL for default

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_menu_label_text
function.description: Creates a new label and sets it as the menu label of @child.

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_scrollable
function.description: Sets whether the tab label area will have arrows for scrolling if there are too many tabs to fit in the area.

parameter.name: scrollable
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if scroll arrows should be added

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_show_border
function.description: Sets whether a bevel will be drawn around the notebook pages. This only has a visual effect when the tabs are not shown. See gtk_notebook_set_show_tabs().

parameter.name: show_border
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if a bevel should be drawn around the notebook

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_show_tabs
function.description: Sets whether to show the tabs for the notebook or not.

parameter.name: show_tabs
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the tabs should be shown

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_tab_detachable
function.description:
Sets whether the tab can be detached from @notebook to another notebook or widget.
Note that 2 notebooks must share a common group identificator (see gtk_notebook_set_group_name()) to allow automatic tabs interchange between them.
If you want a widget to interact with a notebook through DnD (i.e.: accept dragged tabs from it) it must be set as a drop destination and accept the target "GTK_NOTEBOOK_TAB". The notebook will fill the selection with a GtkWidget** pointing to the child widget that corresponds to the dropped tab. |[ static void on_drop_zone_drag_data_received (GtkWidget *widget, GdkDragContext *context, gint x, gint y, GtkSelectionData *selection_data, guint info, guint time, gpointer user_data) { GtkWidget *notebook; GtkWidget **child;
notebook = gtk_drag_get_source_widget (context); child = (void*) gtk_selection_data_get_data (selection_data);
process_widget (*child); gtk_container_remove (GTK_CONTAINER (notebook), *child); } ]|
If you want a notebook to accept drags from other widgets, you will have to set your own DnD code to do it.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: detachable
parameter.parameter_description: whether the tab is detachable or not

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_tab_label
function.description: Changes the tab label for @child. If %NULL is specified for @tab_label, then the page will have the label 'page N'.

parameter.name: tab_label
parameter.parameter_description: the tab label widget to use, or %NULL for default tab label

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_tab_label_text
function.description: Creates a new label and sets it as the tab label for the page containing @child.

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_tab_pos
function.description: Sets the edge at which the tabs for switching pages in the notebook are drawn.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.parameter_description: the edge to draw the tabs at

function.name: gtk_notebook_set_tab_reorderable
function.description:
Sets whether the notebook tab can be reordered via drag and drop or not.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: reorderable
parameter.parameter_description: whether the tab is reorderable or not

function.name: gtk_numerable_icon_get_background_gicon
function.description:
Returns the #GIcon that was set as the base background image, or %NULL if there's none. The caller of this function does not own a reference to the returned #GIcon.
Since: 3.0
function.return: a #GIcon, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_numerable_icon_get_background_icon_name
function.description:
Returns the icon name used as the base background image, or %NULL if there's none.
Since: 3.0
function.return: an icon name, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_numerable_icon_get_count
function.description:
Returns the value currently displayed by @self.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the currently displayed value

function.name: gtk_numerable_icon_get_label
function.description:
Returns the currently displayed label of the icon, or %NULL.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the currently displayed label

function.name: gtk_numerable_icon_get_style_context
function.description:
Returns the #GtkStyleContext used by the icon for theming, or %NULL if there's none.
Since: 3.0
function.return: a #GtkStyleContext, or %NULL. This object is internal to GTK+ and should not be unreffed. Use g_object_ref() if you want to keep it around

function.name: gtk_numerable_icon_new
function.description:
Creates a new unthemed #GtkNumerableIcon.
Since: 3.0
function.return: a new #GIcon

function.name: gtk_numerable_icon_new_with_style_context
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkNumerableIcon which will themed according to the passed #GtkStyleContext. This is a convenience constructor that calls gtk_numerable_icon_set_style_context() internally.
Since: 3.0
function.return: a new #GIcon

function.name: gtk_numerable_icon_set_background_gicon
function.description:
Updates the icon to use @icon as the base background image. If @icon is %NULL, @self will go back using style information or default theming for its background image.
If this method is called and an icon name was already set as background for the icon, @icon will be used, i.e. the last method called between gtk_numerable_icon_set_background_gicon() and gtk_numerable_icon_set_background_icon_name() has always priority.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_numerable_icon_set_background_icon_name
function.description:
Updates the icon to use the icon named @icon_name from the current icon theme as the base background image. If @icon_name is %NULL, @self will go back using style information or default theming for its background image.
If this method is called and a #GIcon was already set as background for the icon, @icon_name will be used, i.e. the last method called between gtk_numerable_icon_set_background_icon_name() and gtk_numerable_icon_set_background_gicon() has always priority.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_numerable_icon_set_count
function.description:
Sets the currently displayed value of @self to @count.
The numeric value is always clamped to make it two digits, i.e. between -99 and 99. Setting a count of zero removes the emblem. If this method is called, and a label was already set on the icon, it will automatically be reset to %NULL before rendering the number, i.e. the last method called between gtk_numerable_icon_set_count() and gtk_numerable_icon_set_label() has always priority.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_numerable_icon_set_label
function.description:
Sets the currently displayed value of @self to the string in @label. Setting an empty label removes the emblem.
Note that this is meant for displaying short labels, such as roman numbers, or single letters. For roman numbers, consider using the Unicode characters U+2160 - U+217F. Strings longer than two characters will likely not be rendered very well.
If this method is called, and a number was already set on the icon, it will automatically be reset to zero before rendering the label, i.e. the last method called between gtk_numerable_icon_set_label() and gtk_numerable_icon_set_count() has always priority.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_numerable_icon_set_style_context
function.description:
Updates the icon to fetch theme information from the given #GtkStyleContext.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_offscreen_window_get_pixbuf
function.description:
Retrieves a snapshot of the contained widget in the form of a #GdkPixbuf. This is a new pixbuf with a reference count of 1, and the application should unreference it once it is no longer needed.
Since: 2.20
function.return: A #GdkPixbuf pointer, or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_offscreen_window_get_surface
function.description:
Retrieves a snapshot of the contained widget in the form of a #cairo_surface_t. If you need to keep this around over window resizes then you should add a reference to it.
Since: 2.20
function.return: A #cairo_surface_t pointer to the offscreen surface, or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_offscreen_window_new
function.description:
Creates a toplevel container widget that is used to retrieve snapshots of widgets without showing them on the screen.
Since: 2.20
function.return: A pointer to a #GtkWidget

function.name: gtk_orientable_get_orientation
function.description:

Since: 2.16

function.name: gtk_overlay_add_overlay
function.description:
Adds @widget to @overlay.
The widget will be stacked on top of the main widget added with gtk_container_add().
The position at which @widget is placed is determined from its #GtkWidget:halign and #GtkWidget:valign properties.
Since: 3.2

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkWidget to be added to the container

function.name: gtk_overlay_new

function.return: a new #GtkOverlay object.

function.name: gtk_paint_expander
function.description:
Draws an expander as used in #GtkTreeView. @x and @y specify the center the expander. The size of the expander is determined by the "expander-size" style property of @widget. (If widget is not specified or doesn't have an "expander-size" property, an unspecified default size will be used, since the caller doesn't have sufficient information to position the expander, this is likely not useful.) The expander is expander_size pixels tall in the collapsed position and expander_size pixels wide in the expanded position.
Deprecated:3.0: Use gtk_render_expander() instead

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: the x position to draw the expander at

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: the y position to draw the expander at

parameter.name: expander_style
parameter.parameter_description: the style to draw the expander in; determines whether the expander is collapsed, expanded, or in an intermediate state.

function.name: gtk_paned_add1
function.description: Adds a child to the top or left pane with default parameters. This is equivalent to <literal>gtk_paned_pack1 (paned, child, FALSE, TRUE)</literal>.

function.name: gtk_paned_add2
function.description: Adds a child to the bottom or right pane with default parameters. This is equivalent to <literal>gtk_paned_pack2 (paned, child, TRUE, TRUE)</literal>.

function.name: gtk_paned_get_child1
function.description:
Obtains the first child of the paned widget.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_paned_get_child2

Obtains the second child of the paned widget.
Since: 2.4
function.return: second child, or %NULL if it is not set.

function.name: gtk_paned_get_handle_window
function.description:
Returns the #GdkWindow of the handle. This function is useful when handling button or motion events because it enables the callback to distinguish between the window of the paned, a child and the handle.
Since: 2.20
function.return: the paned's handle window.

function.name: gtk_parse_args
function.description:
Parses command line arguments, and initializes global attributes of GTK+, but does not actually open a connection to a display. (See gdk_display_open(), gdk_get_display_arg_name())
Any arguments used by GTK+ or GDK are removed from the array and @argc and @argv are updated accordingly.
There is no need to call this function explicitely if you are using gtk_init(), or gtk_init_check().

parameter.name: argc
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the number of command line arguments

parameter.name: argv
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to the array of command line arguments

function.return: %TRUE if initialization succeeded, otherwise %FALSE

function.name: gtk_places_sidebar_add_shortcut
function.description:
Applications may want to present some folders in the places sidebar if they could be immediately useful to users. For example, a drawing program could add a "/usr/share/clipart" location when the sidebar is being used in an "Insert Clipart" dialog box.
This function adds the specified @location to a special place for immutable shortcuts. The shortcuts are application-specific; they are not shared across applications, and they are not persistent. If this function is called multiple times with different locations, then they are added to the sidebar's list in the same order as the function is called.
Since: 3.10

parameter.name: location
parameter.parameter_description: location to add as an application-specific shortcut

function.name: gtk_places_sidebar_get_location
function.description:
Gets the currently-selected location in the @sidebar. This can be #NULL when nothing is selected, for example, when gtk_places_sidebar_set_location() has been called with a location that is not among the sidebar's list of places to show.
You can use this function to get the selection in the @sidebar. Also, if you connect to the #GtkPlacesSidebar::popup-menu signal, you can use this function to get the location that is being referred to during the callbacks for your menu items.
Since: 3.10
function.return: a GFile with the selected location, or #NULL if nothing is visually selected.

function.name: gtk_places_sidebar_get_nth_bookmark
function.description:
This function queries the bookmarks added by the user to the places sidebar, and returns one of them. This function is used by #GtkFileChooser to implement the "Alt-1", "Alt-2", etc. shortcuts, which activate the cooresponding bookmark.
Since: 3.10

parameter.name: n
parameter.parameter_description: index of the bookmark to query

function.return: The bookmark specified by the index @n, or #NULL if no such index exist. Note that the indices start at 0, even though the file chooser starts them with the keyboard shortcut "Alt-1".

function.name: gtk_places_sidebar_get_show_connect_to_server
function.description:
Returns the value previously set with gtk_places_sidebar_set_show_connect_to_server()
Since: 3.10
function.return: %TRUE if the sidebar will display a "Connect to Server" item.

function.name: gtk_places_sidebar_get_show_desktop
function.description:
Returns the value previously set with gtk_places_sidebar_set_show_desktop()
Since: 3.10
function.return: %TRUE if the sidebar will display a builtin shortcut to the desktop folder.

function.name: gtk_places_sidebar_list_shortcuts
function.description: Since: 3.10

function.name: gtk_places_sidebar_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkPlacesSidebar widget. The application should connect to at least the #GtkPlacesSidebar::open-location signal to be notified when the user makes a selection in the sidebar.

function.name: gtk_places_sidebar_remove_shortcut
function.description:
Removes an application-specific shortcut that has been previously been inserted with gtk_places_sidebar_add_shortcut(). If the @location is not a shortcut in the sidebar, then nothing is done.
Since: 3.10

function.name: gtk_places_sidebar_set_location

parameter.name: location
parameter.parameter_description: location to select, or #NULL for no current path

function.name: gtk_places_sidebar_set_open_flags
function.description:
Sets the way in which the calling application can open new locations from the places sidebar. For example, some applications only open locations "directly" into their main view, while others may support opening locations in a new notebook tab or a new window.
This function is used to tell the places @sidebar about the ways in which the application can open new locations, so that the sidebar can display (or not) the "Open in new tab" and "Open in new window" menu items as appropriate.
When the #GtkPlacesSidebar::open-location signal is emitted, its flags argument will be set to one of the @flags that was passed in gtk_places_sidebar_set_open_flags().
Passing 0 for @flags will cause #GTK_PLACES_OPEN_NORMAL to always be sent to callbacks for the "open-location" signal.
Since: 3.10

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: Bitmask of modes in which the calling application can open locations

function.name: gtk_places_sidebar_set_show_connect_to_server
function.description:
Sets whether the @sidebar should show an item for connecting to a network server; this is off by default. An application may want to turn this on if it implements a way for the user to connect to network servers directly.
Since: 3.10

parameter.name: show_connect_to_server
parameter.parameter_description: whether to show an item for the Connect to Server command

function.name: gtk_places_sidebar_set_show_desktop
function.description:
Sets whether the @sidebar should show an item for the Desktop folder; this is off by default. An application may want to turn this on if the desktop environment actually supports the notion of a desktop.
Since: 3.10

parameter.name: show_desktop
parameter.parameter_description: whether to show an item for the Desktop folder

function.name: gtk_plug_construct
function.description: Finish the initialization of @plug for a given #GtkSocket identified by @socket_id. This function will generally only be used by classes deriving from #GtkPlug.

parameter.name: socket_id
parameter.parameter_description: the XID of the socket's window.

function.name: gtk_plug_construct_for_display
function.description:
Finish the initialization of @plug for a given #GtkSocket identified by @socket_id which is currently displayed on @display. This function will generally only be used by classes deriving from #GtkPlug.
Since: 2.2

parameter.name: socket_id
parameter.parameter_description: the XID of the socket's window.

function.name: gtk_plug_focus_first_last
function.description: Called from the GtkPlug backend when the corresponding socket has told the plug that it has received the focus.

function.name: gtk_plug_get_embedded
function.description:
Determines whether the plug is embedded in a socket.
Since: 2.14
function.return: %TRUE if the plug is embedded in a socket

function.name: gtk_plug_get_id
function.description: Gets the window ID of a #GtkPlug widget, which can then be used to embed this window inside another window, for instance with gtk_socket_add_id().
function.return: the window ID for the plug

function.name: gtk_plug_get_socket_window
function.description:
Retrieves the socket the plug is embedded in.
Since: 2.14
function.return: the window of the socket, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_plug_handle_modality_off
function.description: Called from the GtkPlug backend when the corresponding socket has told the plug that it modality has toggled off.

function.name: gtk_plug_handle_modality_on
function.description: Called from the GtkPlug backend when the corresponding socket has told the plug that it modality has toggled on.

function.name: gtk_plug_new
function.description: Creates a new plug widget inside the #GtkSocket identified by @socket_id. If @socket_id is 0, the plug is left "unplugged" and can later be plugged into a #GtkSocket by gtk_socket_add_id().

parameter.name: socket_id
parameter.parameter_description: the window ID of the socket, or 0.

function.return: the new #GtkPlug widget.

function.name: gtk_plug_new_for_display
function.description:
Create a new plug widget inside the #GtkSocket identified by socket_id.
Since: 2.2

parameter.name: socket_id
parameter.parameter_description: the XID of the socket's window.

function.return: the new #GtkPlug widget.

function.name: gtk_print_backend_get_printer_list
function.description: Returns the current list of printers.
function.return: A list of #GtkPrinter objects. The list should be freed with g_list_free().

function.name: gtk_print_context_create_pango_context
function.description:
Creates a new #PangoContext that can be used with the #GtkPrintContext.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a new Pango context for @context

function.name: gtk_print_context_create_pango_layout
function.description:
Creates a new #PangoLayout that is suitable for use with the #GtkPrintContext.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a new Pango layout for @context

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_cairo_context
function.description:
Obtains the cairo context that is associated with the #GtkPrintContext.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the cairo context of @context

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_dpi_x
function.description:
Obtains the horizontal resolution of the #GtkPrintContext, in dots per inch.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the horizontal resolution of @context

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_dpi_y
function.description:
Obtains the vertical resolution of the #GtkPrintContext, in dots per inch.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the vertical resolution of @context

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_hard_margins
function.description:
Obtains the hardware printer margins of the #GtkPrintContext, in units.
Since: 2.20
function.return: %TRUE if the hard margins were retrieved

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_height
function.description:
Obtains the height of the #GtkPrintContext, in pixels.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the height of @context

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_page_setup
function.description:
Obtains the #GtkPageSetup that determines the page dimensions of the #GtkPrintContext.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the page setup of @context

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_pango_fontmap
function.description:
Returns a #PangoFontMap that is suitable for use with the #GtkPrintContext.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the font map of @context

function.name: gtk_print_context_get_width
function.description:
Obtains the width of the #GtkPrintContext, in pixels.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the width of @context

function.name: gtk_print_context_set_cairo_context
function.description:
Sets a new cairo context on a print context.
This function is intended to be used when implementing an internal print preview, it is not needed for printing, since GTK+ itself creates a suitable cairo context in that case.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: dpi_x
parameter.parameter_description: the horizontal resolution to use with @cr

parameter.name: dpi_y
parameter.parameter_description: the vertical resolution to use with @cr

function.name: gtk_print_context_set_hard_margins
function.description: set the hard margins in pixel coordinates

function.name: gtk_print_error_quark
function.description:
Registers an error quark for #GtkPrintOperation if necessary.
Since: 2.10
function.return: The error quark used for #GtkPrintOperation errors.

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_collate
function.description:
Gets whether this job is printed collated.
Since: 3.0
function.return: whether the job is printed collated

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_n_up
function.description:
Gets the n-up setting for this job.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the n-up setting

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_n_up_layout
function.description:
Gets the n-up layout setting for this job.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the n-up layout

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_num_copies
function.description:
Gets the number of copies of this job.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the number of copies

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_page_ranges
function.description:
Gets the page ranges for this job.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: n_ranges
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the number of ranges

function.return: a pointer to an array of #GtkPageRange structs

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_page_set
function.description:
Gets the #GtkPageSet setting for this job.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the #GtkPageSet setting

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_pages
function.description:
Gets the #GtkPrintPages setting for this job.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the #GtkPrintPages setting

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_printer
function.description:
Gets the #GtkPrinter of the print job.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the printer of @job

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_reverse
function.description:
Gets whether this job is printed reversed.
Since: 3.0
function.return: whether the job is printed reversed.

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_rotate
function.description:
Gets whether the job is printed rotated.
Since: 3.0
function.return: whether the job is printed rotated

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_scale
function.description:
Gets the scale for this job (where 1.0 means unscaled).
Since: 3.0
function.return: the scale

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_settings
function.description:
Gets the #GtkPrintSettings of the print job.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the settings of @job

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_status
function.description:
Gets the status of the print job.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the status of @job

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_surface
function.description:
Gets a cairo surface onto which the pages of the print job should be rendered.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the cairo surface of @job

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_title
function.description:
Gets the job title.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the title of @job

function.name: gtk_print_job_get_track_print_status
function.description:
Returns wheter jobs will be tracked after printing. For details, see gtk_print_job_set_track_print_status().
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if print job status will be reported after printing

function.name: gtk_print_job_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkPrintJob.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a new #GtkPrintJob

function.name: gtk_print_job_send
function.description:
Sends the print job off to the printer.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: function to call when the job completes or an error occurs

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data that gets passed to @callback

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_collate
function.description:
Sets whether this job is printed collated.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: collate
parameter.parameter_description: whether the job is printed collated

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_n_up
function.description:
Sets the n-up setting for this job.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_n_up_layout
function.description:
Sets the n-up layout setting for this job.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_num_copies
function.description:
Sets the number of copies for this job.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_page_ranges
function.description:
Sets the page ranges for this job.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: ranges
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to an array of #GtkPageRange structs

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_page_set
function.description:
Sets the #GtkPageSet setting for this job.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_pages
function.description:
Sets the #GtkPrintPages setting for this job.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_reverse
function.description:
Sets whether this job is printed reversed.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: reverse
parameter.parameter_description: whether the job is printed reversed

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_rotate
function.description:
Sets whether this job is printed rotated.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_scale
function.description:
Sets the scale for this job (where 1.0 means unscaled).
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_source_file
function.description:
Make the #GtkPrintJob send an existing document to the printing system. The file can be in any format understood by the platforms printing system (typically PostScript, but on many platforms PDF may work too). See gtk_printer_accepts_pdf() and gtk_printer_accepts_ps().
Since: 2.10
function.return: %FALSE if an error occurred

function.name: gtk_print_job_set_track_print_status
function.description:
If track_status is %TRUE, the print job will try to continue report on the status of the print job in the printer queues and printer. This can allow your application to show things like "out of paper" issues, and when the print job actually reaches the printer.
This function is often implemented using some form of polling, so it should not be enabled unless needed.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_print_operation_cancel
function.description:
Cancels a running print operation. This function may be called from a #GtkPrintOperation::begin-print, #GtkPrintOperation::paginate or #GtkPrintOperation::draw-page signal handler to stop the currently running print operation.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_print_operation_draw_page_finish
function.description:
Signalize that drawing of particular page is complete.
It is called after completion of page drawing (e.g. drawing in another thread). If gtk_print_operation_set_defer_drawing() was called before, then this function has to be called by application. In another case it is called by the library itself.
Since: 2.16

function.name: gtk_print_operation_get_default_page_setup
function.description:
Returns the default page setup, see gtk_print_operation_set_default_page_setup().
Since: 2.10
function.return: the default page setup

function.name: gtk_print_operation_get_embed_page_setup
function.description:
Gets the value of #GtkPrintOperation:embed-page-setup property.
Since: 2.18
function.return: whether page setup selection combos are embedded

function.name: gtk_print_operation_get_error
function.description:
Call this when the result of a print operation is %GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_RESULT_ERROR, either as returned by gtk_print_operation_run(), or in the #GtkPrintOperation::done signal handler. The returned #GError will contain more details on what went wrong.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_print_operation_get_has_selection
function.description:
Gets the value of #GtkPrintOperation:has-selection property.
Since: 2.18
function.return: whether there is a selection

function.name: gtk_print_operation_get_n_pages_to_print
function.description:
Returns the number of pages that will be printed.
Note that this value is set during print preparation phase (%GTK_PRINT_STATUS_PREPARING), so this function should never be called before the data generation phase (%GTK_PRINT_STATUS_GENERATING_DATA). You can connect to the #GtkPrintOperation::status-changed signal and call gtk_print_operation_get_n_pages_to_print() when print status is %GTK_PRINT_STATUS_GENERATING_DATA. This is typically used to track the progress of print operation.
Since: 2.18
function.return: the number of pages that will be printed

function.name: gtk_print_operation_get_print_settings
function.description:
Returns the current print settings.
Note that the return value is %NULL until either gtk_print_operation_set_print_settings() or gtk_print_operation_run() have been called.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the current print settings of @op.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_get_status
function.description:
Returns the status of the print operation. Also see gtk_print_operation_get_status_string().
Since: 2.10
function.return: the status of the print operation

function.name: gtk_print_operation_get_status_string
function.description:
Returns a string representation of the status of the print operation. The string is translated and suitable for displaying the print status e.g. in a #GtkStatusbar.
Use gtk_print_operation_get_status() to obtain a status value that is suitable for programmatic use.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a string representation of the status of the print operation

function.name: gtk_print_operation_get_support_selection
function.description:
Gets the value of #GtkPrintOperation:support-selection property.
Since: 2.18
function.return: whether the application supports print of selection

function.name: gtk_print_operation_is_finished
function.description:
A convenience function to find out if the print operation is finished, either successfully (%GTK_PRINT_STATUS_FINISHED) or unsuccessfully (%GTK_PRINT_STATUS_FINISHED_ABORTED).
Note: when you enable print status tracking the print operation can be in a non-finished state even after done has been called, as the operation status then tracks the print job status on the printer.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE, if the print operation is finished.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkPrintOperation.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a new #GtkPrintOperation

function.name: gtk_print_operation_preview_end_preview
function.description:
Ends a preview.
This function must be called to finish a custom print preview.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_print_operation_preview_is_selected
function.description:
Returns whether the given page is included in the set of pages that have been selected for printing.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if the page has been selected for printing

function.name: gtk_print_operation_preview_render_page
function.description:
Renders a page to the preview, using the print context that was passed to the #GtkPrintOperation::preview handler together with @preview.
A custom iprint preview should use this function in its ::expose handler to render the currently selected page.
Note that this function requires a suitable cairo context to be associated with the print context.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_print_operation_run
function.return: the result of the print operation. A return value of %GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_RESULT_APPLY indicates that the printing was completed successfully. In this case, it is a good idea to obtain the used print settings with gtk_print_operation_get_print_settings() and store them for reuse with the next print operation. A value of %GTK_PRINT_OPERATION_RESULT_IN_PROGRESS means the operation is running asynchronously, and will emit the #GtkPrintOperation::done signal when done.

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_allow_async
function.description:
Sets whether the gtk_print_operation_run() may return before the print operation is completed. Note that some platforms may not allow asynchronous operation.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_current_page
function.description:
Sets the current page.
If this is called before gtk_print_operation_run(), the user will be able to select to print only the current page.
Note that this only makes sense for pre-paginated documents.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_custom_tab_label
function.description:
Sets the label for the tab holding custom widgets.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: the label to use, or %NULL to use the default label

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_default_page_setup
function.description:
Makes @default_page_setup the default page setup for @op.
This page setup will be used by gtk_print_operation_run(), but it can be overridden on a per-page basis by connecting to the #GtkPrintOperation::request-page-setup signal.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_defer_drawing
function.description:
Sets up the #GtkPrintOperation to wait for calling of gtk_print_operation_draw_page_finish() from application. It can be used for drawing page in another thread.
This function must be called in the callback of "draw-page" signal.
Since: 2.16

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_embed_page_setup
function.description:
Embed page size combo box and orientation combo box into page setup page. Selected page setup is stored as default page setup in #GtkPrintOperation.
Since: 2.18

parameter.name: embed
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to embed page setup selection in the #GtkPrintUnixDialog

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_export_filename
function.description:
Sets up the #GtkPrintOperation to generate a file instead of showing the print dialog. The indended use of this function is for implementing "Export to PDF" actions. Currently, PDF is the only supported format.
"Print to PDF" support is independent of this and is done by letting the user pick the "Print to PDF" item from the list of printers in the print dialog.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: filename
parameter.parameter_description: the filename for the exported file

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_has_selection
function.description:
Sets whether there is a selection to print.
Application has to set number of pages to which the selection will draw by gtk_print_operation_set_n_pages() in a callback of #GtkPrintOperation::begin-print.
Since: 2.18

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_job_name
function.description:
Sets the name of the print job. The name is used to identify the job (e.g. in monitoring applications like eggcups).
If you don't set a job name, GTK+ picks a default one by numbering successive print jobs.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: job_name
parameter.parameter_description: a string that identifies the print job

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_n_pages
function.description:
Sets the number of pages in the document.
This <emphasis>must</emphasis> be set to a positive number before the rendering starts. It may be set in a #GtkPrintOperation::begin-print signal hander.
Note that the page numbers passed to the #GtkPrintOperation::request-page-setup and #GtkPrintOperation::draw-page signals are 0-based, i.e. if the user chooses to print all pages, the last ::draw-page signal will be for page @n_pages - 1.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_print_settings
function.description:
Sets the print settings for @op. This is typically used to re-establish print settings from a previous print operation, see gtk_print_operation_run().
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_show_progress
function.description:
If @show_progress is %TRUE, the print operation will show a progress dialog during the print operation.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_support_selection
function.description:
Sets whether selection is supported by #GtkPrintOperation.
Since: 2.18

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_track_print_status
function.description:
If track_status is %TRUE, the print operation will try to continue report on the status of the print job in the printer queues and printer. This can allow your application to show things like "out of paper" issues, and when the print job actually reaches the printer.
This function is often implemented using some form of polling, so it should not be enabled unless needed.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_unit
function.description:
Sets up the transformation for the cairo context obtained from #GtkPrintContext in such a way that distances are measured in units of @unit.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_print_operation_set_use_full_page
function.description:
If @full_page is %TRUE, the transformation for the cairo context obtained from #GtkPrintContext puts the origin at the top left corner of the page (which may not be the top left corner of the sheet, depending on page orientation and the number of pages per sheet). Otherwise, the origin is at the top left corner of the imageable area (i.e. inside the margins).
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: full_page
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to set up the #GtkPrintContext for the full page

function.name: gtk_print_run_page_setup_dialog
function.description:
Runs a page setup dialog, letting the user modify the values from @page_setup. If the user cancels the dialog, the returned #GtkPageSetup is identical to the passed in @page_setup, otherwise it contains the modifications done in the dialog.
Note that this function may use a recursive mainloop to show the page setup dialog. See gtk_print_run_page_setup_dialog_async() if this is a problem.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a new #GtkPageSetup

function.name: gtk_print_run_page_setup_dialog_async
function.description:
Runs a page setup dialog, letting the user modify the values from @page_setup.
In contrast to gtk_print_run_page_setup_dialog(), this function returns after showing the page setup dialog on platforms that support this, and calls @done_cb from a signal handler for the ::response signal of the dialog.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: done_cb
parameter.parameter_description: a function to call when the user saves the modified page setup

function.name: gtk_print_settings_copy
function.description:
Copies a #GtkPrintSettings object.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a newly allocated copy of @other

function.name: gtk_print_settings_foreach
function.description:
Calls @func for each key-value pair of @settings.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get
function.description:
Looks up the string value associated with @key.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the string value for @key

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_bool
function.description:
Returns the boolean represented by the value that is associated with @key.
The string "true" represents %TRUE, any other string %FALSE.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE, if @key maps to a true value.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_bool_with_default
function.description:
Returns the boolean represented by the value that is associated with @key, or @default_val if the value does not represent a boolean.
The string "true" represents %TRUE, the string "false" represents %FALSE.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the boolean value associated with @key

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_collate
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_COLLATE.
Since: 2.10
function.return: whether to collate the printed pages

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_default_source
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_DEFAULT_SOURCE.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the default source

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_dither
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_DITHER.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the dithering that is used

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_double
function.description:
Returns the double value associated with @key, or 0.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the double value of @key

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_double_with_default
function.description:
Returns the floating point number represented by the value that is associated with @key, or @default_val if the value does not represent a floating point number.
Floating point numbers are parsed with g_ascii_strtod().
Since: 2.10
function.return: the floating point number associated with @key

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_duplex
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_DUPLEX.
Since: 2.10
function.return: whether to print the output in duplex.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_finishings
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_FINISHINGS.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the finishings

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_int
function.description:
Returns the integer value of @key, or 0.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the integer value of @key

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_int_with_default
function.description:
Returns the value of @key, interpreted as an integer, or the default value.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the integer value of @key

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_length
function.description:
Returns the value associated with @key, interpreted as a length. The returned value is converted to @units.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: unit
parameter.parameter_description: the unit of the return value

function.return: the length value of @key, converted to @unit

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_media_type
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_MEDIA_TYPE.
The set of media types is defined in PWG 5101.1-2002 PWG. <!-- FIXME link here -->
Since: 2.10
function.return: the media type

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_n_copies
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_N_COPIES.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the number of copies to print

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_number_up
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_NUMBER_UP.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the number of pages per sheet

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_number_up_layout
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_NUMBER_UP_LAYOUT.
Since: 2.14
function.return: layout of page in number-up mode

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_orientation
function.description:
Get the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_ORIENTATION, converted to a #GtkPageOrientation.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the orientation

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_output_bin
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_OUTPUT_BIN.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the output bin

function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PAGE_RANGES.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: num_ranges
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the length of the returned array

function.return: an array of #GtkPageRange<!-- -->s. Use g_free() to free the array when it is no longer needed.

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_page_set
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PAGE_SET.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the set of pages to print

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_paper_height
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PAPER_HEIGHT, converted to @unit.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: unit
parameter.parameter_description: the unit for the return value

function.return: the paper height, in units of @unit

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_paper_size
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PAPER_FORMAT, converted to a #GtkPaperSize.

function.return: the paper size

parameter.name: unit
parameter.parameter_description: the unit for the return value

function.return: the paper width, in units of @unit
