function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PRINT_PAGES.
Since: 2.10
function.return: which pages to print

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_printer
function.description:
Convenience function to obtain the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PRINTER.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the printer name

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_printer_lpi
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_PRINTER_LPI.
Since: 2.16
function.return: the resolution in lpi (lines per inch)

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_quality
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_QUALITY.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the print quality

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_resolution
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_RESOLUTION.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the resolution in dpi

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_resolution_x
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_RESOLUTION_X.
Since: 2.16
function.return: the horizontal resolution in dpi

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_resolution_y
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_RESOLUTION_Y.
Since: 2.16
function.return: the vertical resolution in dpi

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_reverse
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_REVERSE.
Since: 2.10
function.return: whether to reverse the order of the printed pages

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_scale
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_SCALE.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the scale in percent

function.name: gtk_print_settings_get_use_color
function.description:
Gets the value of %GTK_PRINT_SETTINGS_USE_COLOR.
Since: 2.10
function.return: whether to use color

function.name: gtk_print_settings_has_key
function.description:
Returns %TRUE, if a value is associated with @key.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE, if @key has a value

function.name: gtk_print_settings_load_file
function.description:
Reads the print settings from @file_name. If the file could not be loaded then error is set to either a #GFileError or #GKeyFileError. See gtk_print_settings_to_file().
Since: 2.14

parameter.name: file_name
parameter.parameter_description: the filename to read the settings from

function.return: %TRUE on success

function.name: gtk_print_settings_load_key_file
function.description:
Reads the print settings from the group @group_name in @key_file. If the file could not be loaded then error is set to either a #GFileError or #GKeyFileError.
Since: 2.14

parameter.name: key_file
parameter.parameter_description: the #GKeyFile to retrieve the settings from

parameter.name: group_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the group to use, or %NULL to use the default "Print Settings"

function.return: %TRUE on success

function.name: gtk_print_settings_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkPrintSettings object.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a new #GtkPrintSettings object

function.name: gtk_print_settings_new_from_file
function.description:
Reads the print settings from @file_name. Returns a new #GtkPrintSettings object with the restored settings, or %NULL if an error occurred. If the file could not be loaded then error is set to either a #GFileError or #GKeyFileError. See gtk_print_settings_to_file().
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: file_name
parameter.parameter_description: the filename to read the settings from

function.return: the restored #GtkPrintSettings

function.name: gtk_print_settings_new_from_key_file
function.description:
Reads the print settings from the group @group_name in @key_file. Returns a new #GtkPrintSettings object with the restored settings, or %NULL if an error occurred. If the file could not be loaded then error is set to either a #GFileError or #GKeyFileError.
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: key_file
parameter.parameter_description: the #GKeyFile to retrieve the settings from

parameter.name: group_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the group to use, or %NULL to use the default "Print Settings"

function.return: the restored #GtkPrintSettings

function.name: gtk_print_settings_to_file
function.description:
This function saves the print settings from @settings to @file_name. If the file could not be loaded then error is set to either a #GFileError or #GKeyFileError.
Since: 2.12
function.return: %TRUE on success

function.name: gtk_print_settings_to_key_file
function.description:
This function adds the print settings from @settings to @key_file.
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: key_file
parameter.parameter_description: the #GKeyFile to save the print settings to

parameter.name: group_name
parameter.parameter_description: the group to add the settings to in @key_file, or %NULL to use the default "Print Settings"

function.name: gtk_print_settings_unset
function.description:
Removes any value associated with @key. This has the same effect as setting the value to %NULL.
Since: 2.10

function.description:
Adds a custom tab to the print dialog.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: the widget to put in the custom tab

parameter.name: tab_label
parameter.parameter_description: the widget to use as tab label

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_get_current_page
function.description:
Gets the current page of the #GtkPrintUnixDialog.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the current page of @dialog

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_get_embed_page_setup
function.description:
Gets the value of #GtkPrintUnixDialog:embed-page-setup property.
Since: 2.18
function.return: whether there is a selection

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_get_has_selection
function.description:
Gets the value of #GtkPrintUnixDialog:has-selection property.
Since: 2.18
function.return: whether there is a selection

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_get_manual_capabilities
function.description:
Gets the value of #GtkPrintUnixDialog:manual-capabilities property.
Since: 2.18
function.return: the printing capabilities

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_get_page_setup
function.description:
Gets the page setup that is used by the #GtkPrintUnixDialog.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the page setup of @dialog.

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_get_page_setup_set
function.description:
Gets the page setup that is used by the #GtkPrintUnixDialog.
Since: 2.18
function.return: whether a page setup was set by user.

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_get_selected_printer
function.description:
Gets the currently selected printer.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the currently selected printer

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_get_settings
function.description:
Gets a new #GtkPrintSettings object that represents the current values in the print dialog. Note that this creates a <emphasis>new object</emphasis>, and you need to unref it if don't want to keep it.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a new #GtkPrintSettings object with the values from @dialog

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_get_support_selection
function.description:
Gets the value of #GtkPrintUnixDialog:support-selection property.
Since: 2.18
function.return: whether the application supports print of selection

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkPrintUnixDialog.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: Transient parent of the dialog, or %NULL

function.return: a new #GtkPrintUnixDialog

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_set_current_page
function.description:
Sets the current page number. If @current_page is not -1, this enables the current page choice for the range of pages to print.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_set_embed_page_setup
function.description:
Embed page size combo box and orientation combo box into page setup page.
Since: 2.18

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_set_has_selection
function.description:
Sets whether a selection exists.
Since: 2.18

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_set_manual_capabilities
function.description:
This lets you specify the printing capabilities your application supports. For instance, if you can handle scaling the output then you pass #GTK_PRINT_CAPABILITY_SCALE. If you don't pass that, then the dialog will only let you select the scale if the printing system automatically handles scaling.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: capabilities
parameter.parameter_description: the printing capabilities of your application

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_set_page_setup
function.description:
Sets the page setup of the #GtkPrintUnixDialog.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_set_settings
function.description:
Sets the #GtkPrintSettings for the #GtkPrintUnixDialog. Typically, this is used to restore saved print settings from a previous print operation before the print dialog is shown.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_print_unix_dialog_set_support_selection
function.description:
Sets whether the print dialog allows user to print a selection.
Since: 2.18

function.name: gtk_printer_accepts_pdf
function.description:
Returns whether the printer accepts input in PDF format.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if @printer accepts PDF

function.name: gtk_printer_accepts_ps
function.description:
Returns whether the printer accepts input in PostScript format.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if @printer accepts PostScript

function.name: gtk_printer_compare
function.description:
Compares two printers.
Since: 2.10
function.return: 0 if the printer match, a negative value if @a < @b, or a positive value if @a > @b

function.name: gtk_printer_get_backend
function.description:
Returns the backend of the printer.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the backend of @printer

function.name: gtk_printer_get_capabilities
function.description:
Returns the printer's capabilities.
This is useful when you're using #GtkPrintUnixDialog's manual-capabilities setting and need to know which settings the printer can handle and which you must handle yourself.
This will return 0 unless the printer's details are available, see gtk_printer_has_details() and gtk_printer_request_details().
Since: 2.12
function.return: the printer's capabilities

function.name: gtk_printer_get_default_page_size
function.description:
Returns default page size of @printer.
Since: 2.14
function.return: a newly allocated #GtkPageSetup with default page size of the printer.

function.name: gtk_printer_get_description
function.description:
Gets the description of the printer.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the description of @printer

function.name: gtk_printer_get_hard_margins
function.description:
Retrieve the hard margins of @printer, i.e. the margins that define the area at the borders of the paper that the printer cannot print to.
Note: This will not succeed unless the printer's details are available, see gtk_printer_has_details() and gtk_printer_request_details().
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: top
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the top margin in

parameter.name: bottom
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the bottom margin in

parameter.name: left
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the left margin in

parameter.name: right
parameter.parameter_description: a location to store the right margin in

function.return: %TRUE iff the hard margins were retrieved

function.name: gtk_printer_get_icon_name
function.description:
Gets the name of the icon to use for the printer.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the icon name for @printer

function.name: gtk_printer_get_job_count
function.description:
Gets the number of jobs currently queued on the printer.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the number of jobs on @printer

function.name: gtk_printer_get_location
function.description:
Returns a description of the location of the printer.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the location of @printer

function.name: gtk_printer_get_name
function.description:
Returns the name of the printer.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the name of @printer

function.name: gtk_printer_get_state_message
function.description:
Returns the state message describing the current state of the printer.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the state message of @printer

function.name: gtk_printer_has_details
function.description:
Returns whether the printer details are available.
Since: 2.12
function.return: %TRUE if @printer details are available

function.name: gtk_printer_is_accepting_jobs
function.description:
Returns whether the printer is accepting jobs
Since: 2.14
function.return: %TRUE if @printer is accepting jobs

function.name: gtk_printer_is_active
function.description:
Returns whether the printer is currently active (i.e. accepts new jobs).
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if @printer is active

function.name: gtk_printer_is_default
function.description:
Returns whether the printer is the default printer.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if @printer is the default

function.name: gtk_printer_is_paused
function.description:
Returns whether the printer is currently paused. A paused printer still accepts jobs, but it is not printing them.
Since: 2.14
function.return: %TRUE if @printer is paused

function.name: gtk_printer_is_virtual
function.description:
Returns whether the printer is virtual (i.e. does not represent actual printer hardware, but something like a CUPS class).
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if @printer is virtual

function.name: gtk_printer_list_papers
function.description:
Lists all the paper sizes @printer supports. This will return and empty list unless the printer's details are available, see gtk_printer_has_details() and gtk_printer_request_details().
Since: 2.12
function.return: a newly allocated list of newly allocated #GtkPageSetup s.

function.name: gtk_printer_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkPrinter.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a new #GtkPrinter

function.name: gtk_printer_request_details
function.description:
Requests the printer details. When the details are available, the #GtkPrinter::details-acquired signal will be emitted on @printer.
Since: 2.12

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_get_ellipsize
function.description:
Returns the ellipsizing position of the progress bar. See gtk_progress_bar_set_ellipsize().
Since: 2.6
function.return: #PangoEllipsizeMode

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_get_fraction
function.description: Returns the current fraction of the task that's been completed.
function.return: a fraction from 0.0 to 1.0

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_get_inverted
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_progress_bar_set_inverted().
function.return: %TRUE if the progress bar is inverted

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_get_pulse_step
function.description: Retrieves the pulse step set with gtk_progress_bar_set_pulse_step().
function.return: a fraction from 0.0 to 1.0

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_get_show_text
function.description:
Gets the value of the #GtkProgressBar:show-text property. See gtk_progress_bar_set_show_text().
Since: 3.0
function.return: %TRUE if text is shown in the progress bar

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_get_text
function.description: Retrieves the text displayed superimposed on the progress bar, if any, otherwise %NULL. The return value is a reference to the text, not a copy of it, so will become invalid if you change the text in the progress bar.
function.return: text, or %NULL; this string is owned by the widget and should not be modified or freed.

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkProgressBar.
function.return: a #GtkProgressBar.

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_pulse
function.description: Indicates that some progress has been made, but you don't know how much. Causes the progress bar to enter "activity mode," where a block bounces back and forth. Each call to gtk_progress_bar_pulse() causes the block to move by a little bit (the amount of movement per pulse is determined by gtk_progress_bar_set_pulse_step()).

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_set_ellipsize
function.description:
Sets the mode used to ellipsize (add an ellipsis: "...") the text if there is not enough space to render the entire string.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_set_fraction
function.description: Causes the progress bar to "fill in" the given fraction of the bar. The fraction should be between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive.

parameter.name: fraction
parameter.parameter_description: fraction of the task that's been completed

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_set_inverted
function.description: Progress bars normally grow from top to bottom or left to right. Inverted progress bars grow in the opposite direction.

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_set_pulse_step
function.description: Sets the fraction of total progress bar length to move the bouncing block for each call to gtk_progress_bar_pulse().

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_set_show_text
function.description:
Sets whether the progress bar will show text superimposed over the bar. The shown text is either the value of the #GtkProgressBar:text property or, if that is %NULL, the #GtkProgressBar:fraction value, as a percentage.
To make a progress bar that is styled and sized suitably for containing text (even if the actual text is blank), set #GtkProgressBar:show-text to %TRUE and #GtkProgressBar:text to the empty string (not %NULL).
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_progress_bar_set_text
function.description:
Causes the given @text to appear superimposed on the progress bar.
If @text is %NULL and #GtkProgressBar:show-text is %TRUE, the current value of #GtkProgressBar:fraction will be displayed as a percentage.
If @text is non-%NULL and #GtkProgressBar:show-text is %TRUE, the text will be displayed. In this case, it will not display the progress percentage. If @text is the empty string, the progress bar will still be styled and sized suitably for containing text, as long as #GtkProgressBar:show-text is %TRUE.

function.name: gtk_propagate_event
function.description:
Sends an event to a widget, propagating the event to parent widgets if the event remains unhandled.
Events received by GTK+ from GDK normally begin in gtk_main_do_event(). Depending on the type of event, existence of modal dialogs, grabs, etc., the event may be propagated; if so, this function is used.
gtk_propagate_event() calls gtk_widget_event() on each widget it decides to send the event to. So gtk_widget_event() is the lowest-level function; it simply emits the #GtkWidget::event and possibly an event-specific signal on a widget. gtk_propagate_event() is a bit higher-level, and gtk_main_do_event() is the highest level.
All that said, you most likely don't want to use any of these functions; synthesizing events is rarely needed. There are almost certainly better ways to achieve your goals. For example, use gdk_window_invalidate_rect() or gtk_widget_queue_draw() instead of making up expose events.

function.name: gtk_radio_action_get_current_value

function.name: gtk_range_get_adjustment
function.description: Get the #GtkAdjustment which is the "model" object for #GtkRange. See gtk_range_set_adjustment() for details. The return value does not have a reference added, so should not be unreferenced.
function.return: a #GtkAdjustment

function.name: gtk_range_get_fill_level
function.description:
Gets the current position of the fill level indicator.
Since: 2.12
function.return: The current fill level

function.name: gtk_range_get_flippable
function.description:
Gets the value set by gtk_range_set_flippable().
Since: 2.18
function.return: %TRUE if the range is flippable

function.name: gtk_range_get_inverted
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_range_set_inverted().
function.return: %TRUE if the range is inverted

function.name: gtk_range_get_lower_stepper_sensitivity
function.description:
Gets the sensitivity policy for the stepper that points to the 'lower' end of the GtkRange's adjustment.
Since: 2.10
function.return: The lower stepper's sensitivity policy.

function.name: gtk_range_get_min_slider_size
function.description:
This function is useful mainly for #GtkRange subclasses.
See gtk_range_set_min_slider_size().
Since: 2.20
function.return: The minimum size of the range's slider.

function.name: gtk_range_get_range_rect
function.description:
This function returns the area that contains the range's trough and its steppers, in widget->window coordinates.
This function is useful mainly for #GtkRange subclasses.
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: range_rect
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the range rectangle

function.name: gtk_range_get_restrict_to_fill_level
function.description:
Gets whether the range is restricted to the fill level.
Since: 2.12
function.return: %TRUE if @range is restricted to the fill level.

function.name: gtk_range_get_round_digits
function.description:
Gets the number of digits to round the value to when it changes. See #GtkRange::change-value.
Since: 2.24
function.return: the number of digits to round to

function.name: gtk_range_get_show_fill_level
function.description:
Gets whether the range displays the fill level graphically.
Since: 2.12
function.return: %TRUE if @range shows the fill level.

function.name: gtk_range_get_slider_range
function.description:
This function returns sliders range along the long dimension, in widget->window coordinates.
This function is useful mainly for #GtkRange subclasses.
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: slider_start
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the slider's start, or %NULL

parameter.name: slider_end
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the slider's end, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_range_get_slider_size_fixed
function.description:
This function is useful mainly for #GtkRange subclasses.
See gtk_range_set_slider_size_fixed().
Since: 2.20
function.return: whether the range's slider has a fixed size.

function.name: gtk_range_get_upper_stepper_sensitivity
function.description:
Gets the sensitivity policy for the stepper that points to the 'upper' end of the GtkRange's adjustment.
Since: 2.10
function.return: The upper stepper's sensitivity policy.

function.name: gtk_range_get_value
function.description: Gets the current value of the range.
function.return: current value of the range.

function.name: gtk_range_set_adjustment
function.description: Sets the adjustment to be used as the "model" object for this range widget. The adjustment indicates the current range value, the minimum and maximum range values, the step/page increments used for keybindings and scrolling, and the page size. The page size is normally 0 for #GtkScale and nonzero for #GtkScrollbar, and indicates the size of the visible area of the widget being scrolled. The page size affects the size of the scrollbar slider.

function.name: gtk_range_set_fill_level
function.description:
Set the new position of the fill level indicator.
The "fill level" is probably best described by its most prominent use case, which is an indicator for the amount of pre-buffering in a streaming media player. In that use case, the value of the range would indicate the current play position, and the fill level would be the position up to which the file/stream has been downloaded.
This amount of prebuffering can be displayed on the range's trough and is themeable separately from the trough. To enable fill level display, use gtk_range_set_show_fill_level(). The range defaults to not showing the fill level.
Additionally, it's possible to restrict the range's slider position to values which are smaller than the fill level. This is controller by gtk_range_set_restrict_to_fill_level() and is by default enabled.
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: fill_level
parameter.parameter_description: the new position of the fill level indicator

function.name: gtk_range_set_flippable
function.description:
If a range is flippable, it will switch its direction if it is horizontal and its direction is %GTK_TEXT_DIR_RTL.
See gtk_widget_get_direction().
Since: 2.18

function.name: gtk_range_set_increments
function.description: Sets the step and page sizes for the range. The step size is used when the user clicks the #GtkScrollbar arrows or moves #GtkScale via arrow keys. The page size is used for example when moving via Page Up or Page Down keys.

function.name: gtk_range_set_inverted
function.description: Ranges normally move from lower to higher values as the slider moves from top to bottom or left to right. Inverted ranges have higher values at the top or on the right rather than on the bottom or left.

function.name: gtk_range_set_lower_stepper_sensitivity
function.description:
Sets the sensitivity policy for the stepper that points to the 'lower' end of the GtkRange's adjustment.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_range_set_min_slider_size
function.description:
Sets the minimum size of the range's slider.
This function is useful mainly for #GtkRange subclasses.
Since: 2.20

function.name: gtk_range_set_range
function.description: Sets the allowable values in the #GtkRange, and clamps the range value to be between @min and @max. (If the range has a non-zero page size, it is clamped between @min and @max - page-size.)

function.name: gtk_range_set_restrict_to_fill_level
function.description:
Sets whether the slider is restricted to the fill level. See gtk_range_set_fill_level() for a general description of the fill level concept.
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: restrict_to_fill_level
parameter.parameter_description: Whether the fill level restricts slider movement.

function.name: gtk_range_set_round_digits
function.description:
Sets the number of digits to round the value to when it changes. See #GtkRange::change-value.
Since: 2.24

function.name: gtk_range_set_show_fill_level
function.description:
Sets whether a graphical fill level is show on the trough. See gtk_range_set_fill_level() for a general description of the fill level concept.
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: show_fill_level
parameter.parameter_description: Whether a fill level indicator graphics is shown.

function.name: gtk_range_set_slider_size_fixed
function.description:
Sets whether the range's slider has a fixed size, or a size that depends on its adjustment's page size.
This function is useful mainly for #GtkRange subclasses.
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: size_fixed
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to make the slider size constant

function.name: gtk_range_set_upper_stepper_sensitivity
function.description:
Sets the sensitivity policy for the stepper that points to the 'upper' end of the GtkRange's adjustment.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_range_set_value
function.description: Sets the current value of the range; if the value is outside the minimum or maximum range values, it will be clamped to fit inside them. The range emits the #GtkRange::value-changed signal if the value changes.

function.name: gtk_rc_add_default_file
function.description:
Adds a file to the list of files to be parsed at the end of gtk_init().
Deprecated:3.0: Use #GtkStyleContext with a custom #GtkStyleProvider instead

parameter.parameter_description: the pathname to the file. If @filename is not absolute, it is searched in the current directory.

function.name: gtk_rc_find_module_in_path

Searches for a theme engine in the GTK+ search path. This function is not useful for applications and should not be used.
Deprecated: 3.0: Use #GtkCssProvider instead.
function.return: The filename, if found (must be freed with g_free()), otherwise %NULL.

function.name: gtk_rc_find_pixmap_in_path

Looks up a file in pixmap path for the specified #GtkSettings. If the file is not found, it outputs a warning message using g_warning() and returns %NULL.

parameter.parameter_description: Scanner used to get line number information for the warning message, or %NULL

parameter.name: pixmap_file
parameter.parameter_description: name of the pixmap file to locate.

function.return: the filename.

function.name: gtk_rc_get_default_files
function.description:
Retrieves the current list of RC files that will be parsed at the end of gtk_init().
Deprecated:3.0: Use #GtkStyleContext instead
function.return: A %NULL-terminated array of filenames. This memory is owned by GTK+ and must not be freed by the application. If you want to store this information, you should make a copy.

function.name: gtk_rc_get_im_module_file
function.description:
Obtains the path to the IM modules file. See the documentation of the <link linkend="im-module-file"><envar>GTK_IM_MODULE_FILE</envar></link> environment variable for more details.
Deprecated: 3.0: Use #GtkCssProvider instead.
function.return: a newly-allocated string containing the name of the file listing the IM modules available for loading

function.name: gtk_rc_get_im_module_path
function.description:
Obtains the path in which to look for IM modules. See the documentation of the <link linkend="im-module-path"><envar>GTK_PATH</envar></link> environment variable for more details about looking up modules. This function is useful solely for utilities supplied with GTK+ and should not be used by applications under normal circumstances.
Deprecated: 3.0: Use #GtkCssProvider instead.
function.return: a newly-allocated string containing the path in which to look for IM modules.

function.name: gtk_rc_get_module_dir
function.description:
Returns a directory in which GTK+ looks for theme engines. For full information about the search for theme engines, see the docs for <envar>GTK_PATH</envar> in <xref linkend="gtk-running"/>.
Deprecated: 3.0: Use #GtkCssProvider instead.
function.return: the directory. (Must be freed with g_free())

function.name: gtk_rc_get_style
function.description:
Finds all matching RC styles for a given widget, composites them together, and then creates a #GtkStyle representing the composite appearance. (GTK+ actually keeps a cache of previously created styles, so a new style may not be created.)
Deprecated:3.0: Use #GtkStyleContext instead
function.return: the resulting style. No refcount is added to the returned style, so if you want to save this style around, you should add a reference yourself.

function.name: gtk_rc_get_style_by_paths
function.description:
Creates up a #GtkStyle from styles defined in a RC file by providing the raw components used in matching. This function may be useful when creating pseudo-widgets that should be themed like widgets but don't actually have corresponding GTK+ widgets. An example of this would be items inside a GNOME canvas widget.
The action of gtk_rc_get_style() is similar to: |[ gtk_widget_path (widget, NULL, &path, NULL); gtk_widget_class_path (widget, NULL, &class_path, NULL); gtk_rc_get_style_by_paths (gtk_widget_get_settings (widget), path, class_path, G_OBJECT_TYPE (widget)); ]|
Deprecated:3.0: Use #GtkStyleContext instead

parameter.name: widget_path
parameter.parameter_description: the widget path to use when looking up the style, or %NULL if no matching against the widget path should be done

parameter.name: class_path
parameter.parameter_description: the class path to use when looking up the style, or %NULL if no matching against the class path should be done.

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: a type that will be used along with parent types of this type when matching against class styles, or #G_TYPE_NONE

function.return: A style created by matching with the supplied paths, or %NULL if nothing matching was specified and the default style should be used. The returned value is owned by GTK+ as part of an internal cache, so you must call g_object_ref() on the returned value if you want to keep a reference to it.

function.name: gtk_rc_get_theme_dir
function.description:
Returns the standard directory in which themes should be installed. (GTK+ does not actually use this directory itself.)
Deprecated: 3.0: Use #GtkCssProvider instead.
function.return: The directory (must be freed with g_free()).

function.description:
Parses a #GtkStateType variable from the format expected in a RC file.
Deprecated: 3.0: Use #GtkCssProvider instead

parameter.name: scanner
parameter.parameter_description: a #GScanner (must be initialized for parsing an RC file)

parameter.name: state
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to a #GtkStateType variable in which to store the result.

function.return: %G_TOKEN_NONE if parsing succeeded, otherwise the token that was expected but not found.

function.name: gtk_rc_parse_string
function.description:
Parses resource information directly from a string.
Deprecated: 3.0: Use #GtkCssProvider instead.

function.name: gtk_rc_property_parse_border
function.description: A #GtkRcPropertyParser for use with gtk_settings_install_property_parser() or gtk_widget_class_install_style_property_parser() which parses borders in the form <literal>"{ left, right, top, bottom }"</literal> for integers %left, %right, %top and %bottom.

parameter.name: property_value
parameter.parameter_description: a #GValue which must hold boxed values.

function.return: %TRUE if @gstring could be parsed and @property_value has been set to the resulting #GtkBorder.

function.name: gtk_rc_property_parse_color
function.description: A #GtkRcPropertyParser for use with gtk_settings_install_property_parser() or gtk_widget_class_install_style_property_parser() which parses a color given either by its name or in the form <literal>{ red, green, blue }</literal> where %red, %green and %blue are integers between 0 and 65535 or floating-point numbers between 0 and 1.
function.return: %TRUE if @gstring could be parsed and @property_value has been set to the resulting #GdkColor.

function.name: gtk_rc_property_parse_enum
function.description:
A #GtkRcPropertyParser for use with gtk_settings_install_property_parser() or gtk_widget_class_install_style_property_parser() which parses a single enumeration value.
The enumeration value can be specified by its name, its nickname or its numeric value. For consistency with flags parsing, the value may be surrounded by parentheses.

parameter.name: property_value
parameter.parameter_description: a #GValue which must hold enum values.

function.return: %TRUE if @gstring could be parsed and @property_value has been set to the resulting #GEnumValue.

function.name: gtk_rc_property_parse_flags
function.description:
A #GtkRcPropertyParser for use with gtk_settings_install_property_parser() or gtk_widget_class_install_style_property_parser() which parses flags.
Flags can be specified by their name, their nickname or numerically. Multiple flags can be specified in the form <literal>"( flag1 | flag2 | ... )"</literal>.

parameter.name: property_value
parameter.parameter_description: a #GValue which must hold flags values.

function.return: %TRUE if @gstring could be parsed and @property_value has been set to the resulting flags value.

function.name: gtk_rc_property_parse_requisition
function.description: A #GtkRcPropertyParser for use with gtk_settings_install_property_parser() or gtk_widget_class_install_style_property_parser() which parses a requisition in the form <literal>"{ width, height }"</literal> for integers %width and %height.

parameter.name: property_value
parameter.parameter_description: a #GValue which must hold boxed values.

function.return: %TRUE if @gstring could be parsed and @property_value has been set to the resulting #GtkRequisition.

function.name: gtk_rc_reparse_all
function.description:
If the modification time on any previously read file for the default #GtkSettings has changed, discard all style information and then reread all previously read RC files.
Deprecated: 3.0: Use #GtkCssProvider instead.
function.return: %TRUE if the files were reread.

function.name: gtk_rc_reparse_all_for_settings
function.description:
If the modification time on any previously read file for the given #GtkSettings has changed, discard all style information and then reread all previously read RC files.
Deprecated: 3.0: Use #GtkCssProvider instead.

parameter.name: force_load
parameter.parameter_description: load whether or not anything changed

function.return: %TRUE if the files were reread.

function.name: gtk_rc_reset_styles
function.description:
This function recomputes the styles for all widgets that use a particular #GtkSettings object. (There is one #GtkSettings object per #GdkScreen, see gtk_settings_get_for_screen()); It is useful when some global parameter has changed that affects the appearance of all widgets, because when a widget gets a new style, it will both redraw and recompute any cached information about its appearance. As an example, it is used when the default font size set by the operating system changes. Note that this function doesn't affect widgets that have a style set explicitely on them with gtk_widget_set_style().
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.0: Use #GtkCssProvider instead.

function.name: gtk_rc_scanner_new
function.description: Deprecated:3.0: Use #GtkCssProvider instead

function.name: gtk_rc_set_default_files
function.description:
Sets the list of files that GTK+ will read at the end of gtk_init().
Deprecated:3.0: Use #GtkStyleContext with a custom #GtkStyleProvider instead

function.name: gtk_rc_style_copy
function.description:
Makes a copy of the specified #GtkRcStyle. This function will correctly copy an RC style that is a member of a class derived from #GtkRcStyle.
Deprecated: 3.0: Use #GtkCssProvider instead.
function.return: the resulting #GtkRcStyle

function.name: gtk_rc_style_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkRcStyle with no fields set and a reference count of 1.
Deprecated: 3.0: Use #GtkCssProvider instead.
function.return: the newly-created #GtkRcStyle

function.name: gtk_recent_action_get_show_numbers
function.description:
Returns the value set by gtk_recent_chooser_menu_set_show_numbers().
Since: 2.12
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: %TRUE if numbers should be shown.

function.name: gtk_recent_action_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkRecentAction object. To add the action to a #GtkActionGroup and set the accelerator for the action, call gtk_action_group_add_action_with_accel().
Since: 2.12
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: a unique name for the action

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: the label displayed in menu items and on buttons, or %NULL

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.parameter_description: a tooltip for the action, or %NULL

parameter.name: stock_id
parameter.parameter_description: the stock icon to display in widgets representing the action, or %NULL

function.return: the newly created #GtkRecentAction.

function.name: gtk_recent_action_new_for_manager
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkRecentAction object. To add the action to a #GtkActionGroup and set the accelerator for the action, call gtk_action_group_add_action_with_accel().
Since: 2.12
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: a unique name for the action

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: the label displayed in menu items and on buttons, or %NULL

parameter.name: tooltip
parameter.parameter_description: a tooltip for the action, or %NULL

parameter.name: stock_id
parameter.parameter_description: the stock icon to display in widgets representing the action, or %NULL

parameter.name: manager
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkRecentManager, or %NULL for using the default #GtkRecentManager

function.return: the newly created #GtkRecentAction

function.name: gtk_recent_action_set_show_numbers
function.description:
Sets whether a number should be added to the items shown by the widgets representing @action. The numbers are shown to provide a unique character for a mnemonic to be used inside the menu item's label. Only the first ten items get a number to avoid clashes.
Since: 2.12
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: show_numbers
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the shown items should be numbered

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_add_filter
function.description:
Adds @filter to the list of #GtkRecentFilter objects held by @chooser.
If no previous filter objects were defined, this function will call gtk_recent_chooser_set_filter().
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_dialog_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkRecentChooserDialog. This function is analogous to gtk_dialog_new_with_buttons().
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: Transient parent of the dialog, or %NULL,

parameter.name: first_button_text
parameter.parameter_description: stock ID or text to go in the first button, or %NULL

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: response ID for the first button, then additional (button, id) pairs, ending with %NULL

function.return: a new #GtkRecentChooserDialog

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_dialog_new_for_manager
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkRecentChooserDialog with a specified recent manager.
This is useful if you have implemented your own recent manager, or if you have a customized instance of a #GtkRecentManager object.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: Transient parent of the dialog, or %NULL,

parameter.name: first_button_text
parameter.parameter_description: stock ID or text to go in the first button, or %NULL

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: response ID for the first button, then additional (button, id) pairs, ending with %NULL

function.return: a new #GtkRecentChooserDialog

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_get_current_item
function.description:
Gets the #GtkRecentInfo currently selected by @chooser.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a #GtkRecentInfo. Use gtk_recent_info_unref() when when you have finished using it.

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_get_current_uri
function.description:
Gets the URI currently selected by @chooser.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a newly allocated string holding a URI.

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_get_filter
function.description:
Gets the #GtkRecentFilter object currently used by @chooser to affect the display of the recently used resources.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a #GtkRecentFilter object.

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_get_items
function.description:
Gets the list of recently used resources in form of #GtkRecentInfo objects.
The return value of this function is affected by the "sort-type" and "limit" properties of @chooser.
Since: 2.10
function.return: A newly allocated list of #GtkRecentInfo objects. You should use gtk_recent_info_unref() on every item of the list, and then free the list itself using g_list_free().

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_get_limit
function.description:
Gets the number of items returned by gtk_recent_chooser_get_items() and gtk_recent_chooser_get_uris().
Since: 2.10
function.return: A positive integer, or -1 meaning that all items are returned.

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_get_local_only
function.description:
Gets whether only local resources should be shown in the recently used resources selector. See gtk_recent_chooser_set_local_only()
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if only local resources should be shown.

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_get_select_multiple
function.description:
Gets whether @chooser can select multiple items.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if @chooser can select more than one item.

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_get_show_icons
function.description:
Retrieves whether @chooser should show an icon near the resource.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if the icons should be displayed, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_get_show_not_found
function.description:
Retrieves whether @chooser should show the recently used resources that were not found.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if the resources not found should be displayed, and %FALSE otheriwse.

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_get_show_private
function.description:
Returns whether @chooser should display recently used resources registered as private.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if the recent chooser should show private items, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_get_show_tips
function.description:
Gets whether @chooser should display tooltips containing the full path of a recently user resource.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if the recent chooser should show tooltips, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_get_sort_type
function.description:
Gets the value set by gtk_recent_chooser_set_sort_type().
Since: 2.10
function.return: the sorting order of the @chooser.

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_get_uris
function.description:
Gets the URI of the recently used resources.
The return value of this function is affected by the "sort-type" and "limit" properties of @chooser.
Since the returned array is %NULL terminated, @length may be %NULL.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: return location for a the length of the URI list, or %NULL

function.return: A newly allocated, %NULL-terminated array of strings. Use g_strfreev() to free it.

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_list_filters
function.description:
Gets the #GtkRecentFilter objects held by @chooser.
Since: 2.10
function.return: A singly linked list of #GtkRecentFilter objects. You should just free the returned list using g_slist_free().

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_menu_get_show_numbers
function.description:
Returns the value set by gtk_recent_chooser_menu_set_show_numbers().
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if numbers should be shown.

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_menu_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkRecentChooserMenu widget.
This kind of widget shows the list of recently used resources as a menu, each item as a menu item. Each item inside the menu might have an icon, representing its MIME type, and a number, for mnemonic access.
This widget implements the #GtkRecentChooser interface.
This widget creates its own #GtkRecentManager object. See the gtk_recent_chooser_menu_new_for_manager() function to know how to create a #GtkRecentChooserMenu widget bound to another #GtkRecentManager object.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a new #GtkRecentChooserMenu

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_menu_new_for_manager
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkRecentChooserMenu widget using @manager as the underlying recently used resources manager.
This is useful if you have implemented your own recent manager, or if you have a customized instance of a #GtkRecentManager object or if you wish to share a common #GtkRecentManager object among multiple #GtkRecentChooser widgets.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a new #GtkRecentChooserMenu, bound to @manager.

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_menu_set_show_numbers
function.description:
Sets whether a number should be added to the items of @menu. The numbers are shown to provide a unique character for a mnemonic to be used inside ten menu item's label. Only the first the items get a number to avoid clashes.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_remove_filter
function.description:
Removes @filter from the list of #GtkRecentFilter objects held by @chooser.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_select_all
function.description:
Selects all the items inside @chooser, if the @chooser supports multiple selection.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_select_uri
function.description:
Selects @uri inside @chooser.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if @uri was found.

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_set_current_uri
function.description:
Sets @uri as the current URI for @chooser.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if the URI was found.

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_set_filter
function.description:
Sets @filter as the current #GtkRecentFilter object used by @chooser to affect the displayed recently used resources.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_set_limit
function.description:
Sets the number of items that should be returned by gtk_recent_chooser_get_items() and gtk_recent_chooser_get_uris().
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: limit
parameter.parameter_description: a positive integer, or -1 for all items

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_set_local_only
function.description:
Sets whether only local resources, that is resources using the file:// URI scheme, should be shown in the recently used resources selector. If @local_only is %TRUE (the default) then the shown resources are guaranteed to be accessible through the operating system native file system.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: local_only
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if only local files can be shown

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_set_select_multiple
function.description:
Sets whether @chooser can select multiple items.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: select_multiple
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if @chooser can select more than one item

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_set_show_icons
function.description:
Sets whether @chooser should show an icon near the resource when displaying it.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: show_icons
parameter.parameter_description: whether to show an icon near the resource

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_set_show_not_found
function.description:
Sets whether @chooser should display the recently used resources that it didn't find. This only applies to local resources.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: show_not_found
parameter.parameter_description: whether to show the local items we didn't find

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_set_show_private
function.description:
Whether to show recently used resources marked registered as private.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_set_show_tips
function.description:
Sets whether to show a tooltips containing the full path of each recently used resource in a #GtkRecentChooser widget.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_set_sort_func
function.description:
Sets the comparison function used when sorting to be @sort_func. If the @chooser has the sort type set to #GTK_RECENT_SORT_CUSTOM then the chooser will sort using this function.
To the comparison function will be passed two #GtkRecentInfo structs and @sort_data; @sort_func should return a positive integer if the first item comes before the second, zero if the two items are equal and a negative integer if the first item comes after the second.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: sort_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data to pass to @sort_func, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_set_sort_type

parameter.name: sort_type
parameter.parameter_description: sort order that the chooser should use

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_unselect_all
function.description:
Unselects all the items inside @chooser.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_unselect_uri
function.description:
Unselects @uri inside @chooser.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_widget_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkRecentChooserWidget object. This is an embeddable widget used to access the recently used resources list.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a new #GtkRecentChooserWidget

function.name: gtk_recent_chooser_widget_new_for_manager
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkRecentChooserWidget with a specified recent manager.
This is useful if you have implemented your own recent manager, or if you have a customized instance of a #GtkRecentManager object.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a new #GtkRecentChooserWidget

function.name: gtk_recent_filter_add_age
function.description:
Adds a rule that allows resources based on their age - that is, the number of days elapsed since they were last modified.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_recent_filter_add_application
function.description:
Adds a rule that allows resources based on the name of the application that has registered them.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_recent_filter_add_custom
function.description:
Adds a rule to a filter that allows resources based on a custom callback function. The bitfield @needed which is passed in provides information about what sorts of information that the filter function needs; this allows GTK+ to avoid retrieving expensive information when it isn't needed by the filter.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: needed
parameter.parameter_description: bitfield of flags indicating the information that the custom filter function needs.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: callback function; if the function returns %TRUE, then the file will be displayed.

parameter.name: data_destroy
parameter.parameter_description: function to call to free @data when it is no longer needed.

function.name: gtk_recent_filter_add_group
function.description:
Adds a rule that allows resources based on the name of the group to which they belong
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_recent_filter_add_mime_type
function.description:
Adds a rule that allows resources based on their registered MIME type.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_recent_filter_add_pattern
function.description:
Adds a rule that allows resources based on a pattern matching their display name.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_recent_filter_add_pixbuf_formats
function.description:
Adds a rule allowing image files in the formats supported by GdkPixbuf.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_recent_filter_filter
function.description:
Tests whether a file should be displayed according to @filter. The #GtkRecentFilterInfo structure @filter_info should include the fields returned from gtk_recent_filter_get_needed().
This function will not typically be used by applications; it is intended principally for use in the implementation of #GtkRecentChooser.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: filter_info
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkRecentFilterInfo structure containing information about a recently used resource

function.return: %TRUE if the file should be displayed

function.name: gtk_recent_filter_get_name
function.description:
Gets the human-readable name for the filter. See gtk_recent_filter_set_name().
Since: 2.10
function.return: the name of the filter, or %NULL. The returned string is owned by the filter object and should not be freed.

function.name: gtk_recent_filter_get_needed
function.description:
Gets the fields that need to be filled in for the structure passed to gtk_recent_filter_filter()
This function will not typically be used by applications; it is intended principally for use in the implementation of #GtkRecentChooser.
Since: 2.10
function.return: bitfield of flags indicating needed fields when calling gtk_recent_filter_filter()

function.name: gtk_recent_filter_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkRecentFilter with no rules added to it. Such filter does not accept any recently used resources, so is not particularly useful until you add rules with gtk_recent_filter_add_pattern(), gtk_recent_filter_add_mime_type(), gtk_recent_filter_add_application(), gtk_recent_filter_add_age(). To create a filter that accepts any recently used resource, use: |[ GtkRecentFilter *filter = gtk_recent_filter_new (); gtk_recent_filter_add_pattern (filter, "*"); ]|
Since: 2.10
function.return: a new #GtkRecentFilter

function.name: gtk_recent_filter_set_name
function.description:
Sets the human-readable name of the filter; this is the string that will be displayed in the recently used resources selector user interface if there is a selectable list of filters.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_recent_info_create_app_info
function.description: Creates a #GAppInfo for the specified #GtkRecentInfo

parameter.name: app_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the application that should be mapped to a #GAppInfo; if %NULL is used then the default application for the MIME type is used

function.return: the newly created #GAppInfo, or %NULL. In case of error, @error will be set either with a %GTK_RECENT_MANAGER_ERROR or a %G_IO_ERROR

function.name: gtk_recent_info_exists
function.description:
Checks whether the resource pointed by @info still exists. At the moment this check is done only on resources pointing to local files.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if the resource exists

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_added
function.description:
Gets the timestamp (seconds from system's Epoch) when the resource was added to the recently used resources list.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the number of seconds elapsed from system's Epoch when the resource was added to the list, or -1 on failure.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_age
function.description:
Gets the number of days elapsed since the last update of the resource pointed by @info.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a positive integer containing the number of days elapsed since the time this resource was last modified.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_application_info
function.description:
Gets the data regarding the application that has registered the resource pointed by @info.
If the command line contains any escape characters defined inside the storage specification, they will be expanded.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: app_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the application that has registered this item

parameter.name: app_exec
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the string containing the command line

parameter.name: count
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the number of times this item was registered

parameter.name: time_
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the timestamp this item was last registered for this application

function.return: %TRUE if an application with @app_name has registered this resource inside the recently used list, or %FALSE otherwise. The @app_exec string is owned by the #GtkRecentInfo and should not be modified or freed

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_applications
function.description:
Retrieves the list of applications that have registered this resource.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the length of the returned list

function.return: a newly allocated %NULL-terminated array of strings. Use g_strfreev() to free it.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_description
function.description:
Gets the (short) description of the resource.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the description of the resource. The returned string is owned by the recent manager, and should not be freed.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_display_name
function.description:
Gets the name of the resource. If none has been defined, the basename of the resource is obtained.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the display name of the resource. The returned string is owned by the recent manager, and should not be freed.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_gicon
function.description:
Retrieves the icon associated to the resource MIME type.
Since: 2.22
function.return: a #GIcon containing the icon, or %NULL. Use g_object_unref() when finished using the icon

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_groups
function.description:
Returns all groups registered for the recently used item @info. The array of returned group names will be %NULL terminated, so length might optionally be %NULL.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the number of groups returned

function.return: a newly allocated %NULL terminated array of strings. Use g_strfreev() to free it.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_icon
function.description:
Retrieves the icon of size @size associated to the resource MIME type.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size of the icon in pixels

function.return: a #GdkPixbuf containing the icon, or %NULL. Use g_object_unref() when finished using the icon.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_mime_type
function.description:
Gets the MIME type of the resource.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the MIME type of the resource. The returned string is owned by the recent manager, and should not be freed.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_modified
function.description:
Gets the timestamp (seconds from system's Epoch) when the meta-data for the resource was last modified.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the number of seconds elapsed from system's Epoch when the resource was last modified, or -1 on failure.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_private_hint
function.description:
Gets the value of the "private" flag. Resources in the recently used list that have this flag set to %TRUE should only be displayed by the applications that have registered them.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if the private flag was found, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_short_name
function.description:
Computes a valid UTF-8 string that can be used as the name of the item in a menu or list. For example, calling this function on an item that refers to "file:///foo/bar.txt" will yield "bar.txt".
Since: 2.10
function.return: A newly-allocated string in UTF-8 encoding; free it with g_free().

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_uri
function.description:
Gets the URI of the resource.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the URI of the resource. The returned string is owned by the recent manager, and should not be freed.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_uri_display
function.description:
Gets a displayable version of the resource's URI. If the resource is local, it returns a local path; if the resource is not local, it returns the UTF-8 encoded content of gtk_recent_info_get_uri().
Since: 2.10
function.return: a newly allocated UTF-8 string containing the resource's URI or %NULL. Use g_free() when done using it.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_get_visited
function.description:
Gets the timestamp (seconds from system's Epoch) when the meta-data for the resource was last visited.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the number of seconds elapsed from system's Epoch when the resource was last visited, or -1 on failure.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_has_application
function.description:
Checks whether an application registered this resource using @app_name.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: app_name
parameter.parameter_description: a string containing an application name

function.return: %TRUE if an application with name @app_name was found, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_has_group
function.description:
Checks whether @group_name appears inside the groups registered for the recently used item @info.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if the group was found.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_is_local
function.description:
Checks whether the resource is local or not by looking at the scheme of its URI.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if the resource is local.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_last_application
function.description:
Gets the name of the last application that have registered the recently used resource represented by @info.
Since: 2.10
function.return: an application name. Use g_free() to free it.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_match
function.description:
Checks whether two #GtkRecentInfo structures point to the same resource.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if both #GtkRecentInfo structures point to se same resource, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_ref
function.description:
Increases the reference count of @recent_info by one.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the recent info object with its reference count increased by one.

function.name: gtk_recent_info_unref
function.description:
Decreases the reference count of @info by one. If the reference count reaches zero, @info is deallocated, and the memory freed.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_add_full
function.description:
Adds a new resource, pointed by @uri, into the recently used resources list, using the metadata specified inside the #GtkRecentData structure passed in @recent_data.
The passed URI will be used to identify this resource inside the list.
In order to register the new recently used resource, metadata about the resource must be passed as well as the URI; the metadata is stored in a #GtkRecentData structure, which must contain the MIME type of the resource pointed by the URI; the name of the application that is registering the item, and a command line to be used when launching the item.
Optionally, a #GtkRecentData structure might contain a UTF-8 string to be used when viewing the item instead of the last component of the URI; a short description of the item; whether the item should be considered private - that is, should be displayed only by the applications that have registered it.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if the new item was successfully added to the recently used resources list, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_add_item
function.description:
Adds a new resource, pointed by @uri, into the recently used resources list.
This function automatically retrieves some of the needed metadata and setting other metadata to common default values; it then feeds the data to gtk_recent_manager_add_full().
See gtk_recent_manager_add_full() if you want to explicitly define the metadata for the resource pointed by @uri.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if the new item was successfully added to the recently used resources list

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_get_default
function.description:
Gets a unique instance of #GtkRecentManager, that you can share in your application without caring about memory management.
Since: 2.10
function.return: A unique #GtkRecentManager. Do not ref or unref it.

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_get_items
function.description:
Gets the list of recently used resources.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a list of newly allocated #GtkRecentInfo objects. Use gtk_recent_info_unref() on each item inside the list, and then free the list itself using g_list_free().

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_has_item
function.description:
Checks whether there is a recently used resource registered with @uri inside the recent manager.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if the resource was found, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_lookup_item
function.description:
Searches for a URI inside the recently used resources list, and returns a structure containing informations about the resource like its MIME type, or its display name.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a return location for a #GError, or %NULL

function.return: a #GtkRecentInfo structure containing information about the resource pointed by @uri, or %NULL if the URI was not registered in the recently used resources list. Free with gtk_recent_info_unref().

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_move_item
function.description:
Changes the location of a recently used resource from @uri to @new_uri.
Please note that this function will not affect the resource pointed by the URIs, but only the URI used in the recently used resources list.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: uri
parameter.parameter_description: the URI of a recently used resource

parameter.name: new_uri
parameter.parameter_description: the new URI of the recently used resource, or %NULL to remove the item pointed by @uri in the list

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a return location for a #GError, or %NULL

function.return: %TRUE on success.

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_new
function.description:
Creates a new recent manager object. Recent manager objects are used to handle the list of recently used resources. A #GtkRecentManager object monitors the recently used resources list, and emits the "changed" signal each time something inside the list changes.
#GtkRecentManager objects are expensive: be sure to create them only when needed. You should use gtk_recent_manager_get_default() instead.
Since: 2.10
function.return: A newly created #GtkRecentManager object.

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_purge_items
function.description:
Purges every item from the recently used resources list.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a return location for a #GError, or %NULL

function.return: the number of items that have been removed from the recently used resources list.

function.name: gtk_recent_manager_remove_item
function.description:
Removes a resource pointed by @uri from the recently used resources list handled by a recent manager.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: uri
parameter.parameter_description: the URI of the item you wish to remove

function.return: %TRUE if the item pointed by @uri has been successfully removed by the recently used resources list, and %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_render_activity
function.description:
Renders an activity area (Such as in #GtkSpinner or the fill line in #GtkRange), the state %GTK_STATE_FLAG_ACTIVE determines whether there is activity going on.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_render_arrow
function.description:
Renders an arrow pointing to @angle.
<example> <title>Typical arrow rendering at 0, 1/2 ∏, ∏ and 3/2 ∏</title> <inlinegraphic fileref="arrows.png" format="PNG"/> </example>
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: angle
parameter.parameter_description: arrow angle from 0 to 2 * %G_PI, being 0 the arrow pointing to the north

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: X origin of the render area

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: Y origin of the render area

function.name: gtk_render_background
function.description:
Renders the background of an element.
<example> <title>Typical background rendering, showing the effect of <parameter>background-image</parameter>, <parameter>border-width</parameter> and <parameter>border-radius</parameter></title> <inlinegraphic fileref="background.png" format="PNG"/> </example>
Since: 3.0.

function.name: gtk_render_check
function.description:
Renders a checkmark (as in a #GtkCheckButton).
The %GTK_STATE_FLAG_ACTIVE state determines whether the check is on or off, and %GTK_STATE_FLAG_INCONSISTENT determines whether it should be marked as undefined.
<example> <title>Typical checkmark rendering</title> <inlinegraphic fileref="checks.png" format="PNG"/> </example>
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_render_expander
function.description:
Renders an expander (as used in #GtkTreeView and #GtkExpander) in the area defined by @x, @y, @width, @height. The state %GTK_STATE_FLAG_ACTIVE determines whether the expander is collapsed or expanded.
<example> <title>Typical expander rendering</title> <inlinegraphic fileref="expanders.png" format="PNG"/> </example>
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_render_extension
function.description:
Renders a extension (as in a #GtkNotebook tab) in the rectangle defined by @x, @y, @width, @height. The side where the extension connects to is defined by @gap_side.
<example> <title>Typical extension rendering</title> <inlinegraphic fileref="extensions.png" format="PNG"/> </example>
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_render_focus
function.description:
Renders a focus indicator on the rectangle determined by @x, @y, @width, @height. <example> <title>Typical focus rendering</title> <inlinegraphic fileref="focus.png" format="PNG"/> </example>
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_render_frame
function.description:
Renders a frame around the rectangle defined by @x, @y, @width, @height.
<example> <title>Examples of frame rendering, showing the effect of <parameter>border-image</parameter>, <parameter>border-color</parameter>, <parameter>border-width</parameter>, <parameter>border-radius</parameter> and junctions</title> <inlinegraphic fileref="frames.png" format="PNG"/> </example>
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_render_frame_gap
function.description:
Renders a frame around the rectangle defined by (@x, @y, @width, @height), leaving a gap on one side. @xy0_gap and @xy1_gap will mean X coordinates for %GTK_POS_TOP and %GTK_POS_BOTTOM gap sides, and Y coordinates for %GTK_POS_LEFT and %GTK_POS_RIGHT.
<example> <title>Typical rendering of a frame with a gap</title> <inlinegraphic fileref="frame-gap.png" format="PNG"/> </example>
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: xy0_gap
parameter.parameter_description: initial coordinate (X or Y depending on @gap_side) for the gap

parameter.name: xy1_gap
parameter.parameter_description: end coordinate (X or Y depending on @gap_side) for the gap

function.name: gtk_render_handle
function.description:
Renders a handle (as in #GtkHandleBox, #GtkPaned and #GtkWindow<!-- -->'s resize grip), in the rectangle determined by @x, @y, @width, @height.
<example> <title>Handles rendered for the paned and grip classes</title> <inlinegraphic fileref="handles.png" format="PNG"/> </example>
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_render_icon
function.description:
Renders the icon in @pixbuf at the specified @x and @y coordinates.
Since: 3.2

parameter.name: pixbuf
parameter.parameter_description: a #GdkPixbuf containing the icon to draw

function.name: gtk_render_icon_pixbuf
function.description:
Renders the icon specified by @source at the given @size, returning the result in a pixbuf.
Since: 3.0
Deprecated: 3.10: Use gtk_icon_theme_load_icon() instead.

parameter.name: source
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkIconSource specifying the icon to render

parameter.name: size
parameter.parameter_description: the size to render the icon at. A size of (GtkIconSize) -1 means render at the size of the source and don't scale.

function.return: a newly-created #GdkPixbuf containing the rendered icon

function.name: gtk_render_icon_surface
function.description:
Renders the icon in @surface at the specified @x and @y coordinates.
Since: 3.10

parameter.name: surface
parameter.parameter_description: a #cairo_surface_t containing the icon to draw

function.name: gtk_render_insertion_cursor
function.description:
Draws a text caret on @cr at the specified index of @layout.
Since: 3.4

function.name: gtk_render_layout
function.description:
Renders @layout on the coordinates @x, @y
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_render_line
function.description:
Renders a line from (x0, y0) to (x1, y1).
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: x0
parameter.parameter_description: X coordinate for the origin of the line

parameter.name: y0
parameter.parameter_description: Y coordinate for the origin of the line

parameter.name: x1
parameter.parameter_description: X coordinate for the end of the line

parameter.name: y1
parameter.parameter_description: Y coordinate for the end of the line

function.name: gtk_render_option
function.description:
Renders an option mark (as in a #GtkRadioButton), the %GTK_STATE_FLAG_ACTIVE state will determine whether the option is on or off, and %GTK_STATE_FLAG_INCONSISTENT whether it should be marked as undefined.
<example> <title>Typical option mark rendering</title> <inlinegraphic fileref="options.png" format="PNG"/> </example>
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_render_slider
function.description:
Renders a slider (as in #GtkScale) in the rectangle defined by @x, @y, @width, @height. @orientation defines whether the slider is vertical or horizontal.
<example> <title>Typical slider rendering</title> <inlinegraphic fileref="sliders.png" format="PNG"/> </example>
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_requisition_copy
function.description: Copies a #GtkRequisition.
function.return: a copy of @requisition

function.name: gtk_requisition_free
function.description: Frees a #GtkRequisition.

function.name: gtk_requisition_new
function.description:
Allocates a new #GtkRequisition structure and initializes its elements to zero.
Since: 3.0
function.return: a new empty #GtkRequisition. The newly allocated #GtkRequisition should be freed with gtk_requisition_free().

function.name: gtk_revealer_get_child_revealed
function.description:
Returns whether the child is fully revealed, ie wether the transition to the revealed state is completed.
Since: 3.10
function.return: %TRUE if the child is fully revealed

function.name: gtk_revealer_get_reveal_child
function.description:
Returns whether the child is currently revealed. See gtk_revealer_set_reveal_child().
This function returns %TRUE as soon as the transition is to the revealed state is started. To learn whether the child is fully revealed (ie the transition is completed), use gtk_revealer_get_child_revealed().
Since: 3.10
function.return: %TRUE if the child is revealed.

function.name: gtk_revealer_get_transition_duration
function.description:
Returns the amount of time (in milliseconds) that transitions will take.
Since: 3.10
function.return: the transition duration

function.name: gtk_revealer_get_transition_type
function.description:
Gets the type of animation that will be used for transitions in @revealer.
Since: 3.10
function.return: the current transition type of @revealer

function.name: gtk_revealer_set_reveal_child
function.description:
Tells the #GtkRevealer to reveal or conceal its child.
The transition will be animated with the current transition type of @revealer.
Since: 3.10

function.name: gtk_revealer_set_transition_duration
function.description:
Sets the duration that transitions will take.
Since: 3.10

function.name: gtk_revealer_set_transition_type
function.description:
Sets the type of animation that will be used for transitions in @revealer. Available types include various kinds of fades and slides.
Since: 3.10

function.name: gtk_rgb_to_hsv
function.description:
Converts a color from RGB space to HSV.
Input values must be in the [0.0, 1.0] range; output values will be in the same range.
Since: 2.14

parameter.name: h
parameter.parameter_description: Return value for the hue component

parameter.name: s
parameter.parameter_description: Return value for the saturation component

parameter.name: v
parameter.parameter_description: Return value for the value component

function.name: gtk_scale_add_mark
function.description:
Adds a mark at @value.
A mark is indicated visually by drawing a tick mark next to the scale, and GTK+ makes it easy for the user to position the scale exactly at the marks value.
If @markup is not %NULL, text is shown next to the tick mark.
To remove marks from a scale, use gtk_scale_clear_marks().
Since: 2.16

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: the value at which the mark is placed, must be between the lower and upper limits of the scales' adjustment

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: where to draw the mark. For a horizontal scale, #GTK_POS_TOP and %GTK_POS_LEFT are drawn above the scale, anything else below. For a vertical scale, #GTK_POS_LEFT and %GTK_POS_TOP are drawn to the left of the scale, anything else to the right.

parameter.name: markup
parameter.parameter_description: Text to be shown at the mark, using <link linkend="PangoMarkupFormat">Pango markup</link>, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_scale_button_get_adjustment
function.description:
Gets the #GtkAdjustment associated with the #GtkScaleButton's scale. See gtk_range_get_adjustment() for details.
Since: 2.12
function.return: the adjustment associated with the scale

function.name: gtk_scale_button_get_minus_button
function.description:
Retrieves the minus button of the #GtkScaleButton.
Since: 2.14
function.return: the minus button of the #GtkScaleButton

function.name: gtk_scale_button_get_plus_button
function.description:
Retrieves the plus button of the #GtkScaleButton.
Since: 2.14
function.return: the plus button of the #GtkScaleButton

function.name: gtk_scale_button_get_popup
function.description:
Retrieves the popup of the #GtkScaleButton.
Since: 2.14
function.return: the popup of the #GtkScaleButton

function.name: gtk_scale_button_get_value
function.description:
Gets the current value of the scale button.
Since: 2.12
function.return: current value of the scale button

function.name: gtk_scale_button_new
function.description:
Creates a #GtkScaleButton, with a range between @min and @max, with a stepping of @step.
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: min
parameter.parameter_description: the minimum value of the scale (usually 0)

parameter.name: max
parameter.parameter_description: the maximum value of the scale (usually 100)

parameter.name: step
parameter.parameter_description: the stepping of value when a scroll-wheel event, or up/down arrow event occurs (usually 2)
