parameter.name: icons
parameter.parameter_description: a %NULL-terminated array of icon names, or %NULL if you want to set the list later with gtk_scale_button_set_icons()

function.return: a new #GtkScaleButton

function.name: gtk_scale_button_set_adjustment
function.description:
Sets the #GtkAdjustment to be used as a model for the #GtkScaleButton's scale. See gtk_range_set_adjustment() for details.
Since: 2.12

function.name: gtk_scale_button_set_icons
function.description:
Sets the icons to be used by the scale button. For details, see the #GtkScaleButton:icons property.
Since: 2.12

function.name: gtk_scale_button_set_value
function.description:
Sets the current value of the scale; if the value is outside the minimum or maximum range values, it will be clamped to fit inside them. The scale button emits the #GtkScaleButton::value-changed signal if the value changes.
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: new value of the scale button

function.name: gtk_scale_clear_marks
function.description:
Removes any marks that have been added with gtk_scale_add_mark().
Since: 2.16

function.name: gtk_scale_get_digits
function.description: Gets the number of decimal places that are displayed in the value.
function.return: the number of decimal places that are displayed

function.name: gtk_scale_get_draw_value
function.description: Returns whether the current value is displayed as a string next to the slider.
function.return: whether the current value is displayed as a string

function.name: gtk_scale_get_has_origin
function.description:
Returns whether the scale has an origin.
Since: 3.4
function.return: %TRUE if the scale has an origin.

function.name: gtk_scale_get_layout
function.description:
Gets the #PangoLayout used to display the scale. The returned object is owned by the scale so does not need to be freed by the caller.
Since: 2.4
function.return: the #PangoLayout for this scale, or %NULL if the #GtkScale:draw-value property is %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_scale_get_layout_offsets
function.description:
Obtains the coordinates where the scale will draw the #PangoLayout representing the text in the scale. Remember when using the #PangoLayout function you need to convert to and from pixels using PANGO_PIXELS() or #PANGO_SCALE.
If the #GtkScale:draw-value property is %FALSE, the return values are undefined.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: location to store X offset of layout, or %NULL

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: location to store Y offset of layout, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_scale_get_value_pos
function.description: Gets the position in which the current value is displayed.
function.return: the position in which the current value is displayed

function.name: gtk_scale_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkScale.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: adjustment
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkAdjustment which sets the range of the scale, or %NULL to create a new adjustment.

function.return: a new #GtkScale

function.name: gtk_scale_new_with_range
function.description:
Creates a new scale widget with the given orientation that lets the user input a number between @min and @max (including @min and @max) with the increment @step. @step must be nonzero; it's the distance the slider moves when using the arrow keys to adjust the scale value.
Note that the way in which the precision is derived works best if @step is a power of ten. If the resulting precision is not suitable for your needs, use gtk_scale_set_digits() to correct it.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: step
parameter.parameter_description: step increment (tick size) used with keyboard shortcuts

function.return: a new #GtkScale

function.name: gtk_scale_set_digits
function.description: Sets the number of decimal places that are displayed in the value. Also causes the value of the adjustment to be rounded off to this number of digits, so the retrieved value matches the value the user saw.

parameter.name: digits
parameter.parameter_description: the number of decimal places to display, e.g. use 1 to display 1.0, 2 to display 1.00, etc

function.name: gtk_scale_set_draw_value
function.description: Specifies whether the current value is displayed as a string next to the slider.

function.name: gtk_scale_set_has_origin
function.description:
If @has_origin is set to %TRUE (the default), the scale will highlight the part of the scale between the origin (bottom or left side) of the scale and the current value.
Since: 3.4

parameter.name: has_origin
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the scale has an origin

function.name: gtk_scale_set_value_pos
function.description: Sets the position in which the current value is displayed.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.parameter_description: the position in which the current value is displayed

function.name: gtk_scrollable_get_hadjustment
function.description:
Retrieves the #GtkAdjustment used for horizontal scrolling.
Since: 3.0
function.return: horizontal #GtkAdjustment.

function.name: gtk_scrollable_get_hscroll_policy
function.description:
Gets the horizontal #GtkScrollablePolicy.
Since: 3.0
function.return: The horizontal #GtkScrollablePolicy.

function.name: gtk_scrollable_get_vadjustment
function.description:
Retrieves the #GtkAdjustment used for vertical scrolling.
Since: 3.0
function.return: vertical #GtkAdjustment.

function.name: gtk_scrollable_get_vscroll_policy
function.description:
Gets the vertical #GtkScrollablePolicy.
Since: 3.0
function.return: The vertical #GtkScrollablePolicy.

function.name: gtk_scrollable_set_hadjustment
function.description:
Sets the horizontal adjustment of the #GtkScrollable.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_scrollable_set_hscroll_policy
function.description:
Sets the #GtkScrollablePolicy to determine whether horizontal scrolling should start below the minimum width or below the natural width.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_scrollable_set_vadjustment
function.description:
Sets the vertical adjustment of the #GtkScrollable.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_scrollable_set_vscroll_policy
function.description:
Sets the #GtkScrollablePolicy to determine whether vertical scrolling should start below the minimum height or below the natural height.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_scrollbar_new
function.description:
Creates a new scrollbar with the given orientation.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: adjustment
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkAdjustment to use, or %NULL to create a new adjustment.

function.return: the new #GtkScrollbar.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_add_with_viewport
function.description:
Used to add children without native scrolling capabilities. This is simply a convenience function; it is equivalent to adding the unscrollable child to a viewport, then adding the viewport to the scrolled window. If a child has native scrolling, use gtk_container_add() instead of this function.
The viewport scrolls the child by moving its #GdkWindow, and takes the size of the child to be the size of its toplevel #GdkWindow. This will be very wrong for most widgets that support native scrolling; for example, if you add a widget such as #GtkTreeView with a viewport, the whole widget will scroll, including the column headings. Thus, widgets with native scrolling support should not be used with the #GtkViewport proxy.
A widget supports scrolling natively if it implements the #GtkScrollable interface.
Deprecated: 3.8: gtk_container_add() will now automatically add a #GtkViewport if the child doesn't implement #GtkScrollable.

parameter.name: child
parameter.parameter_description: the widget you want to scroll

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_capture_button_press
function.description:
Return whether button presses are captured during kinetic scrolling. See gtk_scrolled_window_set_capture_button_press().
Since: 3.4
function.return: %TRUE if button presses are captured during kinetic scrolling

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_hadjustment
function.description: Returns the horizontal scrollbar's adjustment, used to connect the horizontal scrollbar to the child widget's horizontal scroll functionality.
function.return: the horizontal #GtkAdjustment

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_hscrollbar
function.description:
Returns the horizontal scrollbar of @scrolled_window.
Since: 2.8
function.return: the horizontal scrollbar of the scrolled window, or %NULL if it does not have one.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_kinetic_scrolling
function.description:
Returns the specified kinetic scrolling behavior.
Since: 3.4
function.return: the scrolling behavior flags.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_min_content_height
function.description:
Gets the minimal content height of @scrolled_window, or -1 if not set.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the minimal content height

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_min_content_width
function.description:
Gets the minimum content width of @scrolled_window, or -1 if not set.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the minimum content width

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_placement
function.description: Gets the placement of the contents with respect to the scrollbars for the scrolled window. See gtk_scrolled_window_set_placement().
function.return:
the current placement value.
See also gtk_scrolled_window_set_placement() and gtk_scrolled_window_unset_placement().

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_policy
function.description: Retrieves the current policy values for the horizontal and vertical scrollbars. See gtk_scrolled_window_set_policy().

parameter.name: hscrollbar_policy
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the policy for the horizontal scrollbar, or %NULL.

parameter.name: vscrollbar_policy
parameter.parameter_description: location to store the policy for the vertical scrollbar, or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_shadow_type
function.description: Gets the shadow type of the scrolled window. See gtk_scrolled_window_set_shadow_type().
function.return: the current shadow type

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_vadjustment
function.description: Returns the vertical scrollbar's adjustment, used to connect the vertical scrollbar to the child widget's vertical scroll functionality.
function.return: the vertical #GtkAdjustment

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_get_vscrollbar
function.description:
Returns the vertical scrollbar of @scrolled_window.
Since: 2.8
function.return: the vertical scrollbar of the scrolled window, or %NULL if it does not have one.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_new
function.description:
Creates a new scrolled window.
The two arguments are the scrolled window's adjustments; these will be shared with the scrollbars and the child widget to keep the bars in sync with the child. Usually you want to pass %NULL for the adjustments, which will cause the scrolled window to create them for you.
function.return: a new scrolled window

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_capture_button_press
function.description:
Changes the behaviour of @scrolled_window wrt. to the initial event that possibly starts kinetic scrolling. When @capture_button_press is set to %TRUE, the event is captured by the scrolled window, and then later replayed if it is meant to go to the child widget.
This should be enabled if any child widgets perform non-reversible actions on #GtkWidget::button-press-event. If they don't, and handle additionally handle #GtkWidget::grab-broken-event, it might be better to set @capture_button_press to %FALSE.
This setting only has an effect if kinetic scrolling is enabled.
Since: 3.4

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_hadjustment
function.description: Sets the #GtkAdjustment for the horizontal scrollbar.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_kinetic_scrolling
function.description:
Turns kinetic scrolling on or off. Kinetic scrolling only applies to devices with source %GDK_SOURCE_TOUCHSCREEN.
Since: 3.4

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_min_content_height
function.description:
Sets the minimum height that @scrolled_window should keep visible. Note that this can and (usually will) be smaller than the minimum size of the content.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_min_content_width
function.description:
Sets the minimum width that @scrolled_window should keep visible. Note that this can and (usually will) be smaller than the minimum size of the content.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_placement
function.description:
Sets the placement of the contents with respect to the scrollbars for the scrolled window.
The default is %GTK_CORNER_TOP_LEFT, meaning the child is in the top left, with the scrollbars underneath and to the right. Other values in #GtkCornerType are %GTK_CORNER_TOP_RIGHT, %GTK_CORNER_BOTTOM_LEFT, and %GTK_CORNER_BOTTOM_RIGHT.
See also gtk_scrolled_window_get_placement() and gtk_scrolled_window_unset_placement().

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_policy
function.description:
Sets the scrollbar policy for the horizontal and vertical scrollbars.
The policy determines when the scrollbar should appear; it is a value from the #GtkPolicyType enumeration. If %GTK_POLICY_ALWAYS, the scrollbar is always present; if %GTK_POLICY_NEVER, the scrollbar is never present; if %GTK_POLICY_AUTOMATIC, the scrollbar is present only if needed (that is, if the slider part of the bar would be smaller than the trough - the display is larger than the page size).

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_shadow_type
function.description: Changes the type of shadow drawn around the contents of @scrolled_window.

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: kind of shadow to draw around scrolled window contents

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_set_vadjustment
function.description: Sets the #GtkAdjustment for the vertical scrollbar.

function.name: gtk_scrolled_window_unset_placement
function.description:
Unsets the placement of the contents with respect to the scrollbars for the scrolled window. If no window placement is set for a scrolled window, it defaults to GTK_CORNER_TOP_LEFT.
See also gtk_scrolled_window_set_placement() and gtk_scrolled_window_get_placement().
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_search_bar_connect_entry
function.description:
Connects the #GtkEntry widget passed as the one to be used in this search bar. The entry should be a descendant of the search bar. This is only required if the entry isn't the direct child of the search bar (as in our main example).
Since: 3.10

function.name: gtk_search_bar_get_search_mode
function.description:
Returns whether the search mode is on or off.
Since: 3.10
function.return: whether search mode is toggled on

function.name: gtk_search_bar_get_show_close_button
function.description:
Returns whether the close button is shown.
Since: 3.10
function.return: whether the close button is shown

function.name: gtk_search_bar_handle_event
function.description:
This function should be called when the top-level window which contains the search bar received a key event.
If the key event is handled by the search bar, the bar will be shown, the entry populated with the entered text and %GDK_EVENT_STOP will be returned. The caller should ensure that events are not propagated further.
If no entry has been connected to the search bar, using gtk_search_bar_connect_entry(), this function will return immediately with a warning.
<example> <title>Showing the search bar on key presses</title> <programlisting><![CDATA[ static gboolean window_key_press_event_cb (GtkWidget *widget, GdkEvent *event, gpointer user_data) { return gtk_search_bar_handle_event (GTK_SEARCH_BAR (user_data), event); }
g_signal_connect (window, "key-press-event", G_CALLBACK (window_key_press_event_cb), search_bar); ]]></programlisting> </example>
Since: 3.10
function.return: %GDK_EVENT_STOP if the key press event resulted in text being entered in the search entry (and revealing the search bar if necessary), %GDK_EVENT_PROPAGATE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_search_bar_new
function.description:
Creates a #GtkSearchBar. You will need to tell it about which widget is going to be your text entry using gtk_search_bar_set_entry().
Since: 3.10
function.return: a new #GtkSearchBar

function.name: gtk_search_bar_set_search_mode
function.description:
Switches the search mode on or off.
Since: 3.10

parameter.name: search_mode
parameter.parameter_description: the new state of the search mode

function.name: gtk_search_bar_set_show_close_button
function.description:
Shows or hides the close button. Applications that already have a "search" toggle button should not show a close button in their search bar, as it duplicates the role of the toggle button.
Since: 3.10

parameter.name: visible
parameter.parameter_description: whether the close button will be shown or not

function.name: gtk_search_entry_new
function.description:
Creates a #GtkSearchEntry, with a find icon when the search field is empty, and a clear icon when it isn't.
Since: 3.6
function.return: a new #GtkSearchEntry

function.name: gtk_selection_add_target
function.description: Appends a specified target to the list of supported targets for a given widget and selection.

parameter.name: info
parameter.parameter_description: A unsigned integer which will be passed back to the application.

function.name: gtk_selection_add_targets
function.description: Prepends a table of targets to the list of supported targets for a given widget and selection.

parameter.name: targets
parameter.parameter_description: a table of targets to add

function.name: gtk_selection_clear_targets
function.description: Remove all targets registered for the given selection for the widget.

function.name: gtk_selection_convert
function.description: Requests the contents of a selection. When received, a "selection-received" signal will be generated.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: The widget which acts as requestor

parameter.name: time_
parameter.parameter_description: Time of request (usually of triggering event) In emergency, you could use #GDK_CURRENT_TIME

function.return: %TRUE if requested succeeded. %FALSE if we could not process request. (e.g., there was already a request in process for this widget).

function.name: gtk_selection_data_copy
function.description: Makes a copy of a #GtkSelectionData structure and its data.
function.return: a pointer to a copy of @data.

function.name: gtk_selection_data_free
function.description: Frees a #GtkSelectionData structure returned from gtk_selection_data_copy().

function.name: gtk_selection_data_get_data
function.description:
Retrieves the raw data of the selection.
Since: 2.14
function.return: the raw data of the selection.

function.name: gtk_selection_data_get_data_type
function.description:
Retrieves the data type of the selection.
Since: 2.14
function.return: the data type of the selection.

function.name: gtk_selection_data_get_data_with_length
function.description:
Retrieves the raw data of the selection along with its length.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: return location for length of the data segment

function.return: the raw data of the selection

function.name: gtk_selection_data_get_display
function.description:
Retrieves the display of the selection.
Since: 2.14
function.return: the display of the selection.

function.name: gtk_selection_data_get_format
function.description:
Retrieves the format of the selection.
Since: 2.14
function.return: the format of the selection.

function.name: gtk_selection_data_get_length
function.description:
Retrieves the length of the raw data of the selection.
Since: 2.14
function.return: the length of the data of the selection.

function.name: gtk_selection_data_get_pixbuf
function.description:
Gets the contents of the selection data as a #GdkPixbuf.
Since: 2.6
function.return: if the selection data contained a recognized image type and it could be converted to a #GdkPixbuf, a newly allocated pixbuf is returned, otherwise %NULL. If the result is non-%NULL it must be freed with g_object_unref().

function.name: gtk_selection_data_get_selection
function.description:
Retrieves the selection #GdkAtom of the selection data.
Since: 2.16
function.return: the selection #GdkAtom of the selection data.

function.name: gtk_selection_data_get_target
function.description:
Retrieves the target of the selection.
Since: 2.14
function.return: the target of the selection.

function.name: gtk_selection_data_get_targets
function.description: Gets the contents of @selection_data as an array of targets. This can be used to interpret the results of getting the standard TARGETS target that is always supplied for any selection.

parameter.name: targets
parameter.parameter_description: location to store an array of targets. The result stored here must be freed with g_free().

parameter.name: n_atoms
parameter.parameter_description: location to store number of items in @targets.

function.return: %TRUE if @selection_data contains a valid array of targets, otherwise %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_selection_data_get_text
function.description: Gets the contents of the selection data as a UTF-8 string.
function.return: if the selection data contained a recognized text type and it could be converted to UTF-8, a newly allocated string containing the converted text, otherwise %NULL. If the result is non-%NULL it must be freed with g_free().

function.name: gtk_selection_data_get_uris
function.description:
Gets the contents of the selection data as array of URIs.
Since: 2.6
function.return: if the selection data contains a list of URIs, a newly allocated %NULL-terminated string array containing the URIs, otherwise %NULL. If the result is non-%NULL it must be freed with g_strfreev().

function.name: gtk_selection_data_set
function.description: Stores new data into a #GtkSelectionData object. Should <emphasis>only</emphasis> be called from a selection handler callback. Zero-terminates the stored data.

parameter.name: format
parameter.parameter_description: format (number of bits in a unit)

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: pointer to the data (will be copied)

function.name: gtk_selection_data_set_pixbuf
function.description:
Sets the contents of the selection from a #GdkPixbuf The pixbuf is converted to the form determined by @selection_data->target.
Since: 2.6
function.return: %TRUE if the selection was successfully set, otherwise %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_selection_data_set_text

parameter.name: len
parameter.parameter_description: the length of @str, or -1 if @str is nul-terminated.

function.return: %TRUE if the selection was successfully set, otherwise %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_selection_data_set_uris
function.description:
Sets the contents of the selection from a list of URIs. The string is converted to the form determined by @selection_data->target.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: uris
parameter.parameter_description: a %NULL-terminated array of strings holding URIs

function.return: %TRUE if the selection was successfully set, otherwise %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_selection_data_targets_include_image
function.description:
Given a #GtkSelectionData object holding a list of targets, determines if any of the targets in @targets can be used to provide a #GdkPixbuf.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: writable
parameter.parameter_description: whether to accept only targets for which GTK+ knows how to convert a pixbuf into the format

function.return: %TRUE if @selection_data holds a list of targets, and a suitable target for images is included, otherwise %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_selection_data_targets_include_rich_text
function.description:
Given a #GtkSelectionData object holding a list of targets, determines if any of the targets in @targets can be used to provide rich text.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if @selection_data holds a list of targets, and a suitable target for rich text is included, otherwise %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_selection_data_targets_include_text
function.description: Given a #GtkSelectionData object holding a list of targets, determines if any of the targets in @targets can be used to provide text.
function.return: %TRUE if @selection_data holds a list of targets, and a suitable target for text is included, otherwise %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_selection_data_targets_include_uri
function.description:
Given a #GtkSelectionData object holding a list of targets, determines if any of the targets in @targets can be used to provide a list or URIs.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if @selection_data holds a list of targets, and a suitable target for URI lists is included, otherwise %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_selection_owner_set
function.description: Claims ownership of a given selection for a particular widget, or, if @widget is %NULL, release ownership of the selection.

parameter.name: selection
parameter.parameter_description: an interned atom representing the selection to claim

parameter.name: time_
parameter.parameter_description: timestamp with which to claim the selection

function.return: %TRUE if the operation succeeded

function.name: gtk_selection_owner_set_for_display
function.description:
Claim ownership of a given selection for a particular widget, or, if @widget is %NULL, release ownership of the selection.
Since: 2.2

parameter.name: display
parameter.parameter_description: the #GdkDisplay where the selection is set

parameter.name: selection
parameter.parameter_description: an interned atom representing the selection to claim.

parameter.name: time_
parameter.parameter_description: timestamp with which to claim the selection

function.return: TRUE if the operation succeeded

function.name: gtk_selection_remove_all
function.description: Removes all handlers and unsets ownership of all selections for a widget. Called when widget is being destroyed. This function will not generally be called by applications.

function.name: gtk_separator_menu_item_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkSeparatorMenuItem.
function.return: a new #GtkSeparatorMenuItem.

function.name: gtk_separator_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkSeparator with the given orientation.
Since: 3.0
function.return: a new #GtkSeparator.

function.name: gtk_separator_tool_item_get_draw
function.description:
Returns whether @item is drawn as a line, or just blank. See gtk_separator_tool_item_set_draw().
Since: 2.4
function.return: %TRUE if @item is drawn as a line, or just blank.

function.name: gtk_separator_tool_item_new
function.description:
Create a new #GtkSeparatorToolItem
Since: 2.4
function.return: the new #GtkSeparatorToolItem

function.name: gtk_separator_tool_item_set_draw
function.description:
Whether @item is drawn as a vertical line, or just blank. Setting this to %FALSE along with gtk_tool_item_set_expand() is useful to create an item that forces following items to the end of the toolbar.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: draw
parameter.parameter_description: whether @item is drawn as a vertical line

function.name: gtk_set_debug_flags
function.description: Sets the GTK+ debug flags.

function.name: gtk_settings_get_default
function.description: Gets the #GtkSettings object for the default GDK screen, creating it if necessary. See gtk_settings_get_for_screen().
function.return: a #GtkSettings object. If there is no default screen, then returns %NULL.

function.name: gtk_settings_get_for_screen
function.description:
Gets the #GtkSettings object for @screen, creating it if necessary.
Since: 2.2
function.return: a #GtkSettings object.

function.name: gtk_show_about_dialog
function.description:
This is a convenience function for showing an application's about box. The constructed dialog is associated with the parent window and reused for future invocations of this function.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: first_property_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the first property

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: value of first property, followed by more properties, %NULL-terminated

function.name: gtk_show_uri
function.description:
This is a convenience function for launching the default application to show the uri. The uri must be of a form understood by GIO (i.e. you need to install gvfs to get support for uri schemes such as http:// or ftp://, as only local files are handled by GIO itself). Typical examples are <simplelist> <member><filename>file:///home/gnome/pict.jpg</filename></member> <member><filename>http://www.gnome.org</filename></member> <member><filename>mailto:me@gnome.org</filename></member> </simplelist> Ideally the timestamp is taken from the event triggering the gtk_show_uri() call. If timestamp is not known you can take %GDK_CURRENT_TIME.
This function can be used as a replacement for gnome_vfs_url_show() and gnome_url_show().
Since: 2.14

parameter.name: screen
parameter.parameter_description: screen to show the uri on or %NULL for the default screen

parameter.name: timestamp
parameter.parameter_description: a timestamp to prevent focus stealing

parameter.name: error
parameter.parameter_description: a #GError that is returned in case of errors

function.return: %TRUE on success, %FALSE on error

function.name: gtk_size_group_add_widget
function.description:
Adds a widget to a #GtkSizeGroup. In the future, the requisition of the widget will be determined as the maximum of its requisition and the requisition of the other widgets in the size group. Whether this applies horizontally, vertically, or in both directions depends on the mode of the size group. See gtk_size_group_set_mode().
When the widget is destroyed or no longer referenced elsewhere, it will be removed from the size group.

function.name: gtk_size_group_get_ignore_hidden
function.description:
Returns if invisible widgets are ignored when calculating the size.
Since: 2.8
function.return: %TRUE if invisible widgets are ignored.

function.name: gtk_size_group_get_mode
function.description: Gets the current mode of the size group. See gtk_size_group_set_mode().
function.return: the current mode of the size group.

function.name: gtk_size_group_get_widgets
function.description:
Returns the list of widgets associated with @size_group.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a #GSList of widgets. The list is owned by GTK+ and should not be modified.

function.name: gtk_size_group_new
function.description: Create a new #GtkSizeGroup.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.parameter_description: the mode for the new size group.

function.return: a newly created #GtkSizeGroup

function.name: gtk_size_group_remove_widget
function.description: Removes a widget from a #GtkSizeGroup.

function.name: gtk_size_group_set_ignore_hidden
function.description:
Sets whether unmapped widgets should be ignored when calculating the size.
Since: 2.8

parameter.name: ignore_hidden
parameter.parameter_description: whether unmapped widgets should be ignored when calculating the size

function.name: gtk_size_group_set_mode
function.description: Sets the #GtkSizeGroupMode of the size group. The mode of the size group determines whether the widgets in the size group should all have the same horizontal requisition (%GTK_SIZE_GROUP_HORIZONTAL) all have the same vertical requisition (%GTK_SIZE_GROUP_VERTICAL), or should all have the same requisition in both directions (%GTK_SIZE_GROUP_BOTH).

parameter.name: mode
parameter.parameter_description: the mode to set for the size group.

function.name: gtk_socket_add_grabbed_key
function.description: Called from the GtkSocket platform-specific backend when the corresponding plug has told the socket to grab a key.

function.name: gtk_socket_add_id
function.description:
Adds an XEMBED client, such as a #GtkPlug, to the #GtkSocket. The client may be in the same process or in a different process.
To embed a #GtkPlug in a #GtkSocket, you can either create the #GtkPlug with <literal>gtk_plug_new (0)</literal>, call gtk_plug_get_id() to get the window ID of the plug, and then pass that to the gtk_socket_add_id(), or you can call gtk_socket_get_id() to get the window ID for the socket, and call gtk_plug_new() passing in that ID.
The #GtkSocket must have already be added into a toplevel window before you can make this call.

parameter.name: window
parameter.parameter_description: the Window of a client participating in the XEMBED protocol.

function.name: gtk_socket_add_window
function.description: Adds a window to a GtkSocket.

parameter.name: xid
parameter.parameter_description: the native identifier for a window

parameter.name: need_reparent
parameter.parameter_description: whether the socket's plug's window needs to be reparented to the socket

function.name: gtk_socket_advance_toplevel_focus
function.description: Called from the GtkSocket backend when the corresponding plug has told the socket to move the focus.

function.name: gtk_socket_claim_focus
function.description: Claims focus for the socket. XXX send_event?

function.name: gtk_socket_end_embedding
function.description: Called to end the embedding of a plug in the socket.

function.name: gtk_socket_get_id
function.description:
Gets the window ID of a #GtkSocket widget, which can then be used to create a client embedded inside the socket, for instance with gtk_plug_new().
The #GtkSocket must have already be added into a toplevel window before you can make this call.
function.return: the window ID for the socket

function.name: gtk_socket_get_plug_window
function.description:
Retrieves the window of the plug. Use this to check if the plug has been created inside of the socket.
Since: 2.14
function.return: the window of the plug if available, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_socket_handle_map_request
function.description: Called from the GtkSocket backend when the plug has been mapped.

function.name: gtk_socket_new
function.description: Create a new empty #GtkSocket.
function.return: the new #GtkSocket.

function.name: gtk_socket_remove_grabbed_key
function.description: Called from the GtkSocket backend when the corresponding plug has told the socket to remove a key grab.

function.name: gtk_socket_unmap_notify
function.description: Called from the GtkSocket backend when the plug has been unmapped ???

function.name: gtk_spin_button_configure
function.description: Changes the properties of an existing spin button. The adjustment, climb rate, and number of decimal places are all changed accordingly, after this function call.

parameter.name: digits
parameter.parameter_description: the number of decimal places to display in the spin button

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_adjustment
function.description: Get the adjustment associated with a #GtkSpinButton
function.return: the #GtkAdjustment of @spin_button

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_digits
function.description: Fetches the precision of @spin_button. See gtk_spin_button_set_digits().
function.return: the current precision

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_increments
function.description: Gets the current step and page the increments used by @spin_button. See gtk_spin_button_set_increments().

parameter.name: step
parameter.parameter_description: location to store step increment, or %NULL

parameter.name: page
parameter.parameter_description: location to store page increment, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_numeric
function.description: Returns whether non-numeric text can be typed into the spin button. See gtk_spin_button_set_numeric().
function.return: %TRUE if only numeric text can be entered

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_range
function.description: Gets the range allowed for @spin_button. See gtk_spin_button_set_range().

parameter.name: min
parameter.parameter_description: location to store minimum allowed value, or %NULL

parameter.name: max
parameter.parameter_description: location to store maximum allowed value, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_snap_to_ticks
function.description: Returns whether the values are corrected to the nearest step. See gtk_spin_button_set_snap_to_ticks().
function.return: %TRUE if values are snapped to the nearest step

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_update_policy
function.description: Gets the update behavior of a spin button. See gtk_spin_button_set_update_policy().
function.return: the current update policy

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_value
function.description: Get the value in the @spin_button.
function.return: the value of @spin_button

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_value_as_int
function.description: Get the value @spin_button represented as an integer.
function.return: the value of @spin_button

function.name: gtk_spin_button_get_wrap
function.description: Returns whether the spin button's value wraps around to the opposite limit when the upper or lower limit of the range is exceeded. See gtk_spin_button_set_wrap().
function.return: %TRUE if the spin button wraps around

function.name: gtk_spin_button_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkSpinButton.

parameter.name: adjustment
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkAdjustment object that this spin button should use, or %NULL

parameter.name: climb_rate
parameter.parameter_description: specifies how much the spin button changes when an arrow is clicked on

parameter.name: digits
parameter.parameter_description: the number of decimal places to display

function.return: The new spin button as a #GtkWidget

function.name: gtk_spin_button_new_with_range
function.description:
This is a convenience constructor that allows creation of a numeric #GtkSpinButton without manually creating an adjustment. The value is initially set to the minimum value and a page increment of 10 * @step is the default. The precision of the spin button is equivalent to the precision of @step.
Note that the way in which the precision is derived works best if @step is a power of ten. If the resulting precision is not suitable for your needs, use gtk_spin_button_set_digits() to correct it.

parameter.name: step
parameter.parameter_description: Increment added or subtracted by spinning the widget

function.return: The new spin button as a #GtkWidget

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_adjustment
function.description: Replaces the #GtkAdjustment associated with @spin_button.

parameter.name: adjustment
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkAdjustment to replace the existing adjustment

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_digits
function.description: Set the precision to be displayed by @spin_button. Up to 20 digit precision is allowed.

parameter.name: digits
parameter.parameter_description: the number of digits after the decimal point to be displayed for the spin button's value

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_increments
function.description: Sets the step and page increments for spin_button. This affects how quickly the value changes when the spin button's arrows are activated.

parameter.name: step
parameter.parameter_description: increment applied for a button 1 press.

parameter.name: page
parameter.parameter_description: increment applied for a button 2 press.

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_numeric
function.description: Sets the flag that determines if non-numeric text can be typed into the spin button.

parameter.name: numeric
parameter.parameter_description: flag indicating if only numeric entry is allowed

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_range
function.description:
Sets the minimum and maximum allowable values for @spin_button.
If the current value is outside this range, it will be adjusted to fit within the range, otherwise it will remain unchanged.

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_snap_to_ticks
function.description: Sets the policy as to whether values are corrected to the nearest step increment when a spin button is activated after providing an invalid value.

parameter.name: snap_to_ticks
parameter.parameter_description: a flag indicating if invalid values should be corrected

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_update_policy
function.description: Sets the update behavior of a spin button. This determines whether the spin button is always updated or only when a valid value is set.

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_value
function.description: Sets the value of @spin_button.

function.name: gtk_spin_button_set_wrap
function.description: Sets the flag that determines if a spin button value wraps around to the opposite limit when the upper or lower limit of the range is exceeded.

parameter.name: wrap
parameter.parameter_description: a flag indicating if wrapping behavior is performed

function.name: gtk_spin_button_spin
function.description: Increment or decrement a spin button's value in a specified direction by a specified amount.

parameter.name: direction
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkSpinType indicating the direction to spin

parameter.name: increment
parameter.parameter_description: step increment to apply in the specified direction

function.name: gtk_spin_button_update
function.description: Manually force an update of the spin button.

function.name: gtk_spinner_new
function.description:
Returns a new spinner widget. Not yet started.
Since: 2.20
function.return: a new #GtkSpinner

function.name: gtk_spinner_start
function.description:
Starts the animation of the spinner.
Since: 2.20

function.name: gtk_spinner_stop
function.description:
Stops the animation of the spinner.
Since: 2.20

function.name: gtk_stack_add_named
function.description:
Adds a child to @stack. The child is identified by the @name.
Since: 3.10

function.name: gtk_stack_add_titled
function.description:
Adds a child to @stack. The child is identified by the @name. The @title will be used by #GtkStackSwitcher to represent @child in a tab bar, so it should be short.
Since: 3.10

function.name: gtk_stack_get_homogeneous
function.description:
Gets whether @stack is homogeneous. See gtk_stack_set_homogeneous().
Since: 3.10
function.return: whether @stack is homogeneous.

function.name: gtk_stack_get_transition_duration
function.description:
Returns the amount of time (in milliseconds) that transitions between pages in @stack will take.
Since: 3.10
function.return: the transition duration

function.name: gtk_stack_get_transition_type
function.description:
Gets the type of animation that will be used for transitions between pages in @stack.
Since: 3.10
function.return: the current transition type of @stack

function.name: gtk_stack_get_visible_child
function.description:
Gets the currently visible child of @stack, or %NULL if there are no visible children.
Since: 3.10
function.return: the visible child of the #GtkStack

function.name: gtk_stack_get_visible_child_name
function.description:
Returns the name of the currently visible child of @stack, or %NULL if there is no visible child.
Since: 3.10
function.return: the name of the visible child of the #GtkStack

function.name: gtk_stack_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkStack container.
Since: 3.10
function.return: a new #GtkStack

function.name: gtk_stack_set_homogeneous
function.description:
Sets the #GtkStack to be homogeneous or not. If it is homogeneous, the #GtkStack will request the same size for all its children. If it isn't, the stack may change size when a different child becomes visible.
Since: 3.10

function.name: gtk_stack_set_transition_duration
function.description:
Sets the duration that transitions between pages in @stack will take.
Since: 3.10

function.name: gtk_stack_set_transition_type
function.description:
Sets the type of animation that will be used for transitions between pages in @stack. Available types include various kinds of fades and slides.
The transition type can be changed without problems at runtime, so it is possible to change the animation based on the page that is about to become current.
Since: 3.10

function.name: gtk_stack_set_visible_child
function.description:
Makes @child the visible child of @stack.
If @child is different from the currently visible child, the transition between the two will be animated with the current transition type of @stack.
Since: 3.10

function.name: gtk_stack_set_visible_child_full
function.description:
Makes the child with the given name visible.
Since: 3.10

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the child to make visible

function.name: gtk_stack_set_visible_child_name
function.description:
Makes the child with the given name visible.
If @child is different from the currently visible child, the transition between the two will be animated with the current transition type of @stack.
Since: 3.10

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the child to make visible

function.name: gtk_stack_switcher_get_stack
function.description:
Retrieves the stack. See gtk_stack_switcher_set_stack().
Since: 3.10
function.return: the stack, or %NULL if none has been set explicitly.

function.name: gtk_stack_switcher_new
function.description:
Create a new #GtkStackSwitcher.
Since: 3.10
function.return: a new #GtkStackSwitcher.

function.name: gtk_stack_switcher_set_stack
function.description:
Sets the stack to control.
Since: 3.10

function.name: gtk_status_icon_get_geometry
function.description:
Obtains information about the location of the status icon on screen. This information can be used to e.g. position popups like notification bubbles.
See gtk_status_icon_position_menu() for a more convenient alternative for positioning menus.
Note that some platforms do not allow GTK+ to provide this information, and even on platforms that do allow it, the information is not reliable unless the status icon is embedded in a notification area, see gtk_status_icon_is_embedded().
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: screen
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the screen, or %NULL if the information is not needed

parameter.name: area
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the area occupied by the status icon, or %NULL

parameter.name: orientation
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the orientation of the panel in which the status icon is embedded, or %NULL. A panel at the top or bottom of the screen is horizontal, a panel at the left or right is vertical.

function.return: %TRUE if the location information has been filled in

function.name: gtk_status_icon_get_gicon
function.return: the displayed icon, or %NULL if the image is empty

function.name: gtk_status_icon_get_has_tooltip
function.description:
Returns the current value of the has-tooltip property. See #GtkStatusIcon:has-tooltip for more information.
Since: 2.16
function.return: current value of has-tooltip on @status_icon.

function.name: gtk_status_icon_get_icon_name
function.description:
Gets the name of the icon being displayed by the #GtkStatusIcon. The storage type of the status icon must be %GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY or %GTK_IMAGE_ICON_NAME (see gtk_status_icon_get_storage_type()). The returned string is owned by the #GtkStatusIcon and should not be freed or modified.
Since: 2.10
function.return: name of the displayed icon, or %NULL if the image is empty.

function.name: gtk_status_icon_get_pixbuf
function.description:
Gets the #GdkPixbuf being displayed by the #GtkStatusIcon. The storage type of the status icon must be %GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY or %GTK_IMAGE_PIXBUF (see gtk_status_icon_get_storage_type()). The caller of this function does not own a reference to the returned pixbuf.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the displayed pixbuf, or %NULL if the image is empty.

function.name: gtk_status_icon_get_screen
function.description:
Returns the #GdkScreen associated with @status_icon.
Since: 2.12
function.return: a #GdkScreen.

function.name: gtk_status_icon_get_size
function.description:
Gets the size in pixels that is available for the image. Stock icons and named icons adapt their size automatically if the size of the notification area changes. For other storage types, the size-changed signal can be used to react to size changes.
Note that the returned size is only meaningful while the status icon is embedded (see gtk_status_icon_is_embedded()).
Since: 2.10
function.return: the size that is available for the image

function.name: gtk_status_icon_get_stock
function.description:
Gets the id of the stock icon being displayed by the #GtkStatusIcon. The storage type of the status icon must be %GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY or %GTK_IMAGE_STOCK (see gtk_status_icon_get_storage_type()). The returned string is owned by the #GtkStatusIcon and should not be freed or modified.
Since: 2.10
Deprecated: 3.10: Use gtk_status_icon_get_icon_name() instead.
function.return: stock id of the displayed stock icon, or %NULL if the image is empty.

function.name: gtk_status_icon_get_storage_type
function.description:
Gets the type of representation being used by the #GtkStatusIcon to store image data. If the #GtkStatusIcon has no image data, the return value will be %GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the image representation being used

function.name: gtk_status_icon_get_title
function.description:
Gets the title of this tray icon. See gtk_status_icon_set_title().
Since: 2.18
function.return: the title of the status icon

function.name: gtk_status_icon_get_tooltip_markup
function.description:
Gets the contents of the tooltip for @status_icon.
Since: 2.16
function.return: the tooltip text, or %NULL. You should free the returned string with g_free() when done.

function.name: gtk_status_icon_get_tooltip_text
function.description:
Gets the contents of the tooltip for @status_icon.
Since: 2.16
function.return: the tooltip text, or %NULL. You should free the returned string with g_free() when done.

function.name: gtk_status_icon_get_visible
function.description:
Returns whether the status icon is visible or not. Note that being visible does not guarantee that the user can actually see the icon, see also gtk_status_icon_is_embedded().
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if the status icon is visible

function.name: gtk_status_icon_get_x11_window_id
function.description:
This function is only useful on the X11/freedesktop.org platform. It returns a window ID for the widget in the underlying status icon implementation. This is useful for the Galago notification service, which can send a window ID in the protocol in order for the server to position notification windows pointing to a status icon reliably.
This function is not intended for other use cases which are more likely to be met by one of the non-X11 specific methods, such as gtk_status_icon_position_menu().
Since: 2.14
function.return: An 32 bit unsigned integer identifier for the underlying X11 Window

function.name: gtk_status_icon_is_embedded
function.description:
Returns whether the status icon is embedded in a notification area.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if the status icon is embedded in a notification area.

function.name: gtk_status_icon_new
function.description:
Creates an empty status icon object.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a new #GtkStatusIcon

function.name: gtk_status_icon_new_from_file
function.description:
Creates a status icon displaying the file @filename.
The image will be scaled down to fit in the available space in the notification area, if necessary.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a new #GtkStatusIcon

function.name: gtk_status_icon_new_from_gicon
function.description:
Creates a status icon displaying a #GIcon. If the icon is a themed icon, it will be updated when the theme changes.
Since: 2.14
function.return: a new #GtkStatusIcon

function.name: gtk_status_icon_new_from_icon_name
function.description:
Creates a status icon displaying an icon from the current icon theme. If the current icon theme is changed, the icon will be updated appropriately.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a new #GtkStatusIcon

function.name: gtk_status_icon_new_from_pixbuf
function.description:
Creates a status icon displaying @pixbuf.
The image will be scaled down to fit in the available space in the notification area, if necessary.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a new #GtkStatusIcon

function.name: gtk_status_icon_new_from_stock
function.description:
Creates a status icon displaying a stock icon. Sample stock icon names are #GTK_STOCK_OPEN, #GTK_STOCK_QUIT. You can register your own stock icon names, see gtk_icon_factory_add_default() and gtk_icon_factory_add().
Since: 2.10
Deprecated: 3.10: Use gtk_status_icon_new_from_icon_name() instead.
function.return: a new #GtkStatusIcon

function.name: gtk_status_icon_position_menu
function.description:
Menu positioning function to use with gtk_menu_popup() to position @menu aligned to the status icon @user_data.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the x position

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the y position

parameter.name: push_in
parameter.parameter_description: whether the first menu item should be offset (pushed in) to be aligned with the menu popup position (only useful for GtkOptionMenu).

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: the status icon to position the menu on

function.name: gtk_status_icon_set_from_file
function.description:
Makes @status_icon display the file @filename. See gtk_status_icon_new_from_file() for details.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_status_icon_set_from_gicon
function.description:
Makes @status_icon display the #GIcon. See gtk_status_icon_new_from_gicon() for details.
Since: 2.14

function.name: gtk_status_icon_set_from_icon_name
function.description:
Makes @status_icon display the icon named @icon_name from the current icon theme. See gtk_status_icon_new_from_icon_name() for details.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_status_icon_set_from_pixbuf
function.description:
Makes @status_icon display @pixbuf. See gtk_status_icon_new_from_pixbuf() for details.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_status_icon_set_from_stock
function.description:
Makes @status_icon display the stock icon with the id @stock_id. See gtk_status_icon_new_from_stock() for details.
Since: 2.10
Deprecated: 3.10: Use gtk_status_icon_set_from_icon_name() instead.

function.name: gtk_status_icon_set_has_tooltip
function.description:
Sets the has-tooltip property on @status_icon to @has_tooltip. See #GtkStatusIcon:has-tooltip for more information.
Since: 2.16

parameter.name: has_tooltip
parameter.parameter_description: whether or not @status_icon has a tooltip

function.name: gtk_status_icon_set_name
function.description:
Sets the name of this tray icon. This should be a string identifying this icon. It is may be used for sorting the icons in the tray and will not be shown to the user.
Since: 2.20

function.name: gtk_status_icon_set_screen
function.description:
Sets the #GdkScreen where @status_icon is displayed; if the icon is already mapped, it will be unmapped, and then remapped on the new screen.
Since: 2.12

function.name: gtk_status_icon_set_title
function.description:
Sets the title of this tray icon. This should be a short, human-readable, localized string describing the tray icon. It may be used by tools like screen readers to render the tray icon.
Since: 2.18

function.name: gtk_status_icon_set_tooltip_markup
function.description:
Sets @markup as the contents of the tooltip, which is marked up with the <link linkend="PangoMarkupFormat">Pango text markup language</link>.
This function will take care of setting #GtkStatusIcon:has-tooltip to %TRUE and of the default handler for the #GtkStatusIcon::query-tooltip signal.
See also the #GtkStatusIcon:tooltip-markup property and gtk_tooltip_set_markup().
Since: 2.16

parameter.name: markup
parameter.parameter_description: the contents of the tooltip for @status_icon, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_status_icon_set_tooltip_text
function.description:
Sets @text as the contents of the tooltip.
This function will take care of setting #GtkStatusIcon:has-tooltip to %TRUE and of the default handler for the #GtkStatusIcon::query-tooltip signal.
See also the #GtkStatusIcon:tooltip-text property and gtk_tooltip_set_text().
Since: 2.16

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: the contents of the tooltip for @status_icon

function.name: gtk_status_icon_set_visible
function.description:
Shows or hides a status icon.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: visible
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to show the status icon, %FALSE to hide it

function.name: gtk_statusbar_get_context_id
function.description: Returns a new context identifier, given a description of the actual context. Note that the description is <emphasis>not</emphasis> shown in the UI.

parameter.name: context_description
parameter.parameter_description: textual description of what context the new message is being used in

function.return: an integer id

function.name: gtk_statusbar_get_message_area
function.description:
Retrieves the box containing the label widget.
Since: 2.20
function.return: a #GtkBox

function.name: gtk_statusbar_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkStatusbar ready for messages.
function.return: the new #GtkStatusbar

function.name: gtk_statusbar_pop
function.description:
Removes the first message in the #GtkStatusbar's stack with the given context id.
Note that this may not change the displayed message, if the message at the top of the stack has a different context id.

function.name: gtk_statusbar_push
function.description: Pushes a new message onto a statusbar's stack.

parameter.name: context_id
parameter.parameter_description: the message's context id, as returned by gtk_statusbar_get_context_id()

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: the message to add to the statusbar

function.return: a message id that can be used with gtk_statusbar_remove().

function.name: gtk_statusbar_remove
function.description: Forces the removal of a message from a statusbar's stack. The exact @context_id and @message_id must be specified.

parameter.name: message_id
parameter.parameter_description: a message identifier, as returned by gtk_statusbar_push()

function.name: gtk_statusbar_remove_all
function.description:
Forces the removal of all messages from a statusbar's stack with the exact @context_id.
Since: 2.22

function.name: gtk_stock_add
function.description:
Registers each of the stock items in @items. If an item already exists with the same stock ID as one of the @items, the old item gets replaced. The stock items are copied, so GTK+ does not hold any pointer into @items and @items can be freed. Use gtk_stock_add_static() if @items is persistent and GTK+ need not copy the array.
Deprecated: 3.10

function.name: gtk_stock_add_static
gtk_stock_item_copy
function.description:
Copies a stock item, mostly useful for language bindings and not in applications.
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: a new #GtkStockItem

function.name: gtk_stock_item_free
function.description:
Frees a stock item allocated on the heap, such as one returned by gtk_stock_item_copy(). Also frees the fields inside the stock item, if they are not %NULL.
Deprecated: 3.10

function.name: gtk_stock_list_ids
function.description:
Retrieves a list of all known stock IDs added to a #GtkIconFactory or registered with gtk_stock_add(). The list must be freed with g_slist_free(), and each string in the list must be freed with g_free().
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: a list of known stock IDs

function.name: gtk_stock_lookup
function.description:
Fills @item with the registered values for @stock_id, returning %TRUE if @stock_id was known.
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: item
parameter.parameter_description: stock item to initialize with values

function.return: %TRUE if @item was initialized

function.name: gtk_stock_set_translate_func

parameter.name: domain
parameter.parameter_description: the translation domain for which @func shall be used

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: a #GDestroyNotify that is called when @data is no longer needed

function.name: gtk_style_apply_default_background
function.description: Deprecated:3.0: Use #GtkStyleContext instead

function.name: gtk_style_attach
function.description:
Attaches a style to a window; this process allocates the colors and creates the GC's for the style - it specializes it to a particular visual. The process may involve the creation of a new style if the style has already been attached to a window with a different style and visual.
Since this function may return a new object, you have to use it in the following way: <literal>style = gtk_style_attach (style, window)</literal>
Deprecated:3.0: Use gtk_widget_style_attach() instead
function.return: Either @style, or a newly-created #GtkStyle. If the style is newly created, the style parameter will be unref'ed, and the new style will have a reference count belonging to the caller.

function.name: gtk_style_context_add_class
function.description:
Adds a style class to @context, so posterior calls to gtk_style_context_get() or any of the gtk_render_*() functions will make use of this new class for styling.
In the CSS file format, a #GtkEntry defining an "entry" class, would be matched by:
<programlisting> GtkEntry.entry { ... } </programlisting>
While any widget defining an "entry" class would be matched by: <programlisting> .entry { ... } </programlisting>
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: class_name
parameter.parameter_description: class name to use in styling

function.name: gtk_style_context_add_provider
function.description:
Adds a style provider to @context, to be used in style construction. Note that a style provider added by this function only affects the style of the widget to which @context belongs. If you want to affect the style of all widgets, use gtk_style_context_add_provider_for_screen().
<note><para>If both priorities are the same, A #GtkStyleProvider added through this function takes precedence over another added through gtk_style_context_add_provider_for_screen().</para></note>
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: priority
parameter.parameter_description: the priority of the style provider. The lower it is, the earlier it will be used in the style construction. Typically this will be in the range between %GTK_STYLE_PROVIDER_PRIORITY_FALLBACK and %GTK_STYLE_PROVIDER_PRIORITY_USER

function.name: gtk_style_context_add_provider_for_screen
function.description:
Adds a global style provider to @screen, which will be used in style construction for all #GtkStyleContexts under @screen.
GTK+ uses this to make styling information from #GtkSettings available.
<note><para>If both priorities are the same, A #GtkStyleProvider added through gtk_style_context_add_provider() takes precedence over another added through this function.</para></note>
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: priority
parameter.parameter_description: the priority of the style provider. The lower it is, the earlier it will be used in the style construction. Typically this will be in the range between %GTK_STYLE_PROVIDER_PRIORITY_FALLBACK and %GTK_STYLE_PROVIDER_PRIORITY_USER

function.name: gtk_style_context_add_region
function.description:
Adds a region to @context, so posterior calls to gtk_style_context_get() or any of the gtk_render_*() functions will make use of this new region for styling.
In the CSS file format, a #GtkTreeView defining a "row" region, would be matched by:
<programlisting> GtkTreeView row { ... } </programlisting>
Pseudo-classes are used for matching @flags, so the two following rules: <programlisting> GtkTreeView row:nth-child(even) { ... } GtkTreeView row:nth-child(odd) { ... } </programlisting>
would apply to even and odd rows, respectively.
<note><para>Region names must only contain lowercase letters and '-', starting always with a lowercase letter.</para></note>
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: region_name
parameter.parameter_description: region name to use in styling

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: flags that apply to the region

function.name: gtk_style_context_cancel_animations
function.description:
Stops all running animations for @region_id and all animatable regions underneath.
A %NULL @region_id will stop all ongoing animations in @context, when dealing with a #GtkStyleContext obtained through gtk_widget_get_style_context(), this is normally done for you in all circumstances you would expect all widget to be stopped, so this should be only used in complex widgets with different animatable regions.
Since: 3.0
Deprecated: 3.6: This function does nothing.

parameter.name: region_id
parameter.parameter_description: animatable region to stop, or %NULL. See gtk_style_context_push_animatable_region()

function.name: gtk_style_context_get
function.description:
Retrieves several style property values from @context for a given state.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: state
parameter.parameter_description: state to retrieve the property values for

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: property name /return value pairs, followed by %NULL

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_background_color
function.description:
Gets the background color for a given state.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: state
parameter.parameter_description: state to retrieve the color for

parameter.name: color
parameter.parameter_description: return value for the background color

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_border
function.description:
Gets the border for a given state as a #GtkBorder. See %GTK_STYLE_PROPERTY_BORDER_WIDTH.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: state
parameter.parameter_description: state to retrieve the border for

parameter.name: border
parameter.parameter_description: return value for the border settings

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_border_color
function.description:
Gets the border color for a given state.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: state
parameter.parameter_description: state to retrieve the color for

parameter.name: color
parameter.parameter_description: return value for the border color

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_color
function.description:
Gets the foreground color for a given state.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: state
parameter.parameter_description: state to retrieve the color for

parameter.name: color
parameter.parameter_description: return value for the foreground color

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_direction
function.description:
Returns the widget direction used for rendering.
Since: 3.0
Deprecated: 3.8: Use gtk_style_context_get_state() and check for #GTK_STATE_FLAG_DIR_LTR and #GTK_STATE_FLAG_DIR_RTL instead.
function.return: the widget direction

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_font
function.description:
Returns the font description for a given state. The returned object is const and will remain valid until the #GtkStyleContext::changed signal happens.
Since: 3.0
Deprecated: 3.8: Use gtk_style_context_get() for "font" or subproperties instead.

parameter.name: state
parameter.parameter_description: state to retrieve the font for

function.return: the #PangoFontDescription for the given state. This object is owned by GTK+ and should not be freed.

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_frame_clock
function.description:
Returns the #GdkFrameClock to which @context is attached.
Since: 3.8
function.return: a #GdkFrameClock, or %NULL if @context does not have an attached frame clock.

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_junction_sides
function.description:
Returns the sides where rendered elements connect visually with others.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the junction sides

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_margin
function.description:
Gets the margin for a given state as a #GtkBorder. See %GTK_STYLE_PROPERTY_MARGIN.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: state
parameter.parameter_description: state to retrieve the border for

parameter.name: margin
parameter.parameter_description: return value for the margin settings

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_padding
function.description:
Gets the padding for a given state as a #GtkBorder. See %GTK_STYLE_PROPERTY_PADDING.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: state
parameter.parameter_description: state to retrieve the padding for

parameter.name: padding
parameter.parameter_description: return value for the padding settings

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_parent
function.description:
Gets the parent context set via gtk_style_context_set_parent(). See that function for details.
Since: 3.4
function.return: the parent context or %NULL

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_path
function.description:
Returns the widget path used for style matching.
Since: 3.0
function.return: A #GtkWidgetPath

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_property
function.description:
Gets a style property from @context for the given state.
When @value is no longer needed, g_value_unset() must be called to free any allocated memory.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: state
parameter.parameter_description: state to retrieve the property value for

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the style property value

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_scale
function.description:
Returns the scale used for assets.
Since: 3.10
function.return: the scale

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_screen
function.description: Returns the #GdkScreen to which @context is attached.
function.return: a #GdkScreen.

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_section
function.description:
Queries the location in the CSS where @property was defined for the current @context. Note that the state to be queried is taken from gtk_style_context_get_state().
If the location is not available, %NULL will be returned. The location might not be available for various reasons, such as the property being overridden, @property not naming a supported CSS property or tracking of definitions being disabled for performance reasons.
Shorthand CSS properties cannot be queried for a location and will always return %NULL.
function.return: %NULL or the section where value was defined

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_state
function.description:
Returns the state used when rendering.
Since: 3.0
function.return: the state flags

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_style
function.description:
Retrieves several widget style properties from @context according to the current style.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: property name /return value pairs, followed by %NULL

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_style_property
function.description:
Gets the value for a widget style property.
When @value is no longer needed, g_value_unset() must be called to free any allocated memory.

parameter.name: property_name
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the widget style property

parameter.name: value
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for the property value

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_style_valist
function.description:
Retrieves several widget style properties from @context according to the current style.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: args
parameter.parameter_description: va_list of property name/return location pairs, followed by %NULL

function.name: gtk_style_context_get_valist
function.description:
Retrieves several style property values from @context for a given state.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: state
parameter.parameter_description: state to retrieve the property values for

parameter.name: args
parameter.parameter_description: va_list of property name/return location pairs, followed by %NULL

function.name: gtk_style_context_has_class
function.description:
Returns %TRUE if @context currently has defined the given class name
Since: 3.0
function.return: %TRUE if @context has @class_name defined

function.name: gtk_style_context_has_region
function.description:
Returns %TRUE if @context has the region defined. If @flags_return is not %NULL, it is set to the flags affecting the region.
Since: 3.0
function.return: %TRUE if region is defined

function.name: gtk_style_context_invalidate
function.description:
Invalidates @context style information, so it will be reconstructed again.
If you're using a #GtkStyleContext returned from gtk_widget_get_style_context(), you do not need to call this yourself.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_style_context_list_classes
function.description:
Returns the list of classes currently defined in @context.
Since: 3.0
function.return: a #GList of strings with the currently defined classes. The contents of the list are owned by GTK+, but you must free the list itself with g_list_free() when you are done with it.

function.name: gtk_style_context_list_regions
function.description:
Returns the list of regions currently defined in @context.
Since: 3.0
function.return: a #GList of strings with the currently defined regions. The contents of the list are owned by GTK+, but you must free the list itself with g_list_free() when you are done with it.

function.name: gtk_style_context_lookup_color
function.description: Looks up and resolves a color name in the @context color map.

parameter.name: color
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for the looked up color

function.return: %TRUE if @color_name was found and resolved, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_style_context_lookup_icon_set
function.description:
Looks up @stock_id in the icon factories associated to @context and the default icon factory, returning an icon set if found, otherwise %NULL.
Deprecated: 3.10: Use gtk_icon_theme_lookup_icon() instead.
function.return: The looked up %GtkIconSet, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_style_context_new
function.description:
Creates a standalone #GtkStyleContext, this style context won't be attached to any widget, so you may want to call gtk_style_context_set_path() yourself.
<note> This function is only useful when using the theming layer separated from GTK+, if you are using #GtkStyleContext to theme #GtkWidget<!-- -->s, use gtk_widget_get_style_context() in order to get a style context ready to theme the widget. </note>
function.return: A newly created #GtkStyleContext.

function.name: gtk_style_context_notify_state_change
function.description:
Notifies a state change on @context, so if the current style makes use of transition animations, one will be started so all rendered elements under @region_id are animated for state @state being set to value @state_value.
The @window parameter is used in order to invalidate the rendered area as the animation runs, so make sure it is the same window that is being rendered on by the gtk_render_*() functions.
If @region_id is %NULL, all rendered elements using @context will be affected by this state transition.
As a practical example, a #GtkButton notifying a state transition on the prelight state: <programlisting> gtk_style_context_notify_state_change (context, gtk_widget_get_window (widget), NULL, GTK_STATE_PRELIGHT, button->in_button); </programlisting>
Can be handled in the CSS file like this: <programlisting> GtkButton { background-color: #f00 }
GtkButton:hover { background-color: #fff; transition: 200ms linear } </programlisting>
This combination will animate the button background from red to white if a pointer enters the button, and back to red if the pointer leaves the button.
Note that @state is used when finding the transition parameters, which is why the style places the transition under the :hover pseudo-class.
Since: 3.0
Deprecated: 3.6: This function does nothing.

parameter.name: region_id
parameter.parameter_description: animatable region to notify on, or %NULL. See gtk_style_context_push_animatable_region()

parameter.name: state_value
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if @state is the state we are changing to, %FALSE if we are changing away from it

function.name: gtk_style_context_pop_animatable_region
function.description:
Pops an animatable region from @context. See gtk_style_context_push_animatable_region().
Since: 3.0
Deprecated: 3.6: This function does nothing.

function.name: gtk_style_context_push_animatable_region
function.description:
Pushes an animatable region, so all further gtk_render_*() calls between this call and the following gtk_style_context_pop_animatable_region() will potentially show transition animations for this region if gtk_style_context_notify_state_change() is called for a given state, and the current theme/style defines transition animations for state changes.
The @region_id used must be unique in @context so the theming engine can uniquely identify rendered elements subject to a state transition.
Since: 3.0
Deprecated: 3.6: This function does nothing.

parameter.name: region_id
parameter.parameter_description: unique identifier for the animatable region

function.name: gtk_style_context_remove_class
function.description:
Removes @class_name from @context.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_style_context_remove_provider
function.description:
Removes @provider from the style providers list in @context.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_style_context_remove_provider_for_screen
function.description:
Removes @provider from the global style providers list in @screen.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_style_context_remove_region
function.description:
Removes a region from @context.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_style_context_reset_widgets
function.description:
This function recomputes the styles for all widgets under a particular #GdkScreen. This is useful when some global parameter has changed that affects the appearance of all widgets, because when a widget gets a new style, it will both redraw and recompute any cached information about its appearance. As an example, it is used when the color scheme changes in the related #GtkSettings object.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_style_context_restore
function.description:
Restores @context state to a previous stage. See gtk_style_context_save().
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_style_context_save
function.description:
Saves the @context state, so all modifications done through gtk_style_context_add_class(), gtk_style_context_remove_class(), gtk_style_context_add_region(), gtk_style_context_remove_region() or gtk_style_context_set_junction_sides() can be reverted in one go through gtk_style_context_restore().
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_style_context_scroll_animations
function.description:
This function is analogous to gdk_window_scroll(), and should be called together with it so the invalidation areas for any ongoing animation are scrolled together with it.
Since: 3.0
Deprecated: 3.6: This function does nothing.

parameter.name: dx
parameter.parameter_description: Amount to scroll in the X axis

parameter.name: dy
parameter.parameter_description: Amount to scroll in the Y axis

function.name: gtk_style_context_set_background
function.description:
Sets the background of @window to the background pattern or color specified in @context for its current state.
Since: 3.0

function.name: gtk_style_context_set_direction
function.description:
Sets the reading direction for rendering purposes.
If you are using a #GtkStyleContext returned from gtk_widget_get_style_context(), you do not need to call this yourself.
Since: 3.0
Deprecated: 3.8: Use gtk_style_context_set_state() with #GTK_STATE_FLAG_DIR_LTR and #GTK_STATE_FLAG_DIR_RTL instead.

function.name: gtk_style_context_set_frame_clock
function.description:
Attaches @context to the given frame clock.
The frame clock is used for the timing of animations.
If you are using a #GtkStyleContext returned from gtk_widget_get_style_context(), you do not need to call this yourself.
Since: 3.8

function.name: gtk_style_context_set_junction_sides
function.description:
Sets the sides where rendered elements (mostly through gtk_render_frame()) will visually connect with other visual elements.
This is merely a hint that may or may not be honored by theming engines.
Container widgets are expected to set junction hints as appropriate for their children, so it should not normally be necessary to call this function manually.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: sides
parameter.parameter_description: sides where rendered elements are visually connected to other elements

function.name: gtk_style_context_set_parent
function.description:
