parameter.parameter_description: the name of the themed icon

function.name: gtk_tool_button_set_icon_widget
function.description:
Sets @icon as the widget used as icon on @button. If @icon_widget is %NULL the icon is determined by the "stock_id" property. If the "stock_id" property is also %NULL, @button will not have an icon.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: icon_widget
parameter.parameter_description: the widget used as icon, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tool_button_set_label
function.description:
Sets @label as the label used for the tool button. The "label" property only has an effect if not overridden by a non-%NULL "label_widget" property. If both the "label_widget" and "label" properties are %NULL, the label is determined by the "stock_id" property. If the "stock_id" property is also %NULL, @button will not have a label.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: a string that will be used as label, or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_tool_button_set_label_widget
function.description:
Sets @label_widget as the widget that will be used as the label for @button. If @label_widget is %NULL the "label" property is used as label. If "label" is also %NULL, the label in the stock item determined by the "stock_id" property is used as label. If "stock_id" is also %NULL, @button does not have a label.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: label_widget
parameter.parameter_description: the widget used as label, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tool_button_set_stock_id
function.description:
Sets the name of the stock item. See gtk_tool_button_new_from_stock(). The stock_id property only has an effect if not overridden by non-%NULL "label" and "icon_widget" properties.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10: Use gtk_tool_button_set_icon_name() instead.

parameter.name: stock_id
parameter.parameter_description: a name of a stock item, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tool_button_set_use_underline
function.description:
If set, an underline in the label property indicates that the next character should be used for the mnemonic accelerator key in the overflow menu. For example, if the label property is "_Open" and @use_underline is %TRUE, the label on the tool button will be "Open" and the item on the overflow menu will have an underlined 'O'.
Labels shown on tool buttons never have mnemonics on them; this property only affects the menu item on the overflow menu.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: use_underline
parameter.parameter_description: whether the button label has the form "_Open"

function.name: gtk_tool_item_get_ellipsize_mode
function.description:
Returns the ellipsize mode used for @tool_item. Custom subclasses of #GtkToolItem should call this function to find out how text should be ellipsized.
Since: 2.20
function.return: a #PangoEllipsizeMode indicating how text in @tool_item should be ellipsized.

function.name: gtk_tool_item_get_expand
function.description:
Returns whether @tool_item is allocated extra space. See gtk_tool_item_set_expand().
Since: 2.4
function.return: %TRUE if @tool_item is allocated extra space.

function.name: gtk_tool_item_get_homogeneous
function.description:
Returns whether @tool_item is the same size as other homogeneous items. See gtk_tool_item_set_homogeneous().
Since: 2.4
function.return: %TRUE if the item is the same size as other homogeneous items.

function.name: gtk_tool_item_get_icon_size
function.description:
Returns the icon size used for @tool_item. Custom subclasses of #GtkToolItem should call this function to find out what size icons they should use.
Since: 2.4
function.return: a #GtkIconSize indicating the icon size used for @tool_item

function.name: gtk_tool_item_get_is_important
function.description:
Returns whether @tool_item is considered important. See gtk_tool_item_set_is_important()
Since: 2.4
function.return: %TRUE if @tool_item is considered important.

function.name: gtk_tool_item_get_orientation
function.description:
Returns the orientation used for @tool_item. Custom subclasses of #GtkToolItem should call this function to find out what size icons they should use.
Since: 2.4
function.return: a #GtkOrientation indicating the orientation used for @tool_item

function.name: gtk_tool_item_get_proxy_menu_item
function.description:
If @menu_item_id matches the string passed to gtk_tool_item_set_proxy_menu_item() return the corresponding #GtkMenuItem.
Custom subclasses of #GtkToolItem should use this function to update their menu item when the #GtkToolItem changes. That the @menu_item_id<!-- -->s must match ensures that a #GtkToolItem will not inadvertently change a menu item that they did not create.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: menu_item_id
parameter.parameter_description: a string used to identify the menu item

function.return: The #GtkMenuItem passed to gtk_tool_item_set_proxy_menu_item(), if the @menu_item_id<!-- -->s match.

function.name: gtk_tool_item_get_relief_style
function.description:
Returns the relief style of @tool_item. See gtk_button_set_relief(). Custom subclasses of #GtkToolItem should call this function in the handler of the #GtkToolItem::toolbar_reconfigured signal to find out the relief style of buttons.
Since: 2.4
function.return: a #GtkReliefStyle indicating the relief style used for @tool_item.

function.name: gtk_tool_item_get_text_alignment
function.description:
Returns the text alignment used for @tool_item. Custom subclasses of #GtkToolItem should call this function to find out how text should be aligned.
Since: 2.20
function.return: a #gfloat indicating the horizontal text alignment used for @tool_item

function.name: gtk_tool_item_get_text_orientation
function.description:
Returns the text orientation used for @tool_item. Custom subclasses of #GtkToolItem should call this function to find out how text should be orientated.
Since: 2.20
function.return: a #GtkOrientation indicating the text orientation used for @tool_item

function.name: gtk_tool_item_get_text_size_group
function.description:
Returns the size group used for labels in @tool_item. Custom subclasses of #GtkToolItem should call this function and use the size group for labels.
Since: 2.20
function.return: a #GtkSizeGroup

function.name: gtk_tool_item_get_toolbar_style
function.description:
Returns the toolbar style used for @tool_item. Custom subclasses of #GtkToolItem should call this function in the handler of the GtkToolItem::toolbar_reconfigured signal to find out in what style the toolbar is displayed and change themselves accordingly
Possibilities are: <itemizedlist> <listitem> GTK_TOOLBAR_BOTH, meaning the tool item should show both an icon and a label, stacked vertically </listitem> <listitem> GTK_TOOLBAR_ICONS, meaning the toolbar shows only icons </listitem> <listitem> GTK_TOOLBAR_TEXT, meaning the tool item should only show text</listitem> <listitem> GTK_TOOLBAR_BOTH_HORIZ, meaning the tool item should show both an icon and a label, arranged horizontally</listitem> </itemizedlist>
Since: 2.4
function.return: A #GtkToolbarStyle indicating the toolbar style used for @tool_item.

function.name: gtk_tool_item_get_use_drag_window
function.description:
Returns whether @tool_item has a drag window. See gtk_tool_item_set_use_drag_window().
Since: 2.4
function.return: %TRUE if @tool_item uses a drag window.

function.name: gtk_tool_item_get_visible_horizontal
function.description:
Returns whether the @tool_item is visible on toolbars that are docked horizontally.
Since: 2.4
function.return: %TRUE if @tool_item is visible on toolbars that are docked horizontally.

function.name: gtk_tool_item_get_visible_vertical
function.description:
Returns whether @tool_item is visible when the toolbar is docked vertically. See gtk_tool_item_set_visible_vertical().
Since: 2.4
function.return: Whether @tool_item is visible when the toolbar is docked vertically

function.name: gtk_tool_item_group_get_collapsed
function.description:
Gets whether @group is collapsed or expanded.
Since: 2.20
function.return: %TRUE if @group is collapsed, %FALSE if it is expanded

function.name: gtk_tool_item_group_get_drop_item
function.description:
Gets the tool item at position (x, y).
Since: 2.20
function.return: the #GtkToolItem at position (x, y)

function.name: gtk_tool_item_group_get_ellipsize
function.description:
Gets the ellipsization mode of @group.
Since: 2.20
function.return: the #PangoEllipsizeMode of @group

function.name: gtk_tool_item_group_get_header_relief
function.description:
Gets the relief mode of the header button of @group.
Since: 2.20
function.return: the #GtkReliefStyle

function.name: gtk_tool_item_group_get_item_position
function.description:
Gets the position of @item in @group as index.
Since: 2.20
function.return: the index of @item in @group or -1 if @item is no child of @group

function.name: gtk_tool_item_group_get_label
function.description:
Gets the label of @group.
Since: 2.20
function.return: the label of @group. The label is an internal string of @group and must not be modified. Note that %NULL is returned if a custom label has been set with gtk_tool_item_group_set_label_widget()

function.name: gtk_tool_item_group_get_label_widget
function.description:
Gets the label widget of @group. See gtk_tool_item_group_set_label_widget().
Since: 2.20
function.return: the label widget of @group

function.name: gtk_tool_item_group_get_n_items
function.description:
Gets the number of tool items in @group.
Since: 2.20
function.return: the number of tool items in @group

function.name: gtk_tool_item_group_get_nth_item
function.description:
Gets the tool item at @index in group.
Since: 2.20
function.return: the #GtkToolItem at index

function.name: gtk_tool_item_group_insert
function.description:
Inserts @item at @position in the list of children of @group.
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the position of @item in @group, starting with 0. The position -1 means end of list.

function.name: gtk_tool_item_group_new
function.description:
Creates a new tool item group with label @label.
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: the label of the new group

function.return: a new #GtkToolItemGroup.

function.name: gtk_tool_item_group_set_collapsed
function.description:
Sets whether the @group should be collapsed or expanded.
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: collapsed
parameter.parameter_description: whether the @group should be collapsed or expanded

function.name: gtk_tool_item_group_set_ellipsize
function.description:
Sets the ellipsization mode which should be used by labels in @group.
Since: 2.20

function.name: gtk_tool_item_group_set_header_relief
function.description:
Set the button relief of the group header. See gtk_button_set_relief() for details.
Since: 2.20

function.name: gtk_tool_item_group_set_item_position
function.description:
Sets the position of @item in the list of children of @group.
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: item
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkToolItem to move to a new position, should be a child of @group.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: the new position of @item in @group, starting with 0. The position -1 means end of list.

function.name: gtk_tool_item_group_set_label
function.description:
Sets the label of the tool item group. The label is displayed in the header of the group.
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: the new human-readable label of of the group

function.name: gtk_tool_item_group_set_label_widget
function.description:
Sets the label of the tool item group. The label widget is displayed in the header of the group, in place of the usual label.
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: label_widget
parameter.parameter_description: the widget to be displayed in place of the usual label

function.name: gtk_tool_item_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkToolItem
Since: 2.4
function.return: the new #GtkToolItem

function.name: gtk_tool_item_rebuild_menu
function.description:
Calling this function signals to the toolbar that the overflow menu item for @tool_item has changed. If the overflow menu is visible when this function it called, the menu will be rebuilt.
The function must be called when the tool item changes what it will do in response to the #GtkToolItem::create-menu-proxy signal.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_tool_item_retrieve_proxy_menu_item
function.description:
Returns the #GtkMenuItem that was last set by gtk_tool_item_set_proxy_menu_item(), ie. the #GtkMenuItem that is going to appear in the overflow menu.
Since: 2.4
function.return: The #GtkMenuItem that is going to appear in the overflow menu for @tool_item.

function.name: gtk_tool_item_set_expand
function.description:
Sets whether @tool_item is allocated extra space when there is more room on the toolbar then needed for the items. The effect is that the item gets bigger when the toolbar gets bigger and smaller when the toolbar gets smaller.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_tool_item_set_homogeneous
function.description:
Sets whether @tool_item is to be allocated the same size as other homogeneous items. The effect is that all homogeneous items will have the same width as the widest of the items.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: homogeneous
parameter.parameter_description: whether @tool_item is the same size as other homogeneous items

function.name: gtk_tool_item_set_is_important
function.description:
Sets whether @tool_item should be considered important. The #GtkToolButton class uses this property to determine whether to show or hide its label when the toolbar style is %GTK_TOOLBAR_BOTH_HORIZ. The result is that only tool buttons with the "is_important" property set have labels, an effect known as "priority text"
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: is_important
parameter.parameter_description: whether the tool item should be considered important

function.name: gtk_tool_item_set_proxy_menu_item
function.description:
Sets the #GtkMenuItem used in the toolbar overflow menu. The @menu_item_id is used to identify the caller of this function and should also be used with gtk_tool_item_get_proxy_menu_item().
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: menu_item
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkMenuItem to be used in the overflow menu

function.name: gtk_tool_item_set_tooltip_markup
function.description:
Sets the markup text to be displayed as tooltip on the item. See gtk_widget_set_tooltip_markup().
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: markup
parameter.parameter_description: markup text to be used as tooltip for @tool_item

function.name: gtk_tool_item_set_tooltip_text
function.description:
Sets the text to be displayed as tooltip on the item. See gtk_widget_set_tooltip_text().
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: text
parameter.parameter_description: text to be used as tooltip for @tool_item

function.name: gtk_tool_item_set_use_drag_window
function.description:
Sets whether @tool_item has a drag window. When %TRUE the toolitem can be used as a drag source through gtk_drag_source_set(). When @tool_item has a drag window it will intercept all events, even those that would otherwise be sent to a child of @tool_item.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_tool_item_set_visible_horizontal
function.description:
Sets whether @tool_item is visible when the toolbar is docked horizontally.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: visible_horizontal
parameter.parameter_description: Whether @tool_item is visible when in horizontal mode

function.name: gtk_tool_item_set_visible_vertical
function.description:
Sets whether @tool_item is visible when the toolbar is docked vertically. Some tool items, such as text entries, are too wide to be useful on a vertically docked toolbar. If @visible_vertical is %FALSE @tool_item will not appear on toolbars that are docked vertically.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: visible_vertical
parameter.parameter_description: whether @tool_item is visible when the toolbar is in vertical mode

function.name: gtk_tool_item_toolbar_reconfigured
function.description:
Emits the signal #GtkToolItem::toolbar_reconfigured on @tool_item. #GtkToolbar and other #GtkToolShell implementations use this function to notify children, when some aspect of their configuration changes.
Since: 2.14

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_add_drag_dest
function.description:
Sets @palette as drag source (see gtk_tool_palette_set_drag_source()) and sets @widget as a drag destination for drags from @palette. See gtk_drag_dest_set().
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkWidget which should be a drag destination for @palette

parameter.name: flags
parameter.parameter_description: the flags that specify what actions GTK+ should take for drops on that widget

parameter.name: targets
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkToolPaletteDragTargets which the widget should support

parameter.name: actions
parameter.parameter_description: the #GdkDragAction<!-- -->s which the widget should suppport

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_get_drag_item
function.description:
Get the dragged item from the selection. This could be a #GtkToolItem or a #GtkToolItemGroup.
Since: 2.20
function.return: the dragged item in selection

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_get_drag_target_group
function.description:
Get the target entry for a dragged #GtkToolItemGroup.
Since: 2.20
function.return: the #GtkTargetEntry for a dragged group

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_get_drag_target_item
function.description:
Gets the target entry for a dragged #GtkToolItem.
Since: 2.20
function.return: the #GtkTargetEntry for a dragged item.

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_get_drop_group
function.description:
Gets the group at position (x, y).
Since: 2.20
function.return: the #GtkToolItemGroup at position or %NULL if there is no such group

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_get_drop_item
function.description:
Gets the item at position (x, y). See gtk_tool_palette_get_drop_group().
Since: 2.20
function.return: the #GtkToolItem at position or %NULL if there is no such item

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_get_exclusive
function.description:
Gets whether @group is exclusive or not. See gtk_tool_palette_set_exclusive().
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: group
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkToolItemGroup which is a child of palette

function.return: %TRUE if @group is exclusive

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_get_expand
function.description:
Gets whether group should be given extra space. See gtk_tool_palette_set_expand().
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: group
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkToolItemGroup which is a child of palette

function.return: %TRUE if group should be given extra space, %FALSE otherwise

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_get_group_position
function.description:
Gets the position of @group in @palette as index. See gtk_tool_palette_set_group_position().
Since: 2.20
function.return: the index of group or -1 if @group is not a child of @palette

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_get_hadjustment
function.description:
Gets the horizontal adjustment of the tool palette.
Since: 2.20
Deprecated: 3.0: Use gtk_scrollable_get_hadjustment()
function.return: the horizontal adjustment of @palette

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_get_icon_size
function.description:
Gets the size of icons in the tool palette. See gtk_tool_palette_set_icon_size().
Since: 2.20
function.return: the #GtkIconSize of icons in the tool palette

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_get_style
function.description:
Gets the style (icons, text or both) of items in the tool palette.
Since: 2.20
function.return: the #GtkToolbarStyle of items in the tool palette.

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_get_vadjustment
function.description:
Gets the vertical adjustment of the tool palette.
Since: 2.20
Deprecated: 3.0: Use gtk_scrollable_get_vadjustment()
function.return: the vertical adjustment of @palette

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_new
function.description:
Creates a new tool palette.
Since: 2.20
function.return: a new #GtkToolPalette

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_set_drag_source
function.description:
Sets the tool palette as a drag source. Enables all groups and items in the tool palette as drag sources on button 1 and button 3 press with copy and move actions. See gtk_drag_source_set().
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: targets
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkToolPaletteDragTargets which the widget should support

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_set_exclusive
function.description:
Sets whether the group should be exclusive or not. If an exclusive group is expanded all other groups are collapsed.
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: group
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkToolItemGroup which is a child of palette

parameter.name: exclusive
parameter.parameter_description: whether the group should be exclusive or not

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_set_expand
function.description:
Sets whether the group should be given extra space.
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: group
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkToolItemGroup which is a child of palette

parameter.name: expand
parameter.parameter_description: whether the group should be given extra space

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_set_group_position
function.description:
Sets the position of the group as an index of the tool palette. If position is 0 the group will become the first child, if position is -1 it will become the last child.
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: group
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkToolItemGroup which is a child of palette

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_set_icon_size
function.description:
Sets the size of icons in the tool palette.
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: icon_size
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkIconSize that icons in the tool palette shall have

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_set_style
function.description:
Sets the style (text, icons or both) of items in the tool palette.
Since: 2.20

parameter.name: style
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkToolbarStyle that items in the tool palette shall have

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_unset_icon_size
function.description:
Unsets the tool palette icon size set with gtk_tool_palette_set_icon_size(), so that user preferences will be used to determine the icon size.
Since: 2.20

function.name: gtk_tool_palette_unset_style
function.description:
Unsets a toolbar style set with gtk_tool_palette_set_style(), so that user preferences will be used to determine the toolbar style.
Since: 2.20

function.name: gtk_tool_shell_get_ellipsize_mode
function.description:
Retrieves the current ellipsize mode for the tool shell. Tool items must not call this function directly, but rely on gtk_tool_item_get_ellipsize_mode() instead.
Since: 2.20
function.return: the current ellipsize mode of @shell

function.name: gtk_tool_shell_get_icon_size
function.description:
Retrieves the icon size for the tool shell. Tool items must not call this function directly, but rely on gtk_tool_item_get_icon_size() instead.
Since: 2.14
function.return: the current size for icons of @shell

function.name: gtk_tool_shell_get_orientation
function.description:
Retrieves the current orientation for the tool shell. Tool items must not call this function directly, but rely on gtk_tool_item_get_orientation() instead.
Since: 2.14
function.return: the current orientation of @shell

function.name: gtk_tool_shell_get_relief_style
function.description:
Returns the relief style of buttons on @shell. Tool items must not call this function directly, but rely on gtk_tool_item_get_relief_style() instead.
Since: 2.14
function.return: The relief style of buttons on @shell.

function.name: gtk_tool_shell_get_style
function.description:
Retrieves whether the tool shell has text, icons, or both. Tool items must not call this function directly, but rely on gtk_tool_item_get_toolbar_style() instead.
Since: 2.14
function.return: the current style of @shell

function.name: gtk_tool_shell_get_text_alignment
function.description:
Retrieves the current text alignment for the tool shell. Tool items must not call this function directly, but rely on gtk_tool_item_get_text_alignment() instead.
Since: 2.20
function.return: the current text alignment of @shell

function.name: gtk_tool_shell_get_text_orientation
function.description:
Retrieves the current text orientation for the tool shell. Tool items must not call this function directly, but rely on gtk_tool_item_get_text_orientation() instead.
Since: 2.20
function.return: the current text orientation of @shell

function.name: gtk_tool_shell_get_text_size_group
function.description:
Retrieves the current text size group for the tool shell. Tool items must not call this function directly, but rely on gtk_tool_item_get_text_size_group() instead.
Since: 2.20
function.return: the current text size group of @shell

function.name: gtk_tool_shell_rebuild_menu
function.description:
Calling this function signals the tool shell that the overflow menu item for tool items have changed. If there is an overflow menu and if it is visible when this function it called, the menu will be rebuilt.
Tool items must not call this function directly, but rely on gtk_tool_item_rebuild_menu() instead.
Since: 2.14

function.name: gtk_toolbar_get_drop_index

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: x coordinate of a point on the toolbar

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: y coordinate of a point on the toolbar

function.return: The position corresponding to the point (@x, @y) on the toolbar.

function.name: gtk_toolbar_get_icon_size
function.description: Retrieves the icon size for the toolbar. See gtk_toolbar_set_icon_size().
function.return: the current icon size for the icons on the toolbar.

function.name: gtk_toolbar_get_item_index
function.description:
Returns the position of @item on the toolbar, starting from 0. It is an error if @item is not a child of the toolbar.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: item
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkToolItem that is a child of @toolbar

function.return: the position of item on the toolbar.

function.name: gtk_toolbar_get_n_items
function.description:
Returns the number of items on the toolbar.
Since: 2.4
function.return: the number of items on the toolbar

function.name: gtk_toolbar_get_nth_item
function.description:
Returns the @n<!-- -->'th item on @toolbar, or %NULL if the toolbar does not contain an @n<!-- -->'th item.
Since: 2.4
function.return: The @n<!-- -->'th #GtkToolItem on @toolbar, or %NULL if there isn't an @n<!-- -->'th item.

function.name: gtk_toolbar_get_relief_style
function.description:
Returns the relief style of buttons on @toolbar. See gtk_button_set_relief().
Since: 2.4
function.return: The relief style of buttons on @toolbar.

function.name: gtk_toolbar_get_show_arrow
function.description:
Returns whether the toolbar has an overflow menu. See gtk_toolbar_set_show_arrow().
Since: 2.4
function.return: %TRUE if the toolbar has an overflow menu.

function.name: gtk_toolbar_get_style
function.description: Retrieves whether the toolbar has text, icons, or both . See gtk_toolbar_set_style().
function.return: the current style of @toolbar

function.name: gtk_toolbar_insert
function.description:
Insert a #GtkToolItem into the toolbar at position @pos. If @pos is 0 the item is prepended to the start of the toolbar. If @pos is negative, the item is appended to the end of the toolbar.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: pos
parameter.parameter_description: the position of the new item

function.name: gtk_toolbar_new
function.description: Creates a new toolbar.
function.return: the newly-created toolbar.

function.name: gtk_toolbar_set_drop_highlight_item
function.description:
Highlights @toolbar to give an idea of what it would look like if @item was added to @toolbar at the position indicated by @index_. If @item is %NULL, highlighting is turned off. In that case @index_ is ignored.
The @tool_item passed to this function must not be part of any widget hierarchy. When an item is set as drop highlight item it can not added to any widget hierarchy or used as highlight item for another toolbar.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: tool_item
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkToolItem, or %NULL to turn of highlighting

function.name: gtk_toolbar_set_icon_size
function.description:
This function sets the size of stock icons in the toolbar. You can call it both before you add the icons and after they've been added. The size you set will override user preferences for the default icon size.
This should only be used for special-purpose toolbars, normal application toolbars should respect the user preferences for the size of icons.

parameter.name: icon_size
parameter.parameter_description: The #GtkIconSize that stock icons in the toolbar shall have.

function.name: gtk_toolbar_set_show_arrow
function.description:
Sets whether to show an overflow menu when @toolbar doesn't have room for all items on it. If %TRUE, items that there are not room are available through an overflow menu.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: show_arrow
parameter.parameter_description: Whether to show an overflow menu

function.name: gtk_toolbar_set_style
function.description: Alters the view of @toolbar to display either icons only, text only, or both.

function.name: gtk_toolbar_unset_icon_size
function.description: Unsets toolbar icon size set with gtk_toolbar_set_icon_size(), so that user preferences will be used to determine the icon size.

function.name: gtk_toolbar_unset_style
function.description: Unsets a toolbar style set with gtk_toolbar_set_style(), so that user preferences will be used to determine the toolbar style.

function.name: gtk_tooltip_set_custom
function.description:
Replaces the widget packed into the tooltip with @custom_widget. @custom_widget does not get destroyed when the tooltip goes away. By default a box with a #GtkImage and #GtkLabel is embedded in the tooltip, which can be configured using gtk_tooltip_set_markup() and gtk_tooltip_set_icon().
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: custom_widget
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkWidget, or %NULL to unset the old custom widget.

function.name: gtk_tooltip_set_icon
gtk_tooltip_set_icon_from_gicon
function.description:
Sets the icon of the tooltip (which is in front of the text) to be the icon indicated by @gicon with the size indicated by @size. If @gicon is %NULL, the image will be hidden.
Since: 2.20

function.name: gtk_tooltip_set_icon_from_icon_name
function.description:
Sets the icon of the tooltip (which is in front of the text) to be the icon indicated by @icon_name with the size indicated by @size. If @icon_name is %NULL, the image will be hidden.
Since: 2.14

function.name: gtk_tooltip_set_icon_from_stock
function.description:
Sets the icon of the tooltip (which is in front of the text) to be the stock item indicated by @stock_id with the size indicated by @size. If @stock_id is %NULL, the image will be hidden.
Since: 2.12
Deprecated: 3.10: Use gtk_tooltip_set_icon_from_icon_name() instead.

function.name: gtk_tooltip_set_markup
function.description:
Sets the text of the tooltip to be @markup, which is marked up with the <link linkend="PangoMarkupFormat">Pango text markup language</link>. If @markup is %NULL, the label will be hidden.
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: markup
parameter.parameter_description: a markup string (see <link linkend="PangoMarkupFormat">Pango markup format</link>) or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tooltip_set_text
function.description:
Sets the text of the tooltip to be @text. If @text is %NULL, the label will be hidden. See also gtk_tooltip_set_markup().
Since: 2.12

function.name: gtk_tooltip_set_tip_area
function.description:
Sets the area of the widget, where the contents of this tooltip apply, to be @rect (in widget coordinates). This is especially useful for properly setting tooltips on #GtkTreeView rows and cells, #GtkIconViews, etc.
For setting tooltips on #GtkTreeView, please refer to the convenience functions for this: gtk_tree_view_set_tooltip_row() and gtk_tree_view_set_tooltip_cell().
Since: 2.12

function.name: gtk_tooltip_trigger_tooltip_query
function.description:
Triggers a new tooltip query on @display, in order to update the current visible tooltip, or to show/hide the current tooltip. This function is useful to call when, for example, the state of the widget changed by a key press.
Since: 2.12

function.name: gtk_tree_drag_dest_drag_data_received
function.description: Asks the #GtkTreeDragDest to insert a row before the path @dest, deriving the contents of the row from @selection_data. If @dest is outside the tree so that inserting before it is impossible, %FALSE will be returned. Also, %FALSE may be returned if the new row is not created for some model-specific reason. Should robustly handle a @dest no longer found in the model!

parameter.name: dest
parameter.parameter_description: row to drop in front of

function.return: whether a new row was created before position @dest

function.name: gtk_tree_drag_dest_row_drop_possible
function.description: Determines whether a drop is possible before the given @dest_path, at the same depth as @dest_path. i.e., can we drop the data in @selection_data at that location. @dest_path does not have to exist; the return value will almost certainly be %FALSE if the parent of @dest_path doesn't exist, though.
function.return: %TRUE if a drop is possible before @dest_path

function.name: gtk_tree_drag_source_drag_data_delete
function.description: Asks the #GtkTreeDragSource to delete the row at @path, because it was moved somewhere else via drag-and-drop. Returns %FALSE if the deletion fails because @path no longer exists, or for some model-specific reason. Should robustly handle a @path no longer found in the model!
function.return: %TRUE if the row was successfully deleted

function.name: gtk_tree_drag_source_drag_data_get
function.description: Asks the #GtkTreeDragSource to fill in @selection_data with a representation of the row at @path. @selection_data->target gives the required type of the data. Should robustly handle a @path no longer found in the model!

parameter.name: selection_data
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkSelectionData to fill with data from the dragged row

function.return: %TRUE if data of the required type was provided

function.name: gtk_tree_drag_source_row_draggable
function.description: Asks the #GtkTreeDragSource whether a particular row can be used as the source of a DND operation. If the source doesn't implement this interface, the row is assumed draggable.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: row on which user is initiating a drag

function.return: %TRUE if the row can be dragged

function.name: gtk_tree_get_row_drag_data
function.description: Obtains a @tree_model and @path from selection data of target type %GTK_TREE_MODEL_ROW. Normally called from a drag_data_received handler. This function can only be used if @selection_data originates from the same process that's calling this function, because a pointer to the tree model is being passed around. If you aren't in the same process, then you'll get memory corruption. In the #GtkTreeDragDest drag_data_received handler, you can assume that selection data of type %GTK_TREE_MODEL_ROW is in from the current process. The returned path must be freed with gtk_tree_path_free().
function.return: %TRUE if @selection_data had target type %GTK_TREE_MODEL_ROW and is otherwise valid

function.name: gtk_tree_iter_copy
function.description:
Creates a dynamically allocated tree iterator as a copy of @iter.
This function is not intended for use in applications, because you can just copy the structs by value (<literal>GtkTreeIter new_iter = iter;</literal>). You must free this iter with gtk_tree_iter_free().
function.return: a newly-allocated copy of @iter

function.name: gtk_tree_iter_free
function.description:
Frees an iterator that has been allocated by gtk_tree_iter_copy().
This function is mainly used for language bindings.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_clear_cache
function.description:
This function should almost never be called. It clears the @filter of any cached iterators that haven't been reffed with gtk_tree_model_ref_node(). This might be useful if the child model being filtered is static (and doesn't change often) and there has been a lot of unreffed access to nodes. As a side effect of this function, all unreffed iters will be invalid.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_convert_child_iter_to_iter
function.description:
Sets @filter_iter to point to the row in @filter that corresponds to the row pointed at by @child_iter. If @filter_iter was not set, %FALSE is returned.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: child_iter
parameter.parameter_description: A valid #GtkTreeIter pointing to a row on the child model.

function.return: %TRUE, if @filter_iter was set, i.e. if @child_iter is a valid iterator pointing to a visible row in child model.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_convert_child_path_to_path
function.description:
Converts @child_path to a path relative to @filter. That is, @child_path points to a path in the child model. The rerturned path will point to the same row in the filtered model. If @child_path isn't a valid path on the child model or points to a row which is not visible in @filter, then %NULL is returned.
Since: 2.4
function.return: A newly allocated #GtkTreePath, or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_convert_iter_to_child_iter
function.description:
Sets @child_iter to point to the row pointed to by @filter_iter.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: filter_iter
parameter.parameter_description: A valid #GtkTreeIter pointing to a row on @filter.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_convert_path_to_child_path
function.description:
Converts @filter_path to a path on the child model of @filter. That is, @filter_path points to a location in @filter. The returned path will point to the same location in the model not being filtered. If @filter_path does not point to a location in the child model, %NULL is returned.
Since: 2.4
function.return: A newly allocated #GtkTreePath, or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_get_model
function.description:
Returns a pointer to the child model of @filter.
Since: 2.4
function.return: A pointer to a #GtkTreeModel.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkTreeModel, with @child_model as the child_model and @root as the virtual root.
Since: 2.4
function.return: A new #GtkTreeModel.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_refilter
function.description:
Emits ::row_changed for each row in the child model, which causes the filter to re-evaluate whether a row is visible or not.
Since: 2.4

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_set_modify_func
function.description:
With the @n_columns and @types parameters, you give an array of column types for this model (which will be exposed to the parent model/view). The @func, @data and @destroy parameters are for specifying the modify function. The modify function will get called for <emphasis>each</emphasis> data access, the goal of the modify function is to return the data which should be displayed at the location specified using the parameters of the modify function.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: n_columns
parameter.parameter_description: The number of columns in the filter model.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: User data to pass to the modify function, or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_set_visible_column
function.description:
Sets @column of the child_model to be the column where @filter should look for visibility information. @columns should be a column of type %G_TYPE_BOOLEAN, where %TRUE means that a row is visible, and %FALSE if not.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: A #gint which is the column containing the visible information.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_filter_set_visible_func

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: User data to pass to the visible function, or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_foreach
function.description:
Calls func on each node in model in a depth-first fashion.
If @func returns %TRUE, then the tree ceases to be walked, and gtk_tree_model_foreach() returns.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: a function to be called on each row

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get
function.description:
Gets the value of one or more cells in the row referenced by @iter. The variable argument list should contain integer column numbers, each column number followed by a place to store the value being retrieved. The list is terminated by a -1. For example, to get a value from column 0 with type %G_TYPE_STRING, you would write: <literal>gtk_tree_model_get (model, iter, 0, &place_string_here, -1)</literal>, where <literal>place_string_here</literal> is a <type>gchar*</type> to be filled with the string.
Returned values with type %G_TYPE_OBJECT have to be unreferenced, values with type %G_TYPE_STRING or %G_TYPE_BOXED have to be freed. Other values are passed by value.

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: pairs of column number and value return locations, terminated by -1

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_column_type
function.description: Returns the type of the column.
function.return: the type of the column

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_flags
function.description:
Returns a set of flags supported by this interface.
The flags are a bitwise combination of #GtkTreeModelFlags. The flags supported should not change during the lifetime of the @tree_model.
function.return: the flags supported by this interface

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_iter
function.description: Sets @iter to a valid iterator pointing to @path. If @path does not exist, @iter is set to an invalid iterator and %FALSE is returned.
function.return: %TRUE, if @iter was set

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_iter_first
function.description: Initializes @iter with the first iterator in the tree (the one at the path "0") and returns %TRUE. Returns %FALSE if the tree is empty.
function.return: %TRUE, if @iter was set

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_iter_from_string
function.description: Sets @iter to a valid iterator pointing to @path_string, if it exists. Otherwise, @iter is left invalid and %FALSE is returned.
function.return: %TRUE, if @iter was set

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_n_columns
function.description: Returns the number of columns supported by @tree_model.
function.return: the number of columns

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_path
function.description:
Returns a newly-created #GtkTreePath referenced by @iter.
This path should be freed with gtk_tree_path_free().
function.return: a newly-created #GtkTreePath

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_string_from_iter
function.description:
Generates a string representation of the iter.
This string is a ':' separated list of numbers. For example, "4:10:0:3" would be an acceptable return value for this string.
Since: 2.2
function.return: a newly-allocated string. Must be freed with g_free().

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_valist
function.description: See gtk_tree_model_get(), this version takes a <type>va_list</type> for language bindings to use.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_get_value
function.description:
Initializes and sets @value to that at @column.
When done with @value, g_value_unset() needs to be called to free any allocated memory.

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: the column to lookup the value at

function.name: gtk_tree_model_iter_children
function.description:
Sets @iter to point to the first child of @parent.
If @parent has no children, %FALSE is returned and @iter is set to be invalid. @parent will remain a valid node after this function has been called.
If @parent is %NULL returns the first node, equivalent to <literal>gtk_tree_model_get_iter_first (tree_model, iter);</literal>

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: the new #GtkTreeIter to be set to the child

function.return: %TRUE, if @child has been set to the first child

function.name: gtk_tree_model_iter_has_child
function.description: Returns %TRUE if @iter has children, %FALSE otherwise.
function.return: %TRUE if @iter has children

function.name: gtk_tree_model_iter_n_children
function.description:
Returns the number of children that @iter has.
As a special case, if @iter is %NULL, then the number of toplevel nodes is returned.
function.return: the number of children of @iter

function.name: gtk_tree_model_iter_next
function.description:
Sets @iter to point to the node following it at the current level.
If there is no next @iter, %FALSE is returned and @iter is set to be invalid.
function.return: %TRUE if @iter has been changed to the next node

function.name: gtk_tree_model_iter_nth_child
function.description:
Sets @iter to be the child of @parent, using the given index.
The first index is 0. If @n is too big, or @parent has no children, @iter is set to an invalid iterator and %FALSE is returned. @parent will remain a valid node after this function has been called. As a special case, if @parent is %NULL, then the @n<!-- -->th root node is set.

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkTreeIter to set to the nth child

parameter.name: parent
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkTreeIter to get the child from, or %NULL.

parameter.name: n
parameter.parameter_description: the index of the desired child

function.return: %TRUE, if @parent has an @n<!-- -->th child

function.name: gtk_tree_model_iter_parent

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: the new #GtkTreeIter to set to the parent

function.return: %TRUE, if @iter is set to the parent of @child

function.name: gtk_tree_model_iter_previous
function.description:
Sets @iter to point to the previous node at the current level.
If there is no previous @iter, %FALSE is returned and @iter is set to be invalid.
Since: 3.0
function.return: %TRUE if @iter has been changed to the previous node

function.name: gtk_tree_model_ref_node
function.description:
Lets the tree ref the node.
This is an optional method for models to implement. To be more specific, models may ignore this call as it exists primarily for performance reasons.
This function is primarily meant as a way for views to let caching models know when nodes are being displayed (and hence, whether or not to cache that node). Being displayed means a node is in an expanded branch, regardless of whether the node is currently visible in the viewport. For example, a file-system based model would not want to keep the entire file-hierarchy in memory, just the sections that are currently being displayed by every current view.
A model should be expected to be able to get an iter independent of its reffed state.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_row_changed
function.description: Emits the #GtkTreeModel::row-changed signal on @tree_model.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreePath pointing to the changed row

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: a valid #GtkTreeIter pointing to the changed row

function.name: gtk_tree_model_row_deleted
function.description:
Emits the #GtkTreeModel::row-deleted signal on @tree_model.
This should be called by models after a row has been removed. The location pointed to by @path should be the location that the row previously was at. It may not be a valid location anymore.
Nodes that are deleted are not unreffed, this means that any outstanding references on the deleted node should not be released.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreePath pointing to the previous location of the deleted row

function.name: gtk_tree_model_row_has_child_toggled

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreePath pointing to the changed row

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: a valid #GtkTreeIter pointing to the changed row

function.name: gtk_tree_model_row_inserted
function.description: Emits the #GtkTreeModel::row-inserted signal on @tree_model.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreePath pointing to the inserted row

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: a valid #GtkTreeIter pointing to the inserted row

function.name: gtk_tree_model_rows_reordered
function.description:
Emits the #GtkTreeModel::rows-reordered signal on @tree_model.
This should be called by models when their rows have been reordered.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreePath pointing to the tree node whose children have been reordered

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: a valid #GtkTreeIter pointing to the node whose children have been reordered, or %NULL if the depth of @path is 0

parameter.name: new_order
parameter.parameter_description: an array of integers mapping the current position of each child to its old position before the re-ordering, i.e. @new_order<literal>[newpos] = oldpos</literal>

function.name: gtk_tree_model_rows_reordered_with_length
function.description:
Emits the #GtkTreeModel::rows-reordered signal on @tree_model.
This should be called by models when their rows have been reordered.
Since: 3.10

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreePath pointing to the tree node whose children have been reordered

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: a valid #GtkTreeIter pointing to the node whose children have been reordered, or %NULL if the depth of @path is 0

parameter.name: new_order
parameter.parameter_description: an array of integers mapping the current position of each child to its old position before the re-ordering, i.e. @new_order<literal>[newpos] = oldpos</literal>

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_clear_cache
function.description: This function should almost never be called. It clears the @tree_model_sort of any cached iterators that haven't been reffed with gtk_tree_model_ref_node(). This might be useful if the child model being sorted is static (and doesn't change often) and there has been a lot of unreffed access to nodes. As a side effect of this function, all unreffed iters will be invalid.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_convert_child_iter_to_iter
function.description: Sets @sort_iter to point to the row in @tree_model_sort that corresponds to the row pointed at by @child_iter. If @sort_iter was not set, %FALSE is returned. Note: a boolean is only returned since 2.14.

parameter.name: child_iter
parameter.parameter_description: A valid #GtkTreeIter pointing to a row on the child model

function.return: %TRUE, if @sort_iter was set, i.e. if @sort_iter is a valid iterator pointer to a visible row in the child model.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_convert_child_path_to_path
function.description: Converts @child_path to a path relative to @tree_model_sort. That is, @child_path points to a path in the child model. The returned path will point to the same row in the sorted model. If @child_path isn't a valid path on the child model, then %NULL is returned.
function.return: A newly allocated #GtkTreePath, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_convert_iter_to_child_iter
function.description: Sets @child_iter to point to the row pointed to by @sorted_iter.

parameter.name: sorted_iter
parameter.parameter_description: A valid #GtkTreeIter pointing to a row on @tree_model_sort.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_convert_path_to_child_path
function.description: Converts @sorted_path to a path on the child model of @tree_model_sort. That is, @sorted_path points to a location in @tree_model_sort. The returned path will point to the same location in the model not being sorted. If @sorted_path does not point to a location in the child model, %NULL is returned.
function.return: A newly allocated #GtkTreePath, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_get_model
function.description: Returns the model the #GtkTreeModelSort is sorting.
function.return: the "child model" being sorted

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_iter_is_valid
function.description:
<warning><para> This function is slow. Only use it for debugging and/or testing purposes. </para></warning>
Checks if the given iter is a valid iter for this #GtkTreeModelSort.
Since: 2.2
function.return: %TRUE if the iter is valid, %FALSE if the iter is invalid.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_new_with_model
function.description: Creates a new #GtkTreeModel, with @child_model as the child model.
function.return: A new #GtkTreeModel.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_reset_default_sort_func
function.description: This resets the default sort function to be in the 'unsorted' state. That is, it is in the same order as the child model. It will re-sort the model to be in the same order as the child model only if the #GtkTreeModelSort is in 'unsorted' state.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_sort_set_model
function.description: Sets the model of @tree_model_sort to be @model. If @model is %NULL, then the old model is unset. The sort function is unset as a result of this call. The model will be in an unsorted state until a sort function is set.

function.name: gtk_tree_model_unref_node
function.description:
Lets the tree unref the node.
This is an optional method for models to implement. To be more specific, models may ignore this call as it exists primarily for performance reasons. For more information on what this means, see gtk_tree_model_ref_node().
Please note that nodes that are deleted are not unreffed.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_append_index
function.description:
Appends a new index to a path.
As a result, the depth of the path is increased.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_compare
function.description:
Compares two paths.
If @a appears before @b in a tree, then -1 is returned. If @b appears before @a, then 1 is returned. If the two nodes are equal, then 0 is returned.
function.return: the relative positions of @a and @b

function.name: gtk_tree_path_copy
function.description: Creates a new #GtkTreePath as a copy of @path.
function.return: a new #GtkTreePath

function.name: gtk_tree_path_down
function.description: Moves @path to point to the first child of the current path.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_free
function.description: Frees @path. If @path is %NULL, it simply returns.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_get_depth
function.description: Returns the current depth of @path.
function.return: The depth of @path

function.name: gtk_tree_path_get_indices
function.description:
Returns the current indices of @path.
This is an array of integers, each representing a node in a tree. This value should not be freed.
The length of the array can be obtained with gtk_tree_path_get_depth().
function.return: The current indices, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_path_get_indices_with_depth
function.description:
Returns the current indices of @path.
This is an array of integers, each representing a node in a tree. It also returns the number of elements in the array. The array should not be freed.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: depth
parameter.parameter_description: return location for number of elements returned in the integer array, or %NULL

function.return: The current indices, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_path_is_ancestor
function.description: Returns %TRUE if @descendant is a descendant of @path.
function.return: %TRUE if @descendant is contained inside @path

function.name: gtk_tree_path_is_descendant
function.description: Returns %TRUE if @path is a descendant of @ancestor.
function.return: %TRUE if @ancestor contains @path somewhere below it

function.name: gtk_tree_path_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkTreePath. This structure refers to a row.
function.return: A newly created #GtkTreePath.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_new_first
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkTreePath.
The string representation of this path is "0".
function.return: A new #GtkTreePath

function.name: gtk_tree_path_new_from_indices
function.description:
Creates a new path with @first_index and @varargs as indices.
Since: 2.2
function.return: A newly created #GtkTreePath

function.name: gtk_tree_path_new_from_string
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkTreePath initialized to @path.
@path is expected to be a colon separated list of numbers. For example, the string "10:4:0" would create a path of depth 3 pointing to the 11th child of the root node, the 5th child of that 11th child, and the 1st child of that 5th child. If an invalid path string is passed in, %NULL is returned.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: The string representation of a path

function.return: A newly-created #GtkTreePath, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_path_next
function.description: Moves the @path to point to the next node at the current depth.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_prepend_index
function.description:
Prepends a new index to a path.
As a result, the depth of the path is increased.

function.name: gtk_tree_path_prev
function.description: Moves the @path to point to the previous node at the current depth, if it exists.
function.return: %TRUE if @path has a previous node, and the move was made

function.name: gtk_tree_path_to_string
function.description:
Generates a string representation of the path.
This string is a ':' separated list of numbers. For example, "4:10:0:3" would be an acceptable return value for this string.
function.return: A newly-allocated string. Must be freed with g_free().

function.name: gtk_tree_path_up
function.description: Moves the @path to point to its parent node, if it has a parent.
function.return: %TRUE if @path has a parent, and the move was made

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_copy
function.description:
Copies a #GtkTreeRowReference.
Since: 2.2
function.return: a copy of @reference

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_deleted
function.description: Lets a set of row reference created by gtk_tree_row_reference_new_proxy() know that the model emitted the #GtkTreeModel::row-deleted signal.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: the path position that was deleted

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_free
function.description: Free's @reference. @reference may be %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_get_model
function.description:
Returns the model that the row reference is monitoring.
Since: 2.8
function.return: the model

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_get_path
function.description: Returns a path that the row reference currently points to, or %NULL if the path pointed to is no longer valid.
function.return: a current path, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_inserted
function.description: Lets a set of row reference created by gtk_tree_row_reference_new_proxy() know that the model emitted the #GtkTreeModel::row-inserted signal.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: the row position that was inserted

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_new
function.description:
Creates a row reference based on @path.
This reference will keep pointing to the node pointed to by @path, so long as it exists. Any changes that occur on @model are propagated, and the path is updated appropriately. If @path isn't a valid path in @model, then %NULL is returned.
function.return: a newly allocated #GtkTreeRowReference, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_new_proxy
function.description:
You do not need to use this function.
Creates a row reference based on @path.
This reference will keep pointing to the node pointed to by @path, so long as it exists. If @path isn't a valid path in @model, then %NULL is returned. However, unlike references created with gtk_tree_row_reference_new(), it does not listen to the model for changes. The creator of the row reference must do this explicitly using gtk_tree_row_reference_inserted(), gtk_tree_row_reference_deleted(), gtk_tree_row_reference_reordered().
These functions must be called exactly once per proxy when the corresponding signal on the model is emitted. This single call updates all row references for that proxy. Since built-in GTK+ objects like #GtkTreeView already use this mechanism internally, using them as the proxy object will produce unpredictable results. Further more, passing the same object as @model and @proxy doesn't work for reasons of internal implementation.
This type of row reference is primarily meant by structures that need to carefully monitor exactly when a row reference updates itself, and is not generally needed by most applications.
function.return: a newly allocated #GtkTreeRowReference, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_reordered
function.description: Lets a set of row reference created by gtk_tree_row_reference_new_proxy() know that the model emitted the #GtkTreeModel::rows-reordered signal.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: the parent path of the reordered signal

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: the iter pointing to the parent of the reordered

function.name: gtk_tree_row_reference_valid
function.description: Returns %TRUE if the @reference is non-%NULL and refers to a current valid path.
function.return: %TRUE if @reference points to a valid path

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_count_selected_rows
function.description:
Returns the number of rows that have been selected in @tree.
Since: 2.2
function.return: The number of rows selected.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_get_mode
function.description: Gets the selection mode for @selection. See gtk_tree_selection_set_mode().
function.return: the current selection mode

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_get_select_function
function.description:
Returns the current selection function.
Since: 2.14
function.return: The function.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_get_selected
function.description: Sets @iter to the currently selected node if @selection is set to #GTK_SELECTION_SINGLE or #GTK_SELECTION_BROWSE. @iter may be NULL if you just want to test if @selection has any selected nodes. @model is filled with the current model as a convenience. This function will not work if you use @selection is #GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE.

parameter.name: model
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to set to the #GtkTreeModel, or NULL.

function.return: TRUE, if there is a selected node.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_get_selected_rows
function.description:
Creates a list of path of all selected rows. Additionally, if you are planning on modifying the model after calling this function, you may want to convert the returned list into a list of #GtkTreeRowReference<!-- -->s. To do this, you can use gtk_tree_row_reference_new().
To free the return value, use: |[ g_list_free_full (list, (GDestroyNotify) gtk_tree_path_free); ]|
Since: 2.2

parameter.name: model
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to set to the #GtkTreeModel, or %NULL.

function.return: A #GList containing a #GtkTreePath for each selected row.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_get_tree_view
function.description: Returns the tree view associated with @selection.
function.return: A #GtkTreeView

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_get_user_data
function.description: Returns the user data for the selection function.
function.return: The user data.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_iter_is_selected
function.description: Returns %TRUE if the row at @iter is currently selected.
function.return: %TRUE, if @iter is selected

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_path_is_selected
function.description: Returns %TRUE if the row pointed to by @path is currently selected. If @path does not point to a valid location, %FALSE is returned
function.return: %TRUE if @path is selected.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_select_all
function.description: Selects all the nodes. @selection must be set to #GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE mode.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_select_iter
function.description: Selects the specified iterator.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_select_path
function.description: Select the row at @path.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_select_range
function.description: Selects a range of nodes, determined by @start_path and @end_path inclusive. @selection must be set to #GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE mode.

parameter.name: start_path
parameter.parameter_description: The initial node of the range.

parameter.name: end_path
parameter.parameter_description: The final node of the range.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_selected_foreach
function.description: Calls a function for each selected node. Note that you cannot modify the tree or selection from within this function. As a result, gtk_tree_selection_get_selected_rows() might be more useful.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: The function to call for each selected node.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: user data to pass to the function.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_set_mode
function.description: Sets the selection mode of the @selection. If the previous type was #GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE, then the anchor is kept selected, if it was previously selected.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_set_select_function
function.description:
Sets the selection function.
If set, this function is called before any node is selected or unselected, giving some control over which nodes are selected. The select function should return %TRUE if the state of the node may be toggled, and %FALSE if the state of the node should be left unchanged.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: The selection function's data. May be %NULL

parameter.name: destroy
parameter.parameter_description: The destroy function for user data. May be %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_unselect_all
function.description: Unselects all the nodes.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_unselect_iter
function.description: Unselects the specified iterator.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_unselect_path
function.description: Unselects the row at @path.

function.name: gtk_tree_selection_unselect_range
function.description:
Unselects a range of nodes, determined by @start_path and @end_path inclusive.
Since: 2.2

parameter.name: start_path
parameter.parameter_description: The initial node of the range.

parameter.name: end_path
parameter.parameter_description: The initial node of the range.

function.name: gtk_tree_set_row_drag_data
function.description: Sets selection data of target type %GTK_TREE_MODEL_ROW. Normally used in a drag_data_get handler.
function.return: %TRUE if the #GtkSelectionData had the proper target type to allow us to set a tree row

function.name: gtk_tree_sortable_get_sort_column_id
function.description: Fills in @sort_column_id and @order with the current sort column and the order. It returns %TRUE unless the @sort_column_id is %GTK_TREE_SORTABLE_DEFAULT_SORT_COLUMN_ID or %GTK_TREE_SORTABLE_UNSORTED_SORT_COLUMN_ID.

parameter.name: sort_column_id
parameter.parameter_description: The sort column id to be filled in

function.return: %TRUE if the sort column is not one of the special sort column ids.

function.name: gtk_tree_sortable_has_default_sort_func
function.description: Returns %TRUE if the model has a default sort function. This is used primarily by GtkTreeViewColumns in order to determine if a model can go back to the default state, or not.
function.return: %TRUE, if the model has a default sort function

function.name: gtk_tree_sortable_set_default_sort_func
function.description:
Sets the default comparison function used when sorting to be @sort_func. If the current sort column id of @sortable is %GTK_TREE_SORTABLE_DEFAULT_SORT_COLUMN_ID, then the model will sort using this function.
If @sort_func is %NULL, then there will be no default comparison function. This means that once the model has been sorted, it can't go back to the default state. In this case, when the current sort column id of @sortable is %GTK_TREE_SORTABLE_DEFAULT_SORT_COLUMN_ID, the model will be unsorted.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: User data to pass to @sort_func, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_sortable_set_sort_column_id
function.description: Sets the current sort column to be @sort_column_id. The @sortable will resort itself to reflect this change, after emitting a #GtkTreeSortable::sort-column-changed signal. @sort_column_id may either be a regular column id, or one of the following special values: <variablelist> <varlistentry> <term>%GTK_TREE_SORTABLE_DEFAULT_SORT_COLUMN_ID</term> <listitem>the default sort function will be used, if it is set</listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term>%GTK_TREE_SORTABLE_UNSORTED_SORT_COLUMN_ID</term> <listitem>no sorting will occur</listitem> </varlistentry> </variablelist>

parameter.name: sort_column_id
parameter.parameter_description: the sort column id to set

parameter.name: order
parameter.parameter_description: The sort order of the column

function.name: gtk_tree_sortable_set_sort_func
function.description: Sets the comparison function used when sorting to be @sort_func. If the current sort column id of @sortable is the same as @sort_column_id, then the model will sort using this function.

parameter.name: sort_column_id
parameter.parameter_description: the sort column id to set the function for

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: User data to pass to @sort_func, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_sortable_sort_column_changed
function.description: Emits a #GtkTreeSortable::sort-column-changed signal on @sortable.

function.name: gtk_tree_store_append
function.description: Appends a new row to @tree_store. If @parent is non-%NULL, then it will append the new row after the last child of @parent, otherwise it will append a row to the top level. @iter will be changed to point to this new row. The row will be empty after this function is called. To fill in values, you need to call gtk_tree_store_set() or gtk_tree_store_set_value().

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: An unset #GtkTreeIter to set to the appended row

function.name: gtk_tree_store_clear
function.description: Removes all rows from @tree_store

function.name: gtk_tree_store_insert
function.description: Creates a new row at @position. If parent is non-%NULL, then the row will be made a child of @parent. Otherwise, the row will be created at the toplevel. If @position is -1 or is larger than the number of rows at that level, then the new row will be inserted to the end of the list. @iter will be changed to point to this new row. The row will be empty after this function is called. To fill in values, you need to call gtk_tree_store_set() or gtk_tree_store_set_value().

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: An unset #GtkTreeIter to set to the new row

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: position to insert the new row, or -1 for last

function.name: gtk_tree_store_insert_after
function.description:
Inserts a new row after @sibling. If @sibling is %NULL, then the row will be prepended to @parent 's children. If @parent and @sibling are %NULL, then the row will be prepended to the toplevel. If both @sibling and @parent are set, then @parent must be the parent of @sibling. When @sibling is set, @parent is optional.
@iter will be changed to point to this new row. The row will be empty after this function is called. To fill in values, you need to call gtk_tree_store_set() or gtk_tree_store_set_value().

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: An unset #GtkTreeIter to set to the new row

function.name: gtk_tree_store_insert_before
function.description:
Inserts a new row before @sibling. If @sibling is %NULL, then the row will be appended to @parent 's children. If @parent and @sibling are %NULL, then the row will be appended to the toplevel. If both @sibling and @parent are set, then @parent must be the parent of @sibling. When @sibling is set, @parent is optional.
@iter will be changed to point to this new row. The row will be empty after this function is called. To fill in values, you need to call gtk_tree_store_set() or gtk_tree_store_set_value().

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: An unset #GtkTreeIter to set to the new row

function.name: gtk_tree_store_insert_with_values
function.description:
Creates a new row at @position. @iter will be changed to point to this new row. If @position is -1, or larger than the number of rows on the list, then the new row will be appended to the list. The row will be filled with the values given to this function.
Calling <literal>gtk_tree_store_insert_with_values (tree_store, iter, position, ...)</literal> has the same effect as calling |[ gtk_tree_store_insert (tree_store, iter, position); gtk_tree_store_set (tree_store, iter, ...); ]| with the different that the former will only emit a row_inserted signal, while the latter will emit row_inserted, row_changed and if the tree store is sorted, rows_reordered. Since emitting the rows_reordered signal repeatedly can affect the performance of the program, gtk_tree_store_insert_with_values() should generally be preferred when inserting rows in a sorted tree store.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: An unset #GtkTreeIter to set the new row, or %NULL.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: position to insert the new row, or -1 to append after existing rows

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: pairs of column number and value, terminated with -1

function.name: gtk_tree_store_insert_with_valuesv
function.description:
A variant of gtk_tree_store_insert_with_values() which takes the columns and values as two arrays, instead of varargs. This function is mainly intended for language bindings.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: An unset #GtkTreeIter to set the new row, or %NULL.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: position to insert the new row, or -1 for last

parameter.name: n_values
parameter.parameter_description: the length of the @columns and @values arrays

function.name: gtk_tree_store_is_ancestor
function.description: Returns %TRUE if @iter is an ancestor of @descendant. That is, @iter is the parent (or grandparent or great-grandparent) of @descendant.
function.return: %TRUE, if @iter is an ancestor of @descendant

function.name: gtk_tree_store_iter_depth
function.description: Returns the depth of @iter. This will be 0 for anything on the root level, 1 for anything down a level, etc.
function.return: The depth of @iter

function.name: gtk_tree_store_iter_is_valid
function.description:
WARNING: This function is slow. Only use it for debugging and/or testing purposes.
Checks if the given iter is a valid iter for this #GtkTreeStore.
Since: 2.2
function.return: %TRUE if the iter is valid, %FALSE if the iter is invalid.

function.name: gtk_tree_store_move_after
function.description:
Moves @iter in @tree_store to the position after @position. @iter and @position should be in the same level. Note that this function only works with unsorted stores. If @position is %NULL, @iter will be moved to the start of the level.
Since: 2.2

function.name: gtk_tree_store_move_before
function.description:
Moves @iter in @tree_store to the position before @position. @iter and @position should be in the same level. Note that this function only works with unsorted stores. If @position is %NULL, @iter will be moved to the end of the level.
Since: 2.2

function.name: gtk_tree_store_new
function.description:
Creates a new tree store as with @n_columns columns each of the types passed in. Note that only types derived from standard GObject fundamental types are supported.
As an example, <literal>gtk_tree_store_new (3, G_TYPE_INT, G_TYPE_STRING, GDK_TYPE_PIXBUF);</literal> will create a new #GtkTreeStore with three columns, of type <type>int</type>, <type>string</type> and #GdkPixbuf respectively.

parameter.name: n_columns
parameter.parameter_description: number of columns in the tree store

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: all #GType types for the columns, from first to last

function.return: a new #GtkTreeStore

function.name: gtk_tree_store_newv
function.description: Non vararg creation function. Used primarily by language bindings.

parameter.name: n_columns
parameter.parameter_description: number of columns in the tree store

parameter.name: types
parameter.parameter_description: an array of #GType types for the columns, from first to last

function.return: a new #GtkTreeStore

function.name: gtk_tree_store_prepend
function.description: Prepends a new row to @tree_store. If @parent is non-%NULL, then it will prepend the new row before the first child of @parent, otherwise it will prepend a row to the top level. @iter will be changed to point to this new row. The row will be empty after this function is called. To fill in values, you need to call gtk_tree_store_set() or gtk_tree_store_set_value().

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: An unset #GtkTreeIter to set to the prepended row

function.name: gtk_tree_store_remove
function.description: Removes @iter from @tree_store. After being removed, @iter is set to the next valid row at that level, or invalidated if it previously pointed to the last one.
function.return: %TRUE if @iter is still valid, %FALSE if not.

function.name: gtk_tree_store_reorder
function.description:
Reorders the children of @parent in @tree_store to follow the order indicated by @new_order. Note that this function only works with unsorted stores.
Since: 2.2

parameter.name: new_order
parameter.parameter_description: an array of integers mapping the new position of each child to its old position before the re-ordering, i.e. @new_order<literal>[newpos] = oldpos</literal>.

function.name: gtk_tree_store_set
function.description:
Sets the value of one or more cells in the row referenced by @iter. The variable argument list should contain integer column numbers, each column number followed by the value to be set. The list is terminated by a -1. For example, to set column 0 with type %G_TYPE_STRING to "Foo", you would write <literal>gtk_tree_store_set (store, iter, 0, "Foo", -1)</literal>.
The value will be referenced by the store if it is a %G_TYPE_OBJECT, and it will be copied if it is a %G_TYPE_STRING or %G_TYPE_BOXED.

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: A valid #GtkTreeIter for the row being modified

parameter.name: Varargs
parameter.parameter_description: pairs of column number and value, terminated with -1

function.name: gtk_tree_store_set_column_type
function.description: Supported types include: %G_TYPE_UINT, %G_TYPE_INT, %G_TYPE_UCHAR, %G_TYPE_CHAR, %G_TYPE_BOOLEAN, %G_TYPE_POINTER, %G_TYPE_FLOAT, %G_TYPE_DOUBLE, %G_TYPE_STRING, %G_TYPE_OBJECT, and %G_TYPE_BOXED, along with subclasses of those types such as %GDK_TYPE_PIXBUF.

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: type of the data to be stored in @column

function.name: gtk_tree_store_set_column_types
function.description: This function is meant primarily for #GObjects that inherit from #GtkTreeStore, and should only be used when constructing a new #GtkTreeStore. It will not function after a row has been added, or a method on the #GtkTreeModel interface is called.

parameter.name: n_columns
parameter.parameter_description: Number of columns for the tree store

parameter.name: types
parameter.parameter_description: An array of #GType types, one for each column

function.name: gtk_tree_store_set_valist
function.description: See gtk_tree_store_set(); this version takes a <type>va_list</type> for use by language bindings.

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: A valid #GtkTreeIter for the row being modified

function.name: gtk_tree_store_set_value
function.description: Sets the data in the cell specified by @iter and @column. The type of @value must be convertible to the type of the column.

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: A valid #GtkTreeIter for the row being modified
