function.name: gtk_tree_store_set_valuesv
function.description:
A variant of gtk_tree_store_set_valist() which takes the columns and values as two arrays, instead of varargs. This function is mainly intended for language bindings or in case the number of columns to change is not known until run-time.
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: A valid #GtkTreeIter for the row being modified

parameter.name: n_values
parameter.parameter_description: the length of the @columns and @values arrays

function.name: gtk_tree_store_swap
function.description:
Swaps @a and @b in the same level of @tree_store. Note that this function only works with unsorted stores.
Since: 2.2

function.name: gtk_tree_view_append_column
function.description: Appends @column to the list of columns. If @tree_view has "fixed_height" mode enabled, then @column must have its "sizing" property set to be GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_FIXED.
function.return: The number of columns in @tree_view after appending.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_collapse_all
function.description: Recursively collapses all visible, expanded nodes in @tree_view.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_collapse_row
function.description: Collapses a row (hides its child rows, if they exist).

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: path to a row in the @tree_view

function.return: %TRUE if the row was collapsed.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_add_attribute
function.description: Adds an attribute mapping to the list in @tree_column. The @column is the column of the model to get a value from, and the @attribute is the parameter on @cell_renderer to be set from the value. So for example if column 2 of the model contains strings, you could have the "text" attribute of a #GtkCellRendererText get its values from column 2.

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: The column position on the model to get the attribute from.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_cell_get_position
function.description: Obtains the horizontal position and size of a cell in a column. If the cell is not found in the column, @start_pos and @width are not changed and %FALSE is returned.

parameter.name: x_offset
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the horizontal position of @cell within @tree_column, may be %NULL

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: return location for the width of @cell, may be %NULL

function.return: %TRUE if @cell belongs to @tree_column.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_cell_get_size
function.description: Obtains the width and height needed to render the column. This is used primarily by the #GtkTreeView.

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: The area a cell in the column will be allocated, or %NULL

parameter.name: x_offset
parameter.parameter_description: location to return x offset of a cell relative to @cell_area, or %NULL

parameter.name: y_offset
parameter.parameter_description: location to return y offset of a cell relative to @cell_area, or %NULL

parameter.name: width
parameter.parameter_description: location to return width needed to render a cell, or %NULL

parameter.name: height
parameter.parameter_description: location to return height needed to render a cell, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_cell_is_visible
function.description: Returns %TRUE if any of the cells packed into the @tree_column are visible. For this to be meaningful, you must first initialize the cells with gtk_tree_view_column_cell_set_cell_data()
function.return: %TRUE, if any of the cells packed into the @tree_column are currently visible

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_cell_render
function.description: Renders the cell contained by #tree_column. This is used primarily by the #GtkTreeView.

parameter.name: background_area
parameter.parameter_description: entire cell area (including tree expanders and maybe padding on the sides)

parameter.name: cell_area
parameter.parameter_description: area normally rendered by a cell renderer

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_cell_set_cell_data
function.description: Sets the cell renderer based on the @tree_model and @iter. That is, for every attribute mapping in @tree_column, it will get a value from the set column on the @iter, and use that value to set the attribute on the cell renderer. This is used primarily by the #GtkTreeView.

parameter.name: tree_model
parameter.parameter_description: The #GtkTreeModel to to get the cell renderers attributes from.

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: The #GtkTreeIter to to get the cell renderer's attributes from.

parameter.name: is_expanded
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE, if the row has visible children

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_clear
function.description: Unsets all the mappings on all renderers on the @tree_column.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_clear_attributes
function.description: Clears all existing attributes previously set with gtk_tree_view_column_set_attributes().

parameter.name: cell_renderer
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkCellRenderer to clear the attribute mapping on.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_clicked
function.description: Emits the "clicked" signal on the column. This function will only work if @tree_column is clickable.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_focus_cell
function.description:
Sets the current keyboard focus to be at @cell, if the column contains 2 or more editable and activatable cells.
Since: 2.2

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_alignment
function.description: Returns the current x alignment of @tree_column. This value can range between 0.0 and 1.0.
function.return: The current alignent of @tree_column.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_button
function.description:
Returns the button used in the treeview column header
Since: 3.0
function.return: The button for the column header.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_clickable
function.description: Returns %TRUE if the user can click on the header for the column.
function.return: %TRUE if user can click the column header.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_expand
function.description:
Returns %TRUE if the column expands to fill available space.
Since: 2.4
function.return: %TRUE if the column expands to fill available space.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_fixed_width
function.description: Gets the fixed width of the column. This may not be the actual displayed width of the column; for that, use gtk_tree_view_column_get_width().
function.return: The fixed width of the column.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_max_width
function.description: Returns the maximum width in pixels of the @tree_column, or -1 if no maximum width is set.
function.return: The maximum width of the @tree_column.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_min_width
function.description: Returns the minimum width in pixels of the @tree_column, or -1 if no minimum width is set.
function.return: The minimum width of the @tree_column.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_reorderable
function.description: Returns %TRUE if the @tree_column can be reordered by the user.
function.return: %TRUE if the @tree_column can be reordered by the user.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_resizable
function.description: Returns %TRUE if the @tree_column can be resized by the end user.
function.return: %TRUE, if the @tree_column can be resized.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_sizing
function.description: Returns the current type of @tree_column.
function.return: The type of @tree_column.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_sort_column_id
function.description: Gets the logical @sort_column_id that the model sorts on when this column is selected for sorting. See gtk_tree_view_column_set_sort_column_id().
function.return: the current @sort_column_id for this column, or -1 if this column can't be used for sorting.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_sort_indicator
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_tree_view_column_set_sort_indicator().
function.return: whether the sort indicator arrow is displayed

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_sort_order
function.description: Gets the value set by gtk_tree_view_column_set_sort_order().
function.return: the sort order the sort indicator is indicating

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_spacing
function.description: Returns the spacing of @tree_column.
function.return: the spacing of @tree_column.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_title
function.description: Returns the title of the widget.
function.return: the title of the column. This string should not be modified or freed.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_tree_view
function.description:
Returns the #GtkTreeView wherein @tree_column has been inserted. If @column is currently not inserted in any tree view, %NULL is returned.
Since: 2.12
function.return: The tree view wherein @column has been inserted if any, %NULL otherwise.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_visible
function.description: Returns %TRUE if @tree_column is visible.
function.return: whether the column is visible or not. If it is visible, then the tree will show the column.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_widget
function.description: Returns the #GtkWidget in the button on the column header. If a custom widget has not been set then %NULL is returned.
function.return: The #GtkWidget in the column header, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_width
function.description: Returns the current size of @tree_column in pixels.
function.return: The current width of @tree_column.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_get_x_offset
function.description:
Returns the current X offset of @tree_column in pixels.
Since: 3.2
function.return: The current X offset of @tree_column.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkTreeViewColumn.
function.return: A newly created #GtkTreeViewColumn.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_new_with_area
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkTreeViewColumn using @area to render its cells.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: area
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellArea that the newly created column should use to layout cells.

function.return: A newly created #GtkTreeViewColumn.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_new_with_attributes

parameter.name: title
parameter.parameter_description: The title to set the header to

function.return: A newly created #GtkTreeViewColumn.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_pack_end
function.description: Adds the @cell to end of the column. If @expand is %FALSE, then the @cell is allocated no more space than it needs. Any unused space is divided evenly between cells for which @expand is %TRUE.

parameter.name: expand
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if @cell is to be given extra space allocated to @tree_column.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_pack_start
function.description: Packs the @cell into the beginning of the column. If @expand is %FALSE, then the @cell is allocated no more space than it needs. Any unused space is divided evenly between cells for which @expand is %TRUE.

parameter.name: expand
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if @cell is to be given extra space allocated to @tree_column.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_queue_resize
function.description:
Flags the column, and the cell renderers added to this column, to have their sizes renegotiated.
Since: 2.8

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_set_alignment
function.description: Sets the alignment of the title or custom widget inside the column header. The alignment determines its location inside the button -- 0.0 for left, 0.5 for center, 1.0 for right.

parameter.name: xalign
parameter.parameter_description: The alignment, which is between [0.0 and 1.0] inclusive.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_set_attributes
function.description: Sets the attributes in the list as the attributes of @tree_column. The attributes should be in attribute/column order, as in gtk_tree_view_column_add_attribute(). All existing attributes are removed, and replaced with the new attributes.

parameter.name: cell_renderer
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkCellRenderer we're setting the attributes of

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_set_cell_data_func
function.description: Sets the #GtkTreeCellDataFunc to use for the column. This function is used instead of the standard attributes mapping for setting the column value, and should set the value of @tree_column's cell renderer as appropriate. @func may be %NULL to remove an older one.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_set_clickable
function.description: Sets the header to be active if @clickable is %TRUE. When the header is active, then it can take keyboard focus, and can be clicked.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_set_expand
function.description:
Sets the column to take available extra space. This space is shared equally amongst all columns that have the expand set to %TRUE. If no column has this option set, then the last column gets all extra space. By default, every column is created with this %FALSE.
Along with "fixed-width", the "expand" property changes when the column is resized by the user.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: expand
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the column should expand to fill available space.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_set_fixed_width
function.description:
If @fixed_width is not -1, sets the fixed width of @tree_column; otherwise unsets it. The effective value of @fixed_width is clamped between the minumum and maximum width of the column; however, the value stored in the "fixed-width" property is not clamped. If the column sizing is #GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_GROW_ONLY or #GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_AUTOSIZE, setting a fixed width overrides the automatically calculated width. Note that @fixed_width is only a hint to GTK+; the width actually allocated to the column may be greater or less than requested.
Along with "expand", the "fixed-width" property changes when the column is resized by the user.

parameter.name: fixed_width
parameter.parameter_description: The new fixed width, in pixels, or -1.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_set_max_width
function.description: Sets the maximum width of the @tree_column. If @max_width is -1, then the maximum width is unset. Note, the column can actually be wider than max width if it's the last column in a view. In this case, the column expands to fill any extra space.

parameter.name: max_width
parameter.parameter_description: The maximum width of the column in pixels, or -1.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_set_min_width
function.description: Sets the minimum width of the @tree_column. If @min_width is -1, then the minimum width is unset.

parameter.name: min_width
parameter.parameter_description: The minimum width of the column in pixels, or -1.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_set_reorderable
function.description: If @reorderable is %TRUE, then the column can be reordered by the end user dragging the header.

parameter.name: reorderable
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE, if the column can be reordered.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_set_resizable
function.description: If @resizable is %TRUE, then the user can explicitly resize the column by grabbing the outer edge of the column button. If resizable is %TRUE and sizing mode of the column is #GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_AUTOSIZE, then the sizing mode is changed to #GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_GROW_ONLY.

parameter.name: resizable
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE, if the column can be resized

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_set_sizing
function.description: Sets the growth behavior of @tree_column to @type.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_set_sort_column_id
function.description: Sets the logical @sort_column_id that this column sorts on when this column is selected for sorting. Doing so makes the column header clickable.

parameter.name: sort_column_id
parameter.parameter_description: The @sort_column_id of the model to sort on.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_set_sort_indicator
function.description: Call this function with a @setting of %TRUE to display an arrow in the header button indicating the column is sorted. Call gtk_tree_view_column_set_sort_order() to change the direction of the arrow.

parameter.name: setting
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to display an indicator that the column is sorted

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_set_sort_order
function.description:
Changes the appearance of the sort indicator.
This <emphasis>does not</emphasis> actually sort the model. Use gtk_tree_view_column_set_sort_column_id() if you want automatic sorting support. This function is primarily for custom sorting behavior, and should be used in conjunction with gtk_tree_sortable_set_sort_column_id() to do that. For custom models, the mechanism will vary.
The sort indicator changes direction to indicate normal sort or reverse sort. Note that you must have the sort indicator enabled to see anything when calling this function; see gtk_tree_view_column_set_sort_indicator().

parameter.name: order
parameter.parameter_description: sort order that the sort indicator should indicate

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_set_spacing
function.description: Sets the spacing field of @tree_column, which is the number of pixels to place between cell renderers packed into it.

parameter.name: spacing
parameter.parameter_description: distance between cell renderers in pixels.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_set_title
function.description: Sets the title of the @tree_column. If a custom widget has been set, then this value is ignored.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_set_visible
function.description: Sets the visibility of @tree_column.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_column_set_widget
function.description: Sets the widget in the header to be @widget. If widget is %NULL, then the header button is set with a #GtkLabel set to the title of @tree_column.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_columns_autosize
function.description: Resizes all columns to their optimal width. Only works after the treeview has been realized.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_convert_bin_window_to_tree_coords
function.description:
Converts bin_window coordinates to coordinates for the tree (the full scrollable area of the tree).
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: tx
parameter.parameter_description: return location for tree X coordinate

parameter.name: ty
parameter.parameter_description: return location for tree Y coordinate

function.name: gtk_tree_view_convert_bin_window_to_widget_coords
function.description:
Converts bin_window coordinates (see gtk_tree_view_get_bin_window()) to widget relative coordinates.
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: wx
parameter.parameter_description: return location for widget X coordinate

parameter.name: wy
parameter.parameter_description: return location for widget Y coordinate

function.name: gtk_tree_view_convert_tree_to_bin_window_coords
function.description:
Converts tree coordinates (coordinates in full scrollable area of the tree) to bin_window coordinates.
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: bx
parameter.parameter_description: return location for X coordinate relative to bin_window

parameter.name: by
parameter.parameter_description: return location for Y coordinate relative to bin_window

function.name: gtk_tree_view_convert_tree_to_widget_coords
function.description:
Converts tree coordinates (coordinates in full scrollable area of the tree) to widget coordinates.
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: tx
parameter.parameter_description: X coordinate relative to the tree

parameter.name: ty
parameter.parameter_description: Y coordinate relative to the tree

parameter.name: wx
parameter.parameter_description: return location for widget X coordinate

parameter.name: wy
parameter.parameter_description: return location for widget Y coordinate

function.name: gtk_tree_view_convert_widget_to_bin_window_coords
function.description:
Converts widget coordinates to coordinates for the bin_window (see gtk_tree_view_get_bin_window()).
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: wx
parameter.parameter_description: X coordinate relative to the widget

parameter.name: wy
parameter.parameter_description: Y coordinate relative to the widget

parameter.name: bx
parameter.parameter_description: return location for bin_window X coordinate

parameter.name: by
parameter.parameter_description: return location for bin_window Y coordinate

function.name: gtk_tree_view_convert_widget_to_tree_coords
function.description:
Converts widget coordinates to coordinates for the tree (the full scrollable area of the tree).
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: wx
parameter.parameter_description: X coordinate relative to the widget

parameter.name: wy
parameter.parameter_description: Y coordinate relative to the widget

parameter.name: tx
parameter.parameter_description: return location for tree X coordinate

parameter.name: ty
parameter.parameter_description: return location for tree Y coordinate

function.name: gtk_tree_view_create_row_drag_icon
function.description: Creates a #cairo_surface_t representation of the row at @path. This image is used for a drag icon.
function.return: a newly-allocated surface of the drag icon.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_enable_model_drag_dest
function.description: Turns @tree_view into a drop destination for automatic DND. Calling this method sets #GtkTreeView:reorderable to %FALSE.

parameter.name: targets
parameter.parameter_description: the table of targets that the drag will support

parameter.name: actions
parameter.parameter_description: the bitmask of possible actions for a drag from this widget

function.name: gtk_tree_view_enable_model_drag_source
function.description: Turns @tree_view into a drag source for automatic DND. Calling this method sets #GtkTreeView:reorderable to %FALSE.

parameter.name: start_button_mask
parameter.parameter_description: Mask of allowed buttons to start drag

parameter.name: targets
parameter.parameter_description: the table of targets that the drag will support

parameter.name: actions
parameter.parameter_description: the bitmask of possible actions for a drag from this widget

function.name: gtk_tree_view_expand_all
function.description: Recursively expands all nodes in the @tree_view.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_expand_row
function.description: Opens the row so its children are visible.

parameter.name: open_all
parameter.parameter_description: whether to recursively expand, or just expand immediate children

function.return: %TRUE if the row existed and had children

function.name: gtk_tree_view_expand_to_path
gtk_tree_view_get_activate_on_single_click
function.description:
Gets the setting set by gtk_tree_view_set_activate_on_single_click().
Since: 3.8
function.return: %TRUE if row-activated will be emitted on a single click

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_background_area
function.description: Fills the bounding rectangle in bin_window coordinates for the cell at the row specified by @path and the column specified by @column. If @path is %NULL, or points to a node not found in the tree, the @y and @height fields of the rectangle will be filled with 0. If @column is %NULL, the @x and @width fields will be filled with 0. The returned rectangle is equivalent to the @background_area passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render(). These background areas tile to cover the entire bin window. Contrast with the @cell_area, returned by gtk_tree_view_get_cell_area(), which returns only the cell itself, excluding surrounding borders and the tree expander area.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreePath for the row, or %NULL to get only horizontal coordinates

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreeViewColumn for the column, or %NULL to get only vertical coordiantes

parameter.name: rect
parameter.parameter_description: rectangle to fill with cell background rect

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_bin_window
function.description: Returns the window that @tree_view renders to. This is used primarily to compare to <literal>event->window</literal> to confirm that the event on @tree_view is on the right window.
function.return: A #GdkWindow, or %NULL when @tree_view hasn't been realized yet

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_cell_area
function.description: Fills the bounding rectangle in bin_window coordinates for the cell at the row specified by @path and the column specified by @column. If @path is %NULL, or points to a path not currently displayed, the @y and @height fields of the rectangle will be filled with 0. If @column is %NULL, the @x and @width fields will be filled with 0. The sum of all cell rects does not cover the entire tree; there are extra pixels in between rows, for example. The returned rectangle is equivalent to the @cell_area passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render(). This function is only valid if @tree_view is realized.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreePath for the row, or %NULL to get only horizontal coordinates

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreeViewColumn for the column, or %NULL to get only vertical coordinates

parameter.name: rect
parameter.parameter_description: rectangle to fill with cell rect

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_column
function.description: Gets the #GtkTreeViewColumn at the given position in the #tree_view.

parameter.name: n
parameter.parameter_description: The position of the column, counting from 0.

function.return: The #GtkTreeViewColumn, or %NULL if the position is outside the range of columns.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_columns
function.description: Returns a #GList of all the #GtkTreeViewColumn s currently in @tree_view. The returned list must be freed with g_list_free ().
function.return: A list of #GtkTreeViewColumn s

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_cursor
function.description:
Fills in @path and @focus_column with the current path and focus column. If the cursor isn't currently set, then *@path will be %NULL. If no column currently has focus, then *@focus_column will be %NULL.
The returned #GtkTreePath must be freed with gtk_tree_path_free() when you are done with it.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to be filled with the current cursor path, or %NULL

parameter.name: focus_column
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to be filled with the current focus column, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_dest_row_at_pos
function.description: Determines the destination row for a given position. @drag_x and @drag_y are expected to be in widget coordinates. This function is only meaningful if @tree_view is realized. Therefore this function will always return %FALSE if @tree_view is not realized or does not have a model.

parameter.name: drag_x
parameter.parameter_description: the position to determine the destination row for

parameter.name: drag_y
parameter.parameter_description: the position to determine the destination row for

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for the path of the highlighted row, or %NULL.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for the drop position, or %NULL

function.return: whether there is a row at the given position, %TRUE if this is indeed the case.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_drag_dest_row
function.description: Gets information about the row that is highlighted for feedback.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for the path of the highlighted row, or %NULL.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for the drop position, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_enable_search
function.description: Returns whether or not the tree allows to start interactive searching by typing in text.
function.return: whether or not to let the user search interactively

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_enable_tree_lines
function.description:
Returns whether or not tree lines are drawn in @tree_view.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if tree lines are drawn in @tree_view, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_expander_column
function.description: Returns the column that is the current expander column. This column has the expander arrow drawn next to it.
function.return: The expander column.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_fixed_height_mode
function.description:
Returns whether fixed height mode is turned on for @tree_view.
Since: 2.6
function.return: %TRUE if @tree_view is in fixed height mode

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_grid_lines
function.description:
Returns which grid lines are enabled in @tree_view.
Since: 2.10
function.return: a #GtkTreeViewGridLines value indicating which grid lines are enabled.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_hadjustment
function.description:
Gets the #GtkAdjustment currently being used for the horizontal aspect.
Deprecated: 3.0: Use gtk_scrollable_get_hadjustment()
function.return: A #GtkAdjustment object, or %NULL if none is currently being used.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_headers_clickable
function.description:
Returns whether all header columns are clickable.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if all header columns are clickable, otherwise %FALSE

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_headers_visible
function.description: Returns %TRUE if the headers on the @tree_view are visible.
function.return: Whether the headers are visible or not.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_hover_expand
function.description:
Returns whether hover expansion mode is turned on for @tree_view.
Since: 2.6
function.return: %TRUE if @tree_view is in hover expansion mode

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_hover_selection
function.description:
Returns whether hover selection mode is turned on for @tree_view.
Since: 2.6
function.return: %TRUE if @tree_view is in hover selection mode

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_level_indentation
function.description:
Returns the amount, in pixels, of extra indentation for child levels in @tree_view.
Since: 2.12
function.return: the amount of extra indentation for child levels in @tree_view. A return value of 0 means that this feature is disabled.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_model
function.description: Returns the model the #GtkTreeView is based on. Returns %NULL if the model is unset.
function.return: A #GtkTreeModel, or %NULL if none is currently being used.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_n_columns
function.description:
Queries the number of columns in the given @tree_view.
Since: 3.4
function.return: The number of columns in the @tree_view

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_path_at_pos
function.description:
Finds the path at the point (@x, @y), relative to bin_window coordinates (please see gtk_tree_view_get_bin_window()). That is, @x and @y are relative to an events coordinates. @x and @y must come from an event on the @tree_view only where <literal>event->window == gtk_tree_view_get_bin_window (<!-- -->)</literal>. It is primarily for things like popup menus. If @path is non-%NULL, then it will be filled with the #GtkTreePath at that point. This path should be freed with gtk_tree_path_free(). If @column is non-%NULL, then it will be filled with the column at that point. @cell_x and @cell_y return the coordinates relative to the cell background (i.e. the @background_area passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render()). This function is only meaningful if @tree_view is realized. Therefore this function will always return %FALSE if @tree_view is not realized or does not have a model.
For converting widget coordinates (eg. the ones you get from GtkWidget::query-tooltip), please see gtk_tree_view_convert_widget_to_bin_window_coords().

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: The x position to be identified (relative to bin_window).

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: The y position to be identified (relative to bin_window).

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to a #GtkTreePath pointer to be filled in, or %NULL

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to a #GtkTreeViewColumn pointer to be filled in, or %NULL

parameter.name: cell_x
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer where the X coordinate relative to the cell can be placed, or %NULL

parameter.name: cell_y
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer where the Y coordinate relative to the cell can be placed, or %NULL

function.return: %TRUE if a row exists at that coordinate.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_reorderable
function.description: Retrieves whether the user can reorder the tree via drag-and-drop. See gtk_tree_view_set_reorderable().
function.return: %TRUE if the tree can be reordered.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_row_separator_func
function.description:
Returns the current row separator function.
Since: 2.6
function.return: the current row separator function.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_rubber_banding
function.description:
Returns whether rubber banding is turned on for @tree_view. If the selection mode is #GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE, rubber banding will allow the user to select multiple rows by dragging the mouse.
Since: 2.10
function.return: %TRUE if rubber banding in @tree_view is enabled.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_rules_hint
function.description: Gets the setting set by gtk_tree_view_set_rules_hint().
function.return: %TRUE if rules are useful for the user of this tree

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_search_column
function.description: Gets the column searched on by the interactive search code.
function.return: the column the interactive search code searches in.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_search_entry
function.description:
Returns the #GtkEntry which is currently in use as interactive search entry for @tree_view. In case the built-in entry is being used, %NULL will be returned.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the entry currently in use as search entry.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_search_equal_func
function.description: Returns the compare function currently in use.
function.return: the currently used compare function for the search code.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_search_position_func
function.description:
Returns the positioning function currently in use.
Since: 2.10
function.return: the currently used function for positioning the search dialog.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_selection
function.description: Gets the #GtkTreeSelection associated with @tree_view.
function.return: A #GtkTreeSelection object.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_show_expanders
function.description:
Returns whether or not expanders are drawn in @tree_view.
Since: 2.12
function.return: %TRUE if expanders are drawn in @tree_view, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_tooltip_column
function.description:
Returns the column of @tree_view's model which is being used for displaying tooltips on @tree_view's rows.
Since: 2.12
function.return: the index of the tooltip column that is currently being used, or -1 if this is disabled.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_tooltip_context
function.description:
This function is supposed to be used in a #GtkWidget::query-tooltip signal handler for #GtkTreeView. The @x, @y and @keyboard_tip values which are received in the signal handler, should be passed to this function without modification.
The return value indicates whether there is a tree view row at the given coordinates (%TRUE) or not (%FALSE) for mouse tooltips. For keyboard tooltips the row returned will be the cursor row. When %TRUE, then any of @model, @path and @iter which have been provided will be set to point to that row and the corresponding model. @x and @y will always be converted to be relative to @tree_view's bin_window if @keyboard_tooltip is %FALSE.
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: the x coordinate (relative to widget coordinates)

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: the y coordinate (relative to widget coordinates)

parameter.name: keyboard_tip
parameter.parameter_description: whether this is a keyboard tooltip or not

parameter.name: model
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to receive a #GtkTreeModel or %NULL

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to receive a #GtkTreePath or %NULL

parameter.name: iter
parameter.parameter_description: a pointer to receive a #GtkTreeIter or %NULL

function.return: whether or not the given tooltip context points to a row.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_vadjustment
function.description:
Gets the #GtkAdjustment currently being used for the vertical aspect.
Deprecated: 3.0: Use gtk_scrollable_get_vadjustment()
function.return: A #GtkAdjustment object, or %NULL if none is currently being used.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_visible_range
function.description:
Sets @start_path and @end_path to be the first and last visible path. Note that there may be invisible paths in between.
The paths should be freed with gtk_tree_path_free() after use.
Since: 2.8

parameter.name: start_path
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for start of region, or %NULL.

parameter.name: end_path
parameter.parameter_description: Return location for end of region, or %NULL.

function.return: %TRUE, if valid paths were placed in @start_path and @end_path.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_get_visible_rect
function.description: Fills @visible_rect with the currently-visible region of the buffer, in tree coordinates. Convert to bin_window coordinates with gtk_tree_view_convert_tree_to_bin_window_coords(). Tree coordinates start at 0,0 for row 0 of the tree, and cover the entire scrollable area of the tree.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_insert_column
function.description: This inserts the @column into the @tree_view at @position. If @position is -1, then the column is inserted at the end. If @tree_view has "fixed_height" mode enabled, then @column must have its "sizing" property set to be GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_FIXED.
function.return: The number of columns in @tree_view after insertion.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_insert_column_with_attributes
function.description: Creates a new #GtkTreeViewColumn and inserts it into the @tree_view at @position. If @position is -1, then the newly created column is inserted at the end. The column is initialized with the attributes given. If @tree_view has "fixed_height" mode enabled, then the new column will have its sizing property set to be GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_FIXED.

parameter.name: position
parameter.parameter_description: The position to insert the new column in

parameter.name: title
parameter.parameter_description: The title to set the header to

function.return: The number of columns in @tree_view after insertion.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_insert_column_with_data_func
function.description: Convenience function that inserts a new column into the #GtkTreeView with the given cell renderer and a #GtkTreeCellDataFunc to set cell renderer attributes (normally using data from the model). See also gtk_tree_view_column_set_cell_data_func(), gtk_tree_view_column_pack_start(). If @tree_view has "fixed_height" mode enabled, then the new column will have its "sizing" property set to be GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_FIXED.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: function to set attributes of cell renderer

function.return: number of columns in the tree view post-insert

function.name: gtk_tree_view_is_blank_at_pos
function.description:
Determine whether the point (@x, @y) in @tree_view is blank, that is no cell content nor an expander arrow is drawn at the location. If so, the location can be considered as the background. You might wish to take special action on clicks on the background, such as clearing a current selection, having a custom context menu or starting rubber banding.
The @x and @y coordinate that are provided must be relative to bin_window coordinates. That is, @x and @y must come from an event on @tree_view where <literal>event->window == gtk_tree_view_get_bin_window (<!-- -->)</literal>.
For converting widget coordinates (eg. the ones you get from GtkWidget::query-tooltip), please see gtk_tree_view_convert_widget_to_bin_window_coords().
The @path, @column, @cell_x and @cell_y arguments will be filled in likewise as for gtk_tree_view_get_path_at_pos(). Please see gtk_tree_view_get_path_at_pos() for more information.
Since: 3.0

parameter.name: x
parameter.parameter_description: The x position to be identified (relative to bin_window)

parameter.name: y
parameter.parameter_description: The y position to be identified (relative to bin_window)

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to a #GtkTreePath pointer to be filled in, or %NULL

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer to a #GtkTreeViewColumn pointer to be filled in, or %NULL

parameter.name: cell_x
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer where the X coordinate relative to the cell can be placed, or %NULL

parameter.name: cell_y
parameter.parameter_description: A pointer where the Y coordinate relative to the cell can be placed, or %NULL

function.return: %TRUE if the area at the given coordinates is blank, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_is_rubber_banding_active
function.description:
Returns whether a rubber banding operation is currently being done in @tree_view.
Since: 2.12
function.return: %TRUE if a rubber banding operation is currently being done in @tree_view.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_map_expanded_rows
function.description: Calls @func on all expanded rows.

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: User data to be passed to the function.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_move_column_after
function.description: Moves @column to be after to @base_column. If @base_column is %NULL, then @column is placed in the first position.

parameter.name: base_column
parameter.parameter_description: The #GtkTreeViewColumn to be moved relative to, or %NULL.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkTreeView widget.
function.return: A newly created #GtkTreeView widget.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_new_with_model
function.description: Creates a new #GtkTreeView widget with the model initialized to @model.
function.return: A newly created #GtkTreeView widget.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_remove_column
function.description: Removes @column from @tree_view.
function.return: The number of columns in @tree_view after removing.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_row_activated
function.description: Activates the cell determined by @path and @column.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_row_expanded
function.description: Returns %TRUE if the node pointed to by @path is expanded in @tree_view.
function.return: %TRUE if #path is expanded.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_scroll_to_cell
function.description:
Moves the alignments of @tree_view to the position specified by @column and @path. If @column is %NULL, then no horizontal scrolling occurs. Likewise, if @path is %NULL no vertical scrolling occurs. At a minimum, one of @column or @path need to be non-%NULL. @row_align determines where the row is placed, and @col_align determines where @column is placed. Both are expected to be between 0.0 and 1.0. 0.0 means left/top alignment, 1.0 means right/bottom alignment, 0.5 means center.
If @use_align is %FALSE, then the alignment arguments are ignored, and the tree does the minimum amount of work to scroll the cell onto the screen. This means that the cell will be scrolled to the edge closest to its current position. If the cell is currently visible on the screen, nothing is done.
This function only works if the model is set, and @path is a valid row on the model. If the model changes before the @tree_view is realized, the centered path will be modified to reflect this change.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: The path of the row to move to, or %NULL.

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: The #GtkTreeViewColumn to move horizontally to, or %NULL.

parameter.name: use_align
parameter.parameter_description: whether to use alignment arguments, or %FALSE.

parameter.name: row_align
parameter.parameter_description: The vertical alignment of the row specified by @path.

parameter.name: col_align
parameter.parameter_description: The horizontal alignment of the column specified by @column.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_scroll_to_point
function.description:
Scrolls the tree view such that the top-left corner of the visible area is @tree_x, @tree_y, where @tree_x and @tree_y are specified in tree coordinates. The @tree_view must be realized before this function is called. If it isn't, you probably want to be using gtk_tree_view_scroll_to_cell().
If either @tree_x or @tree_y are -1, then that direction isn't scrolled.

parameter.name: tree_x
parameter.parameter_description: X coordinate of new top-left pixel of visible area, or -1

parameter.name: tree_y
parameter.parameter_description: Y coordinate of new top-left pixel of visible area, or -1

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_activate_on_single_click
function.description:
Cause the #GtkTreeView::row-activated signal to be emitted on a single click instead of a double click.
Since: 3.8

parameter.name: single
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to emit row-activated on a single click

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_column_drag_function
function.description: Sets a user function for determining where a column may be dropped when dragged. This function is called on every column pair in turn at the beginning of a column drag to determine where a drop can take place. The arguments passed to @func are: the @tree_view, the #GtkTreeViewColumn being dragged, the two #GtkTreeViewColumn s determining the drop spot, and @user_data. If either of the #GtkTreeViewColumn arguments for the drop spot are %NULL, then they indicate an edge. If @func is set to be %NULL, then @tree_view reverts to the default behavior of allowing all columns to be dropped everywhere.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: A function to determine which columns are reorderable, or %NULL.

parameter.name: user_data
parameter.parameter_description: User data to be passed to @func, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_cursor
function.description:
Sets the current keyboard focus to be at @path, and selects it. This is useful when you want to focus the user's attention on a particular row. If @focus_column is not %NULL, then focus is given to the column specified by it. Additionally, if @focus_column is specified, and @start_editing is %TRUE, then editing should be started in the specified cell. This function is often followed by @gtk_widget_grab_focus (@tree_view) in order to give keyboard focus to the widget. Please note that editing can only happen when the widget is realized.
If @path is invalid for @model, the current cursor (if any) will be unset and the function will return without failing.

parameter.name: start_editing
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the specified cell should start being edited.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_cursor_on_cell
function.description:
Sets the current keyboard focus to be at @path, and selects it. This is useful when you want to focus the user's attention on a particular row. If @focus_column is not %NULL, then focus is given to the column specified by it. If @focus_column and @focus_cell are not %NULL, and @focus_column contains 2 or more editable or activatable cells, then focus is given to the cell specified by @focus_cell. Additionally, if @focus_column is specified, and @start_editing is %TRUE, then editing should be started in the specified cell. This function is often followed by @gtk_widget_grab_focus (@tree_view) in order to give keyboard focus to the widget. Please note that editing can only happen when the widget is realized.
If @path is invalid for @model, the current cursor (if any) will be unset and the function will return without failing.
Since: 2.2

parameter.name: start_editing
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the specified cell should start being edited.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_destroy_count_func
function.description:
This function should almost never be used. It is meant for private use by ATK for determining the number of visible children that are removed when the user collapses a row, or a row is deleted.
Deprecated: 3.4: Accessibility does not need the function anymore.

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: Function to be called when a view row is destroyed, or %NULL

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: User data to be passed to @func, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_drag_dest_row
function.description: Sets the row that is highlighted for feedback. If @path is %NULL, an existing highlight is removed.

parameter.name: path
parameter.parameter_description: The path of the row to highlight, or %NULL

parameter.name: pos
parameter.parameter_description: Specifies whether to drop before, after or into the row

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_enable_search
function.description:
If @enable_search is set, then the user can type in text to search through the tree interactively (this is sometimes called "typeahead find").
Note that even if this is %FALSE, the user can still initiate a search using the "start-interactive-search" key binding.

parameter.name: enable_search
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE, if the user can search interactively

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_enable_tree_lines
function.description:
Sets whether to draw lines interconnecting the expanders in @tree_view. This does not have any visible effects for lists.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE to enable tree line drawing, %FALSE otherwise.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_expander_column
function.description:
Sets the column to draw the expander arrow at. It must be in @tree_view. If @column is %NULL, then the expander arrow is always at the first visible column.
If you do not want expander arrow to appear in your tree, set the expander column to a hidden column.

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: %NULL, or the column to draw the expander arrow at.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_fixed_height_mode
function.description:
Enables or disables the fixed height mode of @tree_view. Fixed height mode speeds up #GtkTreeView by assuming that all rows have the same height. Only enable this option if all rows are the same height and all columns are of type %GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_FIXED.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_grid_lines
function.description:
Sets which grid lines to draw in @tree_view.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: grid_lines
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkTreeViewGridLines value indicating which grid lines to enable.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_hadjustment
function.description:
Sets the #GtkAdjustment for the current horizontal aspect.
Deprecated: 3.0: Use gtk_scrollable_set_hadjustment()

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_headers_clickable
function.description: Allow the column title buttons to be clicked.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_headers_visible
function.description: Sets the visibility state of the headers.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_hover_expand
function.description:
Enables or disables the hover expansion mode of @tree_view. Hover expansion makes rows expand or collapse if the pointer moves over them.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_hover_selection
function.description:
Enables or disables the hover selection mode of @tree_view. Hover selection makes the selected row follow the pointer. Currently, this works only for the selection modes %GTK_SELECTION_SINGLE and %GTK_SELECTION_BROWSE.
Since: 2.6

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_level_indentation
function.description:
Sets the amount of extra indentation for child levels to use in @tree_view in addition to the default indentation. The value should be specified in pixels, a value of 0 disables this feature and in this case only the default indentation will be used. This does not have any visible effects for lists.
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: indentation
parameter.parameter_description: the amount, in pixels, of extra indentation in @tree_view.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_model
function.description: Sets the model for a #GtkTreeView. If the @tree_view already has a model set, it will remove it before setting the new model. If @model is %NULL, then it will unset the old model.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_reorderable
function.description:
This function is a convenience function to allow you to reorder models that support the #GtkTreeDragSourceIface and the #GtkTreeDragDestIface. Both #GtkTreeStore and #GtkListStore support these. If @reorderable is %TRUE, then the user can reorder the model by dragging and dropping rows. The developer can listen to these changes by connecting to the model's row_inserted and row_deleted signals. The reordering is implemented by setting up the tree view as a drag source and destination. Therefore, drag and drop can not be used in a reorderable view for any other purpose.
This function does not give you any degree of control over the order -- any reordering is allowed. If more control is needed, you should probably handle drag and drop manually.

parameter.name: reorderable
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE, if the tree can be reordered.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_row_separator_func
function.description:
Sets the row separator function, which is used to determine whether a row should be drawn as a separator. If the row separator function is %NULL, no separators are drawn. This is the default value.
Since: 2.6

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: user data to pass to @func, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_rubber_banding
function.description:
Enables or disables rubber banding in @tree_view. If the selection mode is #GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE, rubber banding will allow the user to select multiple rows by dragging the mouse.
Since: 2.10

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_rules_hint
function.description: This function tells GTK+ that the user interface for your application requires users to read across tree rows and associate cells with one another. By default, GTK+ will then render the tree with alternating row colors. Do <emphasis>not</emphasis> use it just because you prefer the appearance of the ruled tree; that's a question for the theme. Some themes will draw tree rows in alternating colors even when rules are turned off, and users who prefer that appearance all the time can choose those themes. You should call this function only as a <emphasis>semantic</emphasis> hint to the theme engine that your tree makes alternating colors useful from a functional standpoint (since it has lots of columns, generally).

parameter.name: setting
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if the tree requires reading across rows

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_search_column
function.description:
Sets @column as the column where the interactive search code should search in for the current model.
If the search column is set, users can use the "start-interactive-search" key binding to bring up search popup. The enable-search property controls whether simply typing text will also start an interactive search.
Note that @column refers to a column of the current model. The search column is reset to -1 when the model is changed.

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: the column of the model to search in, or -1 to disable searching

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_search_entry

parameter.name: entry
parameter.parameter_description: the entry the interactive search code of @tree_view should use or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_search_equal_func
function.description: Sets the compare function for the interactive search capabilities; note that somewhat like strcmp() returning 0 for equality #GtkTreeViewSearchEqualFunc returns %FALSE on matches.

parameter.name: search_equal_func
parameter.parameter_description: the compare function to use during the search

parameter.name: search_user_data
parameter.parameter_description: user data to pass to @search_equal_func, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_search_position_func
function.description:
Sets the function to use when positioning the search dialog.
Since: 2.10

parameter.name: func
parameter.parameter_description: the function to use to position the search dialog, or %NULL to use the default search position function

parameter.name: data
parameter.parameter_description: user data to pass to @func, or %NULL

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_show_expanders
function.description:
Sets whether to draw and enable expanders and indent child rows in @tree_view. When disabled there will be no expanders visible in trees and there will be no way to expand and collapse rows by default. Also note that hiding the expanders will disable the default indentation. You can set a custom indentation in this case using gtk_tree_view_set_level_indentation(). This does not have any visible effects for lists.
Since: 2.12

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_tooltip_cell
function.description:
Sets the tip area of @tooltip to the area @path, @column and @cell have in common. For example if @path is %NULL and @column is set, the tip area will be set to the full area covered by @column. See also gtk_tooltip_set_tip_area().
Note that if @path is not specified and @cell is set and part of a column containing the expander, the tooltip might not show and hide at the correct position. In such cases @path must be set to the current node under the mouse cursor for this function to operate correctly.
See also gtk_tree_view_set_tooltip_column() for a simpler alternative.
Since: 2.12

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_tooltip_column
function.description:
If you only plan to have simple (text-only) tooltips on full rows, you can use this function to have #GtkTreeView handle these automatically for you. @column should be set to the column in @tree_view's model containing the tooltip texts, or -1 to disable this feature.
When enabled, #GtkWidget:has-tooltip will be set to %TRUE and @tree_view will connect a #GtkWidget::query-tooltip signal handler.
Note that the signal handler sets the text with gtk_tooltip_set_markup(), so &, <, etc have to be escaped in the text.
Since: 2.12

parameter.name: column
parameter.parameter_description: an integer, which is a valid column number for @tree_view's model

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_tooltip_row
function.description:
Sets the tip area of @tooltip to be the area covered by the row at @path. See also gtk_tree_view_set_tooltip_column() for a simpler alternative. See also gtk_tooltip_set_tip_area().
Since: 2.12

function.name: gtk_tree_view_set_vadjustment
function.description:
Sets the #GtkAdjustment for the current vertical aspect.
Deprecated: 3.0: Use gtk_scrollable_set_vadjustment()

function.name: gtk_tree_view_unset_rows_drag_dest
function.description: Undoes the effect of gtk_tree_view_enable_model_drag_dest(). Calling this method sets #GtkTreeView:reorderable to %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_tree_view_unset_rows_drag_source
function.description: Undoes the effect of gtk_tree_view_enable_model_drag_source(). Calling this method sets #GtkTreeView:reorderable to %FALSE.

function.name: gtk_true
function.return: %TRUE

function.name: gtk_ui_manager_add_ui
function.description:
Adds a UI element to the current contents of @manager.
If @type is %GTK_UI_MANAGER_AUTO, GTK+ inserts a menuitem, toolitem or separator if such an element can be inserted at the place determined by @path. Otherwise @type must indicate an element that can be inserted at the place determined by @path.
If @path points to a menuitem or toolitem, the new element will be inserted before or after this item, depending on @top.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: merge_id
parameter.parameter_description: the merge id for the merged UI, see gtk_ui_manager_new_merge_id()

parameter.name: name
parameter.parameter_description: the name for the added UI element

parameter.name: action
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the action to be proxied, or %NULL to add a separator

parameter.name: type
parameter.parameter_description: the type of UI element to add.

parameter.name: top
parameter.parameter_description: if %TRUE, the UI element is added before its siblings, otherwise it is added after its siblings.

function.name: gtk_ui_manager_add_ui_from_file
function.description:
Parses a file containing a <link linkend="XML-UI">UI definition</link> and merges it with the current contents of @manager.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: filename
parameter.parameter_description: the name of the file to parse

function.return: The merge id for the merged UI. The merge id can be used to unmerge the UI with gtk_ui_manager_remove_ui(). If an error occurred, the return value is 0.

function.name: gtk_ui_manager_add_ui_from_resource
function.description:
Parses a resource file containing a <link linkend="XML-UI">UI definition</link> and merges it with the current contents of @manager.
Since: 3.4
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: resource_path
parameter.parameter_description: the resource path of the file to parse

function.return: The merge id for the merged UI. The merge id can be used to unmerge the UI with gtk_ui_manager_remove_ui(). If an error occurred, the return value is 0.

function.name: gtk_ui_manager_add_ui_from_string
function.description:
Parses a string containing a <link linkend="XML-UI">UI definition</link> and merges it with the current contents of @manager. An enclosing <ui> element is added if it is missing.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: length
parameter.parameter_description: the length of @buffer (may be -1 if @buffer is nul-terminated)

function.return: The merge id for the merged UI. The merge id can be used to unmerge the UI with gtk_ui_manager_remove_ui(). If an error occurred, the return value is 0.

function.name: gtk_ui_manager_ensure_update
gtk_ui_manager_get_accel_group
function.description:
Returns the #GtkAccelGroup associated with @manager.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: the #GtkAccelGroup.

function.name: gtk_ui_manager_get_action
function.description:
Looks up an action by following a path. See gtk_ui_manager_get_widget() for more information about paths.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: the action whose proxy widget is found by following the path, or %NULL if no widget was found.

function.name: gtk_ui_manager_get_action_groups
function.description:
Returns the list of action groups associated with @manager.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: a #GList of action groups. The list is owned by GTK+ and should not be modified.

function.name: gtk_ui_manager_get_add_tearoffs
function.description:
Returns whether menus generated by this #GtkUIManager will have tearoff menu items.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.4: Tearoff menus are deprecated and should not be used in newly written code.
function.return: whether tearoff menu items are added

function.name: gtk_ui_manager_get_toplevels
function.description:
Obtains a list of all toplevel widgets of the requested types.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: types
parameter.parameter_description: specifies the types of toplevel widgets to include. Allowed types are #GTK_UI_MANAGER_MENUBAR, #GTK_UI_MANAGER_TOOLBAR and #GTK_UI_MANAGER_POPUP.

function.return: a newly-allocated #GSList of all toplevel widgets of the requested types. Free the returned list with g_slist_free().

function.name: gtk_ui_manager_get_ui
function.description:
Creates a <link linkend="XML-UI">UI definition</link> of the merged UI.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: A newly allocated string containing an XML representation of the merged UI.

function.name: gtk_ui_manager_get_widget
function.description:
Looks up a widget by following a path. The path consists of the names specified in the XML description of the UI. separated by '/'. Elements which don't have a name or action attribute in the XML (e.g. <popup>) can be addressed by their XML element name (e.g. "popup"). The root element ("/ui") can be omitted in the path.
Note that the widget found by following a path that ends in a <menu> element is the menuitem to which the menu is attached, not the menu itmanager.
Also note that the widgets constructed by a ui manager are not tied to the lifecycle of the ui manager. If you add the widgets returned by this function to some container or explicitly ref them, they will survive the destruction of the ui manager.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: the widget found by following the path, or %NULL if no widget was found.

function.name: gtk_ui_manager_insert_action_group
function.description:
Inserts an action group into the list of action groups associated with @manager. Actions in earlier groups hide actions with the same name in later groups.
If @pos is larger than the number of action groups in @manager, or negative, @action_group will be inserted at the end of the internal list.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: action_group
parameter.parameter_description: the action group to be inserted

parameter.name: pos
parameter.parameter_description: the position at which the group will be inserted.

function.name: gtk_ui_manager_new
function.description:
Creates a new ui manager object.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: a new ui manager object.

function.name: gtk_ui_manager_new_merge_id
function.description:
Returns an unused merge id, suitable for use with gtk_ui_manager_add_ui().
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10
function.return: an unused merge id.

function.name: gtk_ui_manager_remove_action_group
function.description:
Removes an action group from the list of action groups associated with @manager.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: action_group
parameter.parameter_description: the action group to be removed

function.name: gtk_ui_manager_remove_ui
function.description:
Unmerges the part of @manager<!-- -->s content identified by @merge_id.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.10

parameter.name: merge_id
parameter.parameter_description: a merge id as returned by gtk_ui_manager_add_ui_from_string()

function.name: gtk_ui_manager_set_add_tearoffs
function.description:
Sets the "add_tearoffs" property, which controls whether menus generated by this #GtkUIManager will have tearoff menu items.
Note that this only affects regular menus. Generated popup menus never have tearoff menu items.
Since: 2.4
Deprecated: 3.4: Tearoff menus are deprecated and should not be used in newly written code.

parameter.name: add_tearoffs
parameter.parameter_description: whether tearoff menu items are added

function.name: gtk_vbox_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkVBox.
Deprecated: 3.2: You can use gtk_box_new() with %GTK_ORIENTATION_VERTICAL instead, which is a quick and easy change. But the recommendation is to switch to #GtkGrid, since #GtkBox is going to go away eventually. See <xref linkend="gtk-migrating-GtkGrid"/>.

parameter.name: homogeneous
parameter.parameter_description: %TRUE if all children are to be given equal space allotments.

parameter.name: spacing
parameter.parameter_description: the number of pixels to place by default between children.

function.return: a new #GtkVBox.

function.name: gtk_vbutton_box_new
function.description:
Creates a new vertical button box.
Deprecated: 3.2: Use gtk_button_box_new() with %GTK_ORIENTATION_VERTICAL instead
function.return: a new button box #GtkWidget.

function.name: gtk_viewport_get_bin_window
function.description:
Gets the bin window of the #GtkViewport.
Since: 2.20
function.return: a #GdkWindow

function.name: gtk_viewport_get_hadjustment
function.description:
Returns the horizontal adjustment of the viewport.
Deprecated: 3.0: Use gtk_scrollable_get_hadjustment()
function.return: the horizontal adjustment of @viewport.

function.name: gtk_viewport_get_shadow_type
function.description: Gets the shadow type of the #GtkViewport. See gtk_viewport_set_shadow_type().
function.return: the shadow type

function.name: gtk_viewport_get_vadjustment
function.description:
Returns the vertical adjustment of the viewport.
Deprecated: 3.0: Use gtk_scrollable_get_vadjustment()
function.return: the vertical adjustment of @viewport.

function.name: gtk_viewport_get_view_window
function.description:
Gets the view window of the #GtkViewport.
Since: 2.22
function.return: a #GdkWindow

function.name: gtk_viewport_new
function.description: Creates a new #GtkViewport with the given adjustments, or with default adjustments if none are given.
function.return: a new #GtkViewport

function.name: gtk_viewport_set_hadjustment
function.description:
Sets the horizontal adjustment of the viewport.
Deprecated: 3.0: Use gtk_scrollable_set_hadjustment()

function.name: gtk_viewport_set_shadow_type
function.description: Sets the shadow type of the viewport.

function.name: gtk_viewport_set_vadjustment
function.description:
Sets the vertical adjustment of the viewport.
Deprecated: 3.0: Use gtk_scrollable_set_vadjustment()

function.name: gtk_volume_button_new
function.description:
Creates a #GtkVolumeButton, with a range between 0.0 and 1.0, with a stepping of 0.02. Volume values can be obtained and modified using the functions from #GtkScaleButton.
Since: 2.12
function.return: a new #GtkVolumeButton

function.name: gtk_vpaned_new
function.description:
Create a new #GtkVPaned
Deprecated: 3.2: Use gtk_paned_new() with %GTK_ORIENTATION_VERTICAL instead
function.return: the new #GtkVPaned

function.name: gtk_vscale_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkVScale.
Deprecated: 3.2: Use gtk_scale_new() with %GTK_ORIENTATION_VERTICAL instead

parameter.name: adjustment
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkAdjustment which sets the range of the scale.

function.return: a new #GtkVScale.

function.name: gtk_vscale_new_with_range
function.description:
Creates a new vertical scale widget that lets the user input a number between @min and @max (including @min and @max) with the increment @step. @step must be nonzero; it's the distance the slider moves when using the arrow keys to adjust the scale value.
Note that the way in which the precision is derived works best if @step is a power of ten. If the resulting precision is not suitable for your needs, use gtk_scale_set_digits() to correct it.
Deprecated: 3.2: Use gtk_scale_new_with_range() with %GTK_ORIENTATION_VERTICAL instead

parameter.name: step
parameter.parameter_description: step increment (tick size) used with keyboard shortcuts

function.return: a new #GtkVScale

function.name: gtk_vscrollbar_new
function.description:
Creates a new vertical scrollbar.
Deprecated: 3.2: Use gtk_scrollbar_new() with %GTK_ORIENTATION_VERTICAL instead

parameter.name: adjustment
parameter.parameter_description: the #GtkAdjustment to use, or %NULL to create a new adjustment

function.return: the new #GtkVScrollbar

function.name: gtk_vseparator_new
function.description:
Creates a new #GtkVSeparator.
Deprecated: 3.2: Use gtk_separator_new() with %GTK_ORIENTATION_VERTICAL instead
function.return: a new #GtkVSeparator.

function.name: gtk_widget_activate
function.description: For widgets that can be "activated" (buttons, menu items, etc.) this function activates them. Activation is what happens when you press Enter on a widget during key navigation. If @widget isn't activatable, the function returns %FALSE.
function.return: %TRUE if the widget was activatable

function.name: gtk_widget_add_accelerator
function.description: Installs an accelerator for this @widget in @accel_group that causes @accel_signal to be emitted if the accelerator is activated. The @accel_group needs to be added to the widget's toplevel via gtk_window_add_accel_group(), and the signal must be of type %G_SIGNAL_ACTION. Accelerators added through this function are not user changeable during runtime. If you want to support accelerators that can be changed by the user, use gtk_accel_map_add_entry() and gtk_widget_set_accel_path() or gtk_menu_item_set_accel_path() instead.

parameter.name: widget
parameter.parameter_description: widget to install an accelerator on

parameter.name: accel_signal
parameter.parameter_description: widget signal to emit on accelerator activation

parameter.name: accel_group
parameter.parameter_description: accel group for this widget, added to its toplevel

parameter.name: accel_mods
parameter.parameter_description: modifier key combination of the accelerator

function.name: gtk_widget_add_device_events
gtk_widget_add_events
function.description: Adds the events in the bitfield @events to the event mask for @widget. See gtk_widget_set_events() for details.

function.name: gtk_widget_add_mnemonic_label
function.description:
Adds a widget to the list of mnemonic labels for this widget. (See gtk_widget_list_mnemonic_labels()). Note the list of mnemonic labels for the widget is cleared when the widget is destroyed, so the caller must make sure to update its internal state at this point as well, by using a connection to the #GtkWidget::destroy signal or a weak notifier.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: label
parameter.parameter_description: a #GtkWidget that acts as a mnemonic label for @widget

function.name: gtk_widget_add_tick_callback
function.description:
Queues an animation frame update and adds a callback to be called before each frame. Until the tick callback is removed, it will be called frequently (usually at the frame rate of the output device or as quickly as the application can be repainted, whichever is slower). For this reason, is most suitable for handling graphics that change every frame or every few frames. The tick callback does not automatically imply a relayout or repaint. If you want a repaint or relayout, and aren't changing widget properties that would trigger that (for example, changing the text of a #GtkLabel), then you will have to call gtk_widget_queue_resize() or gtk_widget_queue_draw_area() yourself.
gdk_frame_clock_get_frame_time() should generally be used for timing continuous animations and gdk_frame_timings_get_predicted_presentation_time() if you are trying to display isolated frames at particular times.
This is a more convenient alternative to connecting directly to the #GdkFrameClock::update signal of #GdkFrameClock, since you don't have to worry about when a #GdkFrameClock is assigned to a widget.
Since: 3.8

parameter.name: callback
parameter.parameter_description: function to call for updating animations

parameter.name: notify
parameter.parameter_description: function to call to free @user_data when the callback is removed.

function.return: an id for the connection of this callback. Remove the callback by passing it to gtk_widget_remove_tick_callback()

function.name: gtk_widget_can_activate_accel
function.description:
Determines whether an accelerator that activates the signal identified by @signal_id can currently be activated. This is done by emitting the #GtkWidget::can-activate-accel signal on @widget; if the signal isn't overridden by a handler or in a derived widget, then the default check is that the widget must be sensitive, and the widget and all its ancestors mapped.
Since: 2.4

parameter.name: signal_id
parameter.parameter_description: the ID of a signal installed on @widget

function.return: %TRUE if the accelerator can be activated.

function.name: gtk_widget_child_focus
function.description:
This function is used by custom widget implementations; if you're writing an app, you'd use gtk_widget_grab_focus() to move the focus to a particular widget, and gtk_container_set_focus_chain() to change the focus tab order. So you may want to investigate those functions instead.
gtk_widget_child_focus() is called by containers as the user moves around the window using keyboard shortcuts. @direction indicates what kind of motion is taking place (up, down, left, right, tab forward, tab backward). gtk_widget_child_focus() emits the #GtkWidget::focus signal; widgets override the default handler for this signal in order to implement appropriate focus behavior.
The default ::focus handler for a widget should return %TRUE if moving in @direction left the focus on a focusable location inside that widget, and %FALSE if moving in @direction moved the focus outside the widget. If returning %TRUE, widgets normally call gtk_widget_grab_focus() to place the focus accordingly; if returning %FALSE, they don't modify the current focus location.
function.return: %TRUE if focus ended up inside @widget

function.name: gtk_widget_child_notify
function.description:
Emits a #GtkWidget::child-notify signal for the <link linkend="child-properties">child property</link> @child_property on @widget.
This is the analogue of g_object_notify() for child properties.
Also see gtk_container_child_notify().

parameter.name: child_property
parameter.parameter_description: the name of a child property installed on the class of @widget<!-- -->'s parent

function.name: gtk_widget_class_bind_template_callback
function.description:
Binds a callback function defined in a template to the @widget_class.
This macro is a convenience wrapper around the gtk_widget_class_bind_template_callback_full() function.
Since: 3.10

function.name: gtk_widget_class_bind_template_callback_full
function.description:
Declares a @callback_symbol to handle @callback_name from the template XML defined for @widget_type. See gtk_builder_add_callback_symbol().
<note><para>This must be called from a composite widget classes class initializer after calling gtk_widget_class_set_template()</para></note>
Since: 3.10

parameter.name: callback_name
parameter.parameter_description: The name of the callback as expected in the template XML

function.name: gtk_widget_class_bind_template_child
function.description:
Binds a child widget defined in a template to the @widget_class.
This macro is a convenience wrapper around the gtk_widget_class_bind_template_child_full() function.
This macro will use the offset of the @member_name inside the @TypeName instance structure.
Since: 3.10

parameter.name: TypeName
parameter.parameter_description: the type name of this widget

parameter.name: member_name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the instance member in the instance struct for @data_type

function.name: gtk_widget_class_bind_template_child_internal
function.description:
Binds a child widget defined in a template to the @widget_class, and also makes it available as an internal child in GtkBuilder, under the name @member_name.
This macro is a convenience wrapper around the gtk_widget_class_bind_template_child_full() function.
This macro will use the offset of the @member_name inside the @TypeName instance structure.
Since: 3.10

parameter.name: member_name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the instance member in the instance struct for @data_type

function.name: gtk_widget_class_bind_template_child_internal_private
function.description:
Binds a child widget defined in a template to the @widget_class, and also makes it available as an internal child in GtkBuilder, under the name @member_name.
This macro is a convenience wrapper around the gtk_widget_class_bind_template_child_full() function.
This macro will use the offset of the @member_name inside the @TypeName private data structure.
Since: 3.10

parameter.name: member_name
parameter.parameter_description: name of the instance private member on the private struct for @data_type

function.name: gtk_widget_class_bind_template_child_private
function.description:
Binds a child widget defined in a template to the @widget_class.
This macro is a convenience wrapper around the gtk_widget_class_bind_template_child_full() function.
